The overall effect is enhanced with a lovely beer garden/courtyard with fishpond, plants, retro signage and mix of glass, tarp and wooden coverage that turns the pub overall into a full 'venue' and attraction.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Terrific character inside and out with pace that gets going early and maintains a lively friendly feel throughout. Magnificent.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Simple snacks, outdoor seating, live music performances, jukebox, pool table, fish pond, dog friendly.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for basic options.

description: A magnificent pub that blows the alternatives clean out of the water. This is what you desire on a visit to Hereford, a truly friendly exuberant and unpretentious venue that serves up good stuff in a welcoming environment that makes you feel like staying all afternoon. Essential visit when in Hereford. (Added 2020)

name: Philharmonic Dining Rooms
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical Nicholson's chain  choices covering most bases, albeit with some ales on rotation.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Grade II listed Victorian pub with Art Deco lighting, intricately detailed ceiling, mosaic floor and bar. Grade I listed 120 year old Gents toilets. Rooms named after Brahms and Lizst. Leather furniture. Splendour.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
There is an unmistakable feel of airport waiting lounges to chain pubs set in magnificent buildings. The passing trade and loose furniture adds to that. There was always a risk that could happen here and it does to an extent, however, the quality ultimately shines through

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Cooked meals, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Higher than average for the area.

description: Architecturally one of the most significant, if not the most significant pub in the UK, a near intact example of the height of the late Victorian craze for opulence and splendour, with details and craftmanship put together in a way that is without understatement jaw-dropping when considering the location. Sadly in the clutches of the mediocre Nicholson's, which shows to an extent in the chain-pub elements, the menus, the tired looking meals and the transient trade, but not so much that it comes close to ruining the experience. This is not a Wetherspoons where you are in hell looking up at heaven. For anyone vaguely interested in decor and finery, this comes recommended. Craft beer epicurists and those seeking a more understated experience should look elsewhere. For us, this comes highly recommended, a clearly unique, special place. (Added 2021)

name: Roscoe Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cask ale focused with several ales on rotation, each kept immaculately.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Small rooms surround an intimate bar area. The place is cosy and small with communal upholstered bench seating and invites conversation.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local life ranging from roaming boozehounds, craft beer aficionados, couples, students. It's a democratic pub with people from all walks of life, all for the better.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area

description: One of CAMRA's ever-present pubs in the Real Ale Guide, this was also the focus of one woman's battle to save the venue from less responsible owners. After a years long struggle the place is hers and has gained fame and high repute. The place itself is almost an exercise in understatement given all that. It is a cosy little boozer with comfortable snug rooms that invite social conversation and draws in a wide range of people. The kind of pub that should be everywhere. Don't come for food, for cutting edge keg beers or a romantic date, but for the authentic pub environment and top class traditional ale. (Added 2021)

name: Lion Tavern
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good array of cask ales, dominates the selection, including their own singularly available mild made by a local brewery. Limited but stock perfunctory alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A preserved victorian boozer with ornate interior, mosaic floor, etch glass panels, dark wood fittings, side rooms and niches, perhaps topped off by a windowed dome with detailed stained glass. The seating is comfortable upholstered and typical English pub stock stuff. The main bar area remains a true boozer.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An authentic city tavern that retains a slightly pugnacious alternative edge (this is Liverpool after all). Bustling and busy, with opportunities for interactions abounding. Unpretentious but nevertheless relatively friendly. Not somewhere to take a craft beer aficionado or your date.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
....snacks? It's a boozer, simply.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent given the central location.

description: A central boozer that attracts a working class passing trade without feeling run down, basically. Added to that, a wonderful venue with CAMRA-inventory Victorian interior, ornate surroundings with comfortable furnishings. The layout invites conversation whether that's in the truly authentic bar area or the niches on the other side. (Added 2021)

name: Castle Hotel
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A compact but well curated balance of cask, keg and bottled beer with an equally adroit back bar of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A Victorian hotel, well preserved. First impressions come from the faienced tiling outside, before opening to a small bar area and snug back room, gloriously gloomy with piano and fireplace and upholstered leather.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true boozer with a mixed crowd. A seat on busy evenings can be gold dust. Gloomy, cosy and delightful in the back room, while a chat-fest out front at the bar. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Small outdoor space at the back, limited snacks. Occasional live music and literary events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard for the area, so fairly expensive.

description: This little pub is an undeniable classic, with a well preserved appearance outside and in, core city centre boozer atmosphere at the bar front and the parlour room directly behind it. Somewhere to escape your troubles, a cosy drinking den and one we enjoyed very much. (Added 2020)

name: Brownhill & Co.
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer focused with 8 kegs and 1 cask tap. Specialist craft beer with large (if dwindling) fridge selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Green paint, dark brown wooden furniture, sleek bar top and plants with some minimalist beer ephemera on the walls. Becoming more characterful as the years pass.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Friendly and helpful service with an upmarket café feel.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Tasting events, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
More expensive for the area. This is in line with the produce but you can frequently find the same for less elsewhere.

description: It has taken many visits to eventually convince us, despite spending  pleasant evenings here. The format is fairly 'arch' with servings of tap water and table service, with former insistence on servings of less than a pint. That has been relaxed over time and there is no doubt the bar is a pleasant place to spend an afternoon or evening and one of Leeds' beer hotspots, probably surpassing old stagers like North Bar these days. Overall you can't argue with the quality of drinks or service, though it may not be for everyone's tastes or wallet. (Added August 2023)

name: The Blue Boar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A rotating range of independent guest ales by small brewers and small selection of ciders and keg options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Rustic alehouse with hops hanging by the bar, mid-brown wooden bench seats and upturned barrels. Simple one room affair.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local life and natural ambience of conversation. Definitely an oldies preferred hangout but not exclusively

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Board games, books, small selection of snacks and sandwiches.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A strong option for any fan of a rustic and slightly genteel alehouse. Simple charms with plenty to drink and plenty to do. A social meeting spot with conversation across tables and even some board games and books to assist. A really nice place and one we can recommend. (Added 2021)

name: The Ale Wagon
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Hoskins Ales (now contract brewed elsewhere) are the perfect match for this rustic out of time boozer. Some guest ales also and a decently stocked back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A pleasingly unchanged bar with pastel painted walls, and rustic but comfortable bench seating. The place comes across fairly untouched since the 1960s.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Stripped back ale house ambience with natural conversation and socialising. It feels democratic. This is never going to be everyone's cup of tea but it is friendly and welcoming.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, board games and books.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: A gloriously untampered with ale house in the heart of the city, the kind of which has been extinguished elsewhere. Inside pastel paints sympathetically brighten up the place with recovered retro fittings and furnishings giving it a timeless look. Service is friendly and the ales are interesting. A must visit in Leicester if you like this sort of thing. (Added 2021)

name: Fanny's Ale House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Excellent local cask ale options, however fairly poor range of keg and bottles given the beer centric format. Perfunctory alternatives

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Distinctive retro downstairs and bar area with ceiling fans slowly rotating, wooden bench seats and an antiquey ale house vibe, albeit genteel. Piano and several little side rooms. Upstairs is a 2nd largely unused pointless bar with some space for music performances, perhaps slightly tackier decor and furniture by comparison.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A sense of local life immediately and a quirky distinctive hangout spot.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Music, snacks, events, limited outdoor space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Mediocre for the area

description: We are pleased to report the refurbishment hasn't ruined this ale house revival which retains its nooks and crannies downstairs along with the distinctive ceiling fans and wood panels, piano and great cask ale options. Shipley are lucky to have this and The Fox as local drinking options when considering the situation in nearby towns. (Added August 2021)

name: The Record Café
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of keg, cask and bottled beers locally, nationally and across the world.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Café bar/music store with music ephemera, plants and attractive lamplight. Comfortable bench seating.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Sleepy but comfortable during the afternoon, picking up pace in the evenings. Sometimes a little too cold and clinical.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Record store upstairs, small range of charcuterie and cheeses, snacks. Limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive for the area, very much more like Leeds city centre prices than something to expect in Bradford, though quality is high.

description: An attractive café bar which offers a little respite from the grim surroundings of Bradford. Friendly service and a healthy range of beer options, along with a generally laid back feel provides a calmness, while some distinctive decor and the record store adds just a bit of an edge to stand out. Very enjoyable visit and we'll return again. (Added August 2021)

name: Eagle
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Reliable range of real ales in the main pub and the RAF bar. Keg options and bottles quite formulaic due to GK ownership.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Interesting enough venue with gothic mid-brown wooden fittings and stone floor in the main pub, but the real interest happens at the back, with the 'RAF Bar', a very characterful bar room with historic interior filled with RAF insignia, trinkets, niknaks and autographs, which started when pilots burnt their names onto the ceiling with lighters. Unique.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Passing trade in the centre of a university town, and the chain pub grind of lunch meals detracts from the venue, but the pleasant surroundings and prospect of improvement during the evenings makes it still one to bear in mind.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, meals, two bar areas, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
More expensive for the area.

description: An interesting venue which feels like two pubs in one. Firstly, the Eagle part which is a pleasant old coaching inn with stone floor and wood fittings, secondly the RAF bar with its historic and highly personalised interior. We have to try and rate both in one, and it is inescapable that when doing so, the pub deserves its listing. Good choice of real ales, pleasant rooms and distinctive decor in the RAF bar tip it over the edge. It's sad that some of the chain pub grind and transient custom slightly takes the edge off what would otherwise be a true classic. Nevertheless, it is still well worth popping in. (Added August 2021)

name: The Elm Tree
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A compact range of real ales and keg options covering old and new, complimented by a strong Belgian beer fridge covering the trad bases and a few specialists. Some real cider too. Strong options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Folk heritage meets fantasy. Upside down witches hats, D&D ephemera, Hobbity, what is currently called 'goblin core', mixed with Belgian beer signage. For some reason it always feels a nature fit. A small fitted bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A neighbourhood hidey hole with friendly locals and a core alternative crowd. It's also not a GK pub in Cambridge - rejoice! 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music and events, snacks, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A pub anyone would want at the end of their street. Excellent selection of beers covering cask, keg and bottles, trad and modern, along with ciders. Distinctive personalised interior that feels homely and welcoming, as well as characterful and distinctive. A home from home. A meeting place for social groups and some music performances too. One we will keep coming back to. (Added August 2021)

name: The Nags Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Adnam's beers on cask, a couple of lagers and Guinness. Compact bar with a decent slightly heterodox choice of spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very personalised, a pub that is one of those living museums. Collectors items, old radios, toby jugs, antique dispensing machines all gathering dust for fear of knocking them all over and shattering them. A basement floor with similar layout. Extremely characterful and highly unusual for London

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
With a strict no-phones policy, the emphasis is on conversation or quiet reading as the folk music crackles away in the background. Relatively sleepy on an afternoon, the place can be enjoyed in a completely different way at night. Husband and wife team in charge.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited food and drinks, small outdoor seating, Very occasional live music.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard (ie. Expensive)

description: A true throwback and one of the most characterful pubs in all of London, this is a living museum from floor to ceiling. Compact, worn out and oozing character, you will not run out of things to look at and ponder. A husband and wife team run the show, with their own slightly outdated rules (no phones, minimum £15 card spend) and an uncompromising attitude that has earned them low ratings online. However, if you bear those in mind to avoid disappointment, there is much to love. Surrounded by gleaming mansions and sports cars, this is a survivor and worthy of not just attention and patronage but loyalty. (Added August 2021)

name: Post Office Vaults
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Great range of ciders on tap/box, good cask options. Extensive bottle selection from Belgium and Germany.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Basement hangout with pub billiard table and simple seating. All about the socialising. Small venue, surprising for city centre Birmingham

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cosy and intimate, simple and social

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Pub billiards, snacks, limited else, due to space.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
OK/good for the area

description: A surprising and distinctive venue outside the usual Birmingham offerings, this small basement bar offers intimate and unpretentious surroundings with an excellent range of beers. A must visit for those who like that sort of thing (Added August 2021)

name: Bacchus Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
If Nicholson's weren't so awful then it should have 5 or 6 cask options, but you'll be lucky to find 2 or 3 at most. A stock range of alternatives to beer.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Here is where Bacchus shines. Cheesey? Definitely. Bad taste? Undoubtedly, but there's something assertive about how its but together. Think roman arches, Bacchanalian portraits and heraldry mixed with gothic cellar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Pretty decent. There's always the prospect of a rabble joining due to it being a city centre chain, but no bad experiences to report. The cellar atmosphere stands out.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Cooked meals, snacks, theme rooms

Value For Money: ❤️
Very poor, even for the area

description: Despite chain ownership, erratic drinks selection and very poor value, we add this because it's so assertively, ridiculously fun. The Bacchus decor mixed with faux-Medieval works surprisingly well, almost transfixing in its luridness. There's nothing quite like this, certainly not in Birmingham anyway. (Added August 2021)

name: The Beacon Hotel
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Home brewed beer including the locally famous Sarah Hughes Dark Ruby Mild (6% abv!) along with keg options. Small selection of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Period features with compact central bar with hatches leading into side rooms. The siderooms have a genteel pre-war feel with patterned wall paper, bench seating, piano, fireplace.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Magnificent atmosphere in afternoon or evening with a mixed crowd of different ages and backgrounds socialising.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Home brewed beer, outdoor seating, snacks, occasional events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent + fair value, if not outstanding

description: This is a diamond of a pub that sums up the ethos of "If it ain't broke, don't fix it'. A wonderfully unspoilt pre-war pub with fixtures and fittings complimented by sympathetic decor that is transporting back in time.  However, that is only the start, as the general atmosphere of the place is the real reason to come. Several siderooms offer slightly different feels, each feeling intimate and social. A couple have connection to the bar via a hatch, so it always feels like there's a buzz of some kind. In case that wasn't enough, there is a small brewery on site which makes a couple of lovely ales. There are fireplaces, a piano and this is just an all-round amazing pub. (Added August 2021)

name: Britannia Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Small range of cask ales and some rather mainstream keg options. Small fridge. Not it's strong suit, however Batham's beers are highly regarded.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A lovely as yet unspoilt pub, which has made one or two modernisations but is still a small bar to the left of the entrance with a series of lounges to socialise and relax in. The most evocative is the lounge ahead of the entrance which is extremely cosy, with a fireplace, bench seating and an entire bar front transplanted opposite. Quite a sight.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
There are enough nooks and crannies to find a quiet, enjoyable place to brood during the day, but it does come alive when busier, and clearly in the winter months.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Several different rooms, fireplace, limited outdoor seating, snacks. 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value

description: A strong option as one's local pub, the layout offers a range of options, each of which are enjoyable and traditional, with a standout lounge that is supremely cosy. Batham's beer on cask will delight some. Service is down-to-earth but friendly with it. A must-see when in the area. (Added August 2021)

name: The Trumpet
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
3 cask from local brewery, with fairly mainstream keg options. Decent selection of spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A one room jazz den with memorabilia on the walls, highly personalised and wonderful ageing of the wood fittings. Rich green painted wood strip ceiling with lamps.  Magnificent.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Absolutely superb, outstanding atmosphere both before and during the live music performances.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live jazz music performances which are paid for with tips (please bring cash as it is also cash only). Raffle (also helps support the performers), outdoor seating, limited snacks. Occasional alternatives with food nights (think Paella).

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for money.

description: A one-off among the finest venues in England, this jazz bar combines amazing decor, with antiques and memorabilia perfectly complimenting a beautifully ageing wood fit pub with bench seating and carpets. Live performances feature almost daily, with tips + raffle surcharge to pay for those. N.B: Bring hard cash as they don't accept cards. Along with the likes of Yorckschlosschen, Papa Joes and Kontrabas, England has a Jazz Bar worthy of renown anywhere in Europe. Visit at once. (Added August 2021)

name: West Riding Refreshment Rooms
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Various real ales from local and regional breweries. Reasonably well stocked bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Attracting stone cottage by the railway tracks. Inside, vintage signage evoking the golden age of rail in a surprisingly natural and organic feeling pub layout. Surprisingly homely for a station bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A mixture of stalwarts and the predictable transient trade you will get from a train station pub.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks including amusing crisp butty menu.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard, perhaps a little higher than average for the area.

description: On the West Yorkshire 'Real Ale Trail', this station bar has been in CAMRA's Good Beer Guide for 25 years solid and acts both as a useful stop off for passengers using the service and as a local's hangout. With several rooms along a long, attractive stone railway house, you will find a corner to your liking. Sociable and with typical Yorkshire patter flying back and forth, there's some atmosphere to be found too. Slight marks down for the rather generic signage which the company beerhouses also deploys in some of its other pubs, which makes it lose that slightly quintessentially personalised and distinctive feel. (Added August 2021)

name: John Kavanagh The Gravediggers
description:
EBG Rating:: 10
Choice/Quality of Drinks: A very standard Dublin selection of Guinness plus other corporate offerings. The Guinness however, is rarely better than here, and at a far more affordable price than in the centre.
Style/Décor: Timewarp, with weathered wooden fittings. Characterful and beautiful, with scenes deserving of portraiture. Truly authentic bar, with the restaurant section not far behind.
Atmosphere/Character: Brooding and evocative while still having a friendly neighbourhood crowd. Less touristy due to its location and near universally adored.
Amenities/Events: Food, limited standing outdoors, some community events.
Value For Money: If anything in Dublin is that good value for money, a sub 5 euro pint of Guinness is probably it.
description: A masterpiece of historical, weathered beauty. Aged wood that has absorbed a patina of years past, shades of brown and a space that is both intimate, private and yet social with it. Interesting throwback features like wooden screens and partitions, leaning posts. Adored by the locals who know they live near one of the best pubs in Europe. (Added September 2021)

name: Toners
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard corporate range of beers that affects Ireland up and down, however an extensive range of whiskies and formerly award winning.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fantastic old as hell worn away wood, partitions, stripped back, brown and atmospheric. Outside in Toners Yard is a reasonably interesting and ramshackle retro seating area that is deceptively large.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An old time place with a rebooted contemporary, if retro, outdoor space. Both serve their purpose excellently, while not really interacting too much. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, outdoor space, occasional live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Poor

description: Look at Toner's online and you'll find plenty of pictures of a small elderly pub with a lot of character. That exists, and is good enough to comment on in and of itself, however you'll also find a huge yard with partial cover with retro signage. Check out Toner's whisky range. A good all rounder and a great place. (added September 2021)

name: Doheny & Nesbitt
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Nearly all standard corporate fare however a couple of independent craft beers on tap and a well stocked back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmospheric pub with nooks and crannies, gaelic footy memorabilia and a long welcoming bar area. Interesting curved roof and retro signage. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A bustling, social all-rounder that does well to feel spacious and airy despite the bunker-like lack of windows as you venture inside. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, limited outdoor space. Occasional events, live sport, etc.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the city centre

description: A reliable stalwart of the city, yet still interesting and distinctive in its own right. A unique shape with every inch of wall space used for decoration. You'll find it is useful for pub grub and match days without ever feeling too towny. A standout 'Irish Pub' even on a street filled with them. (Added September 2021)

name: Bowes Lounge Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard corporate fare for Dublin, but a well kept pint of Guinness.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Victorian era pub with dark wood panels, mirrors, etched glass, but quite cosy, mixing intimacy of space with grandness of detail. Leather upholstered seating and a narrow room with a long bar along it.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
No tv, no music, no jukebox, this is a palace of simplicity, drink and conversation abound.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Not much to add here.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard city prices - expensive.

description: Close to the heart of the action but just off enough to benefit from the breathing space. On Dublin's Victorian pub crawl and with true classic fittings and a familiar appearance with wood panels, ornate details and some preserved stain glass. The snug is a nice feature too. There is an almost scholarly vibe to the place without music, tv, jukebox, and the atmosphere is created through the ambience of social conversation and the craic from the bar staff. (added September 2021)

name: Mary's Bar & Hardware
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard corporate fare from the big brewers, with some café style options too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Blending living room, American diner and Irish pub stylings all in one. There's plenty on the walls to peruse in this narrow long room. Quirky, and characterful.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A typically mixed crowd, some using it as a café diner, later on a bar. That shows in the general environment in afternoon and evening.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, jukebox, hardware (yeah, right)!

Value For Money: ❤️
Expensive even for the area.

description: Got to give some time and love to a pub that's also a something else, even if the hardware aspect is now almost entirely a conceit. The venue itself is an oddity, but a characterful one, blending living room, American diner and Irish pub stylings all in one. There's plenty on the walls to peruse in this narrow long room. Food is available along with a fairly stock array of drinks. One to put on the rota for Dublin. (Added September 2021)

name: King Charles I
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Real ales, with some passable keg options. Ale-focused but basic back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Small 1 roomed pub. Wood panels with taxidermy and musical/theatre nik naks. Fireplace. Piano and guitar in the corner.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Characterful venue with some local life, coming into its own in the winter months with an intimate one room affair.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music, fireplace, snacks, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably good for the area.

description: A distinctive and personalised venue which retains some characterful wood fittings. Small and intimate with a fireplace and live music, along with compact but decent assortment of ales. Only a short walk from Kings Cross but you'll find local life and decent value here. This may be on account of it being nicely hidden away around a corner, therefore a place for those in the know rather than passing trade from tourists. Lovely unpretentious atmosphere. (added September 2021)

name: The Queens Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A compact range of cask/keg/bottled beers covering a number of bases well. Extensive whiskey selection and decent back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Victorian pub with tiling and wood fittings, however relatively airy with light wood furniture and a skylight.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A good all-rounder, suitable to visit as a couple or with friends, or for a solo venture. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, limited outdoor space, occasional live events, music, books & board games.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly good considering the area.

description: We try to show due credit to venues that cover several bases well, and that can be said for this pub. There's a little bit in there for a lot of people. If you like preserved interiors there are some nice Victorian tiles and fittings to enjoy. If you don't like gloomy old man's pubs, then this one is light and airy without losing its essential intimacy. If you are an epicurist then the selection of ales and whiskies will appeal. If you need to tighten your belt you might be surprised by the good value on offer. If  you are seeking local life away from the tourst trail you will find it here. If you are looking for live events and community, again, this pub delivers. (Added September 2021)

name: Fox & Anchor, Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Youngs ales with some guest options. Competent back bar.
Style/Décor: Victoriana with beautiful facade leading to narrow high ceilinged pub. Back room 'The Fox's Den' leads to a series of gloomy atmospheric snugs, the more distinctive part of the pub.
Atmosphere/Character: A bit of a bunker, the layout of the main room is not as well planned out as you'd like, but the backroom is supremely atmospheric with little hatches and snugs, intimate and private, yet still social, like many of the best pubs. This elevates what would otherwise be simply a nice enough pub. Like many opulent taverns it doesn't have much in the way of local life,.
Amenities/Events: Food, snugs.
Value For Money: Poor
description: After careful deliberation this pub sneaks onto our guide through a combination of a truly beautiful frontage and characterful backroom areas with unique snug rooms including one with closing doors for a carriage-like experience. The rest is competent too, a Victoria high-ceilinged narrow tavern with Young's beers. The situation of the pub is slightly off the beaten path, which is to its advantage in some respects. The food and poor value slightly detracts as does the seating layout in the main room which feels like a missed opportunity to do more. But still, it has unique features, decent drinks and well worth a look (added September 2021)

name: The Viktor Wynd Museum of Curiosities, Fine Art & UnNatural History
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cocktails and limited alternatives

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Victorian epicurism and curiosities. Macabre.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Part-Museum, Part-Bar. There is plenty to explore. Brooding, bizarre atmosphere, albeit the bar feels like an add-on

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Museum, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive

description: A must-see museum with a bar that takes bits of it to form its character. Macabre occult figures, twisted taxidermy and Penny Dreadful style London Victoriana with chintz and sleaze. Cocktails dominate with a limited selection of alternatives. (added August 2019)

name: O'Donoghues Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
The usual poor quality array of corporate beer on offer, with perhaps 1 craft option on rotation. A decent back bar with whiskies.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Traditional preserved Irish pub with its wood fittings, upturned barrels, leaning posts, and snug backroom. Expanded outdoor seating too.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cosy and characterful with a mixture of local life and tourists. Depending on the tourist crowd that can drag it down, but it's of the more superior city centre options.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live music, outdoor seating, accommodation, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Poor value for money

description: While not in the Temple Bar area of pure tourism, this is a very well-known city centre pub with a mixture of locals and tourists and gets very busy on weekends and evenings. It's easy to see why, with a beautifully preserved traditional interior, a narrow bar leading to a very snug backroom with framed photographs and history almost sweating off the walls. (Added September 2021)

name: Kehoes Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The standard corporate fare plus 1 or 2 local independent offerings on tap which counts as a revolution for Dublin, with a decent selection of whiskies and gins behind the bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An interesting combination of Victorian splendour and more obviously historic and preserved elements that are creaking around it. Several snugs and a long bar with an upstairs lounge to boot.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Busy city trade but a combination of locals and passing visitors - including tourists still keeps a reasonable balance. An approachable, friendly place.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Additional seating upstairs, occasional live music, limited.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Poor value for money.

description: A standout venue in a city centre crammed with bars containing standout features. On the Victorian tourist trail but don't expect out and out gin palace type splendour. It's a combination of Victorian styling such as the wood fit bar and more historic feeling nooks and crannies with its two snugs, leaning posts and upstairs lounge. Beers are typical of the area and with a local independent offering. It should be a venue up your sleeve if you are looking for a good pub in the centre. (added September 2021)

name: O'Connors Traditional Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A typical Irish pub range dominated by the corporate offerings who have a stranglehold on most pubs. Murphy's in addition to Guinness here. A regular back bar offering. Cocktails offered.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The 'traditional pub' in the pubs title is slightly pointed and people might think that it would err towards chintzy. In fact it strikes a nice balance with a carefully curated downstairs and upstairs room which comes across homely, with pantry type decorations downstairs and a living room and drawing room aesthetic upstairs including piano.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Sleepy with a pleasant village pub feel during the day despite being on the high street, then a transformation in the evening at the place fills up and becomes raucous.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Toasties + Live music most nights. Outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: A strong choice while in Killarney, the place doesn't go for the gloomy drinking den aesthetic that most Irish pubs are known for, but instead there's a genteel pantry/kitchen type vibe with light wood strip and retro signage, cushioned seats and a homely antiquey lounge area upstairs. Live music pulls in evening crowds and it goes from feeling like a quiet village pub to the heart of the market town in no time at all (added September 2021)

name: Tigh Ui Chathain
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Typical Irish corporate fare, albeit with 1 beer on from West Kerry brewery, which counts as a minor miracle. Decent whisky selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A really quite typical Irish pub decor but not too heavy on the flags and bunting, which helps. Cosy gloom accented by candlelight, some coastal decor as could be expected. A great view out of the back.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A local's pub by day and by night, with local conversation that gradually gives way to a more communal atmosphere during the evenings. The lady of the house keeps charge very well.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Excellent-looking homely pub with views of the mountains and coastline. Rustic wood panelling and some typical coastal pub decor. Some live music and good grub. Almost unanimous praise. (added September 2021)

name: Tig Bhric & West Kerry Brewery
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Independent, small-batch, locally brewed beers both on cask and keg.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A beautiful personalised barn with wood strip ceiling giant fireplace, cushions and intended to be as homely as possible. Akin to a German Gasthof in layout but with an Irish and personal feel.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Super cosy and comfortable with an intimate atmosphere. Calm with only natural ambience and great views surrounding the brewery. Limited hours due to licensing rules for the brewery and the family element means it closes mid-evening.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Brewery tap, snacks, outdoor seating, accommodation

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area and given the operation.

description: A true standout, both for the fact it is an independent small-batch brewery in Ireland, more so that it is based near the middle of nowhere, more still that it has a pub that on its own would be worth visiting even if it only served macro-brew beer. A family operation and labour of love, the beers are true standouts, by far and a way above the norm available in the country, while the pub itself is the epitome of homeliness, with wood strip ceiling giving it a cosy Gasthof feel, with a large fireplace that when going emits an almost intoxicating incense. One of the true wonders of the beer world. Unfortunately it closes early evening, though it's unfortunate it ever closes! (Added September 2021)

name: O'Flaherty's Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard fare of corporate macro brew beers with a decent enough back bar and whisky selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Vivid green paint with most inches of wall space taken up with memorabilia and local artwork. Not too hokey and plastic Paddy, in fact a fairly authentic effort at personalising the place. A large open plan room by Irish standards with a secret feature of a second bar hidden round the back of a quite different yellow/brown wooden style.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Opens later afternoons at quieter times of the year and gets busier in the evenings. Local life to be found, friendly staff.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live music, events, sport, a 2nd bar!

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: An overall excellent looking bar set up to be a bit of an all-rounder but distinctive enough with a cosy enough layout to have some character too. Live music, events, sport etc. (added September 2021)

name: Dick Mack's Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
On site brewery along with Irish classics and large whiskey selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Saloon bar with two snugs, backrooms and preserved interior wood fittings, down to the shop counter people now sit around.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superb day or night, with the right combination of local crowd and travellers, albeit it might lean heavily towards tourists during peak season. Bar staff giving good craic.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, on site brewery, habadashery, outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, a little higher perhaps.

description: A true classic, Dick Mack's would already be the best pub in town for its preserved decor and genius loci, that's before you get into the evening singalongs, snugs and on site brewery that provides sweet relief from the incessant hegemony that is the Irish pub scene. Wonderful craic from bar staff and quirks everywhere from the snugs facing each other opposite two sides of the bar with hatches for service to the habadashery shop counter and original shelves. A true wonderful classic and one of the best pubs you're ever likely to go to.  "Where's the church? - Opposite Dick Mack's. Where's Dick Mack's? Opposite the church". (Added September 2021)

name: Foxy John's
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard selection of Irish macro-brews with a couple of local independents providing sweet relief. Good whisky selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Hardware store-cum-bar. To your right you'll find dusty dog-eared boxes and shelves of hardware, nuts and bolts, and to the left, the bar with a snug to your left. Stool and ledge seating only in the main bar area, with a less interesting but pleasant backroom behind.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The bartender promises 'ruthless craic' and there are a cast of regulars sat at the shop counter who will certainly pass comment whenever they feel like it. This may intimidate some but if you want local life you can't complaint if they serve it to you. Atmosphere perhaps best in the intimate snug to the left of the entrance. Perfect for having a sup of whisky and rumination.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Hardware store. Snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Slightly more expensive for the area.

description: A local institution run with an iron fist. Just as its notoriety has gained, the locals have dug in. You'll be promised and perhaps served up 'ruthless craic' (although if you understand it quickly enough give a bit back - they do genuinely enjoy it). Both Hardware store and pub, this is an oddity, and there is a degree of self-awareness that is the case. Locals prop themselves up by the shop counter and in the snug, but you may find room at quieter times. A quirky, special place. (added September 2021)

name: Baily's Corner
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Very standard range of Irish corporate beers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Long bunker-like interior without windows except the front. Low ceilinged with a classical saloon bar feel. Tinted windows, upholstered leather seating and large snug by the entrance. More interesting in the back area with some retro signage and artwork along with comfortable booths and tables.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bustling market town trade that gets livelier at night. Friendly helpful service.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, live music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Good for the location and in general

description: A fine market town tavern with an appropriately mixed crowd of ages and backgrounds. Friendly staff. A comfortable well put together venue which has as its standouts a snug by the entrance and attractive backroom booths. A superior choice while in Tralee (added September 2021)

name: Paddy Mac's Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Very standard remorselessly identikit corporate fare.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Interesting decor and layout with tinted glass and snug by the entrance. Even after that there's more to explore, despite initial appearances of a normal drop in central tavern. Check the niche to the right with its panels and intimate space. Upturned barrels, leaning posts and little booths make good use of a modest space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A fair mixture of passing trade, this is a typical market town centre pub with people dropping in for a good time, not a long time.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
TV, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Moderate

description: A decent all-rounder which uses its small space well to host niches, booths and a snug as well as an effective bar area. Sport on TV will suit some, while the pretty tinted glass and the way that dances across the tiled floor will catch the eye of those who may have immediately written the pub off as standard. It's a solid all-rounder and enough to squeak onto our guide. (added September 2021)

name: Dadalie club
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bernard beer, occasional rotating guest beers and decent stocked back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Highly individual and personalised cluttered cabin with a bit of an alpine lodge feel, especially the sleighs pinned to the ceiling. Lots of wood.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Intimate and cosy, village life.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fire, outdoor seating small range of food options. Music and sport.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable for the area.

description: What a surprise find! Discovered solely by walking past it, this place would be a good catch in most countries but especially a rural area of Czechia. More effort than normal has been put into making this a highly personalised and distinctive place, cluttered with nik naks and generally alpine/winter theme, it is as cosy as that suggests. Reasonable array of drinks and a local community do the rest. Fab find, a must if you are anywhere near Pardubice. (added October 2021)

name: U Toulavé pípy
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
High quality unfiltered beers from independent small breweries on rotation, craft can in the fridge and basic, standard back bar that can be found at a minimum in most Czech pubs

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A simple minimal format with bright room and wooden furniture, however some efforts to personalise.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The people make any pub and this is its strength even above the beers. Popular with the local community, perhaps a younger crowd than most, friendly and chatty, a proper pub.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited food options, suggestion of live music.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher than average for the area, nothing outrageous.

description: A neighbourhood hospoda full and singing with conversation is a joy to behold and that was certainly the case on our visit. The venue relies on a solid, reliable format, a one room affair with chunky tables and high quality beers on tap. The social aspect stands out above the norm, as do the wares. A must whilst in Pardubice. (added October 2021)

name: Cafe Bajer "In the yard"
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: Limited selection due to café format, however most bases perfunctorily covered.
Style/Décor: Spectaculator art nouveau ensemble with details bursting out from almost every corner and surface. Magnificent.
Atmosphere/Character: The artistry makes the place a must visit, and creates a distinctive feel regardless of how many people are there or what the people are like, that must be noted. A place for an early evening drink rather than late night debauchery.
Amenities/Events: Attractive courtyard garden, small selection of food and café wares.
Value For Money: A little higher than most for the area.
description: The art nouveau ensemble renders this place a standout, even before the lovely courtyard garden is included. Magnificent mirrors, curves and details hog the eyeline and place you in a den of opulence. That's enough, surely? (added October 2021)

name: BROWAR MIEJSKI
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Central European style lagers fresh, unfiltered and unpasteurized from their brewery tanks. Usual selection of back bar offerings.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably pubby with a modest layout that isn't overly cavernous and allows for niches and creates a fairly intimate welcoming space. Rustic decor and hints at the city's history.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical of a central brewery institution, but with a certain modesty in terms of size that makes it feel more like a pub at times too.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Brewery, meals, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher for the area, some servings are smaller than the standard too.

description: Often the problem with city centre brewpubs is, well, the lack of pubbiness. Transient trade, large rooms, constant cooking smells. Not the case here. This one has a nice modest layout that feels very much like a pub, with the TV screen in the corner and niches to sit at. The brewkit is visible and the offerings are decent. While they won't change the world they will help it go round. Central European staples which hit the spot with reasonable accuracy and the typical selection of food to go with it. A solid choice for an afternoon pint and a read even if you don't want to eat. No doubt on certain evenings it gets going from a pub perspective too. (added October 2021)

name: MIRROR PUB
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Small but reasonable offerings of typical Czech drinks, including a few tap options of beers and liqueurs.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Basement venue with exposed brickwork and dive bar appearance, including some rock music nik naks.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cosy cavern feel with a relatively younger crowd.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited in that respect

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: If you like basement pubs with rock music on and good beer you'll probably like this one, which is a good example of its kind. Exposed brickwork and little maze of rooms, each of which are quite small gives it a clandestine feel, while the busy trade keeps the atmosphere buzzing. A nice hideout. (added October 2021)

name: Hobbit club
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A tidy range from their dedicated brewery, quite a standout feature for a small rock club. Usual standard back bar offerings otherwise.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Dog eared and unpretentious, that's how they like it. This is not a place for posers, unless they're posing to be low effort rejectors of normality. Simple tables and rock music + LOTR decor, which is thankfully kept to an understated minimum.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Super casual and super social, which is the key to the success of the place.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Own beers, board games, occasional live music and community meetups.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good

description: How do you renovate a bar that is almost entirely dedicated to being scruffy? Difficult to say, but all the same, this place looks just the wrong side of scruffy, even factoring in that's the whole point. Nevertheless, its quality is buoyed by a great range of its own beers, and a genuinely casual enjoyable social feel, one that can still be enjoyed regardless of the chug-chugging of non-descript metal in the background, which may of course be your thing. (added October 2021)

name: U Zrzavé Mary
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly decent quality, if concise choice of independent brewed beer from small breweries. Good back bar options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Red walls, brooding lights, antiques piled upon each other. Wooden tables. A small backroom with most of the action around the main bar. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Both a dropout venue and quite a cool one, which pulls in an interesting mix of those who want to be seen and those who just want to hang out. Younger, of course, on average. A great atmosphere that bubbles up.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Pizza can be ordered in. Snacks. Err..you can stand outside and have a cigarette?

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Decent for the area.

description: You walk towards the place, grim looking entrance, punters kicking about outside with fags, and already get the sense you're onto a winner. How so? Well, maybe that's a study all by itself worth having. Inside you find a true cult pub and dive bar with dark red walls, brooding lighting and recovered old wireless radios stacked high along the walls. It gets better still with a modest range of independent brewed beer from small brewery and decent selection from the back bar too. You can feel the warm and love radiating back from the people inside. While it's far too casual, dark and dog-eared to appeal to everyone this is a sterling example of what it is. Pure atmosphere. (added October 2021)

name: Vinárna U Bielase
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Wines and spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pub-like and genteel with wood panels, rustic furniture, net curtains, woozy lights. A one room setup with partitioned bench seating and a bar along the side. Personalised and homely.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Calm when quiet (which it often is) but you can imagine it becoming more soulful when full. The master of ceremonies is also a charismatic fellow.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Small selection of snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal

description: Quite simple, go here before it disappears. With no online presence or interest in having one, this is an in-the-know old fashioned wine pub with a dying cast of regulars and kindly old proprietor who takes everything at a steady pace. Beautiful genteel personalised interior that exudes warmth from the wood and woozy lighting. Everything a true old-school Vinarna should be. A classic example. (added October 2021)

name: Kurnik Šopa Hospoda²
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Multitap offering of beers from independent breweries, usually unfiltered and unpasteurised. Bottle range including some other European offerings.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Simple hospoda format, one room with people sat around a long bar, chunky mid-brown furniture and understated but homely decor. Some retro signage.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
True social hospoda with friends and neighbours, albeit an overall younger crowd. The beers attract a few beer fans as well. Observably excellent dynamic between staff and customers, almost a ballet.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Small range of food options, limited other amenities.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Slightly higher for the area, justified by the product.

description: Bringing together simple things to produce an effect more than the sum of its parts deserves the label brilliant. This is a brilliant pub that in its execution comes across as effortless what so many find almost impossible. There is no alchemy here, just good decisions made by wise people. The format is familiar, a hospoda with mid-brown furniture, one room stretched around a bar and homely, understated feel. The offerings are a series of great beers from small breweries, in fact that is the core of its wares, though there are also bottles available and a decent back bar too. Something about the place drags you into its movements and dynamic, keeps you pinned to your seat and makes you long for a home from home that wasn't thousands of miles away. Put simply, if you lived here, you would make this place your 2nd home. Go at once. (added October 2021)

name: Hostinec U Bláhovky
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell tapped by award winning crew and an old school selection of liqueurs.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Old-school Pivnice with browns and golds. Simple small main room dominated by a boxy bar area. Space for leaning at the bar and two tables opposite for perching, with the stamgasts on the right. More space in the backroom. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
In moments a place you never want to leave, that sucks you in and presumably sucks you dry of your money afterwards. Every penny is worth it. A great Pivnice that benefits from its neighbourhood setting with a cast of locals and far enough from the city centre to ensure the only tourists that visit tend to be respectful curious ones. Stays open reasonably late and a final PU is never going to be far from your thoughts.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, pub snacks + roast pork knee

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive for the area

description: Adored neighbourhood pub with a layout and dynamic every bit akin to classic Prague pubs like U Hrocha. Tapster and server duo operated from a small old bar, in a main room which has space for seating and leaning, old brown wooden tables and one of course reserved for their core patrons, the stamgasty. Backroom is still pretty good actually though try to get a seat in the main room to enjoy the comings and goings. Renowned for human head sized pork joints (not an understatement) as well as the Pilsner Urquell which they are so famous for they appear on national adverts. Busy even in Covid times, so have a backup venue in the area ready in case there's no space. A must in Brno. A truly wonderful pub. (added October 2021)

name: Zastávka pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Multitap with beer from small breweries. Decent selection of back bar options, if unimaginative.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Bus/tram stop decor which is a little dorky but not overbearing. Otherwise you'll find a typical multi-room pivnice.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
An overall younger crowd attracted by the beer offerings and on account of the suburban location near bus and tram stops. Needs people in it to have any atmosphere, but once that's the case, it's a nice place.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited food offerings, books + board games, dog friendly

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
OK for the area

description: Is it an overflow car park from Blahovky? Probably too mean, but even in its own right there are plenty of reasons to justify a visit. The dorky 'Zastavka' theme refers to bus and tram stops, and extends to a backroom with a snug shaped like a tram carriage. The rest of the pub is more familiar territory with wooden tables and a beer focus, with several good independently brewed beer from small breweries. The layout requires plenty of customers to make it work, but when that happens it is really singing. (added October 2021)

name: Mýdlo
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly decent, with two independent small brewed Czech beers on tap and a host of hard liquor in the back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Somewhere between the grimiest dive bar imaginable and a basement squat. This makes it sound squalid, and it sort of is. However the premises, including old doors and signage have been maintained which gives it an air of history and significance. A former laundry, apparently. Yellow walls.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A smokey, grungey but vibrant bar that feels clandestine and yet welcoming. There are no airs and graces here, while it is also a totally love or hate it place.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Pool table, smoking, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good

description: This basement bar is truly a cult classic for Brno, around for donkey's years and no-one can remember it ever being anything other than a scuzzy drop-out joint, but in the best possible way. A former laundry, the signage and original doorways remain in place, for a while it still offered to carry out laundry services while you waited for a beer. Why you would do that in such a smokey room is anyone's guess. The yellow walls are a true throwback to the smoking joints of pre-ban days and a young crowd of anyone from bohemians to borderline vagrants makes a beeline for this place. There is much to love, from the steam heater kicking out warm into the main room, the fuzzy surroundings, haze of smoke and terrific beer on offer. Come home reeking but having had a cracking night out. (added October 2021)

name: Blues Bar Traubka
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A decent back bar selection and simple lager options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An antiquey bar with recovered furniture and ornaments in a dimly lit two room bar of reds and yellows. It feels like it will extend to the backroom only to be met by two very tiny toilet rooms.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent, brooding, characterful drinking spot. Look around to find groups that seem permanently attached to their seats, and almost dreamlike inertia as the evening slides away.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
....? Drinks? We'll get back to you on that.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: A down and dirty late night scuzz bar par excellence. Battered antique furniture dimly lit in reds and yellows. Exposed brickwork and very intimate surroundings. Probably the most atmospheric venue in Brno. From the outside all looks closed but give that door another try, and you'll be welcomed into this private little den. Fantastic hang out spot that along with Mydlo makes this street somewhat notorious. Terrible name for the bar, but other than that, one of the best in Europe. (added October 2021)

name: U Vodičků
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell and the usual back bar offerings

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
This isn't a 'Pilsner Urquell Original Restaurant' but a compact neighborhood pub that just happens to go down that offer. You'll find a typical bar/on the stand layout on entry, a few high tables and chairs then a communal backroom with genteel decor. The Pilsner tanks are glowing green by the bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
As with being a neighbourhood pub, you get neighbourly social trade, people turning up for a drink and a chat, not just dinner and transient trade. That's all for the better and there's a real sense of welcome and community here.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair but a little high for the area.

description: Pilsner Urquell Original Restaurants aren't as dominant in Brno as in Prague and this one breaks the usual mould. It is in the suburbs rather than city centre, which while not unusual in itself, is supplemented by its compact size. It has a tasteful and stylish design with hladinka pours that look to die for. Very well rated so far which speaks for its kitchen output too. The main appeal however is of a lively vibrant social scene that choose this place and Na Srebaku over the road to socialise. Highly recommended to get a tram out here for them both. (added October 2021)

name: Pivnice Na Šrébráku
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A rotating offer from some of Czechia's best independent small breweries. Beers dominate but there is a small back bar of supplementary liqueurs.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple knajpa format with a bar on entry and minimalist side room with communal tables. Some of the signage has a distinctive look.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A neighbourhood pub that's independent and not tied into the big macro breweries offerings, already a good start. On our visit the atmosphere was calm and quiet but it was clear that the place had been and would be busy. Simply, a good social meeting place with an individual non-brand feel. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair

description: The growth of untied pubs in Czechia is undoubtedly a good thing if you want to get away from the canteen smells and Staropramen tablecloths and have an actual social venue which serves good independent beers. This is one such place which locals are lucky to have. (added October 2021)

name: U Svatych
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Poutnik pivo including the unfiltered edition. That's all you need to know.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Typical Pivnice with curved ceilings and windows, plain white walls and midbrown furniture set across a series of rooms including a garden. Decorated with religious art in accordance with its name 'All Saints'. Bar area and the room to its right seems the best place to be.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A social scene that's detached from any tourism in the main centre and really feels like an everyday type place, not in a bad way at all. Here is where real life is coming and going. A shame the stamgast table takes up so much room when it's empty.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, garden, dartboard, simple meals

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good

description: At first glance you may have thought this was a throwback boozer, looking at clips and images. While the bar area certainly gives off that impression, this is very much a relevant present day pub with a crowd to match. That said, while some of the space lacks true intimacy and the throng of the best pivnices, it is still distinctive with its mid-brown wood furniture, curved ceilings and religious iconography on the walls. The best area appears to be around the bar and to the right of the main entrance. A garden, TV, dartboard and meals supplement the offering, which is capped off by having Poutnik beer on tap, an absolutely superb session lager. (added October 2021)

name: Pivnice U Pivoje
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.4
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell all the way. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A very classic unspoilt Pilsner pub with dark wood strips, curved doorway and knajpa style bar area with stamgast tables to the right. Some personalisation including a guitar in the corner. Side room for socialising.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmospheric and distinctive drinking den that is set apart from more modern alternatives by the character of its age, the husband and wife team running it and the fact it is a comfy, lived in establishment. Time to learn some lessons.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited food selections, TV screen, snacks, live music, limited leaning posts outside

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value

description: Very well reviewed PU corner pub, another hiding in plain sight between Letna and Strossmayerovo Namesti, surely one of the best areas for unspoilt pubs in Prague. A family operation that's down to earth with relatively cheap prices and a simple knajpa type format, akin to more famous venues such as U Jelinku or Hrocha but without the city crowd and a true cast of locals. Very good and down to earth, comes into its own on weekends with a younger crowd and some live music. (Added October 2021)

name: U sv. Antoníčka
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
PU & Gambrinus 12, with limited selection of liqueurs

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Knajpa type drinking at the entrance with lots of blackened wood, which leads into a central hall with high ceiling, net curtain and antique print on one side.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very much a throwback to the old times. Simple grade 4 dining and boozing in a format that has barely changed.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, separate drinking area

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good 

description: One of Prague's remaining 'fours'. Ie - fourth grade establishment, by the people for the people. Fair prices and honest grub, and of course local life. Until recently the menu was still printed on a typewriter. Dark walls, high ceiling, net curtains in the main area, with a knajpa style boozing area at the front, which unfortunately lacks a bit of a centre piece to gather around, but is still welcome. Old, lived in and really quite far away now from the establishments Prague offers younger people and tourists. (added October 2021)

name: Hostinec Na Slamníku
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Range of Uneticky Pivovar's beers and decent selection of wine and liqueurs

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Historic pub, among the oldest in Prague. The outside of the place looks fairly elderly, with similarly large signage aping its Austrian era appearance. A beautiful front garden, and you are then lead into the main pub room which is a square, high ceilinged and fairly - by Czech standards - formal affair. Solid hard wood furniture and genteel decor.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Certainly operates as a gastropub by day with decent reputation for food, which impinges on true pub drinking a little, but clearly space later on for this to transform into a good boozer as well.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
High standard pub meals, garden

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Slightly higher for the area

description: A historic venue, one of the oldest in the city limits to have been continually operating for hundreds of years. Change happens carefully here but it does happen. The inside has been a little gastropubbed, but still remains a decent upright yet genteel rustic appearance in keeping with its country pub type setting (albeit more of a leafy suburban location). The beers are truly excellent as is the food, so this is somewhere to recommend for a higher standard than the average Czech hospoda, prices not too much higher considering that. Drop in for lunch or give it a chance for a drink later on in the day. (added October 2021)

name: U Prezidentů
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Rychtar and Pilsner beers, decent selection of central European liqueurs

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The highlight of the place. Presidents old and new hung on the walls, with various political commentary literally written or carved around them. Rustic/country/homely furniture in a place that is a little smaller than the outside may appear. Though you know even at first glance at the outside of the building this is a highly personalised and distinctive place.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A calm quiet pint in the afternoons can be found, but you really want to be here during the height of the evening to see it at its best.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, home made snacks, limited outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good

description: One of Prague's handful of extremely distinctively designed traditional pubs, this place oozes quirkiness and character from every orifice to the point where it almost feels like a living dynamic being in itself, slowly carved out of existence. There is enough to keep anyone interested, gazing around at the portraiture and graffiti, along with the antiques. Be sure to drop by in the evening with more people present in order to experience the pub at its finest. A gem, well worth the tram ride from the centre. (added October 2021)

name: Trelkovsky Cafe
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Covers most bases but modestly.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Terrific antiquey bunker in true Kraków bar fashion. Lampshades, rugs, candlelight.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brooding woozy and intimate.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, piano, limited snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable for the area

description: It should be in Kazimierz, but isn't. This bar is plonked in a neither here nor there location, which actually helps render it a little off the tourist trail, though you will hear foreign voices due to all the university and hospital buildings nearby. A typical brooding antiquey bar with a slight hint towards the macabre...potentially even sadomasochistic in places. That aside, it is in fact a romantic venue or a late night spot for boozing that is quite superb. (added October 2021)

name: Tawerna Winne Grono
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Large selection of bottled wine and modest selection from the barrel.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cross between a typical pub with green walls and bench seating and a Vinarna/wine bar vibe. Striking circular hatch between the entrance and the main seating area. Overall a good halfway house.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Homely and cosy, with of course the difference of wine rather than beer drinking dictating the audience. It does try to appeal to both and as such there are some non-wine options.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pleasant outdoor garden, some cold plates of food.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair to middling.

description: A decent option when the Polish lager and craft beers start to get wearing, try a visit here where wine takes centre stage, but the pub itself is still very much a social homely venue with an attractive garden at the front.  (added October 2021)

name: NAPALMĚ, pivní bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Ever changing beers from small independent breweries, mainly very high quality. Very light on alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Basement bar with a yard and back garden upstairs. Low-key with some personalisation. Doesn't look like it has had much money spent on it. Tacky frontage. Small bar area and larger social seating area beside it.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A bit of an odd ball, clearly a 'build it and they will come' venue, and reliant on people actually turning up to drum up atmosphere. Good when that happens, a little soulless without.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor space, limited snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Ok, higher due to the higher quality products.

description: What to say? Well, this is an informal unpretentious bar that is a bit dog eared and DIY in places but knows it and doesn't care. It's nearly all about what comes off the tap, then sitting down and enjoying that with your friends. When it's busy that concept works nicely, and to be fair, the product is absolutely excellent. (added October 2021)

name: Prager Frühling
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Czech classics with seasonal offers from smaller breweries. Limited back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Czech Hospoda type format with a cosy front room and simple wooden furniture. Decorated to commemorate the Prague Spring and revolutions.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A room which lends itself to socialising very well. Communal tables and sense of both intimacy and comfort, relaxation. Drinks focused and for conversation.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Some food available, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable value considering the relatively rare offer.

description: Appearances can be deceptive, so when you look at plates of food and humdrum furniture you may be fooled into thinking this is an average theme pub, but visit and your expectations will be suitably adjusted, for here is a proper hospoda (albeit in Berlin) dedicated to drinking top class Czech pilsners and socialising. The atmosphere is friendly and multilingual, once sat down with friends you will need a crowbar to wrench you out of your seat.  (Added November 2021)

name: Bei Schlawinchen
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Straightforward lager offerings with a decent enough back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Extraordinary array of antiques to gawk at with some wandering into the realm of the macabre. Seedy, kitsch and eclectic, deliberately so.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Typical Neukolln, an extremely varied alternative audience and young crowd in various states of disrepair enjoying this lovely small bar.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Fussball table!

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area, nothing out of the ordinary.

description: A real Marmite pub, this will have some people screaming for the hills on entry, but for those who want a true experience of one of Berlin's famous Neukolln bars then start (or end) here. A cast of rogues, bohemians, lovers and dropouts to sit next to and put the world to rights, table football and giant gorlla dominating the centre of the room and a cave-like arrangement of niknaks of all sorts decorating the walls and ceilings. True atmosphere, but only for the brave. (Added November 2021)

name: Astra Stube
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A limited offering featuring Czech, craft and regional beer. Back bar is decently stocked albeit with a standard range.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
St. Pauli football team pub, which is a lot less ghastly than a football fan pub would ordinarily sound. In fact you'll find low muted red lights which add a calmness and intimacy, with the St Pauli trinkets and memorabilia nicely integrated. Take a look around for some oddities too!

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly first port of call in the area if you are wanting to dip your toe into Neukolln life. Friendly service and a friendly vibe.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited. Table football, snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard and decent value for the area.

description: A good option when dipping your toe into Neukolln nightlife, this is a friendly option with an alternative but welcoming vibe. Even the football theme seems nicely integrated under brooding red lights and a sense that the place is a pub first and a shrine second. It took a couple of goes to get the place, but it certainly deserves a recommendation. (Added November 2021)

name: E. & M. Leydicke
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Homemade liqueurs of various kinds, schnapps, brandies, spirits etc. Limited selection of beer.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Historic preserved venue with decorative wooden bar, tinted windows and parquet floor. An excellent example of faded grandeur leaning towards the classic Berlin roaring 20s era sleaze.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very friendly welcoming multi-lingual host with a great reputation. The atmosphere inside has a clandestine feel, as though almost trespassing, heightened by the smoking. The place is undoubtedly special. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional performances in side room. Smoking allowed.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal for the area and acceptable given the rare venue.

description: One of Berlin's special venues and institutions that it would be a shame to miss out on visited. Beer is not the main event here (although you will see most people with a glass on their table) but the range of liqueurs provided by the proprietor, all stacked behind the bar. A friendly, locally famous guy runs the show and was very welcoming to us on both occasions. Smoking is allowed which will deter some but ultimately completes the sense of atmosphere and place as you are transported back through history. The glamour and a hint of sleaze sums the city up. (Added November 2021)

name: Bayerischer Bahnhof
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
