description: One of the last remaining true Balkan pivnicas, a setup that has survived fashions and various waves of modernity largely unchanged. A simple setup with a kindly, if gruff old geezer serving drinks, with simple Balkan pub grub cooked in the back. The prices are fantastic. At the time of writing 130 lek for 0.5l of beer is unbeatable for the district. It doesn't stop there however, as this pub has the unusual twist of a mature tree in the centre of the bar sprouting through the ceiling to an outdoor terrace, where younger folk congregate. Being cheap, old-school and yet unusual and relevant is quite a feat. It's a must visit. Go while it is still there. (added April 2022)

name: Illyrian Saloon
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard tap options with a more impressive selection of German beers in the fridge. Adequate back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Living up to the name, lots of wood fittings inside with a small stage. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Based in a half-basement, not unlike some central European venues, the interior is more or less windowless with a cosy pubby vibe.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live music, games, snacks, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fine for the area.

description: Illyrian Saloon is an evocative title, and this venue steps out from the cookie cutter Conservatory Lounge Bar format to do something different, which is already a point of interest. Wood fit basement bar with a beer focus, particularly the German beers in the fridge and occasional live music from a small stage. The small outdoor area is green and leafy, which offers an attractive entrance, but it is a venue that needs people in it to have a real atmosphere. Worth a look. (added April 2022)

name: Restorant Tymi
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Extensive bottle selection with a lesser found beer on tap too. The range is good rather than specialist. Beer focused but an adequate back bar for alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Quirky and personalised with plenty of music memorabilia, Albanian heritage decor and bits and pieces of typical pub signage.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
While the pub is also a restaurant, there is an overall pub/bar vibe throughout the day.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, limited outdoor seat, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fine for the area, though not the cheapest by far.

description: There is the permanent question to ask whether a food focused venue is a pub or not. In this case the interior is too clearly pubby to ignore, while the atmosphere is also too informal and social to really refuse to qualify it as a pub either. While there is a certain obligation to order food, many dishes are cheap and light enough to not cause this to be a disqualifying factor. Overall, the vibe is fun, beer focused and distinctive in its personalised way, clearly a city institution. (added April 2022)

name: Çobo Winery
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
High wines and raki from the family business.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Rustic style, though relatively new. Stone buildings with wood fittings in the interior.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Homely with a family character.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Wine tastings, events, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Given the standard and alternatives available, tasting prices are fair, but certainly aimed at the top of the market.

description: Another one to ponder when considering 'when is a bar not a bar?' All things considered, you don't arrive here without wanting to sample the wines. When you sample the wines, the place becomes in essence a pub, with a simple rustic interior with large communal tables, and patio and garden where picnic furniture can be set up. The backdrop of the mountains and local cats and chickens milling about is supremely relaxing in the sunshine with the family made wines, along with cheese and olives provided. (added April 2022)

name: Jazz Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A range covering all bases, albeit in a pretty stock and unimaginative way.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A small awning with brooding red lights leads to similar low lit room with Jazz icons on the wall, simple furniture with a central pillar. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Suitable for a late night Jazz venue, this is a wannabe speakeasy that works fine providing people are present. It feels a little bit like purgatory when it's empty.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Music, snacks, limited other options.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fine given the location.

description: Jazz Inn opens at 9pm, which is an adventurous Western Mediterranean piece of time-keeping, but sets out its stall. Realistically, it often won't get busy until after 10, but then the value of the place emerges. There aren't too many other bars open around Ohrid's old town, with most of the nightlife based on the lake strip and central streets. This provides a magnet for late night revellers in what is a shady brooding, low lit bar churning out one Jazz classic after another until the shutters go down. Drinks options are disappointingly trad, but this is really a one man operation and should not be sniffed at given the pretty poor alternatives in this town. (added April 2022)

name: Speakeasy Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superb imaginative cocktails with a well stocked back bar for any mixers or shorts.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A 2nd floor apartment repurposed into a bar. Simple cream walls with some 70s designs and antiques giving it a timeless feel.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brilliant atmosphere with a younger, alternative but not quite hip crowd, with a focus on conversation over partying.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
What more do you need?

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good value for money considering the quality provided.

description: One of Skopje's best bars, this one really does deserve the title 'hidden', with no obvious signs outside as to its location. In the end, you may find yourself following a group ahead of you into an apartment and hoping for the best. On the 2nd floor, there it is! Enter to find a long bar across the left of the room with two side rooms for further seating. The cocktail maker produces superb drinks from an imaginative menu of well-thought out twists on modern classics. The atmosphere is alive with local conversation in a clandestine but welcoming, intimate space. An unforgettable experience. (added April 2022)

name: Глуво Куче/Deaf Dog
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent range of quality European beers with a range of Macedonian craft beers pushed forward, a real rarity. An adequate back bar for alternatives, but beer is the focus.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
An ottoman vibe to the interior with stained glass, some arched windows and traditional weaves, a one room pub with some outdoor seating.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fairly sleepy during the day, we recommend an early evening visit to find the social value, the place coming alive with locals.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, books, occasional live events.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair given the rarities on offer.

description: One of Skopje's best beer bars, this place serves up a number of beers from independent brewers in North Macedonia, along with an impressive fridge selection of European beers. The drinking happens in a one-room neighbourhood bar established in 2020 but already clearly a city institution. Visit late afternoon to early evening to watch the place fill up and its atmosphere improve. Decent pub grub and friendly attentive service completes what is clearly a labour of love turned into something a bit special for the city. (added April 2022)

name: Pub Porta
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Only a few taps, but a large bottle selection by Macedonian standards, with domestic and European beers, including a tie with O'Hara's in Ireland, of all places (this is not an Irish pub)

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
One-room setup with a covered terrace for smoking, simple wooden fittings and brewery signage. Warm hues. Informal and unshowy.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Social and communal with a binding quality that makes you feel like it's the place to be. Chatty and overall atmospheric.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, outdoor seating (smoking permitted), books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Given the location and offerings, reasonable, as shown by the customers which are local.

description: Set back from a street of long apartment blocks, you could easily walk past this inconspicuous place with its covered terrace, and indeed we did on our first visit. If anywhere says "Let's go to the pub" in Skopje, its here, Pub Porta. The interior is a lovely, small one-room set up with a corner bar and 3 fridges. These contain a healthy range of domestic and European lagers and, for some reason or other, an association with O'Hara's ale in Ireland. Pub grub is served to accompany this but is in no way obligatory. With a social, communal focus, the atmosphere is built around conversation, and in that sense everything feels alive, at home and at one here. A must-visit. (added April 2022)

name: Woodstock Craft Beer & Rock
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lesser spotted Czech beers, a real rarity for Macedonia, along with Hungarian craft beer from Monyo. Standard café bar options, otherwise.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A tacky 70s sign is the worst of it, while more imaginative and tasteful design can be found on the terrace and inside. On a quiet day, especially when warm, it's best to be on the terrace with the curved metal arches and greenery, along with flowerbeds filled with bottle tops. Inside find a two floor setup with various 70s and 80s music and Americana design, a little bit unevenly spread around.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Set on the main road rather than in a particular nightlife spot, this is a little transient feeling of a place, but it is local and friendly.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for the wares available.

description: A direct but accurate title. Craft beer, rock music with a festival theme to the design. Roadside bar with a large terrace and two-floor setup indoors. Friendly service provides a range of reasonably interesting non-standard (for this area) Czech beer and Hungarian craft from Monyo. Rock music sets the tone, and overall it is very much worth dropping by this bar if you like either and are in Skopje. (added April 2022)

name: BKW Hybrid Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Most bases covered competently

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Round bar with cinema showroom type signage above and post-modern decor on the walls. Striking and well-executed, if corporate looking.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
More bar like than the usual Lounge places around the Balkans, this is very clearly for drinking and later, partying.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, outdoor seating, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little more expensive given the outskirts location

description: A reasonably interesting find in the relative outskirts of Skopje, a bar with a neighbourhood audience but a contemporary city feel. The drinks are relatively broad in their coverage (except perhaps for an absence of craft beer, not unique to here in a country like North Macedonia) and the atmosphere in this relatively distinctive bar is kept alive by its local audience. (added April 2022)

name: Old Town Brewery
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A range of brewpub beers along with standard Café Bar offerings as alternatives

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Battered, well-worn wooden furniture inside in a building set up a slope, looking out over the old town. At the back a courtyard with a pretty fountain.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Backpackery with more tourists than most Skopje venues, with a louder, brasher feel as a result. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, food, snacks, live music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little more expensive.

description: While a little bit dog-eared and backpackery, this brewpub (without much competition, it has to be said) offers a rare change from the same beer brands and its central location among the Old Bazaar makes it ideally situations for an afternoon drink by the fountain or a faster paced evening of revelry. We were unimpressed by the beer or the inaccurate menu but  it's difficult to look past as a location or, due to its versatility, its offerings. (added April 2022)

name: Custom pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A classic range of Balkan café bar drinks with some German beer added.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Biker bar / Rock club themed with all that entails, along with a terrace outfront, which  overall takes up the majority of space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasingly local, unvarnished and unpretentious.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Street food van, snacks, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for the area, particularly considering the central location.

description: While the raw ingredients at this unpretentious biker pub are familiar and well-worn, there is something  likeable about its honesty and authenticity, along with a crowd of locals congregating only metres from Skopje's very centre. A reliable bolt hole for an actually not that bad tapped Zlaten Dab, especially in bad weather or at a pinch as a stop off between venues. Later on it gets loud and raucous, but this is North Macedonia, and you wouldn't want it to be any other way. (Added April 2022)

name: Konoba Avlija
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A standard range of Café Bar drinking options covering all bases moderately. Some European lagers too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The strongest suit of the venue is the decor, with every effort made to imbue character, from the neon signage outside, to a corridor filled with ephemera, nik naks and Montenegrin heritage. This leads to an open courtyard with a stage an hatch type decorations around the walls. Not dissimilar to a ruin bar in style.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A Konoba would normally suggest a restaurant but this venue is every bit drinks focused, at least from the late afternoon onwards. Especially when the live music begins, this is in essence a bar, Podgorica's standout in terms of its distinctive character.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, food, snacks, outdoor seating, museum exhibits

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A local institution, the neon signage draws you into a corridor filled with personal effects and Montenegrin heritage before opening out into a wide, but still personalised and characterful courtyard with a stage at the end. While the place offers food, it is known as a bar and drinking venue in the evening, with an environment that comes alive the noisier and busier it gets, much like a ruin pub. A standout venue anywhere, but especially somewhere like Podgorica. (added April 2022)

name: Biro
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Niksicko unfiltered on tap, something that will give Kellerbier fans cause for relief in the Balans beer desert. A lovely beer. Largely the focus is on cocktails and mixers here, also strong.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A pinkish red light dominates the main room which is all about pumping out the hits and getting sweaty. Meanwhile, the courtyards out the back are atmospheric and worth checking out when it's quieter, or just in general.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fairly clubby inside, while conditions take an upturn in the two spaces out the back, which have a more laid back, leafy, courtyard bar atmosphere we can recommend.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Biro is definitely a place for dancing and typically loud Montenegrin partygoing, but if you think it's one-note, think again. With a lovely verdant back yard with cats roaming around there are places to chill out and enjoy the other side of the bar. With unfiltered Niksicko (a drastic improvement on the original) on tap, beer drinkers have a genuinely good lager to enjoy, while the mixers and cocktails can be variable, particularly depending how busy they are. Service is kind, fast and welcoming. (Added April 2022)

name: Klub Haustor
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️~A familiar range of café bar classics across the alcohol range, with a couple of Budvar bottles too.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Interesting, eye-catching exterior with colourful tiles, and a decorated alleyway. Inside is not quite so dramatic but still personalised. It looks not entirely finished, however.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Smokey in places with a busy bar area and dartboard. While it seems they were aiming for a fun alternative vibe, a wider spread of local life to be found here, of a younger kind.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Dart board, snacks, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Middling for the district.

description: Haustor feels like a step in the right direction but a journey not yet completed. With a striking exterior and attractive alleyway, you can quickly think you are on to a hidden gem. The reality is not far from that, but there is room for improvement inside. It's nice to see local life though, and not just cliques but a range of people. Drinks and prices are fair, and this is definitely one for an alternative/bohemian crowd. Worth a look on a route around Podgorica's bars. (Added April 2022)

name: Itaka library bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A rare location for Montenegrin craft beer - and on tap too. Good standard of café bar options complete a decent set.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Based in an old female Turkish bath house, this place was previously also a bookish cafe. A three storey bar with narrow space around a central atrium, roof terrace.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
There are good views on the glass fronted roof terrace, intimate vibes on the middle floor and lively bar action on the ground floor. With a bookish, academic vibe out of season, the pace doesn't pick up until the crowds arrive in summer.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, snacks, outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair given the options available.

description: An unusual historic building houses this café, resurrecting a more unusual piece of Podgorica's heritage, with a women's Turkish baths on the site formerly. Now, this comes directly under a motorway escarpment, adding to a collage of unusual juxtapositions. Montegrin craft beer is available here, with the bar itself taking cues from the West in terms of its design and attitude. Friendly service and a series of nooks and crannies across 3 floors to have a low key, but intimate and warm evening out. (added April 2022)

name: Munchen Zentrum
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Some German beers, along with a familiar café bar range of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A wooden lodge feel to the interior which, while derivative, still feels nice in the surrounding of concrete apartment blocks.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A local watering hole with a neighbourhood type audience. Well staffed considering all that.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating, sport on TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher considering the backstreet location, but nothing offensive to a Western audience.

description: A more unusual venue for this side of the Balkans, with a cosy cabin-like interior offering chunky furniture and wooden beers. While nothing to get overly wowed about, there is a comfortable familiary that puts you at ease, and is a break from the typical Balkan lounge bar options elsewhere. Local life as well, which pushes it over the threshold. (added April 2022)

name: Bulevar Džada
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A local nano brewed lager is available, along with some decent wine and raki, otherwise standard café bar options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A very small interior with a curved corner bar and some lived-in surroundings, with some strategic lighting. A terrace outside slightly ruined by plasticky crappy furniture.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
This is no showy hangout, instead what you get is a more unvarnished experience with a smokey terrace and lively interior. Don't be bashful, get stuck in and you'll be welcomed like the rest of them.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good 

description: This is no showy hangout, instead what you get is a more unvarnished experience with a smokey terrace and lively interior. Don't be bashful, get stuck in and you'll be welcomed like the rest of them. Not quite a down and dirty venue, there is a hint of sleaze and wildness to it all the same. (added April 2022)

name: PG akademija piva
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Several competent and reliable home brew beers following recognised US and European styles. A strong selection for the region.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A typical brewpub but with brushed metal and dark hues complimenting the brew kit.. A long, large venue with a covered terrace.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A solidly middlebrow corporate brewpub atmosphere with a lack of communal areas and focus on beer, the private experience and food over socialising. Not an unpleasant place to be, but don't expect a 'pub' in the true sense.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, outdoor seating, own brew beers, tastings, tours

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Higher for the area but really quite reasonable factoring in the more unusual offerings.

description: It's brewpub time. Firstly, full marks to the place for doing its homework. The beers here are well brewed and reliable with the operation a slick and relatively corporate one. It wouldn't stand out in other countries but here in Podgorica it certainly does. In some ways its  anaesthetising sterility is a bad thing, in other ways it's quite impressive they invested so much money in a country where there was no established audience for such a venue. You will have a solid brewpub experience here and come away satisfied. (added April 2022)

name: The Nitrox Pub & Eatery
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A big range of drinks for a small bar, with Balkan craft beer and others, along with a large cocktail menu. Be prepared for a lot of the menu to not be available though.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Nautical theme with diving helmets and Octopus emblems in what is a really tiny bar fitting about 10 people sitting and 6 around the bar area.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Intimate and lively with a constant energy

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, food, snacks, TV 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️Poor value and clearly intended to scalp tourists, shown by a lack of local interest.
description: This is the bar Kotor needed, but at what cost? Good beer and cocktails in a relatively updated, relevant feeling mini-pub, but pricing out locals with its tourist focus, expect to pay well over twice the cost as some down the road, and particularly in the capital. Anyway, the nautical design is interesting, it widens Kotor's nightlife and is situated in an atmospheric old town street. Overall it is worthy of a recommendation. (added April 2022)

name: Authentic Pub "Bandiera"
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A standard range of café bar options, with light and dark Niksicko beer on tap.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
'Authentic' apparently means lots of chunky wood, not the worst choice in the world. A small bar up a few steps with a relatively cosy traditional feel, although the claim of authenticity is dubious.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Ever present due to long opening hours, this place runs with an almost meditative perpetuity. Good if you like groundhog day dynamics, or need to find a bar in a pinch. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Relatively fair, as demonstrated by a few locals who combine with tourists here.

description: There's something reassurring about a pub that always seems to be open. Whether morning or late night the show goes on here at this pub which makes a virtue of supposed authenticity. While that isn't quite achieved, at least they have pointed in the right direction with warm and cosier wood fittings and a saloon bar type feel inside, with chunky wooden frames by the bar. A mixture of locals and tourists is kept up by fair pricing, and they have dark and light beer on tap. In Kotor with the options available, this should be on the hitlist for anyone who wants a beer in a more trad place. (added April 2022)

name: Jazz Club Evergreen
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Poor range, some of which isn't even available. Drinks are not this place's strong suit.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️
Some intriguing items inside to look at, but a bit of a mishmash, with a fashion show projection on the wall and fairly bland grey furniture. Again, sitting inside here is not really what it is about.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Not much to promote inside, but when the live performances start on the terrace, with the old town and Fortress in the hills lit up, the atmosphere is unmissable in Kotor.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Live performances, outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Poor value for money, aimed at tourists. Particularly poor for soft drinks

description: It's extremely unusual that we would make a recommendation for a place with no particularly interesting drinks, decor or inside atmosphere, and poor value for money but the live jazz performances out on the terrace in the evening are such that Kotor itself comes to lend this bar a helping hand, transforming a fairly unsuccessful and unlikable bar into a wonderful night out. Ambivalent, much? (Added April 2022)

name: The Swan Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Two active cask lines for handpulled ale, basic lager and ciders and small back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Homely lived in and personalised pub that is like stepping into someone's living room. Two lounges, one with a fireplace and rear view, and one front lounge, both with upholstered bench seats. Small corner bar with window overlooking church. CAMRA inventory listed.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A throwback, family run with local life and simple rural atmosphere. Radio on a low volume and a quiet almost serene atmosphere during the afternoon.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Fireplace, snacks, outdoor seating, occasional community events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair and standard for a village pub.

description: Very well reviewed unspoilt village pub with some personal touches, comfortable bench seating and even some preserved features on CAMRA's national inventory, this was a gem of a find and a throwback, endangered species of a place. Being drinks only and keeping 2 opening times for afternoon and evening hours is relatively rare anyway. Add in the rural location and family run operation and this is one of the last of its kind across the country. Superb homely atmosphere and long may it stay open. Go before it's gone. (added May 2022)

name: The George Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cask ales from local breweries and Pilsner Urquell on draft in top condition. Standard back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A long annexed whitewashed row of stone cottages next to an old bridge, with ample outdoor seating and a rear entrance leading to small rooms with low ceilings. Intimate bar area with fireplace and fishing memorabilia.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
While there are some hints of gentrification in accompaniment with the food focus, the core of a true inn remains with a superb bar area, family run welcome and personal service with staff that make an effort to get to know you. Intimate with low ceilings, a great example of how to pivot to food service while still remaining a pub for socialising.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, Outdoor seating, Meals, Snacks, overnight lodgings

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Not cheap but reasonable for today's country inn and produce of this standard.

description: A spectacularly good pub that has managed to tread the fine line of serving food to pay the bills while also retaining a social pub character to its core. In a relatively remote hamlet with a very infrequent bus service about 40 minutes walk away, there is no great community of locals here, as such it inevitably relies on hikers and diners to pay the bills. Family run, there is a real die hard enthusiasm and care, with Ed serving and taking time to get to know you. Bookings are recommended for for lunch or evening service, while if you want a drink or light meal, the bar area and outdoor patio tables may be available. With award winning pies and fresh fish delivered daily, you can't go wrong with the delicious meals here, nor indeed with the range of local ales from Wensleydale brewery, or Pilsner Urquell lager hauled all the way from Czechia, a rare find out here in the heart of the Yorkshire Dales. Intimate and characterful, your needs will be met and then some. Sit by the fire, enjoy the pub dog George tottering about and design your next hike that coincides with this place. A classic. (Added May 2022)

name: The Fox & Hounds Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Range of Yorkshire Dales ales on tap from small and more recognised breweries. Small but broad enough back bar options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A still relatively unspoilt inn with whitewashed exterior and beer garden outfront by the road through the village. Inside, flagstone floor and fireplace with cosy niches. Small but nicely formed with character that hasn't yet been expunged or renovated into some bland nothingy dining room.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A very sociable village pub supplemented by hikers and day trippers, particularly on weekends. A stalwart with a good balance, not simply turned over for dining.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, live music, community events, meals, overnight lodgings

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing unusual for the area.

description: A notable Yorkshire Dales pub which has retained some country features such as flagstone floor and real fire, along with cosy niches and small rooms inside. It also benefits from not being fully turned over for dining. This is still a sociable village pub with locals supplemented by day-trippers and hikers that happens to do meals and lodgings. A friendly welcome also. (Added May 2022)

name: Harrys Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of real ales, cider and craft keg with a few Belgian options in the fridge. Limited back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cosy, genteel drinking den situated on an alley arcade by a car park. Wood interior with a timeless feel and well designed social spaces.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Friendly alehouse that seems to do a reasonable job deterring market town pissheads. Genteel and relaxing space with a community feel.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, community events, books, board games, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable for the area.

description: Convenient for the train station, Harry's represents more than just a convenient answer to how to kill half an hour before a train. It's a real drinking den of a kind that has rightly gained a good reputation. Wooden and genteel with views of a leafy hedgerow exterior and outdoor decking for summer drinking, the place has fostered a community and deserves a place on our guide. (Added May 2022)

name: Luis Bar at Fernandes Brewery
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wide offering of craft keg and several cask ales with some Belgian beers in the fridge. A reasonable back bar of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Situated in a very unpromising location, so it's a surprise to enter to find a smartly done barn with old pub signage and a well put together. A small downstairs leads to vaulted beams with a gallery overlooking the downstairs.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A clearly cult venue with a lot of history with the brewery connection, full of locals and those in the know. Calm during the afternoon and lively in the evenings.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live events, snacks, darts

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard, perhaps a little higher for the area.

description: Wakefield's truly outstanding venue in terms of distinctive appearance and character, along with its brewery origins. You don't expect any of this as you round an ugly roundabout into a backstreet with dubious characters lurking about among a horizon of towerblocks, but venture inside! With a suite of keg and cask beers and Belgian ales in the fridge, you'll find a good array of choice. Downstairs is a long narrow room with partions and limited seating space. Upstairs you'll find an impressive vaulted ceiling with gallery overlooking the downstairs. Recovered pub and brewery signage is positioned carefully and makes a striking impression. Dartboard to the rear and occasional music nights keep the community aspect alive. A must-visit when pubbing in Wakefield. (Added May 2022)

name: THE MARBLE ARCH INN
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Marble beers on cask and keg with some guests. Well stocked back bar for alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Victorian splendour with preserved mosaic tiling and vaulted beams in a one room setup, famous for its sloping floor down to the bar. A standout.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Popular and buzzing venue on evenings and weekends, the atmosphere a little more lacking on weekday afternoons, partly due to the music choices and volume.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, quiz, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard towards high for the area.

description: One of Manchester's famous historic taverns has been kept well preserved and out of the clutches of large chains, an impressive tightrope walk in itself. The interior with sloping floor and vaulted beams is well worth stopping by for alone, while Marble beers are kept as well as you're likely to find them. A mixture of locals and city trade with only an iffy soundtrack dragging things down. Among the better Manchester pubs. (Added May 2022)

name: Bar Fringe
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Belgian beer focus including some rarely found on tap. Decent if compact fridge selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cream walls with small pillars in a one-room setup leading to the rear garden. A mixture of furniture. Eclectic design with breweriana, personalised bits and pieces and fish tank. A little off beat, and easily passes for a Belgian bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasantly homey and gezellig even in the quieter hours while versatile enough to be able to up the tempo as it gets busier. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
On the expensive side.

description: While Belgian bars have moved out of favour in the last decade, this place has continued trading since the 90s which shows in the lived-in, personalised interior and stalwart vibes. Any novelty has long worn off but they don't tend to make new bars like this, so arguably this now stands out. Indistinguishable from a Belgian bar, which is to its credit, aside from a few cask ale pumps. You can find plenty of classic Belgian marques on tap and in the fridge. Cosy during quiet hours, buzzy later on, the place has an easy versatility and natural, unpretentious appeal. (Added May 2022)

name: Dejvická Nádražka
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple cheap beer options with simple cheap spirits behind the bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A 'lived in' dive with brown texture walls and ceilings, battered furniture and a large high ceilinged room with a stage and piano at the back. Beer garden adjacent, including some seating looking out over the tracks.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
As characterful as you'd expect. This is almost like a station takeover but the police have never turned up to claim it back for The Man. Cool, cult venue with beer garden + platform side chilling and taproom boozing.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor space, piano, stage,  live performances TV, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value these days for Prague, though the final ebbs of the £1 pint ended in 2022.

description: It has taken us a while to get around to visiting but we made it this year. It justifies the hype, a true fourth grade Pajzl, down to earth, unassuming and unpretentious in the extreme. No airs and graces at the bar but cheap beer served quickly and directly. Atmospheric high ceilinged station pub with outdoor seating to look over the infrequently used tracks or the garden area to break out a guitar and have a singsong. True boozing with not a thought to changing the format. A cult venue. Catch it on the right evening and it is truly among Prague's finest. (Added May 2022)

name: U houbaře
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Why, Pilsner Urquell! This is one of Prague's core PU pubs.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Formerly lime green, the place has had a sensitive makeover without ruining the prior aesthetic. Mushroom theme (hence the name) with beer ephemera. A small taproom leads to two larger partitioned rooms as suitable for pubgoing or dining, equally informal.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Service with the tapster/server combo has a degree of formality and familiarity, and the pub is still largely inhabited by locals rather than tourists, although they are used to an increasing number. You'll find the atmosphere sleepy at times, occasionally bursting into animated conversation.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Cooked food, TV, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, but not among the cheaper places.

description: We have known about the place a long time now, all the way back to 2007 in fact, as one of Prague's core Pilsner Urquell pubs. It has taken a while to convince us to include it on the guide, but slowly and surely it has won us over. Perhaps it's the well choreographed tapster-server combo, the persistently local neighbourhood feel to the place that's been lost in certain central Prague places, and the refurbishment that removed the quite garish lime green walls in favour of a sensitive, sympathetic ruralism. It just hits the mark across enough criteria to be a firm recommendation. (added June 2022)

name: U Suchý Dásně
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A couple of tap options covering different strength pale lagers, and a typical Czech back bar offering of hard liquor.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A compact taproom at the entrance leads to a surprisingly big pub with two large rooms off each other. Interesting, often quirky murals on the wall and by Czech standards highly personalised in a lived-in, traditional way.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cult venue that relies on a constantly refreshing trade of alcoholic dropouts, students and the alternative crowd. The atmosphere goes with that, though service is fairly friendly by Prague's sometimes grumpy standards.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Table football, darts, snacks, limited outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the area but not the cheap-as-anything dive you might expect.

description: A cult scuzzy hangout with an interior that tells of the thousands of great nights out its witnessed. A little dog eared and lived in, but then that's the whole point. Stock beers and drinks options with games and social space for people without pretension and seeking a relatively central space to hangout, drop out and get wrecked. If you like the sound of that, you should put it on your to do list. (Added June 2022)

name: Pivní Jistota
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A high quality range of tapped Czech ales from trad to modern styles with a fridge of other options. Limited back bar with some ciders.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️
Simple modern one room café sty;e interior blandly designed, with rather neglected and sad basement area. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
One of those pubs that requires people in it to have any atmosphere per se, but the space is social enough that when it fills up, it will work.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks (paté especially), limited outdoor space.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher than normal for the area and the wares offered, but nothing scary.

description: A venue focused primarily on good beer but with a decent social space too. The multitap options are varied and changing but focus on the best of Czech brewing traditional and modern. Their food options centre around paté, for whatever reason, and there's a little café style terrace for sitting out. Ironically, the best time to come is when it's most difficult to find a seat. One of those places, but on those days, it justifies an inclusion. (Added June 2022)

name: U Velblouda
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Unetice beers on tap, enough to get most Czech pilsner fans off their seats. But also others such as Svijany, and a compact typical back bar of Czech staples for hard liquor.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A small taproom at the entrance fitting probably no more than 12 people, and basement for evening hangouts which feels a bit soulless on quieter evenings. Camel themed (hence the name) but wears that quite lightly, thankfully.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Social but quite local, so mind your p's and q's. In some ways a very typical neighbourhood city drop-in pub for a quick drink and a chat, just with a bit more of a tailored decor and much better beers.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, TV, music, games

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good value considering the quality of the beer.

description: By locals and largely for locals, but if you're polite you won't put anyone's noses out of joint turning up here for a beer. And what a beer - Unetice range on tap for a steal, with a small camel-themed taproom to enjoy it in - lucky you! If its busier, the basement will surge into life, but otherwise you're better off milling at the bar and soaking in some true local life that you won't find most places in central Prague. (added May 2022)

name: Singer Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly good with both small-batch brewed Czech lager and some Euro offerings that may be familiar but are atypical for Czech towns.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Curved bunker-like pivnice that's been turned into an all-purpose evening hangout. Lived-in decor with chunky tables and nik-naks, including the eponymous sewing machines.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️Unpretentious, lively, lived-in, knockabout kind of place, one of the town's longer lasting venues and a bit of an institution. Attracts some alternative, younger audience but also has a collegiate, faintly backpackery type feel.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, games, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair given the location

description: Not a sister pub to Krakow's more famous Singer, but the eponymous sewing machines do make an appearance at this bunker-like Pivnice and late night bolthole near CB's main square. The more familiar down-to-earth qualities are supplemented with some decent and unusual beer options on tap and an uncommon versatility to the place that comes naturally. It's the opposite kind of venue to the upstanding formal Restaurace or Pivnice's with tapsters and servers and cutlery on the table, but it isn't too hostile in its bohemian ways either, most people can find a corner here. (added June 2022)

name: Hostinec U Nezmara
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Samson on tap, unusual, even for the city. Classic Czech back bar options for harder stuff.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An attractive mural by a garage entrance leads to a large courtyard. In the pub itself, find homely, twee interior with doilies and rich blue table cloths. A well looked after pub. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
True local life, after all, few tourists would go this far out of town. However you'll receive a friendly welcome if you mind your ps and qs, and there are two sides to the atmosphere, with some more raucous musical moments in the courtyard and genteel socialising inside.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, small selection of food and snacks, music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: Time stands still here, in a sideroad just outside of the city centre, you'll find this genteel old time Hostinec. But don't think anything has gone stale here. It's a vibrant place with local life spanning the generations. Younger folk spending warm evenings in the courtyard, older folk by the taps socialising. Even the twee decorations look well-tended to with each item dusted and in its place. Further still, you'll find Samson on tap, the other traditional Budweis brand and original hoarding above the taps. It's a fair drink well tapped and at its best, and you are unlikely to find it any better than here. As you enter the place you'll find a new-looking mural/emblem painted on the garage wall, which itself seems to broadcast that the place is still here and still relevant. (Added June 2022)

name: Hostinec U Černého koníčka
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Lobkowicz group beer such as Platan with seasonal specials on rotation. A decent enough back bar with Czech classics.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Upright town centre Hostinec with a clear revivalist feel. Breweriana decorates the wall with some museum pieces too such as the old taps. Large tables and high ceilings, with a sideroom also decently personalised. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The rhythm of these daytime drinking holes has a fascination of all of its own, with the tapster/server combination in full swing, cast of regulars in before the lunch crowd arrives. The place is local but spacious and accommodating. You won't need to worry about heads turning. Arm yourself with a few phrases to help smooth the experience along.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, TV, snacks, limited outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: A pub with a history and a decoration that speaks to it, with a clear revivalist feel, breweriana on the walls, a high ceiling and classic Knajpa type taproom. You'll even find some museum pieces such as old taps and cabinets in the two large rooms in the interior. The rhythm of the day gives the place its charm, with locals being gradually absorbed into the busy lunch service and tapster/server combo at work. It's a proper pub with space to drink and socialise without any pressure to eat, and you may find some nice beers here too, such as the Kvasnicovy Platan lager we found on our visit, poured so immaculately that it deserved drooling over. (Added June 2022)

name: Hospoda Na Louži
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A couple of Czech classics on tap plus a reasonable wine selection given the region and restaurant pretensions.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pleasingly unchanged characterful interior with dark wood compliments by beer ephemera. If it is attempting to evoke times past - which it surely is - it works. The strongest suit of this pub.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A tourist town and that can be reflected in the trade here, which is food-focused but not exclusively. The Hotel aspect of the venue can lead to different sort of encounters as well, not all negative.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Hotel, wine list, limited outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: This restaurant also serves the true function of a pub in its extremely pubby dark-wood panelled interior, with decent beer and wine options to enjoy, in an intimate social space. Yes, there's food service and even hotel comings and goings, but the preserved fittings and decorations conjure up that hazy yet pervasive image of the classic Hospoda of times past. In a place like Cesky Krumlov, it's a bit of a bonus. (Added June 2022)

name: Exxtrablatt
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Some quality German and Austrian beers of traditional style on tap and decent bottle selection, the bar is also well stocked for alternatives and is not by any stretch beer focused.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Sultry gloom in a basement stuffed with framed artwork and photos, some film/music based and some of historic Linz, musical instruments and niknaks on show.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful brooding basement setting that stretches into a backroom where perhaps the most atmosphere can be found, with a social setup and lively, buzzy atmosphere.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic food, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Fairly expensive for the area, but nothing out of the ordinary.

description: One of Linz's clearly best bars, an outstanding basement venue with red walls, musical ephemera and framed photos which goes from a curved bar to a more intimate buzzy backroom. Plenty to recommend it from the decent drinks to the downright friendly feel in spite of the city centre setting. Mark on your list. (Added May 2022)

name: CulturCafé Smaragd
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple cafe bar options, so basic lager, mixers, spirits etc.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Green with a distinctive cannabis theme, off-beat, bohemian but wears it lightly, it isn't exactly an Amsterdam coffeeshop. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Low key, friendly and unpretentious with an arty, bohemian feel.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Standard for city centre Linz.

description: Live music on weekends in this small venue takes up at least a quarter of the space, and with the bar area taking up another quarter, you feel almost like you're receiving a private performance. That is a bit of a plus. Off-beat with a lightly-worn cannabis theme, calling themselves the Grasieri, this cafe bar has a distinctive theme and events to draw you in,  and friendly folk, even if the drinks are a little ho-hum. (Added May 2022)

name: Thüsen Tak
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Bottled beers of a middling/poor standard and hard liquor.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
It's a metal pub, but really taking in all eras of rock. The decor is what you could expect, including some frankly eye opening collages. The venue is small with seating opposite a bar and darts at the back.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
You never know what you're getting with rock pubs but this has a genteel, come one come all category, amplified by the cats prowling around and fairly friendly service. The patrons are also welcoming, which takes the intimidation factor down substantially if you're flying solo.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Darts, pub animals...rock music.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard. Nothing to write home about.

description: It's always nice when gearing up to go to a metal pub to establish how friendly it's going to be. This one is at the more friendly end, an open inclusive space with music spanning all eras of rock and heavy metal. Look out for the pub cats and flying darts on the way to the toilets, grab a bottle of beer and enjoy socialising in a friendly space. Distinctive as well as long standing, it comes recommended. (Added May 2022)

name: Stiegl-Klosterhof
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A wide range of Stiegl beers on tap dominates the selection. Impressive, all fresh and well poured.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An ur-typical central European beer hall with white washed walls, coathooks everywhere and cloistered ceilings, along with huge beer garden. You're probably already picturing it.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
The typical beer hall atmosphere, large volumes of glasses and plates coming and going, huge tables and echo of conversation. This one has a fairly prim and proper operation

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Beer garden, adjoining bar, meals, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Not especially good value

description: Linz's most ur-typical classic beer hall and local institution. These places never get good overall reviews as they often can't cope with the swell of customers during the summer, but the fact is that the Stiegl range is considerable and the beers are all fresh and well poured, the environment is decent in a classical style, food on a normal day hits that precise Austrian mark and there's a more casual adjoining bar to elope to, or the garden, once you're finished. It therefore comes recommended. (Added May 2022)

name: Kombüse
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Sometimes lacking the tap options advertised but a surprisingly decent fridge offering some Franconian beers in bottles. Competent back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Wooden kiosk in a park with surrounding patio furniture and minimal cover. Interior offers red paint and circular seating.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good atmosphere inside and out with alternative soundtrack. Unshowy, unpretentious, local, young.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: Surprisingly expensive given the more ad hoc and informal setting.
description: When it comes to outdoor drinking local style, Kombuse is the option on the edge of town in the city park. A rotunda-style wooden kiosk surrounded by patio furniture and some minimal cover from the elements, inside is red and alternative from the music to the decor. Worth a look. (Added May 2022)

name: Grammophon
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
An unusual if mediocre range of lagers on offer, with a decent back bar of fun party options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very pubby with bench seating surrounding a central bar, and another room at the back. Chunky and wooden.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A younger crowd spanning students to thirty somethings, music at a decent volume allowing for conversation and a buzzy social feel at a good tempo.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, outdoor seating, games, music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable if not outstanding value for money.

description: One of Graz's 'Bausatzlokale', or 'Kit Bars' where you make your own pizza or burger from a checklist of ingredients. This has led to some of them being incorrectly categorised as restaurants, but as you will see, come here on an evening and it is every inch a pub and social meeting place. Buzzy,  welcoming, youthful and one of the good places to be in Graz. (Added June 2022)

name: Posaune
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
An unusual if mediocre range of lagers on offer, with a decent back bar of more fun party options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Compact one-room affair that gets full up quickly, and space them becomes a premium. Down to earth, familiar feeling pub decor that in a way is almost decorated by the people that enter it.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very buzzy popular place in the evening with space at a premium. Youthful, friendly crowd due to the nearby campus and cast  of post-grads and thirty somethings that maintain loyalty.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pizza/Burgers as part of the Kit Bar concept, beer garden, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent, but not spectacular.

description: One of Graz's 'Bausatzlokale', or 'Kit Bars' where you make your own pizza or burger from a checklist of ingredients. This has led to some of them being incorrectly categorised as restaurants, but as you will see, come here on an evening and it is every inch a pub and social meeting place. Buzzy, welcoming, youthful and one of the good places to be in Graz, even more so than the decent Grammophon, Zeppelin and Bier Baron, this was the standout. (Added June 2022)

name: Zeppelin
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical kit bar range, claiming to have a wide selection of beers but really a middling choice of mediocre pale lagers. Decent back bar though.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
One of the more versatile kit bars with a few more amenities and things going on. TV, games and a familiar, slightly more modern space overall than Posaune or Grammophon particularly.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Young, youthful, but casual and lived in, a little slack during the slow hours without the decor to compensate for that, but pleasingly uptempo during the evenings.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Games, TV, Kit Bar meals

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent enough, but not spectacular.

description: One of Graz's 'Bausatzlokale', or 'Kit Bars' where you make your own pizza or burger from a checklist of ingredients. This has led to some of them being incorrectly categorised as restaurants, but as you will see, come here on an evening and it is every inch a pub and social meeting place. Buzzy, welcoming, youthful and nearly all locals - in short, one of the better places to be in Graz. (Added May 2022)

name: Bierbaron Bierspezialitäten
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
The best of the Kit Bars for beers with several taps, some of which offer styles like Maibock and Kellerbier from more obscure Austrian traditional breweries, some other more mediocre options too. Well stocked back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A narrow bar area at the entrance leads to a wider space indoors and bunker like interior. Lived in and a little dog eared..

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Not lacking character, the place has seen many nights of revelry and is clearly a long-standing venue these days (Belgium and the UK with their centuries old venues will scoff at that, of course). On the Kit Bar crawl so youthful with anyone from students to post-grads and thirty somethings tagging along. Friendly service.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Games, kit bar meals, TV, outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair but not spectacular.

description: One of Graz's 'Bausatzlokale', or 'Kit Bars' where you make your own pizza or burger from a checklist of ingredients. This has led to some of them being incorrectly categorised as restaurants, but as you will see, come here on an evening and it is every inch a pub and social meeting place. Buzzy, welcoming, youthful and nearly all locals - in short, one of the better places to be in Graz. (Added May 2022)

name: Bohém Pizzicato
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A decently stocked fridge of beers with stripped back, basic bar options for mixers and shorts.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A ruin pub, or put more accurately, a kiosk in a dilapidated courtyard with some basic lighting and coloured chairs on a terrace. In terms of effort, minimal, but nevertheless, they've chosen a nice spot with some attracting old wooden houses with porches facing one another and a natural theatre type space. The entrance is core 'I'm going into a ruin bar' experience.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Certainly depends how busy it gets, but this is provincial Hungary, and so the more people that are here, the wilder you can expect the atmosphere to be. It doesn't take long for anything peaceful and chatty to develop a bit of an edge with the wrong people around.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair enough value

description: Szombathely's answer to ruin bars isn't at Spricc, but here, with an actual dilapidated courtyard decorated albeit minimally, in ruin pub style with coloured furniture on terrace decking, coloured lights and kiosk type bar. While some of it feels a little abortive, there is life to be had, and the buildings in the courtyard do have a certain brooding atmosphere that propels it into being a place of interest. (Added June 2022)

name: Sörpatika Pub és Pizzéria
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A surprisingly good choice of tap options from Czechia, Germany and Hungary with similarly good can and bottle options. It does advertise itself as a beer pub, but often in Hungary that can mean very little. A standard, rather 'duty free' tier back bar supplements this.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Very pubby inside, with certain saloon bar leanings and definitely more pub that pizzeria. The courtyard to the rear is attractive and tastefully designed adding to the overall hangout space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A reasonably versatile, friendly venue with interior social space and courtyard lounging, both of which is informal and versatile. There's a degree of welcome even as a clear outsider which makes a nice impression.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pizzas, outdoor seating, music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent value for money, albeit higher than the going rate for the area.

description: This beer-focused venue offers a surprisingly good range of traditional European beers on tap and in the fridge, saloon bar type social space and a really pleasant courtyard. Throw in the pizza element and you're pretty much there as far as a decent pub goes. There's a degree of character to the place, it isn't a standard cookie cutter venue and due to covering enough bases well it deserves its place on our guide. (Added June 2022)

name: Kétmedve Söröző
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Plenty of bases covered to an average standard. Not much in the way of higher tier products.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A fairly generic entrance and bar leads to a bigger wood panelled barn type venue which itself then leads to a further covered outdoor area. It's pretty big, and while some of the decoration veers towards the "we got this for free, may as well put it up", overall it's a distinctive space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The atmosphere of a true all-rounder, this place clearly has a gravitational force. People going out for drinks know in Szombathely they will end up here at some stage in the evening. A younger crowd spanning students up to thirty somethings.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Games, arcades, TV, music, meals and snacks, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value

description: With good value drinks and lots of amenities, this strong all-rounder is popular and distinctive too with a large wood-panelled backroom leading to further conservatory areas. With games, arcades, TV, and lots of space to seat yourself, people of all different kinds can sit around without getting in each others way. These type of places deserve recognition and we're happy to recommend it. (Added May 2022)

name: Trabant Romkocsma És Söröző
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent, largely predictable offerings but reinforced by Pilsner Urquell in good condition.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A Trabant on the roof and eye catching exposed bulbs on the signage, strapped to what looks like an old petrol station or garage. Outdoor seating. Inside is a little more kocsma-like with rustic wood, somewhat undermined by insistence on using any freebie corporate signage they must have received. Dartboards at the back of the pub.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly almost perennial type vibe to the place, one to lounge around on sunny days or hurry inside for warmth in winter.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Darts, outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair enough value for money.

description: While the 'ruin bar' moniker is pushing it a little, they have made an effect to personalise this funky little roadside bar with a Trabant on the roof, coloured lights and loungey kocsma type interior. Drinks are decent, service is what counts for friendly in provincial Hungary and not an eyelid is batted whether you're a regular or a visitor. We have to recommend it. (Added May 2022)

name: Foltos Farkas a Sörfőzdék Sörözője
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A high quality range of exclusively Hungarian craft lager and ales from smaller breweries.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A tad rustic but also a tad bohemian, somewhat of a hinterland in this pub, but it does make it feel more friendly and inclusive.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A pretty friendly welcome by Hungarian standards and a true neighbourhood boozer feel, except the local older folk that this may have excluded with its pricing.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Table football, snacks and pub food, TV, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Relatively fair given the offering

description: The best bar in town, seemingly, a friendly and informal hangout space with high quality lager and ales exclusively from Hungary, kind service, table football, TV and a little bit of tapas during the afternoons. Make a beeline for it, this isn't often found in provincial Hungary. (Added June 2022)

name: Calgary Antik Drinkbar
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️
You are in bizarro-world, so don't stress too much about the drinks. You'll be offered beer or palinka, and there may be some wine or bar offerings if you manage to converse successfully with Aunty Viki.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small drinkbar with a curved backlit 'Calgary' sign on the front door that has been "decorated" inside, stock full to overflowing with the life possessions of the owner Viki. It's a powerful and unique appearance.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
An atmosphere unlike any other, if you can imagine a Munich Boazn that has become bedraggled, overflowing, and hoarded with items belonging to its owner. A cat and dog wander in and out, and Auntie Viki fusses back and forth with odd jobs, occasionally stopping to take orders. At the end she works out the bill by hand on a piece of paper.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, snacks, TV, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Irrelevant (though not expensive)

description: For the mystique, its macabre unique experience this is a true one off and outstanding bar in Europe, to the point where such concerns as drink or food are irrelevant. The owner, Auntie Viki welcomes you into a small drinkbar around the size of a Munich Boazn that is stuffed with her life's possessions, along with her dog and cat that bumble about. She is elderly and worthy of time and care, a local living legend as reviews will attest to. Cans of beer or palinka are the regular offer with a stock of spirits at the back of the bar. It even seems impossible to know where to sit, but you should be guided to the seat. Inside an old TV set plays, gowns and dresses are hungup in the back, and you wonder how the hell life took you to this place. This is going to be a very strongly love or hate venue for those reading, but we loved it and wish there were more places like it. Go while it's still open. (Added June 2022)

name: Bem Mozi
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good back bar and decent range of Czech beers on tap too. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Stylish but bohemian nobly-worn cinema bar with a lobby feel, decorated with cinema posters and ephemera.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Friendly, open-ended place with social spaces and private feeling niches. Atmosphere is loungey but not sterile.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cinema, music, live events, community work, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair, no more than the going rate

description: Across the river in Buda and the Rozsadomb district there is a cluster of bars that can combine to make as good an evening out as District VII, without the teeming hordes of tourists either. Bem Mozi is a local cinema bar albeit with an international character, with attractive retro signage and triangular room space like a lobby turned bar. Czech beers and a decent back bar supply the drinks and there's an inclusive European feel to the place that is instantly appealling. (Added June 2022)

name: Ganz Söröző
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Multitap beer bar with Hungarian craft and good Czech options. Decent wine list and ok back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small venue with an extremely characterful frontage, climbing ivy up 4 storeys with a window in the foliage on each floor. There's a patio terrace with a bigger capacity than the small interior which is decorated in a simple DIY, almost micro-pub type feel.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Social, unpretentious and local, as well as very popular. You'll find a crowd of mid-twenties to mid-forties here. It has its alternative side but nothing overly provocative, unless you count the state of the toilets.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Decent value, and certainly fair

description: Another welcome break from touristy bars, Ganz manages to be both very central and feel very neighbourly. The people around you feel like regulars and friends rather than disparate groups of fly by night tourists. A very good rotating selection of Hungarian craft beer and Czech lagers is the bar's big pull, along with the ivy-clad exterior and terrace next door to  one of Budapest's famous thermal spas. District VII is still great but bars like Ganz offer a slice of something different. Low key local life and pubgoing with simple virtues without pretension. (Added June 2022)

name: Manyi - Kulturális Műhely
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Some craft beers available with a limited back bar (it is a social club after all)

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A repurposed venue that makes use of a low-ceilinged garage/warehouse type ground floor and more typical courtyard/balcony area. Lighting is a bit more low key than the ruin bars you may be familiar with.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Far more local, this is an alternative music and arts hangout space rather than the touristy ruin bars across the river. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, community events, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Good, reasonable for the area.

description: Taking inspiration from a few different types of bar, you'll find different social spaces in this culture venue, but the focal point is its stage on the ground floor for live acts. Some local drinks are available and we understand the venue promotes good causes too. Being all-round good eggs, and with a fair bit of atmosphere in the courtyard and when there's music playing, this place comes recommended. (Added June 2022)

name: Guri Serház Keleti
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A brewery tap for Guri with 8 tap options and some bottles and cans, but alternatives to the beer are possible too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Basement venue with limited outdoor street seating and similarly limited inside. It's a little bar, offbeat in style with funky features and a fishtank.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Casual, it's more unusual to find a brewery creating as distinctive a venue these days as more opt for bright lighting and clean modern lines. This adds a bit of versatility and variety to the experience.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited snacks and outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little more expensive but fair for the quality

description: Basement bar that's a de facto brewery tap for Guri, who have a few other venues dotted around the city. This one is distinctive with a fishtank and beer kegs stored anywhere there's space. Off-beat in design and more unusual styles of beer to try, that's reason enough already to give it a go, as the reviews will reinforce. (Added June 2022)

name: Grandio
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Drinks are of the 'party shack' type nature, with the most basic lager to standard international fare, G+Ts etc, not much in the way of craft beer or fancy stuff.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Courtyard ruin-bar with a typically colourful, off-beat and alternative appearance. The wide entranceway leads to a long courtyard surrounded by a building overlooking it (now used as a hostel) a long bar to your left faces a spread of patio furniture and trees.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Over time we've come to like this place all the more, especially when it's busier, with the music and general hubbub of chat and fun finding the right volume level to create a buzz without getting in each others way. While it is of course very international on the ruin-bar trail, they haven't gone too corporate over the years and largely kept the place ticking over doing what it does best.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks, private events, live music, hostel

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the best value ruin bars with beer still well below the average and fair value for mixers and shorts too.

description: We probably visited here on our first ever Budapest trip in 2013 without knowing or remembering the name or location, that being 4 years prior to the European Bar Guide's existence. Since then we've been back a few times and it has crept up the pecking order each time (partly through the closures of others like Instant, Kuplung, Ellato Kert) to the extent that we can comfortably call this one of Budapest's top 5 ruin bars. The space itself is a great skeleton on which to design a ruin bar with a wide tree-dotted courtyard surrounded by a tall building enveloping it. From the entrance way to the colourful interior, you'll feel a sense of ease and fun to the place, a balance that allows different groups to do what they would like to do without excluding or annoying others, which given the international flavour of the place is pretty impressive. (Added June 2022)

name: Rácskert
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A decent range of beers if you include the fridge options, ok wine selection and fully stocked back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Ruin pub with an actual pub building, large car park type space turned into a courtyard with typical Ruin Pub aesthetic, and further bar and kitchens to be found.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The location pulls a good number of people in which is essential as such a venue thrives on numbers. Atmosphere is really pleasant on a warm evening with a buzz of people enjoying themselves. Reasonably loungey mid-tempo pace most of the time.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Street food vans, live music, outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Ok, nothing that stands out.

description: Formerly a bit of a ruin bar overflow car park for those who couldn't get in elsewhere, now one of the fixtures of the circuit. You can't argue with the offerings with a pub space, large outdoor ruin-bar courtyard, streetfood vans and some niches and areas that are a little different. While there's nothing in terms of off-the-chart decor or weirdness, the atmosphere is good, the drinks are competent and it functions. In a sense, a place like this would be one of the best venues nearly everywhere outside Budapest. As it is, it's somewhere in the top 25. (Added June 2022)

name: Terv Presszo
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell along with the drab Hungarian options, along with some classic café bar selections for alternatives, nothing too out of the ordinary.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The strongest suit, neon signage and a true retro feel, if not perhaps in composition then in the thoughts and images it conjures. It's a relatively small space with bench seating and bar at the back.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
The rhythm and tempo gives off the air of a classic city centre institution were it not for the more kindly and unpretentious service of the waiting staff, and the atmosphere falls between those houses somewhat. After a few visits we are convinced it performs the function of a pub, a casual meeting space where visiting purely for a drink is entirely de rigueur.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
For the location, reasonably priced.

description: Don't worry, this isn't a café for transphobes, it's a retro Eszpresszo known for its neon signage inside and retro decor, some of which is dedicated to Hungarian football's glory days. With a fixed menu of drinks and classic Preszzo bistro type food, this is somewhat of a central institution, out on its own without too many bars nearby. If you're visiting the Houses of Parliament it acts as a great bolthole for a drink afterwards.  (Added June 2022)

name: Mélypont Presszó
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Multitap pub with over 8 taps on rotation, focus on small Hungarian craft breweries and Czech lager. Can and bottle selection complimenting. Huge selection of Whiskies and good rum selection too. For drinks, this place is much better than normal.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Caught between two houses. Set in a half step basement there is a fair effort to make a sort of twee living room, but with some odd design choices it doesn't quite fit together coherently. If that is the point, we aren't sure it is effective. All the same, there's some distinctive items and it has a lot of potential. The bar is located on the corridor which leads to some smaller siderooms also fitting out for sitting and socialising.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Basement level drinking den with a social feel and a persistent local crowd not yet washed away with any tourist tides. Music at reasonable background level, occasionally sport on TV. Ticks over like a pub, but just an odd one.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not bad, certainly not cheap but not massively expensive either.

description: One of the retro presszos that came to prominence following the peak of ruin bars in the mid '10s, this basement setting provides no doubt whatsoever as to its commitment to quality drinks, with a big selection of tapped beer, whiskies and rum. The interior is twee but offbeat with clashing decor and some works, some doesn't. Still it's a good social space and this close to the party district it's good to see where some of the residents go for a drink, albeit the more male late thirties contingent. (Added June 2022)

name: Csendes Létterem - Vintage Bar & Café
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A pretty versatile bar menu covering anything from beers to cocktails competently.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The key to the place is its decor, with an almost explosive assortment of cultural ephemera, much of which is macabre which is splashed Jackson Pollock style over the walls and ceilings. Like a ruin bar but confined to a high ceilinged and formerly rather grand mansion house.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The decor itself creates such an atmosphere it is one of those venues where it almost doesn't matter how busy it gets. Somehow doesn't quite become the sum of its parts but not far off.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, Outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little more expensive than average

description: Ruin bar patina over a skeleton of a grand café, the silly, the macabre and the incomprehensible can be found here in a space that is still, in almost every other respect, simply a competent café bar. However, with the assets all combined, this place is a highly distinctive fun venue to be whether it's busy or quiet. (Added June 2022)

name: HOPS BEER BAR BUDAPEST
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
