The bar is set in its courtyard, a green and tastefully decorated natural crucible with colourful artwork and a fountain. The nuts and bolts are as basic as they come. Grab a couple of plastic chairs from the stack, buy some bottled beer or box vermouth from the kiosk and sit around and chat. Stripped back to its very core, this is socialising at its heart. The venue runs community events, art space and live performances too. It's a gem in the heart of the city, with an alternative feel tempered by the fact it has achieved mainstream popularity. (Added November 2022)

name: Jazz Cafe
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
An unflashy selection of beer, wine, cocktails and mixers covering the basics competently.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Vibrant colourful interior befitting a live Jazz venue. Neon signage and Jazz ephemera decked everywhere with a stage at the back of a reasonably sized bar room. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brooding and shady with glowing neons and an excitable social feel, but versatile enough that you could visit for a sit and a chat as well as to enjoy the live performances. A diverse range of customers too, mainly locals rather than tourists.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Live music, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher than average but well within a reasonable margin.

description: Cordoba's old town is not blessed with good bars, and when the daytrippers leave all that is left is restaurants and food leaning tapas bars. However, venture out a short walk through the sleepy streets and there is life to be found in clutches. The best option by far is here, with a personalised, lived-in late bar which like the best of them manages to mine the golden age of Jazz to decorate in a stylish and atmospheric way, complimenting a cluttered stage and vibrant atmosphere. The city's standout venue. (Added November 2022)

name: LA TRANCA
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
An IPA on draft is notable for a traditional tapas bar, otherwise a familiar range of fortified wines and alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Traditional tapas joint decorated with 70s Spanish vinyls, tiled walls and upturned barrels. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Despite the decor, the place feels relevant, no more so than when it is almost full to bursting, which even in low season can be as early as 9pm. It can become genuinely uncomfortable so we recommend visiting earlier on.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, tapas

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair given its popularity.

description: La Tranca could be one of two things, that beautiful characterful tapas place with a fresh relevant feel, or that one you had to stand boxed in like sardines that wasn't apparent why everyone was so obsessed with it. Yes, if any venue is oversubscribed, this is it. We recommend visiting earlier where some of its subtler charms are more apparent, with friendly service, some quirky tapas options, IPA on draft, nice tiles and 70s records pinned to the wall. A local institution but one that may leave you gasping for air if you visit at the wrong time. Luckily Colmado 93 is only a short walk away if that happens. (Added November 2022)

name: Taberna Casa Enrique
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wine specialists with the best from the Spanish regions, a decent selection by the glass. Some barrels of fortified wines too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A one room taberna with space to lean. Decorated with traditional Spanish ephemera - hams, antiques, framed photos and newspaper cuttings. .

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Every bit as characterful as its age, this is a city institution - and knows it - you'll find a small queue at opening time. The small space provides a certain degree of intimacy and a feeling you're involved in something special, writing yourself into the pages of its history.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Tapas, limited outdoor tables.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Outside of the free tapas, the plates are generally fairly expensive. The wines are also a little higher than average. This isn't ideal but not the problem some make out.

description: A historic family tavern that appears to have made a recent move to this new location on a central boulevard. However, on entering you'll be of the impression it has been here decades. One can only assume much of what made the old venue was transported into place. This pub specialises in wines, sherries and vermouth which come with the typical tapas dish gratis. It is a social special feeling place that just by being there makes you feel like you are part of a bigger tradition. Among the warmth and cosy character, the casual social value is accentuated even further. A superior option in the city, one of its best and a must visit if you are seeking authentic or authentic-feeling venues. (Added November 2022)

name: Bodegas Castañeda
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A wine/fortified wine focus with perfunctory alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A long distinguished old room. Large lamps, a long bar and black furniture set the scene 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The decor alone indicates what is clearly a venerable city institution, but this is accentuated by the scurries of staff back and forth with new plates of tapas, and the half hourly brooming of the floor to clear away the detritus left by people nibbling at the bar.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited outdoor space, tapas

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value when considering the complimentary tapas.

description: Possibly Granada's biggest name and institution, this therefore attracts a range of people, deals with a busy trade and has a distinctive identity. All pass through and tell their tales, some complimentary, some not. However, with its authentic appearance and rhythm of service, there is no doubt that a run through of tapas bars in Granada should begin here. (Added November 2022)

name: Colmado 93
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
An arch traditional tapas bar range - vermouth, wines and the 1 lager on tap.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A tiny place which opens out onto the street across 3 sets of windows. Traditional interior with high ceiling, wood fit bar and a little bit of stained glass in there for good measure. Stools and leaning posts only. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A classic example of a Southern Spain tapas bar from its rhythm of service to the hyper informality of being stood around drinking and socialising.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited outdoor tables, tapas

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not unusual for the city centre.

description: This dinky tapas bar fills up quick but is worth persevering with as it is really a classic, ur-typical example of a Southern Spain tapas bar. Extremely informal, largely about standing around, chatting and nibbling, the place has been around long enough to have clearly developed a bit of a rhythm and reputation which it knows. This adds a certain panache to the experience. Mark it for your visit to Malaga. (Added November 2022)

name: La Farola de Orellana
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical tapas bar offering. 1 tapped lager, and focus on wines and vermouth, sherries, etc.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
L shaped bar which opens out onto a narrow street. Iconic original signage which fizzes into life at opening time. Basic counter with natural shades and artwork on the walls.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Before evening service at 8pm a crowd gathers expectantly, which creates its own anticipation and excitement. When it opens you quickly have a busy buzzing bar.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Tapas, limited outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the city centre.

description: There is something enjoyable about waiting with others for a bar to open. You might think that a rather sad comment, like a granny queuing half an hour before a garden centre opens. But here the popularity springs from affection as well as having nothing better to do. Make sure you're in the queue to grab the best tables opposite the bar where you'll be treated to tapas and typical drinks. The tapas isn't free but it is extremely generous for the price. While drinking, nibbling and chatting the place fills up ever more steadily and the staff respond in kind, upping the tempo, the rhythm and ritual itself worthy of respect. For a tapas bar in Malaga you could barely do better. (Added November 2022)

name: El Pimpi
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Broad range of wines, perfunctory range of alternatives. Typical traditional Spanish selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A bodega with a warren of rooms, two long bars, tunnels and passages, green courtyard space in the middle, oak barrels along the walls, beautiful blue tiling and 'wall of fame' framed photos that are at least more understated that the average Irish pub or curry house.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
As befits a historic institution, this is well financed, sparklingly clean and beautiful, set up to accommodate the masses. Despite the sprawling venue the spaces always feel relatively intimate which is to its real credit given the tourist churn.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, drinking and dining.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
On the higher end but not extortionate. Drinks come served with peanuts.

description: Historic bodega  and the big name in the city, even with some competition in Casa de Guardia. The wall of fame attests both to its history and its magnetism. When you're here it's easy to see why. Vivid greens and blue hues in a warren of rooms, some with bars, some with dining space, along with large barrels and plants. A lot of money flows in and out. While the touristic aspect inevitably spoils the experience to a degree, the overall experience is credibly positive. The two bars allow anyone to turn up, lean and socialise with a drink, meaning this comfortably qualifies as an inclusion on our guide. (Added November 2022)

name: La Tertulia
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
More of a beer focus with bottles from 1906 and a few more taps than the average, but a broad, if shallow range of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Funky signage outside leads to a reasonably spacious one room pub with tables and chairs around the edges. A stage at the back with a large mural. Colours of deep red and cream with angular lamp light over the bar. Tastefully done.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A characterful venue with an understated yet distinctive identity, versatile and with an ease to it.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Performances, live events, dance evenings, music, snacks + tapas

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable for the area.

description: La Tertulia is a composed pub with poise and purpose, offering a decent range of drinks in a space that is versatile and yet quite familiar and welcoming too. The versatility is shown by its eclectic mixture of live music, dance nights, performance art and political events which are scattered around different dates. Along with the food offerings this really is a one size fits all pub, but not one that sinks into being bland or backgroundy as so many others do. (Added November 2022)

name: Taberna vinos Antonio Perez
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wine specialists with a good range by the glass. Limited alternatives including tapped lager.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A tiny one room intimate setup with an impressive backlit ceiling feature with sepia toned detail and lacy lamps that overlook a polished wooden counter. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Intimate and personal, not somewhere to take a group, but still reasonably social feeling.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Tapas

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair given the complimentary tapas

description: This neighbourhood wine bar has a retro feel with its staid tapas format and wine focus. Elsewhere in Europe such places are dying out in droves, but not here in Spain. This attracts a neighbourly crowd and courts rave reviews for the quality of wine and tapas which is very good indeed. The atmosphere is calm, poised and personal with its striking backlit ceiling feature setting a tone of light that puts you at ease. Service is gruff but not unfriendly, and plates of tapas come with each drinks order. Well worth seeking out. (added November 2022)

name: Cisco y Tierra
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A most typical tapas bar offering of wines, vermouth and tapped lager.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Almost what you would have in your mind's eye when you picture a rustic tapas bar. Personalised, small, traditional affair with exposed beams, domestic nik naks fixed to the ceiling, bullfighting ephemera and upturned barrels.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
This appears to be the hiding in plain sight local's choice for the city centre, service and atmosphere is authentic and bends to the mood of afternoon, evening or night quite flexibly.

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Tapas

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good considering the tapas plates offered with your drink.

description: An ur-typical tapas bar that you would picture in your minds eye if you imagined a rustic traditional tapas bar in a Spanish city centre. Small, one room affair with exposed beams and nik-naks. This twins the by now familiar set of drinks with fairly generous plates of tapas at decent prices. Casual with stools, leaning posts and minimal tables, this is typically informal and about hanging out, nibbling on food and relaxing. Worth marking down on the city's tapas circuit but also just as a pub. (Added November 2022)

name: Mementomori
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A slightly modernised drinks selection which fits with the modern concept, but still largely mainstream options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A wacky theme bar taken to the next level with giant balloons and animated animals popping up and down from the ceiling. Yes, really.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Café/Lounge bar set on a couple of tiers as you walk through the room. Hypermodern, colourful, vivid and surrealist in style with even the food served in unusual ways.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Meals, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not unusual for the area.

description: A bar with a gimmick that won't be for everyone, but there's no doubt that this is a distinctive and extremely unusual bar in its concept and appearance, which provides not just a point of difference as a whole other universe. While the place is on the foody/lounge bar end, there is so much going on that it will all be quite overwhelming on a 1st visit. (Added November 2022)

name: Central Beers Craft Beer
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good/strong mid 2000 era range of beers focusing on Belgian and German classics, albeit with some more relevant cans and bottles available too. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Modern US style taproom which is well lit with warm colours and mid-brown wood. A one-room bar with a high ceiling and plenty of breweriana decoration. Neither generic nor overly distinctive.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Friendly busy bar with a balance of tourists and locals, a safe space and a reliable bolt hole for a pleasant drink.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, limited outdoor space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Higher than average 

description: A reliable post-millennium craft beer bar with a modern US taproom style appearance and focus on Belgian and German ales along with some contemporary craft options. Much of it feels familiar but the execution is good enough to feel welcoming and appealing. While it may not set hearts alight with passion, there is something to be said about a beer specialist in a country where nearly all pubs have a maximum 1 tapped lager as standard, and this displays a versatility and reliability, while avoiding many of the typical pitfalls, that elevates it beyond the norm. (Added November 2022)

name: The Old Windmill
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cask ales a speciality with some moderate keg options a step up from the norm. Broad if more standard range of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
15th century building with low beams and crooked corners on Spon Street, the best preserved part of Medieval Coventry. Multi-room with fireplaces and a snug, more loungey space to the left of the entrance and further into the bar. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Warm and welcoming with oodles of character from the quirky layout and historic surroundings, particularly when the fires are going.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, games, books, events (live music, Morris dancing)

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, not out of the ordinary.

description: Coventry's city centre is full of flashes of different eras. It can be difficult to know what to make of. For enthusiasts of Medieval architecture, Spon street offers a superb example of a surviving, largely restored row of timber frame houses which are now largely restaurants, with The Old Windmill standing proudly among them. It is fair to call the place an institution, with all that entails. Familiarity, busy trade and an iconic sense that it is as much of the fabric of the city as the Guildhall or Cathedrals. The experience in the Windmill can be surprisingly intimate and almost village like however, split up into several rooms and a snug, you can leave many of the trappings of modern life behind and luxuriate in the simple comforts of a roaring hearth, good ale and good company, at its heart. They boast about their cheese and pasties, host live events and overall provide a versatile space without taking any major backward step in terms of affecting the character of the place. That is to its eternal credit. After all, effective stewardship of a 500 year old pub is not mean feat and we should continue bearing in mind that while the nuts and bolts of the pub are special, it is the people who look after it who make it. It could so easily, as with so many other pubs, have gone wrong. Visit to write your own name into a page of its history, a fabulous pub indeed. (Added November 2022)

name: The Black Horse
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Everard's pub with their central range of ales. Basic alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
From the greywashed exterior things don't look too promising, but the interior has been kept fairly intact. The core of the pub is a two room little ale house with tiled floor and varnished wood. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The main rooms are small, warmly lit and cosy with a sense of intimacy that is almost unerring for what was almost certainly previously an unabashed boozer.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, outdoor terrace seating, darts, piano, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value, not out of the ordinary

description: While the exterior has had a bland lick of grey paint, peer in the windows and you'll suddenly see an appealing warm, cosy pub. The core of the pub, two small bar rooms either side of a central bar are characterful, preserved and tastefully worn in. It's a boozer and social space, not a diner, although it has a few flourishes up its sleeve with a modern roof terrace and darts room at the back. A superior, standout choice in the city. (Added November 2022)

name: The Salmon
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Black Country ales and the familiar, standard range of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Backstreet boozer that looks somewhat out on a limb. A little bruised in places, but inside is a really typical bar with traditional decor, upholstered seating and basic social space. Not outstanding in any particular sense

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Popular, social and local.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, Sport on TV, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Unremarkable

description: A pleasant first visit complimented by a better second visit, this sidestreet pub offers a classic English pub experience, around the bar area with some nice stained glass. Black Country Ales and plenty of guest options, sport on TV, food and snacks, outdoor seating. An all-rounder, though you may wish to make a decision on match days whether to dive in or dive out.... (Added November 2022)

name: La Loca de Gandoca
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Predictable tapas fare with 1 tap lager, and range of wines and vermouth.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Rustic looking signage outside leads to an artsy little bar with a more contemporary, if bohemian interior.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A younger crowd in this well rated and well loved bar. The owner is the star of the show, hopping between his bar and kitchen duties while managing service with flair and panache. It really is no surprise why it captures people's imagination.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Tapas, limited outdoor space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Not unusual for the area, good considering the quality and volume of tapas.

description: One of Granada's top rated tapas bars with good reason. The appeal here, unlike others, isn't so much its history or preserved interior, but the panache and passion you can feel when you're here. The service, hopping between cooking, and drinks serving is done with flair, and the atmosphere manages to be bohemian, while still feeling modern and relevant. A tiny artsy interior where you'll be doing well to get a stool let alone a leaning post, but when you're here, let the good times roll and enjoy high quality tapas served with your drinks. (Added November 2022)

name: La Gloria
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Cruzcampo on tap, along with a range of café bar options that are middling, erring on the budget side of things.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The shining light of the place is its preserved interior features which have more than a hint of Belgian brown café. However, the ornate art nouveau wood carvings, mirror panels and simple seating is transposed to a Spanish context with bullfighting ephemera on the wall, much dedicated to the slain Manolete.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true local environment. It felt like somewhere a tourist would never set foot in. As a result, it was an authentic experience with goods geared for locals. Cordoba attracts lots of domestic tourists and this felt very much like a place residents visit, not foreigners or daytrippers. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, newspapers, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value at local prices.

description: Occasionally you can find a good bar by walking past it, and that's what happened to us. Peering through the window to a scene that looked immediately appealling. A brown café interior of art nouveau wood, mirror panels and simple wooden furniture embellished with local heritage and bullfighting ephemera to give it the Andalusian flavour. Inside, basic meals and simple lager and wines are served to near exclusively locals at a good price. Authentic, not perfect but distinctive. (Added November 2022)

name: Bar Candela
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple lager, better selection of wines and vermouth. A typical tapas bar selection overall.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
An airy, tasteful and arty little corner bar that fills up in no time at all. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Popular with a younger, more female crowd which gives it more of a late bar feel than the aged institutions elsewhere in the city. Very social and bordering on party time later on.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Tapas, limited outdoor space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
One of the less good options in terms of value for money,.

description: A tiny corner bar with a wider appeal than some of the masculine old tapas joints in Granada on account of its  pastel shades, arty interior and Mediterranean feel with modern tapas and louder music indicating a hybrid between a casual tapas place and late night bar. Bustling and hyper social at times, it is a tasteful standout that adds to the flavour and diversity of the city, although not so much in terms of value for money. (Added November 2022)

name: Lucas
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Simple budget offerings of beer and wine directly aimed at locals, not tourists or daytrippers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A café bar with a hint of retro to the exterior signage and a few preserved features such as the clock and those telltale 70s tinted circular glass windows. A one room affair with a long back for service and plenty of tables.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A popular local place that is used as an evening social meet-up space despite on the surface being about breakfast and sandwiches. It may be a diner but there is something about it that feels very pubby, with social cross talk, constant comings and goings and the rhythm of service.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, newspapers, betting

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for money, local prices

description: A venue that locals have almost transformed into a pub through their own selection, this is a breakfast diner that has become a crucial meeting place for socialising, and shows through its atmosphere and rhythm of service. Mind you, there are some stylish hints of its past through the retro signage and a few interior features. Their speciality is sandwiches which can be obtained for a fair price along with the typical lager options. Grab a bite and a cana, sit among locals and acknowledge that this is where the residents of Cordoba actually go, while you've been wandering around the Mezquita square with the daytrippers. (Added December 2022)

name: Birras Deluxe
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
High quality beer on tap and in the fridge, covering Iberian craft beers, UK, European and US modern and classics, it would be difficult to be disappointed, save perhaps for the lack of cask beer, almost unheard of in Spain anyway.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A bright exterior grabs the attention towards this one room craft beer bar with a modern style, solidly built tables with stools at the bar. Brightly lit, perhaps a little too brightly lit to be honest.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
One of those pubs that is somewhat reliant on customers for atmosphere, but visit at a busier time and everything clicks, it makes sense and it a pleasant place to be. Social, more about sitting and chatting.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Tapas/food available, board games, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Fairly expensive even in comparison to nearby craft beer bars.

description: Birras Deluxe concentrates on delivering quality product, and unarguably offers a fantastic selection of beers as its strongest suit. However, with pleasant (if overly brightly lit) decor, a few amenities and reasons to stick around for a chat, the overall combination succeeds and makes it a definitely stop off for any beer lovers visiting Malaga, along with locals seeking a change from the typical Iberian tapas places. (Added December 2022)

name: La Madriguera Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong selection of tapped beer covering Iberian craft to European classics, complimented by a high quality if compact fridge selection.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Off beat and colourful with a bit of a Ska-Punk aesthetic, it tries to make the best of what is almost a corridor.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The layout doesn't promote cross-chat or general socialising unlike many little Spanish bars, but if you're with a partner or small group it's functional. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️
Street food

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Higher than average, but mainly in accordance with quality of produce.

description: One of Malaga's stronger craft beer bars, this place is hyper casual with a ska punk aesthetic, strong range of craft beer, and international food menu underscoring that the place could literally be anywhere in the world. However, credit where its due, the execution is effective despite being hampered by an ungainly space to work with. (Added December 2022)

name: The Jolly Sailor
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Focus on cask ale with a good mixture of classics and regional efforts. Perfunctory alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brick corner boozer directly off from the street. Inside is small and intimate with seating around the corners of a widened out living room style layout, with a small area to the rear of the bar. Decorated traditionally with a homely, lived in feel. Bookshelves, musical instruments, fireplaces and chunky upholstered furniture.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A very homely pub with a real fire in winter which feels welcoming, somewhere you could happily spend a long time in.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, fireplace, board games, musical instruments, snacks, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair, nothing unusual

description: A lovely homely corner pub with a neighbourly feel. Lived-in but well kept, certainly not a euphemism for tatty in this case. Cask ale specialists (Bass fans will rejoice) which is to be expected in what is a traditional, low key, informal and unpretentious pub, which nevertheless has done its best to feel comfortable and well appointed. The sort of pub every single town should have. (Added December 2022)

name: The Castle
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A surprisingly good beer range covering traditional and modern along a range of styles in quite a compact space. The emphasis on smaller independent brewers. A good choice of alternatives to beer reflects its broad audience.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Mock tudor exterior on a pretty cobbled street looks welcoming, and more so on entrance with unspoilt little rooms, none more little than the snug room operating as the bar area. A rear bar room with conservatory and 2nd fire, and third lounge room to the left of the entrance constitutes what is the 'pubby' part of the premises, with a dining room up a step to the rear. Exposed beams and preserved features with a staunchly traditional appearance.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful heritage venue with interesting elements to enjoy, and several fireplaces kicking out warmth and welcome. Service is friendly and chatty, there is the sense of this pub serving as a vital social hub.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little high for the area but not offensively so.

description: Reopened in late 2021, this heritage venue occupies a prime spot in between the train station and town centre, yet is tucked away on a cobbled lane, giving both  convenience and quaintness. The mock tudor exterior points to the traditional interior with blackened beams and quirky features from the tiny snug area by the bar to the conservatory like window in the rear bar room looking out to a small courtyard. This is no museum piece either with Italian cooking and relevant modern beer choices from smaller independent brewers. A social hub that feels at the heart of the community, which must explain the fantastic reviews. A deserved institution for the town of Macclesfield. (Added December 2022)

name: City Arms
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong range of cask ales with some decent keg options too, no getting away from the fact these are beer specialists.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
In amongst glass towers this small row of houses survives. Directly alongside The Vine is the City Arms with green and gold frontage. This scheme continues inside with a standing/leaning bar area which drops down to a small lounge at the back. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the remaining boozers of its kind in the centre, the place is popular with a range of people - albeit predominantly male. Certainly a broad range of class and ages to be found.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Simple meals and snacks, board games and dominos, darts

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Surrounded by gleaming corporate glass blocks, this row of old houses slap bang in the centre of Manchester is a survivor. Next to another pub, The Vine, City Arms offers a throwback ale house experience with standing/leaning room at the bar and a lounge dropping down to the back. Male-dominated but not hostile or unfriendly. A strong range of ales brings similarly wide range of age and class, which improves the atmosphere markedly. While the venue is on the dog-eared side of lived-in, the social scene is very strong and its precarious position elevates the need to keep it going. An option to keep up your sleeve as it also serves to tie together pub or bar crawls across the city. (Added December 2022)

name: Au Sauvignon
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wines, aperitifs and a modest but not dreadful tap beer selection round off a typical trad Bistro offering.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A charming, tiny interior with angular fittings and framed artwork.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Busy, bustling bistro with constant service among minimal space, which graduates to a bar like character as night falls. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Central Paris prices, ergo not cheap

description: As a primer for classic Parisian café culture this works very well, offering the almost incestuously quirky sense of institution, the angular style and homely decor and tradition. Although food is somewhat required these can be light bites not distinguishing it hugely from a tapas place and it works well as a moody cafe bar later on too. (Added January 2023)

name: La Java Café
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Breton twists to everything from beers and ciders to hot drinks, a deliberate distinction to be found.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Over 3,000 dolls inherited through the family stuff the shelves, ceilings and nooks of this otherwise upright venue situated in a typical tall stone St Malo building. Carnival decor with retrieved ephemera and collectors items, you cannot take your eyes off it. Chain swing seats at the bar is another quirky addition as is a mechanical accordion.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Café atmosphere during the day can devolve to revelry in the evenings, with everyone present conscious they are in a special place. However, a reasonably early closure means its potential is never quite realised.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Hot drinks, light bites, mechanical accordion

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Not good, but somewhat predictable. Bearable.

description: Since 1820 the bar otherwise known as the comically lengthy "Le Café du Coin d'en Bas de la Rue du Bout de la Ville d'en Face du Port - La Java" has been operating in the centre of St Malo. A veritable institution, this place exudes charm and character, a reminder of the great lengths and labours of love that make great bars. 3000+ dolls line the walls alongside jaunty carnival ephemera, added to by a mechanical accordion, chain swing seats and a confession box acting as the door to the toilets. The man of the house is a notorious 'character' who will not stand for rude photographers or disrespect, but will be no trouble to any civil or polite customers. The wares have plenty of Breton flair too with local beers and twists to popular cold and hot drinks referencing the local agriculture and celtic customs. Truly above the norm, and a must visit when in Brittany. (Added January 2023)

name: L'atelier de l'artiste
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A balance of options befitting the café bar status, including several beer taps.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Warm, colourful and homely, with small rooms surrounding an interior patio area. Local artwork among aged, lived-in surroundings.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A central vibe at the heart of the action, but not too much churn to destroy what's good about it. Spaces to brood and ponder as well as lively clutches.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Light bites, courtyard, fish tank, outdoor seating, musical instruments

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices, but not out of the ordinary.

description: A central pub that is bravely trying to maintain an arty, pseudy, alternative hangout while situated on prime real estate on the Place Sainte-Anne. The combination of people is actually complimentary however, bringing a collegiate, friendly vibe. The place is warm, slightly ramshackle and decorated with local art, with some unusual nooks and an internal back yard with a patio and fish tank adding to the ensemble. Drinks are typical if not exceptional but broadly well-catered for its diverse audience from middle aged cafe goers to late night student fare. Compliments are due for an operation that has achieved something not many have, a harmonious balance between the mainstream and alternative. (Added January 2023)

name: La Cité d'Ys
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Handsome beer list including Breton ale on handpump/cask which is itself a major standout. The selection aside that is good with a focus on regional breweries. Alternatives are decent too with a fair, carefully curated list of mixers, cocktails and spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small bar with red exterior and wood-fit interior with mock-stone ruins, spiral staircase and round table theme - please don't be put off by this - it isn't as overbearing as that sounds. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Popular with a crowd of post-grads, the situation outside the normal bar crawl district has assigned it a sense of identify. Mildly alternative and solidly leaning towards casual.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live events, snacks, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical Rennes prices but a decent happy hour offering that includes the cask beer mentioned above.

description: Corner bar with celtic signage may indicate an Irish bar but this is anything but. Brittany is part of the set of Celtic nations and proud of it. You'll find the flag draped behind the bar which has a mythical theme referring to Lancelot and the Knights of the Round table whose story originated in the region. The beer list is similarly regional including cask ale on sale in continental Europe. The handpump is very good value at happy hour too dispensing Coreff Ambree, as near to a legitimate English bitter you will get on the continent outside an ex-pat bar. The place seems permanently popular and provides a casual hangout spot all day long for those who steer clear from the late night antics on Rue Michel. A must visit for beer lovers and alt-types in the city. (Added January 2023)

name: Wilkes Head
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A fine selection of traditional ales, some cider and reasonable stock options for alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Difficult to tell whether the signage is deliberately aged or just weathered until you walk in to find a magnificently battered, beaten up old drinking den. The bar room has 3 sides and bench seating with tables facing the bar. A back room with leather upholstered seating and music posters completes the set.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A characterful place when busy, while quiet there is an 'if these walls could talk' vibe too.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, limited outdoor space, occasional live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very good value even factoring in inflation.

description: A venerable boozer manned by a venerable local CAMRA legend who has maintained well-kept hand pumped real ale for decades while his pub becomes, like him, weathered and worn, gaining a little character in the process. This place absolutely will not be everybody's cup of tea, but for others it represents a certain honest, shabby focus on what's meaningful: good music, good company and good ale. (Added January 2023)

name: The Fountain Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.4
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Enter to find a bar dotted with beer pumps. Yes, this is an ale house. Some ciders available also with a perfunctory selection of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Warm hued pub from real fires and wooden furniture, deep creams, browns and dark wood. A welcoming bar room opens out before rear seating areas offer more intimate settings.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Extremely warm and welcoming, the type of pub that could suck you in during the winter months. Friendly and social atmosphere across tables and a good range of clientele too.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, events, fireplace

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Decent value for the area.

description: A wonderful sidestreet traditional pub doing all the best things well. Excellent handpumped ale, a warmth and cosiness that would make a furry blanket seem cold and uninviting and a social atmosphere that feels neither cliquey nor sterile. Friendly with a mixed crowd, it's a miracle we hauled ourselves away from the place. A must visit in Leek. (Added January 2023)

name: Cave à Flo
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A large tap range from Beer specialists including 1 cask line of local Breton amber ale. European focus but some modern styles too. Large bottle selection with wine and spirits cabinet too.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️Unpreposessing warehouse exterior which transforms on entry into an attractive interior well decorated with flags across the ceiling, wooden shelves filled with beers in a large space with communal seating. Side room with games and a large outdoor terrace.  Not dissimilar to an American taproom just with a less cookie cutter approach to the decor.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly personalised and homely with a cult feel, unexpected given the roadside location. Friendly service and groups of locals hanging out even mid-week quiet in winter.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Street food, snacks, shop, games, terrace, takeaway.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for money all-round.

description: A short bus ride away from Rennes centre is justified by this lovely use of what is a pretty unpromising exterior set in an out of town semi-industrial estate. Indoors you'll find a large low-ceiling beer hall layout with personalised decor, rows of beers and wines and a bar with a large selection including a cask line - extremely rare outside the UK. It doesn't stop there with a pizza oven, games, outdoor terrace and general sense of destination to the venue. We would go as far as to say it is a must visit for any beer lovers and especially in spring and summer. (Added January 2023)

name: Origines Bistro-microbrasserie
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
On-site brewery offers 4 lines with guest beers covering another 3 or 4. Decent wine selection and amply stock bar for aperitivo and alternatives. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Repurposed hotel de ville turned into a large culture centre with open space. The design is abstract and deliberately low key, allowing the charm of the building to breathe while putting some new touches to it.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A venue of this size needs customers but it can shed its layers in winter to become a small cosy brewery taproom or blossom out into the summery loungey all-rounder.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, cultural events, on-site brewery, food, snacks, 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: This versatile cultural centre feels distinctly continental in its use of space, with a bistro and taproom indoors offering beer from their onsite brewery, cultural events in the large repurposed hotel and outdoor activities in the front yard. The atmosphere is too bourgeois to be considered alternative but there is an element of the off-beat and bohemian to keep things relatively interesting. The focus on product is notable with the food and drinks meeting a distinctly good standard, above what they could get away with. Prices match what you receive with the welcome exception of the brewery's beers which come a little under the average price for Rennes. Definitely one option to keep in your pocket when on a bar crawl in the city. (Added January 2023)

name: L'Art Brut Bistrot
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A compact but reasonably broad range of drinks, several beer taps including a couple of surprising options, and decent alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Macabre artwork (as per its name) decorates a small bar with tables opposite a brown/industrial chic/rusting dumpster type aesthetic.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Calm during the day and transforms in the evening, no surprise given the small space.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal for the area

description: In among some of the more commercial streets in Paris it is a relief to find a distinctly alternative-slanted bar. The artwork is provocative and macabre with a striking frontage drawing you into a somewhat rusty brown hulk. This creates atmosphere day or night, but ultimately the very small size means it can fill up very quickly. A decent range of drinks at standard prices for the area is of course welcome but mainly this is a distinctive and memorable hangout spot. (Added January 2023)

name: The Kings Arms
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Ossett Brewery beers dominate the selection with several handpumped cask ales. 1 craft pale and 2 lagers. A stock back bar with the usual array of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A grand stately interior with beams and dark wood panels which span a series of small rooms and warren-like passage ways. Several ales on tap and a nice big beer garden/common out front with expansive views.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very characterful due to the preserved interior and unique layout, but also the fires and gas lamps which deliberately give the place its traditional feel. A busy lunch crowd of dog walkers and hikers.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, outdoor seating, guestrooms, adjoining restaurant, fireplace, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, at least the going rate.

description: A splendid stone building with many rooms and passageways to explore, leading to nooks with fireplaces and traditional bench seating in rooms decorated with photography from the areas mining and farming past. Each room has its own highlight, from the tiny snug to the right of the bar, to the fireplace in the simple sideroom, to the more loungey carpeted bar area which has a baronial feel to it. Lamplit, warm and cosy befitting the rural location with hearty meals and Ossett Beers, this is a Yorkshire pub not to be missed. (Added January 2023)

name: La Cour
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Despite a compact bar, you'll find a well stocked selection with several beer taps, a good haul of spirits and some local stuff besides.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Small two storey pub with a rickety frontage. Inside, the bar room is tiny with leaning posts, upstairs more loungey with some eye catching artwork in the toilets.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local, a spread of younger, affluent, off-beat customers set aside from the tackier Rue Saint Michel options. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, Live music, local art

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Normal for the area

description: A small, far more local feeling place with a younger crowd encompassing the alternative to the cosier end of boujie. Upstairs an eclectic but memorable arrangement of décor included cross stitch erotica in the toilets and local artwork that on arrival hadn’t yet been hung on the wall. After a while the place filled up, and we can say this is a good option for later night drinking or earlier musical hangouts. The small bar was staffed by some no-nonsense but friendly guys and drinks choices were very decent

name: L'Imprévu Café
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong selection of French/Belgian beers dominate the eyeline at the bar and on the menu, but this is a café bar and equipped well to deal with alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Off-beat, funky colourful ethnical art in the main room follows the similarly styled entrance. A narrow bar leads to a loungier area at the back.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
Quite funky in among the colours and lights, but can feel a little sparse and cold in winter months, particularly in the afternoons. Go on warm Spring or Autumn evenings.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Light bites, snacks, events, live music

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Expensive even with the happy hour price applied.

description: Funky spot for a commercial and corporate area, this little bar offers a good beer range and colourful surroundings. Service is really friendly too, placing you at ease. A nice touch is a serving of nuts/pretzels with each drink which slightly compensates for the high price. Go during happy hours to stand any chance of your wallet making it out alive. (Added January 2023)

name: AMROK I Bière et Cave Rennes
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️Contemporary craft, often local mixed with Franco/Belgian classics on tap, with a modest bottle selection.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Typical neighbourhood craft fare set in an 80s concrete arcade. Informal quasi industrial chic with colourful murals and communal tables.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly neighbourhood vibe and a predictable demographic of custom for a craft beer bar. Local chat, less 'Erasmus' type feel versus the old town.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Arcade games, bottleshop, snacks, cheeseboard & charcuterie, etc.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable considering the quality of wares.

description: This craft beer bar and bottleshop was an appropriate 1st spot to test Brittany’s approach to such a style of venue. On entry, a familiar industrial chic approach, but being in a retail unit in an arcade still felt down to earth and friendly, rather than the more angular city places you can find. Communal tables, a games machine and striking Amrok mural set the tone. Their beer selection cannily mixed local Brittanique craft with Belgian classics. It all went well.

name: La Maison - bar à bières artisanales
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong selection of contemporary craft beers including from local brewers supplemented with reliable continental classics. Beer is the focus.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Quite casual and dog-eared despite the promotional material making it seem more swish with clean lines. A typical black metal/warm wood industrial chic bar with high tables leads to two quite tatty, informal and loungey side rooms.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A genuinely local spot without a trace of any kind of tourist or student trail, which is to its benefit. Service reasonably friendly and helpful. Lacking a true focal point aside the bar area itself in which to recline.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, books and board games.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Reasonably high but in keeping with the quality of produce.

description: We believe La Maison will have good mileage for beer fans. Despite flash black and gold décor on promotional literature, the venue is quite ‘lived-in’ shall we say? It is definitely a mildly alternative. beer monster-friendly, craft beer  hangout with its casual, tatty backrooms with board games and books. Without a stock of customers the atmosphere can be somewhat lacking. The beer selection was possibly the widest in Rennes however with over 12 taps and a good proportion offering local wares. (Added January 2023)

name: Ty Anna Tavarn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Breton drinks available from cider, spirits and beer, well stocked with plenty of bases covered, though only mid-range in terms of quality.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Eye catching timber frame exterior right at the heart of the action on Place Sainte-Anne. A café terrace overlooking the square, the interior offers a bar designed for standing room only, with some stained glass again pointing at the Breton culture. Backroom is used for live music.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cult local with a casual feel, it has avoided being sucked into the tacky vortex of Rue Saint Michel's student bars while still offering the verve of them, to a great extent. A wider audience sees to it that the atmosphere is more collegiate.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, outdoor terrace, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for central Rennes, but few great deals.

description: This Breton bar in a timber frame building manages to work in a shade of the energy of Rue Saint-Michel with its live music and drinking on the lean rather than sat down, but wasn’t anywhere near as tacky (admittedly, we did see a bowl of punch though) In fact, bonus points go to it for stocking Brittany products from the beers to spirits. A cult venue at the heart of all the action in Rennes, bringing the collective verve of the city together somehow to create something bigger than the sum of its parts. Don't expect refinement, do expect a democratic, lively and informal bar set up for all purposes. (Added January 2023)

name: Fraktal
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A balanced mixture of beer, spirits, cocktails and non-alcoholic drinks.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A peculiar amorphous red splodgy mosaic setup with chrysalis type lamps and a warren of rooms. Everything from an open kitchen with red leather fitted seats to a ramshackle mini stage opposite the main bar. Difficult to describe.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Friendly service and a similarly friendly crowd, not the typical old grizzlies.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, meals, snacks, games

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Fraktal is an odd place, its decoration taking it beyond the typical Czech Hospoda while still feeling somewhat of a hybrid. It's a casual place fit for drinking but kitted out for eating should the occasion demand, with casual hidey holes and nik naks. It's lived-in and worn, as you'll discover, without any major pretensions, which suits us fine. The very friendly service and general oddity makes it stand out just enough to deserve an inclusion. (Added February 2023)

name: Hostinec V Lucemburské
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Very basic drinks. Pilsner Urquell and a perfunctory old-man type array of spirits.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Not so much a revived concept as a frozen in time one. Dark furniture set across a 2 room venue with a taproom and pub room. Retro signage adjacent to the bar, simple tiled floor, net curtains and glazed circular glass.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A local's drinking den from the 4th grade era of soviet times. A truly authentic place but an intimidating one too if you aren't known. Service is reasonably friendly, and the locals are fine enough once they get used to your presence.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the area, but not the basement price.

description: A survivor still offering a throwback atmosphere well into the decade of Tiktok and Artificial Intelligence. This true drinking den with its stripped back, basic wares is a venue that will attract looks from the stamgasty on entry, but is in many ways simply a battered, bruised, honest operation like many of their customers. A fascinating place in many ways, and we hope it remains for many years to come. (Added February 2023)

name: Bondy Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Basic range of beers from Prazdroj with a better stocked back bar for mixers, spirits and cocktails. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Narrow frontage leads to a basement pub with exposed brick vaults decorated in a mildly redneck manner, which is ignorable. Candlelit.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
For a late drink, the candlelight and brick vaults create a nice cosy drinking den, with friendly service from a long serving tapster. A crowd of misfits and local alt-crowd mix in an unpretentious place.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, Games

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area.

description: Bondy Bar's redeeming features are its warmth and lack of pretension. Yes, the redneck type decor might be rather inane, but with friendly service and good atmosphere from candlelit brick vaults, there's a good time to be had here with a crowd that are aware they don't fit in to latest trends and quite happy kicking around places like this. Opens late, and if you're in the area, compare and contrast with the modern Vnitroblock complex. (Added February 2023)

name: Minirest
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer focused with a multitap offering of beers from small independent Czech brewers

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Small unassuming entrance leading to a fairly small bar room with 90s style angular black fittings installed amid a more typical white curved Pivnice ceiling. A little raised seating area near the entrance. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
When busy - which is often - it's a buzzy social environment, and feels almost like you've won a ticket to be there when the tables are full.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Light bites, snacks, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair, not ripoff but still city centre prices

description: Minirest arrived on our radar from the beer scene, offering a multitap selection of pivo from independent small breweries in Czechia. This always raises an eyebrow but you wouldn't want to consume them in a sterile and lifeless environment. Fortunately you won't experience that here. While the venue does not have the historic decor or charm of somewhere like U Zlatego Tygra it feels very social and relevant, while its small size provides an intimacy that the decor itself isn't offering. As a whole, this leads to it being a successful bar and one to bear in mind on any bar crawl, particularly in an area known for shops more than pubs. (Added February 2023)

name: Hostinec Stoletá
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beers are Pilsner Urquell, Kozel, Primator but some others may feature on the taps. The alternatives are equipped from typical familiar café bar range.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The most distinctive feature and key to the inclusion is its revivalist taproom with a beautiful wood fit bar, curved ceiling and painted patterns.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A magnificent place to have a beer in the taproom itself.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, light bites, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard prices for a central 'institution' pub in a provincial town.

description: A revivalist taproom is the heart of this pub, but be careful as it may open at erratic hours. Be sure to check to avoid being turned away or being placed in a bland sideroom. If you do make it to the taproom you will experience a slice of old Czechia in what is certainly the most interesting pub-based thing going on in Kolin. (Added February 2023)

name: Black Dog
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer range dominated by Bernard beers, no bad thing. With a couple of alternatives. The back bar is competent and geared towards its audience.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Built into a slope, you enter in a typical half step basement which feels half underground half not. Curved ceilings and a tight space of dark wood tables arranged around a central bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
The centre of the social calendar for many in Bratislava, this place remains surprisingly local even given its central location. An in demand spot that is hugely characterful in the evening and feels like the place to be.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, with some drinks reasonably priced in comparison to local competitiors.

description: Rightly seen as one of the jewels in Bratislava old town, Cierny Pes/Black Dog is in demand and feels like the place to be when you've been seated. Atmosphere is enhanced hugely by its slanted location with a step into a basement setting with dark wood tables and curved ceilings. The crowd are a 20s-40s post-grad set on a Friday night and the place manages to keep the tourist hordes at arms length out of season, all for the better. If you find you can't get a seat, order at the bar and be patient! (Added February 2023)

name: Múzejný hostinec - Rock v múzeu, koncerty bratislava
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Home brewed beers taking in traditional Czech styles with a seasonal rotation. Alternatives are familiar stock central European selections with a traditional/historic lean.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Revivalist Austrian/Czechoslovakian decor with carved wood, thick curtains and tablecloths. The brewkit is open and viewable in the bar room itself.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Much more informal than the description may suggest. This operates as a village pub as well as a 'destination venue'. Tourists either don't know about this place or can't be bothered going this far off piste, keeping it one for the intrepid. Atmosphere naturally slides from warm, cosy but empty to raucous and lively at the heart of the evening, particularly on event nights.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Brewery, live events, museum, meals, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the quality of produce, slightly above average.

description: Brewery, museum, events venue, and last but not least, pub. Based in the city outskirts, you'll need a couple of buses from the airport or a specific bus from the edge of the city centre to reach here, be warned. A large complex with a revivalist look that is a labour of love. The locals are so lucky to have this here - do they even realise? The brewery's wares are delicious with traditional styles complimented by rotating seasonal styles and specials. The interior is dressy and purposefully museum like but offset by being so informal, low key and local, genuinely producing an effect similar to what a place like Na Slamniku may have felt like 100 years ago. Certainly one of the finest pubs in Slovakia. (Added February 2023)

name: Heltai FolkCenter
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Basic range of Hungarian beers in bottle, a simple club type range of alternatives, purely functional.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
The entrance leads to a courtyard with a terrace, function room, event space and at the back the pub itself. Interior is simply designed with a tiled floor, simple wooden seats, bookshelf and hatch bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
An authentic kocsma type pub room improved further when live folk music is played, further still when dancing begins.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, simple meals, live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for the area.

description: We were lucky enough to spend one of the best nights out we've had in Europe here. It started off in a reasonable but undramatic way, seemingly winding down to last orders at 11pm. Then musicians started to arrive, and before long live music was played with a fiddle and double bass. This led to full on dancing as the evening wore on. Hungarian folk heritage celebrated here, with good value simple food and drink in a traditional kocsma setting. Quite unlike either the townier options or the scuzzy options elsewhere in Cluj. An instant hit. Ignore the reviews! Come here late for the music. (Added February 2023)

name: Lokal
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Standard range of Romanian beers and spirits complimented with a decent selection of craft beer and European classics. Perfunctory alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Courtyard bar with covered outdoor seating in a tent, with a large overflow, event space to the right, the pub itself to the left. The main pub space is split into 3 small rooms, informal and low key with off-beat decor.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A youngish post-grad crowd create a friendly buzz at this casual ruin-bar esque hangout.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks, live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Normal for the city centre, reasonably priced

description: One of Romania's better courtyard bars, with a ruin pub feel at the entrance, with its iconic curved door, the crumbling 2 story edifice above the bar, and its series of rooms to explore. The crowd is youngish, buzzy and the range of drinks surprisingly competent too. On the alternative scene but not so much as to be hostile. A must visit venue in the city. (Added February 2023)

name: Café Moszkva
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A decent range of beer by local standards covering European classics to craft. Competent, stock Eastern Europe back bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A mansion turned into a pub, event space, cafe, club and terrace with a slightly alternative feel. Some elements like the stairway are well executed, others a little bland like the bar room.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Raucous noisy locals hangout with a young crowd. A buzz which changes as you explore the venue. There are places to pick up or slow the tempo as you please.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the city centre

description: Based on Moscow street, this eponymous club/pub/event space/terrace/café has a bit of everything, from its ruin bar/Soviet chic stairwell leading to an upstairs gig room to a battered terrace, to a basement club. You can find space to pick up or lower the tempo as suits your needs. Not all the decoration is as imaginative as it could but but there is so much space to work with. Drinks are a few notches above perfunctory and you will find some local craft beer and a few moderate surprises. Overall one of the centres of Oradea's social scene. (Added February 2023)

name: Columbus Cafe Oradea
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Well stocked bar with a broad mix of mainstream classics, with a few unusual choices thrown in, plus a few local beers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Nautical theme with ship mast and galley style decor. The amount of wood used keeps the tackiness level down quite a bit.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A pub which becomes a fairly packed mainstream bar later at night.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Terrace seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: Located in the stunning Palace of the Black Vulture, Columbus Café is a nautical pub that can transition from sleeping afternoon venue to banging late night bar. With plenty of wood and money lavished on it there's a sense of cosiness and a reasonably friendly welcome from the staff at quieter times too. Keep a look out for the local beers branded after the building this is based on. Worth a trip while on a circuit of Oradea's best bar. (Added February 2023)

name: Gekko Pub & Banya Klub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
A slightly disappointing range that might have cut the mustard 10 years ago but feels a bit outdated.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A club type entrance leads to a narrow courtyard with trees and cover, the nightlife happening all around you. Inside there's a typically Romanian bar with multiple former residential rooms transformed into down-to-earth, unpretentious dog eared social space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true locals bar with a young vibe, a real social scene with groups of friends hanging out.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Table football, live events, TV, snacks, courtyard

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area.

description: A short walk outside the centre leads to this self-contained casual hangout spot with a club grafted onto it. An attractive, if scuzzy courtyard leads to a worn-in, and possibly slightly worn-out social space that is vibrant and buzzing on account of the throngs of people who visit. The drinks are last generation, the place itself is nothing to look at much but the atmosphere is alive and well here. (Added February 2023)

name: Klausen Pubhouse
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A competent but rather macro range of beers as befits this slightly ex-pat type bar. A local IPA on draft is a highlight. Alternatives are stock mainstream options.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A low rise old cottage turned into a pub. An uncanny valley between English pub and Czech pivnice, the ex-pat trappings in the decoration and some bland furniture slightly detract from what is a very pubby, warm welcoming space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A more international crowd but with plenty of local life too. Warm, welcoming and cosy during the day if you have some time to kill and wish to relax.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Slightly higher than average.

description: This functional all-rounder provides a familiar, safe pub to spend an hour or two, with attractive arched ceilings, wood fittings and warm hues. This is slightly pegged back by unfortunately bland furniture choices and a slight ex-pat feel, but overall it executes the job well, and fits a niche that only far tackier Irish-type pubs offer in the city centre. Please note this business is unrelated to Klausen Burger brewery tap. (Added February 2023)

name: Shadow Cafe-Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A broad decent range of beers by Romanian standards with Pilsner Urquell on draft and local craft beers in the fridge. It isn't trying to be a beer specialist but covers its bases well, likewise with the range of mixers, shots, etc.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Rock music theme with artwork of various stars on the wall. This is in a large 2nd floor apartment, hollowed out with multiple rooms to explore. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A popular local hangout with that typically down-to-earth, young Romanian audience.  

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, light bites, snacks, outdoor seating, TV, books, games

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair given the central location

description: A 1st floor of a town house has been turned into a casual rock music themed venue with a down to earth atmosphere that is more mainstream rock than alternative. A good selection of beers for a venue of this kind, multiple rooms to explore and a sense of social scene puts it just above the threshold for inclusion. (Added February 2023)

name: The Shoulder Of Mutton Lockwood
description:
EBG Rating:: 9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of 6+ cask ales of various styles both regional and local. Ample but mainstream alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Preserved 1970s boozer. Stone cottage on a cobbled street with original wood fittings in a multiroom two level pub. The bar room is at the centre with lounges adjacent and corner nooks to either side. Upstairs is a pool room. Rich reds, green leather, varnished wood.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A terrific social hub spanning different generations, social and friendly. A tad local but busy enough trade for that not to be a negative.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pool, Darts, Chess, Dominoes, Music Nights, TV, Snacks, limited outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard value for the area.

description: After being thwarted during Covid and then a closure late in 2022 we finally made it here to verify what we suspected was true all along - this is an amazing pub. A stone cottage on a cobbled street, the pub dating back to the 1970s with stylish CAMRA national inventory interior. It is also cosy, social and local with amenities and multi rooms for different activities without ever losing the core of the pub or feeling shepherded away. What a pub to have as your local! Visit as soon as you can. (Added February 2023)

name: The Star Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A good range of largely local cask ales with a well equipped array of alternatives. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A sidestreet boozer with an entrance straight off the street. Inside the pub is plush with a carpeted floor, thick underlay and comfortable bench seating. A fireplace opposite the bar with family photographs around leaving a sense of homeliness.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cosy, homely and warm with a husband and wife time running the place and personalised to their own requirements as well as the guests, giving the place a particular character. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Occasional live events, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the area with local ales keeping the prices down.

description: A super pub, surviving husband and wife team who have steered this backstreet boozer through floods and Covid. The interior is cosy, homely and immaculately appointed so as to accentuate its warmth and welcome, none more so than a crackling fireplace opposite the bar. Local ales and characterful surroundings make this a prime choice even in a town with some tough competition. (Added February 2023)

name: The Blue Ball Inn
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A tiny bar pumps out a stock range of Yorkshire ales and mainstream alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Higgledy-piggledy. Off-centre door frames, a warren of snug rooms and low ceilings. Small and intimate.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cosy, intimate experience with a series of snugs to occupy. Historic and characterful venue albeit the general atmosphere and crowd can be rough and ready for some.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, snacks, outdoor seating

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the town centre

description: An unspoilt boozer designed for cosy socialising within a warren of snug rooms each at off-centre angles. Stained glass and a flamboyant sign adds a bit of flair to this traditional Yorkshire pub with no airs and graces. Worth checking out due to its unusual nature. (added February 2023)

name: The Little Ale House
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer specialists with several cask and keg lines largely championing smaller independent brewers.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Hops on the wall, rustic chunky furniture, old fashioned fireplace, in an old town house with living room/solicitors type layout.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
A genteel vibe without natural ambience from conversation over music. Ordinarily calm, but the acoustics make it noisy, perhaps overly so, when it is full.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, snacks, occasional events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area, variable though

description: A tasteful, genteel micropub with a leaning towards the rustic. Hops on the wall, recovered chunky wooden furniture in what is an old townhouse with a front room/converted solicitors office type feel. Calm and cosy mostly with a fireplace in the bar room, but an atmospheric yard in the summer too. Beers are high quality with somewhat of an emphasis on smaller independent breweries. Lager choices unreasonably poor however, and at busier times despite the lack of background music, the acoustics can make it rather a noisy place. Nevertheless, this is a very pleasant micropub with a friendly team running it in a superior environment to drink and socialise in. (added February 2023)

name: Hales Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A well stocked back bar, while the beer focus is traditional, you'll find familiar regional options on cask.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A true curiosity with a hodgepodge of styles covering Georgian through to the 20th century. Built above sulphur streams with stonework still present from the 16th century. Leather upholstered seating in the lounge including a partitioned snug by the bar. Gas lamps and taxidermy, dark varnished wood complete a distinctive bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A bustling popular weekend venue, an institution and with a clientele to match. Can be sleepy and atmospheric on weekday afternoons, and changes tack for its acoustic live music sessions too.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, live events, outdoor seating, books, snacks, pub dog

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
On the expensive end, but not outlandishly so in comparison with others.

description: Harrogate's institution pub, this heritage venue sticks out with its gas lamps (including outlandisly lavish cigar lighters at the bar), its leather seats and inheritance of Georgian through to Victorian wood fittings. Built on sulphur streams which can be detected from the cellars, the present day pub is a thriving destination venue, particularly on rugby matchdays or for its acoustic live music sessions. With a pub dog and staff keen to share its history, you'll find plenty to love. (Added February 2023)

name: Wuthering Heights Pub & Camping
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
4 cask ales on rotations each from local breweries.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A stone cottage facing directly onto the street, enter to find the bar on your left and two lounges, one with a fireplace and a cosy trapezoid snug lounge to the rear of the bar. Exposed beams, brasses and jugs decorate the place, with plush red bench seating and carpet adding further cosiness.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful unspoilt pub with a natural ease and ambience quiet or busy. Friendly staff and a local community feel rather than a transient dining room one, although this can change with guests camping nearby and a conveyor belt of hikers on sunny weekends. 

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating, fireplace, books, camping

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair given the rural location.

description: Put aside cynicism over its cash in type name, and you'll find a beautiful cosy village pub that's unspoilt and still serves its local community. Not yet taken over by dining space, social seating can be found by the bar with a fireplace crackling and plush bench seating. With a local campsite and ties to the area, this is rightly a popular place, and long may it stay as it is. (Added February 2023)

name: The Friendly
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Beer focused with a small back bar, 4 cask lines  each from Yorkshire brewers

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A stone cottage directly facing the main street, enter to find the bar on your right with two lounges to the front and rear, with side rooms which are lit and used at busier times. Fairly low slung ceiling with mock timber frames. Decor of local heritage including the areas literary tradition. Comfortable bench seats.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A local's local with a cask of regulars at the bar and husband & wife team, however reasonably friendly, as the name ought to provide. There may be an eyebrow or two raised in surprise at your appearance but not hostility.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for its rural location.

description: What good fortune for Stanbury to have not one but two drinks-focused community pubs? How many more large villages could honestly say the same these days? The Friendly is a deliberately local's local with a bar room full even on Monday afternoons with a cast of regulars. The interior is intimate with a warren of rooms and a low-slung ceiling. Cosy and homely without pretension or airs and graces. Good range of real ales from Yorkshire breweries and comfortable traditional bench seating.
