While a pub like this shouldn't stand out, we are in a dire enough situation with closures and gentrification that it genuinely does.

name: Garlochi
description:
EBG Rating:: 9.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cocktail focus but with some bottled beer including local craft beer. No menu so get creative.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A work of art, Catholic kitsch taken to an extreme, with iconography in models and artwork and decoration. A tiled archway leads up some steps to a single small room. Plush red furnishings and limited seating.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Incense burning creates a heady atmosphere when twinned with an excitable crowd. Busy on weekends, you may find a queue for entry at busier times.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Err...incense? Possible snacks.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not over the top for such an iconic pub.

description: Seville's outstanding bar, not only a work of art in itself but a singular labour of love quite unlike even the iconography strewn bars you'll find in Andalusia. A beautiful tiled archway with the Garlochi sign is a hint of things to come, with steps leading to a shrine and door to a small bar. Decorated from floor to ceiling in sinister Catholic kitsch, there is no shortage of anything to look at, but that's only part of the fun with constant incense burning, an excitable crowd and well stocked bar for cocktails, mixers and a few beers including local craft. An iconic place, one of the greatest in Europe. (Added March 2023)

name: Casa Moreno
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple authentic Cerveceria fare - vermouth, canas, frescas, nothing fancy.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A working shop at the front with attractive black and gold signage, closed door hinting at the clandestine nature of the bar at the back. A small affair with aluminium counter, bullfighting artwork and a few seats at the end of the bar inhabited by locals. Compact, even the toilet door requires a stoop for any tall man to enter.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Truly authentic, characterful and local with a neighbourhood flavour. Family-oriented with chat spilling through the front and back room. Despite that, reasonably friendly and tolerant of tourists.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Grocery store, takeaway, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the area.

description: Both an authentic old bar and a quirky one, this shop front with its attractive black and gold signage will initially appear to be a grocery store with a butcher's style counter and tins on the shelves, however venture further into to find a bar snuck away at the bar. A tiny, local affair that's truly characterful surrounding by the local bullfighting ephemera and hanging out with your friends among a pub offering a local and family flavour without feeling unwelcome interlopers. An unmissable experience providing you can park any moral objections to the bullfighting stuff. (Added March 2023)

name: Cervecería Internacional
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An excellent selection of largely traditional European classics both on tap and bottle, particularly Belgian bottles. Pilsner Urquell on tap and available by the half litre.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A traditional Cerveceria interior, one room with a high ceiling and tall seats, pimped up with breweriana and beer brands in an effective manner. While clearly 'last gen' it has absorbed and taken on character without feeling worn out or tatty.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The feel of a city institution, albeit with a following of beer enthusiasts giving it a slightly more refined atmosphere despite a fairly informal setting.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, gifts, limited outdoor seating.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably priced given the central location and rare offerings

description: In a city without an established multitap beer culture, this standout venue, one of the old guard, is a true pioneer. Unlike other cities, its offerings are not yet superseded and visiting after only drinking Cruzcampo all weekend will be like drinking from a cool mountain stream. Pilsner Urquell on draft and a host of European classics on draft and in bottle provide high quality produce - at last! It isn't just about that though, the venue itself is worth visiting with its air of established institution balanced by its geekier specialist element. Airy but personalised too, it's a space you can inhabit day or night comfortably and at ease. Well up the list of venues to visit in Seville. (Added March 2023)

name: El Rinconcillo
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A bodega focused on wines, sherries and other fortified boozes, with a perfunctory range of alternatives

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Historic 300+ year old venue. Exposed beams and candelabras, a long bar spanning two rooms, one tiled, the other traditional, with a dining area to the rear. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A sense of institution to the place from its decor to the rhythm of service and closely curated use of 'leaning space' which means at busier times you may be turned away. Excited international crowd give it a natural buzz.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Higher than normal on account of its fame

description: The city institution, an ancient bodega that will come up first on any search for old bars in Seville. This establishment is run slickly with a rhythm of service that is characterful, assertive and perhaps chauvinist, don't be surprised to have your food order turned around into one of their convenient options - simply hold your ground. The typical Andalusian focus on wines, sherry, vermouth etc applies here with the ubiquitous bad lager tap churning out canas. The interior feels like it is inbetween two stages, the medieval and the fin de siecle with its ornate windows and tiles on one side, to the chunky exposed beams and gnarled wood fittings in places. Certainly a must visit in Seville, even if it is a bit more formal than your average tapas bar. If you turn up hoping for a place you'll have to trust to luck. (Added March 2023)

name: Bar El Comercio
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Well stocked bodega with a focus on wines, sherries and vermouth. The typical Cruzcampo tap, albeit with a quirk that the beer is served in glazed pots not glasses.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beautiful frontage straight off a commercial street with black and gold signage. Inside a traditional affair, pass by a long bar with tiled walls, simple seating and family photographs along with the usual bullfighting and Easter parade references. 

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
With early closing, the place snubs off its nose to spite its face, getting busy as the evening develops before shuttering just as things are about to take off. Popular brunch spot for Churros but the early evening visit is the best.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Central Seville prices, not out of the ordinary but not cheap

description: A classic central tapas bar that adds colour to any historic centre with its black and gold signage and bar service visible off the street. There is a hint of central institution about it which seems to be deserved overall. Inside a classic bodega scene with meat haunches on hooks, tiled walls, and historic photographs of family, friends, Easter parades and bullfighters. One quirk is that their beer is served in frosted glazed pots rather than glasses which adds a distinctive little flourish to proceedings. (Added March 2023)

name: Ajoblanco
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple neighbourhood bar offering with lager tap, limited bottles and a stripped back selection of the typical wine, sherry, vermouth etc.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Jazz and blues themed bar with large posters and a record collection at the back. Narrow and small.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
This is a little place that can sway from feeling too quiet to being very busy quickly, but a small group of bar flies and the charismatic front of house with his penchant for Jazz and simple homely service makes it a memorable spot.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Jazz records, food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the area

description: A traditional tapas bar that's been set loose from the usual on-rails confines by its charismatic Jazz-loving owner meaning you'll find an offbeat establishment with record collection to the rear and large posters decorating the wall. He gives the places his own identity personally as well as just in the decoration, and no matter what languages you speak it's clear he's a bit of a character. The tapas is very decent here despite looking unpromising and overall fair value too. One to have up your sleeve if the nearby institutions are crammed full, or if you simply like this type of thing. (Added March 2023)

name: Pub Urbano Comix
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
By Seville standards a decent beer selection covering a few styles, with some stock cocktail/mixer options befitting this late bar.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Darkly lit with flourescent features, a late bar with quirky features like a phone box toilet, comic book decor.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A refreshing change of speed from the traditional tapas places, a younger crowd and a different kind of atmosphere that starts social and builds up into a buzz as the evening progresses.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pool table, occasional live events, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing to frighten the horses

description: A late bar with younger crowd, quirky, frequently fluorescent décor and comic book stylings but also quite dark and broody. Like the last place, we arrived a little early and it became quite lively as it went along. A late bar and hangout space, this is somewhere you can go to play pool, shoot the breeze and enjoy a drink that isn’t Cruzcampo or wine based. In many cities other than Seville the beer selection wouldn’t be particularly notable, which underlines the extent of the problem here. In a place like Seville this really stands out. Fans of the likes of Klapper33 in Frankfurt will get on with this place. (Added March 2023)

name: Bicicleteria
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
By Seville standards the presence of Franziskaner wheatbeer on tap qualifies as notable. Otherwise a selection that straddles the typical tapas bar offerings with late bar selection, a few modern hints, certainly not the strong point.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A corner bar in a slightly wedge shaped building, this one leans into the familiar off-beat/kooky bicycle shop format with cycles on the wall and a welcoming cafe bar interior. Small with limited space.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
At the heart of the district's social scene, popular, busy, often crowded at night, with a calmer welcoming atmosphere earlier on.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, live events, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for money, no great deals but nothing offensive either.

description: A place with more admirers than seats, but somehow, stomping our size tens around, we managed to cleave space for 4 around a table while the other 3 of us marked time until some chairs became available. Most cities have this kind of faux-shop kooky café bar with a bike or two stapled to the wall or ceiling, and this one didn’t do too much new, but couldn’t fault the execution or the atmosphere, as it really did feel like being at the core of the social scene. The nightlife around Plaza de Monte-Sion is well worth checking out. (Added March 2023)

name: Bar Casa Morales
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Wines, sherries and vermouth with only basic beer
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Stylish, historic and characterful 2-room tapas bar, be sure to explore the surroundings
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
City centre tempo, mainly standing, nibbling and socialising.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, meals, snacks, newspapers
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Not overly different to most in the vicinity
description: A family operation in the city centre stretching back to 1850, you'll be wowed by the huge vats opposite the bar. Be sure to explore as there are two rooms which the bar straddles. Known for good wines, sherries and vermouth along with tapas which stretches from chicarrones to a big ración of stew or meat.

name: Bodegas Díaz Salazar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A good choice of wines, sherries and vermouth (some from the barrel) which is the focus, with the typical lager tap for beer. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Recently refurbished but in keeping with its 100+ year history. Stylish, upright but classical city bodega with high ceilings, tiles, heritage framed photos, enormous urns at the rear of the room and retro beer signage.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
City rhythms, this is part of the fabric of Seville and service goes according to that.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor space, food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher than average on account of the central location and fame of the venue, but not extortionate.

description: This bar was not on our initial hitlist but its appearance was tempting and it also has a history. This now upright, stylish bodega has attractive frontage and a classical interior. A refurbishment has smartened the place up without losing its soul. This place is a fixture of central Seville and during the mid-20th centuries became a fashionable meeting spot for the political and cultural set. These days there is a mix of old stagers, some tourists and that unmistakable ‘city centre’ rhythm to it, even when quieter. One of the eye-catching elements of the pub is its enormous urns at the back of the room. Try those baby aubergines pickled in chilli and garlic oil – unreal. (Added March 2023)

name: La Goleta
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A tiny bar of typical Andalusian character, personalised with a rustic feel. As simple as you like, simply about leaning and chatting. (Added March 2023)

name: Las Teresas
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: A venue which sprawls across 3 buildings from its original site, each with their own character, but the main bar with its meat haunches and close to the rhythm of service has plenty of character, with quirks such as a display of their historic meat knives (and their RIP dates). Food and wine selection are both good considering the central location. (Added March 2023)

name: Bodega Santa Cruz
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A very typical Andalusian selection of wines, sherries, vermouth etc with the basic lager option

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A small street-facing Bodega with limited wooden seating. Worn in and workaday appearance with retro signage out front.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the centre's classics with the rhythm of service part of the appeal. Remains local despite the occasional patronage of tourists.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, limited outdoor space

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Fair, particularly the food.

description: A historic little bodega, this central venue is content to get ever more ramshackle and informal with wobbly seats, locals yelling banter across the counter and a large menu that slowly vanishes as the day progresses. Here the tapas was not great first time around, but it has largely excellent reviews and did impress on a 2nd visit. (Added March 2023)

name: El Chiringuito
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Narrow, ramshackle bar with an ad hoc feel. Informal and knockabout, friendly and relaxed, less of that tapas rhythm and definitely no stuffed shirts. (Added March 2023)

name: Bar Casa Vizcaíno
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Neighbourhood pub at the heart of Sevilla's community without feeling even a hint of touristic churn. Authentic and very typical for Andalusia, worth a look. (Added August 2023)

name: Bodega Soto
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Neighbourhood pub off the tourist trail. Low-key and spacious with a family friendly character, equally suitable for drinks or meals. (Added 2023)

name: Taberna Gonzalo Molina
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A rare outing for Maestro Dunkel on tap qualifies as notable in this very traditional city. A compact bar means compact alternatives but the usual Andalusian bases are covered without ever glittering with their quality.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Tiny little bar that has apparently recently changed venue. The old place was being held up by scaffolding, perhaps that has now collapsed! This one is a drop-in corner bar for local socialising, but still personalised and characterful with distinctive tiles and personal touches added.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Distinctive venue with a real identity and intimate space which almost naturally creates character even when the place is nearly empty.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the area

description: The original Gonzalo Molina looked otherworldly, a rotting carcass of a bar held up with scaffolding but like the Jedová chýše in Prague appears to have finally expired. The operation has set up in a tiny, and still quite characterful little place, a corner bar with standing room for about a dozen at most. Offering a dark beer on tap counts as a distinctive and notable feature in this arch-traditional Cruzcampo-swilling city. With a local neighbourhood character and identity, but a decent welcome, don't worry about the locals, they will be happy to serve you. (Added March 2023)

name: Clan Sibarita's
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent wine selection which this place concentrates on, with some cocktails.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Personalised with white arches
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Neighbourly and off the tourist trail
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Tapas, snacks, limited outdoor space
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
A little higher than most, although mainly corresponding to the product
description:

name: Ricardo's
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A typically Seville selection with the lager on draft, limited bottles and decent selection of wines, sherries, vermouth.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A little place, neighbourhood location with a wide, if shallow bar area with leaning posts. Limited dining and seating to the right of the bar and in a back room. The walls are decorated from top to toe in family photographs, bullfighting memorabilia and Easter parades.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Crowded by design, do not visit if you are claustrophobic. Popular local institution, this is the venue the residents visit while tourists are at El Rinconcillo. If you are able to find a leaning post guard it with your life. Service is busy and honest and there is a hyper-informality to the atmosphere.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Limited outdoor seating, food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value though no real steals

description: A neighbourhood classic, superb reviews attest to a history of high quality performance, this place is well subscribed and will be packed within 15 minutes of opening in the evening. A narrow cramped venue which is festooned from floor to ceiling with framed photographs and a kitchen pumping out tapas from a modest menu with great efficiency. Hyper-informal and a big concentrated shot of Spanish flavour.  (Added March 2023)

name: La Carbonería
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A broad if shallow range of fortified wines, cocktails, beer and mixers 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An old coal warehouse, hence the name, you'll find an attractive leafy courtyard leading to a large shed area with some traditional decor and bar areas to the sides, Tastefully done.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A throng assemble for Flamenco performances making this an unusually open-plan mass event venue by Seville's normally pokey and compact standards.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Tapas, snacks, outdoor seating, live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Good value considering the free performances

description: For a taste of Flamenco, come here. A hush descends as the acoustic led group begin, and a large venue suddenly begins to feel intimate and huddled, as hundreds on communal bench seats take in the performance. This former coal warehouse is spacious with a large courtyard and fully equipped bar for tapas and drinks, the format unusual in a city that is predominantly about huddled socialising in cramped traditional bars. Certainly high up the list for venues to visit in Seville, but if you are particularly keen on taking in a folk experience it should be near the top of your list. (Added March 2023)

name: Bodega La Aurora
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Popular late bar with comically narrow toilet (urinal), barrels behind the bar and a pleasant ad hoc, neighbourly feel that doesn't appear to be on any tourist trail. (Added 2023)

name: Can Codina
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
description: Reliable corner bodega with a traditional style yet modern audience, good atmosphere and good range of drinks too. (added 2017)

name: The Red Lion
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️
Marstons range of cask and keg, including a house 'own label' bitter.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Attractive stone building set off a street corner with old Wilsons signage. Interior has a wide entrance with rooms off a central hall. Snug/bar room to the right, lounge to the left with games rooms further in. Plush with carpets and upholstered bench seating, traditionally decorated with porcelain figures, plates, etc, somewhat of a timewarp, none more so than the rear of the hall with its almost sleazy red-hued curtains and lamps.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Somewhat of a curio, part simple working class boozer, partly tacky and knackered but with a bit of flair to it that's difficult to shake. Warm and social with a cast of regulars shooting the breeze in the main bar room and social setup in the lounge too. Feels active and relevant.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, games, live events, pool room, fireplace, books

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for money in the current climate.

description: A curio, this preserved pub is at once a little dog-eared yet also quirky and characterful enough, and social and relevant enough to stay in the memory. With amenities, events, local life and darn good value too, you find yourself refusing to mark it down. Plush seating in the lounge with some characterful individual fittings mixes with kitschy tat like porcelain horses and almost sleazy red-hued decor down the hall towards the toilets. You'll leave not quite sure what you experienced. (Added March 2023)

name: The Dun Cow
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A strong selection of beers from old fashion North East classics to contemporary cask and keg ales, standard back bar fare.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Architectural masterpiece, a tall ornate Edwardian pub with carved wood bar and fine detailing. Executed with a flamboyant, confident panache and very well preserved. Rear lounge room past the bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Due to the opulent surroundings an interesting place whether quiet or busy. Has the air of a famous city institution.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️
City centre prices

description: One of the North East's jewels, this building is itself one of Sunderland's finest, inside a heritage pub preserved from the Edwardian era with a flamboyance to the wood detailing that catches the eye. Inside it isn't a museum but a relevant thriving city centre institution with a large array of cask and keg ales from the most old fashioned around to the most in vogue. Meals and snack menu is similarly up to date and decent standard. Clearly a destination venue for any visitors to the city. (Added March 2023)

name: The Ship Isis
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A relevant up to date selection of craft cask and keg ales covering local to international, plenty of choices. Alternatives are reasonably good too if not the focus.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Plush, lavish Victorian interior with thick curtains, detailed ceilings and row of lamps across the bar. Plenty of varnished wood and darkly lit areas, with a lounge to the left of the entrance, bar room to the right. Signage out front a little tired and hardly representative of the lovely sight that greets you upon entering.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Atmospheric day or night, with exterior concerns appearing to melt away once you enter this beautiful timewarp. Cast of regulars and broad clientele too which really helps give it a sense of significance.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, TV, occasional live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Standard for the high quality produce available, certainly not cheap but not unfair.

description: Although the building is a smart, impressive one, some tired signage may not give off immediate vibes as to the lovely pub inside. This plush drinking hole is a bit of a bunker with thick curtains and frosted glass keeping the Sunderland out and the warmth and cosiness in. Fine detail to the interior with decor sympathetic to its turn of the 20th century appearance. A great range of relevant cask and keg ales gives young and old reason to visit which helps give it a sense of significance and social value. Occasional live events and the odd podcast etc are hosted here too. A must visit while in Sunderland. (Added March 2023)

name: Museum Vaults
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
An old fashioned selection befitting an old fashioned pub. Largely keg/creamflow North East options with 1 cask line of local ales and some cans, including box cider. Simple range of alternatives.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A characterful old battleaxe of an alehouse, facing out direct onto the street, inside there's a two-room set up with bar and lounge to the rear. The bar is traditional with exposed beams and fireplace though has a TV and a generally informal setup. The lounge to the rear has detailed wallpaper, altogether rather plush, old fashioned and dimly-lit, with a large hatch to access the bar.

Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local, friendly and chatty with a predictably male, middle aged demographic during the day, but livened up with some local comings and goings and a charismatic bartender. Later on a slightly broader clientele and the atmosphere in the back room allows the depth and subtleties of the place to shine.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, snacks, jukebox, live events, limited outdoor seating to the rear.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value

description: A well loved, battered, characterful little battlecruiser of a pub set directly off the street. From its stained glass, detailed wallpaper, exposed beams, Sunderland footy memorabilia and loyal clientele you know where you are pretty quickly in here. With a local flavour, live events and intimate evening atmosphere this may not have the range of drinks of others nearby and is almost certainly more of a love/hate place, but it remains nonetheless deservedly popular. (Added March 2023)

name: Czarny Tulipan
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A familiar range of stock options, perhaps not the strongest suit of the bar, with room for including craft beer particularly.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of Poland's finest 'antique bars', located in a historic building which has already taken on slightly haunted house appearance, you'll find a warm, lamplit bar area with hazy creams and browns, with two side rooms for pool tables.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A superb atmosphere stems from a number of elements. Firstly, local life and community that is not only off the tourist trail in Torun but local to the district itself, a warm friendly crowd who are familiar with each other. Secondly the wonderful characterful building and decor, which elevate it further.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
TV, Pool, books, board games, smoking area, limited outdoor space, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Very fair value across their range, notably cheap, versus many venues in Poland that would charge double for the same.
description: 'Black Tulip', a seductive name for a seductively superb pub, that gives us wistful nostalgia to think of. Not centrally located, you must consider a tram and a walk to the local district where this serves as its cultural centre. Located in a historic brick building from the turn of the 20th century, there is a hint of haunted house to the brick gothic facade. The glow of several rooms confirm there is more to the place than the bar room, surprisingly pool tables being among them. However, the bar room is truly superb with creams and browns hazily lit, with a heater pumping out in the colder months. The crowd is mixed, slanted towards under 30s but with a degree of mixing you don't always find in Poland. The drinks selection is simple and familiar, lacking much acknowledgement of the developments of the last 20 years, however they are on offer at a great rate, fair and cheap. Once you've secured a table the woozy warm atmosphere sucks you in tight, and you'll feel far away from your cares. What a bar. (Added April 2023)

name: Jazzland
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
While not the focus of the venue, the bar is nevertheless well stocked with a few good beers on tap, healthy back bar of Jazz-appropriate spirits.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Instantly appealing basement venue, stairs leading to a warren of rooms. A concert room dominates with bar room and backrooms further along, all decorated with black and white Jazz and Blues stars who have played the venue.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Whether a concert is on or not, there is a buzz and natural ambience to the place that makes it feel relevant and the place to be.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, meals, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A fairly cheap entry fee for concerts with standard city centre prices for Vienna - that is to say not cheap but not extortionate.
description: The brick vaults and black & white photos may lead you to suspect Jazzland has been around since the golden age. That's not the case but it certainly has been around long enough to become a beloved central institution. Concerts are put on for a small entrance fee and seats in the main room have a very casual/ad hoc theatre layout, with bar and backroom to the sides for casual hangouts and taking in the atmosphere and sounds with the odd glimpse of performance to be spied through the archways. Drinks are appropriate for this style of venue and fairly priced, a slight surprise to find they also serve meals. An unmissable venue in Vienna to pick up on the city's culture cues, yes, but overridingly to have a good time. (Added April 2023)

name: Chmury
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A modern and up to date range covering craft beer, mixers, cocktails and everything in between, a focus has been applied to making the choice relevant.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superb decor in an interesting location. Courtyard filled with different bars and clubs leads to a neon sign, inside dozens of lamps fixed to the ceiling provide a riot of colour, the walls decorated with Twin Peaks memorabilia. Quite an odd, but effective mixture.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A great balance of feeling like the place to be while avoiding some of the sterile or pretentious trappings of similar places. Yes, it still feels just alternative enough here, with the nearby music and events venues adding a fluidity, you can flit in and out.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, pub food, snacks, outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices which are pushed a little higher, however the produce on sale fairly matches those ambitions in quality.
description: In a courtyard off Listopada is Warsaw's most interesting cluster of nightlife, a mini-complex of bars and clubs where you can wander in and out almost in the manner of a ruin bar in Budapest. The atmosphere is fluid as a result, with outside and inside drinking not feeling segregated, which makes the interior of Chmury all the more impressive, with its lampshade strewn ceiling and Twin Peaks ephemera drawing you to spend more time in the bar even on warm evenings. The crowd is inevitably young with the bar-cum-club format, however some of the surrounding venues are family friendly earlier on. Distinctive with a good selection of drinks too including interesting craft beer cans - though not cheap and polish pub food (think Zapikanki) an unexpected offering. There are many reasons to come here. (Added April 2023)

name: Skład Butelek. Klub
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An all-rounder with more of an emphasis on mixers and cocktails, but a decent enough fridge range to keep beer fans occupied.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Think ruin-bar cum cafe, so yellow/brown crackled walls, chips of plaster coming away, knackered vintage furniture. Fairly well done, not giving off a hint of a corporate or demographic led approach. A narrow bar area widens to a couple of ground floor rooms, with upstairs hangout space adding to the 'squat' feel.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent atmosphere feeling very much at the centre of nightlife in Praga district of Warsaw. A friendly crowd, family-friendly too until later on, feeling like an apartment that has been taken over into a bar. A nice casual dynamic arising from being able to explore indoor and outdoor spaces.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Light food, snacks, outdoor area
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Overall reasonable value for the produce available, but in pure numerical terms certainly 'city centre prices'.
description: In a courtyard of Praga you'll find the best area of nightlife in Warsaw, a quasi-ruin bar complex of bars and clubs with a fluid dynamic, you can wander in and out of many as you please. Sklad Butelek is a fairly hip atmospheric venue with warm hues decorated in a more ruin bar aesthetic rather than the loungey corporate approach you'll find in downtown. Two floors to explore and a friendly feel gives the place much to recommend it, with its cocktails and craft beer fridge providing refreshments. (Added April 2023)

name: Loos American Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A compact cocktail menu reflects the compact size of the bar, this is about quality over quantity, with the menu revolving around a modest list of ingredients. Other options are available including tapped beer.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A one-off design by the eponymous Loos, modernist, ahead of its time. Pictures don't do justice to how small the place is, with only a few bench seats opposite the bar and stools at the bar itself. Inside attractive bronze panels above the entrance catch the eye, as do elegant gilt edged underlit tables. The bar itself has a few quirky features too. Space in the room is lost due to the design of the toilet access.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A struggle to maintain its exclusive feel while being a central institution on the tourist trail, that dynamic feeds into the interior rhythm and atmosphere, but overall the experience is a very positive one.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Complimentary water, limited snacks, outdoor seating.
Value For Money: ❤️
Undeniably city centre high-end cocktail prices. If you have a limited budget though it is still worth a one-off visit.
description: Famous, iconic Vienna bar with design inspired by the modernist movements in America, yet its American flag signage out front may inversely be the most tacky element of it. Inside, you'll find a well preserved little cocktail bar, compact with limited seating around benches, far smaller than any images will imply. They maintain order and a sense of exclusivity by maintaining some ground rules. No shorts, sandals etc and no photography. This seems to be effective in weeding out selfish moaners, from what I can see on reviews. The cocktails are curated from a limited menu - deliberately limited - there is simply not space to stock much more than they have, but created carefully and to a high standard, which is a relief given the price! A special one-off experience for a visitor, but it would be an odd place to be a regular in (Added April 2023)

name: Gutruf
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.3
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A simple frozen-in-time cafe bar selection from the 1970s, Almdudler soft drinks, Trumer pils on tap, quaint enough to feel sympathetic towards.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A one-off, the italicised signage and net curtains are iconic, looking like a long-closed operation. Inside you'll find a highly personalised homely cafe/pub with seating opposite the bar and a backroom.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Superbly characterful friendly family operation with cooking happening at the bar itself, a kindly elderly lady serving and a surrounding of local life and the odd tourist enjoying a truly unpretentious and authentic operation.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Half Chinese/Half Viennese food menu, snacks, drinks, newspapers
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value given portions and central location.
description: Iconic 70s pub/cafe/Beisl, a survivor of generations sticking to what it has always done. Personalised interior decorated with retro signage and cuttings from the decades past. A see-and-be-seen place historically, now simply a barnacle that high society has not managed to expunge from the centre. Kindly service and cooking on the bar top create a special feeling of homespun hospitality, a half Chinese half Viennese menu pumping out sizeable portions for its guests. Unmissable, particularly if you're hungry, but a social and authentic place to go just for a drink too. (Added April 2023)

name: W Oparach Absurdu.
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.2
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
4 taps from Browar Amber with a healthy craft can selection. The place is also known for gins and cocktails.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Eye-catching exterior with large neon signage and projecting a sense of institution. Unlike a lot of Warsaw venues this is more ramshackle, somewhere between a cultkneipe you'd find in Germany and one of Kazimier's antique bars in Krakow. Lampshades, rickety furniture, rugs.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Sleepy, but homely character in the afternoon, a characterful place to count the dust motes and ponder. This all changes as it turns to evening with a premium on space, musical acts and sense of cultural institution that is tangible.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks, live events, limited outdoor seating. 
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Overall reasonable value given the place's importance.
description: Praga is the nearest district Warsaw has to an alternative scene like Zizkov, Neukolln, Kazimierz or District VII, although it continues to be somewhat of a pale imitation. More like Gostenhof in Nuremberg perhaps, you need to know your way around to find the intermittent dots of nightlife. All such places need a centrepiece and here it is W Oparach Absurdu, a cosy, antiquey pub with the usual rickety furniture, fairylights and rugs that could easily slot into Krakow's nightlife scene, representing a rare departure from the usual corporate lounge bar fare in Poland's capital. Somewhat of an all-rounder, you can find yourself eating pierogi at lunchtime or dancing to live music in the small hours, this little venue is an essential bolt hole, perhaps not for everyone but fondly thought of by many - including us. (Added April 2023)

name: Pub Gambrinus
description:
EBG Rating:: 8.1
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
A pub offering a few Czech beers would be a pleasant outcome anywhere in the Balkans but one that has 8+ taps largely from excellent small brewers is automatically outstanding.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A little knajpa, battered old wood fittings with leaning posts and simple pubby surroundings with some decorative beery posters (occasionally erring to the banal)
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A sleepy afternoon hangout but social enough to chat to the bar guy or hang out on the terrace. In the evening a place here is sought after.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, books, board games, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Considering the quality of wares the prices are entirely fair, although will be a few cents higher than the average in Maribor. 
description: This down-to-earth pub on the periphery of Maribor centre would be a pleasant enough place of itself, but add 8+ taps offering beer from cutting edge Czech beers, a friendly and enthusiastic owner and you have a very appealing venue. Unpretentious setup clearly inheriting the well-worn remnants of a prior operation with its wood fittings and fairly cosy space. It's always nice to find such places in the land of the blandest Caffe Bars where pub culture, outside of Irish bars, not only doesn't exist but doesn't seem even to be understood as a concept. Finding something like this that also allows you to access some of the best lager on the planet (no joke) is a delight. (Added April 2023)

name: Krivi put
description:
EBG Rating:: 8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A broad range of cheap drinks but not so much available in the higher end of things. Still, bases are covered.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A large venue, barn-like interior with exposed rafters and a huge courtyard area with basic seating and primary colours, not unlike a ruin pub.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Zagreb's alternative scene mixes with virtually anyone who is looking to be around people. You could as easily find well manicured townies as crust punks in this versatile and completely unpretentious hangout.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, Outdoor seating, smoking permitted, live events

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for its offerings, here is where to go to shave a few pennies off the average order.
description: A rest from the typical Caffe Bar format comes in the shape of Krivi put, a large venue with courtyard, porch, terrace, and exposed barn. It is all stripped back, raw and unvarnished without any pretensions towards being some showy see-and-be-seen venue. Its cult status and size means you can find all ends of the nightlife spectrum here from crusties to those dolled up for a night on the tiles. There is further potential to exploit which is a pity, but it is clearly recommendable all the same. (Added April 2023)

name: Hops Craft Beer Pub Graz
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Strong selection of local and internation craft beers, including a decent tap selection, with OKish alternatives.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Pubby interior in a historic old town building, natural brickwork blends with the operations branding to produce a 'craft but pubby' type appearance.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
One of the focal points of Graz's city centre 'pub' nightlife and one of the closest things to a pub you'll find in Austria outside of Irish bars. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, snacks, limited outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for the produce and location, but nothing that's overly good value.
description: Looking past the hint of 'ex-pat pub' vibes you'll initially get, enter to find a tasteful pubby pub with a strong selection of beers and good all-rounder amenities that bind a local, younger crowd to the venue. All in all there's plenty to like and a good atmosphere. We could say more but we've more or less summed it up. (Added April 2023)

name: Le Petit Belge
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer specialists. A high quality range of Belgian ales supported by good quality German and Czech lagers.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Based in an 80s era arcade behind some large concrete pillars, the venue has a typical cafe bar appearance with corner bar in front of you at entry and an L shaped room around it. Tastefully decorated without anything majorly standing out.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A pleasant place for a drink day or night, kind service and a mixed crowd reflecting office workers, students and passing trade.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
TV, pub grub, snacks, outdoor seating, board games, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value without being outstanding.
description: Another venue in Zagreb that stands out a touch from the norm, not only for its excellent selection of beers but attention paid to the overall package. Kind service,  amenities, a good location and pleasant venue too, with a calm, welcoming afternoon cafe atmosphere and a nice glowy evening buzz to it. (Added April 2023)

name: Bacchus jazz bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A competent selection. Perhaps not as up to date as some.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Basement bar with large courtyard space in the interior of a city block. Inside there's a long vaulted room that's seen plenty of years as a bar, characterful and distinctive, particularly by Zagreb standards.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cult venue in the capital, long standing and oft visited, a frequent answer to 'where next'? Going from chatty and cosy on quieter evenings to raucous when music is going.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live music, outdoor seating, snacks, books, board games
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value in what is one of the most central locations in the capital.
description: Cult atmospheric basement jazz venue with a verdant beer garden in spring and summer, a long-standing classic with gigs several nights a week and a host of attractive elements to appeal outside those times too. Fair value with a broad drinks range, centrally located and simply a deserved fixture on the circuit. (Added April 2023)

name: Čeh Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell and Kozel Dark on tap fulfils the Czech element with a few nods in the back bar too, otherwise a familiar Croatian roster.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Plastered with colourful event posters, a corner entrance reveals a single room with a high ceiling and plenty of space.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A very smokey venue with an atmosphere fitting its long standing operation. A fixture on the circuit with a crowd to match. At the heart of Zagreb's social scene, buzzy and chatty.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Pub grub, snacks, smoking allowed, occasional events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value without being outstanding
description: A nice start to any Czech pub is the knowledge they can keep and pour their keg Pilsner Urquell and Kozel well. With that out of the way, let's discuss the pub, which is centrally located and has been a fixture of Zagreb nightlife for well over 15 years, its walls plastered with old and new posters advertising cultural events from floor to ceiling. Smokey, buzzy and chatty, totally unpretentious and more likeable for it. You'll get to know its surges of people as the rises and swells affect the atmosphere and energy, which also has a wistful charm at quieter times. One of Zagreb's stronger spots. (Added April 2023)

name: Woody Beer Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An unexpected hit with several taps covering Croatian craft to Czech pilsner with a host of bottled beers besides.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Simple roadside cafe bar that uses limited space in a homely but basic way.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
True local life to be found here with the owner putting on live music, spreads of food, bbqs, meaning it can turn from sedate café to raucous depending on your visit.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, food, outdoor seating, TV, snacks
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value but not outstanding given the quite basic premises.
description: A roadside bar that doesn't look like much from the outside, although the keen eyed will see the word 'beer' appears, but the 'not looking like much' ends up being part of its appeal. Truly local, you're as likely to find a gibbon in here as you are a camera wielding American in boardshorts or Instagrammer boring everyone to tears. What the Balkans lacks in interior decor in their pubs it can often make up for in hospitality, with its music events, food spreads, barbecues and general bonhomie adding hugely to what may otherwise simply be a down to earth multi-tap pub. Oh yes, the beers are pretty good with a nice selection on tap and in the fridge. You can't help but gradually be won over by its down to earth charms. Is it for everyone? Absolutely not, but that's never prevented a spot that can be loved by some from being included. (Added April 2023)

name: Kavarna Bodi
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.9
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A broad range of options covering mixers, cocktails, shots and - yes - beer. The beer options on tap include some local options, with a broader range in the fridge.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A large historic building, but on entry you may think the place is a small little bar. A raised area overlooks a nice fairylit bar area. However, venture through the curtains to find a large cafe bar with tall ceilings, some eclectic decor and varied vintage furnishings.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
It feels every inch like the hub of Ptuj's nightlife, with a broad and welcoming approach drawing in a varied audience. The roster of cultural events make it a hub of activity. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live events, community activities, meals, snacks, outdoor seating, books, board games, this is not only the strong suit of the venue, it is its purpose. 

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value considering all factors, but nothing too outstanding. Concerts may charge.
description: A versatile cultural hub, the small town of Ptuj has been blessed by Kavarna Bodi, which manages the not simple task of feeling like an intimate drinking hole, a welcoming cafe, a concert hall and a community hub without becoming bland. In a grand corner building, you'll initially be surprised to be greeted with a small bar room with limited raised seating, but the venue unfolds in the room to the left into a grand space with high ceilings, artwork, eclectic decor and vintage furniture which is set aside, sometimes adjusted to accommodate community events, live performances and most legal activities you can think of in between. The amenities are laid on here which is undoubtedly its strongest suit, along with the warm twinkly atmosphere. An essential visit when in Ptuj. (Added April 2023)

name: muzikafe B&B
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cafe range, broad and accommodating for virtually anything one would want to drink, not confined to only basic quality either.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A nationally famous venue in a large restored building in Ptuj old town. Eye catching decoration in the courtyard, niches with warped metal design. Inside, it's a colourful cafe.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️
There's no doubt the best nights are outside in summer in the courtyard. The interior is too stuffy, sleepy and cafe-like to really go overboard about.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Live performances, meals, snacks, outdoor seating, books, board games
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A little higher than usual but nothing offensive. 
description: Nationally famous, muzikafe has made it big on account of its relatively long history, the heritage of the building and its community events at the heart of Ptuj's cultural activities. Summertime in the courtyard is a must, but this is a versatile venue, and you can find yourself almost horizontal on their big sofas inside with a book. A little stuffy and lacking cutting edge indoors, it was a difficult choice but overall it just squeaks onto our guide. (Added April 2023)

name: Cafe Cajt
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent range of tapped beers supported further by the fridge selection. Relevant and up to date but paying homage to some traditional classics too.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A battered old cafe bar with wood fittings, faded upholstered seats. Small with little signage outside.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A friendly locals hangout, most people here know each other, and the crowd is varied too, with the beers attracting a younger audience. You could stay here all day, although it is smoky, and you would come out needing a shower.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Community events, pub snacks, limited outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for the quality of produce and when considering the location.
description: Excellent beers and local life are what it's all about at this tiny worn out wood-fitted cafe bar that has either been inherited or changed its modus operandi to become beer specialists. Unlike city locations like Valhalla, there is little chance of tourists peeking in here, with limited signage and not much of a view from the outside to indicate it's safe. However, you'll find a young cosmopolitan crowd mixing in here, and if you like beer this is a clearly superior option on the circuit. (Added April 2023)

name: Atmosphere bar Břevnov
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer from microbrewery Olesna is an eye opener in a dive bar that you'd think for all the world would be sticking to basic options. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A purposefully dingy dive, a little Klub with a bicycle chained to the front, enter to find a two room Pajzl with wooden tables, dartboard at the rear and everything covered in a smokey layer of murk
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Raw and unfettered, not for the faint hearted, but uniformly friendly and welcoming. Smokey, gritty, crusty, punky and a true example of 'the alternative'. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Dart board, snacks, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Excellent value for money
description: What makes a dirty, smokey dive filled with insalubrious characters worthy of our guide? Well, first we must acknowledge this isn't going to be everybody's thing. Or even a large minority of people's thing. But if you are into raw, unvarnished no airs and graces hangouts to drink, chat and have a laugh, a bunker from the outside world, and a refreshing step away from the clean and clinical sterility of the new bars sweeping Prague, this is a terrific example. For a start, the beer here includes Pivovar Olesna, a microbrewer that many craft taprooms would like to boast on their roster, so you're not sat here drinking stuff like Staropramen or Branik. A wise-cracking old dame works the bar while the owner may be kicking around and is good value to talk to. An evening spent in here felt like making friends - what more can you ask for from a pub? (Added April 2023)

name: HANGÁR Pub & Pivotéka
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Tap beers from Hangar and an exceptional fridge. Beer focus but there are reasonable alternatives. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Classic Hospoda interior in a half-step basement with wood strip panelling and naturally communal intimate space around the bar area. The pub leads to a backroom decorated in similar style. Airplane decoration is to be found around and about the place.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A classic Hospoda atmosphere augmented with a little bit of an ex-pat/tourist crowd, but generally a pleasant mix of both. Service is kind too, and it's a neighbourhood local you'd be delighted to have nearby.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, books, boardgames
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Mediocre
description: A defacto brewery taproom with a big fridge of alternatives, the beers are a big draw, but that could only lead to a guide inclusion if the venue was worthy - which it is! A natural hospoda layout in a half-step basement with wood strip panelling. Kind service and an intimate interior provides a very pleasant atmosphere afternoon or evening. (Added April 2023)

name: Krajina Piva
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer focused with 8-12 Polish craft beer tap options at any given point and 3 fridges of wares, you will not want for a beer. Back bar alternative options are standard however.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
At first glance the bar appears familiar, plain even, but then certain quirks begin to stand out such as the barrels by the bar, exposed beams,  'Hanseatic' belt type historic building, piano and some nautical themes, an overall well decorated pub.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A welcoming comfortable pub with friendly service and despite the central location, somewhat of a neighbourly atmosphere.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Food from a connected restaurant, snacks, piano, books and boar games.

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonable and fair pricing for the produce even if nothing eye catching.
description: A nice find which we visited only an hour before leaving Torun, well located between the train station and old town, focusing on Polish beers including several from the city and region. The venue itself has had some focus applied to it as well, a naturally characterful historic venue with beams and barrels, comfortably furnished with a correctly 'pubby feel', decorated without a cookie cutter craft template applied which is relieving. Friendly and neighbourly despite the location, while the beer is clearly the outstanding element, overall there's plenty to recommend. (Added April 2023)

name: Armand
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A versatile selection covering cocktails, liqueurs and craft beers, well equipped to cover a range of needs.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Appealing interior of vintage furniture, you'll enter to an open plan room of little tables. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fairylit, lamplit and candlelit providing that sultry evening atmosphere in tandem with the soft pastely vintage furnishings. However, the rhythm of the place is buzzy, chatty and social, creating a pleasant mixture.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, occasional live events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices but not extortionate.
description: With a classically Art Deco logo, the interior with off-centre lamps, candle light and rickety vintage furniture doesn't fit that straight edged elegance promised, but aside of that incongruity you can settle in for what the bar actually is, a lovely social spot with a nice buzz, pleasingly informal and welcoming for a downtown bar marketing itself in this way. A broad range of drinks to satisfy most tastes and a place you could happily spend a couple of hours in as the evening flies by. (Added April 2023)

name: Pijana Wiśnia 🍒
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cherry liqueur in different volumes - and would you like that warm or cold? Admirably and unapologetically minimalist.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Eyecatching cascade of bottles fitted to the ceiling and into shapes around the walls. Modern, stylish, somehow unpretentious despite the money lavished on it. One room where you gather around high tables.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Naturally informal due to the drinks and seating, you can spend 5 minutes or an hour here, both effectively. The lavish decor and cut glass add an elan and flamboyance to proceedings even though the place is democratic and informal.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Shop, outdoor seating, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Nothing dramatic to report either way.
description: Flamboyantly cherry, from the retro prints at the bar to the woozy red backlit bottles that line the walls and ceilings, this is one of the more eye catching venues in this chain of liqueur purveying drop in bars. Yes, the format is informal, simply show up, choose your volume and stand at a high table with friends or out on the terrace. You can be here for a good time or a long time. It isn't like us to promote chains but when they do what they do well, we're glad to (Added April 2023)

name: Lucky's Heuriger
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Their own wines with 2 beer taps and limited alternativies.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Homely venue with warm colours and simple genteel decor.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Truly local, you won't find too many if any tourists making the journey here. The atmosphere has a vaguely carvery type feel.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Meals, snacks, outdoor seating, rooms, books, newspapers, TV
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Good value for what is in essence a buffet.
description: The Heuriger is an Austrian wine tavern where wine producers fling open their doors providing hospitality which can extend to rooms and meals or basic deli spreads. Lucky's has more than a hint of the English pub carvery to it, but on a low key independent, family-run level. This element is accentuated by a simple small bar area for their friends and regulars. The interior is warm, homely and genteel with personal flavour, you feel welcome even in an alien concept in an unusual, non-touristy part of town. Home cooking is provided, the buffet and drinks very good value and we came away very happy to come back here, and to try more Heurigers. (added April 2023)

name: Humboldtkeller
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
An old fashioned but worthy selection covering most bases. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Attractive little den with a fireplace, piano and curved ceiling, highly personalised by long-standing owners.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Characterful venue, busy or quiet with kind service and a bluesy, jazzy interior. In colder months the fireplace bangs out some warmth and cosiness.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pub grub, snacks, piano, boardgames, live events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value for money, nothing to remark on as such.
description: In Geidorf, probably the most beautiful district of Graz, at the foot of the Schlossberg, you will find this late bar, which looks inconspicuous from the outside yet has a special flair. The traditional Beisl has long been a cult venue in Graz, especially for music lovers across all styles. Here, jazz lovers and rock fans coexist peacefully and everyone else gets their money's worth.
A cozy bar with fireplace, boardgames and a cellar feel even at ground level, this is a pleasant spot whether it's quiet or busy. Kindly servers Trudi and Alf try to accommodate for everyone, so you can enjoy some Yugo cooking, tapped beer and live music just as you can enjoy wine, candlelight and a good book. Such venues are rare, and survivors in such a brutal trading environment are enough to make your heart sing. (Added April 2023)

name: Medonja
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Surprisingly superior options to the extent it is somewhat of a beer specialist, though you'll find a competent back bar.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
Pubby layout with two lounge rooms and two bars. Quite green, in fact overly green.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Can't knock the atmosphere, this place is full and buzzing on evenings. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Smoking permitted, snacks, games, TV

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value overall
description: Very popular evening venue, its plain furnishings and overly green decor shortcomings ably overcome by the social atmosphere and surprisingly superior beer selection. We weren't expecting much more than a local bolthole but it has quite a bit more going for it than that. You won't escape smoke-free though, so be warned! (Added April 2023)

name: Hub Cooltura Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A notch above the average caffe bar options, broad but not exceptional.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A nicely low key alternative slant on a lounge bar, a corner extension in an atypical building for the neighbourhood, a large curved room with rugs, piano, antique furniture, with beer garden to the rear and cosy looking back room.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Considering the location isn't central, there is a fairly cosmopolitan crowd, largely local with some international flavour. It operates effectively as the neighbourhoods cultural hub, just as the name suggests. Chatty and social with some versatility to up the pace later on in the day.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, meals, snacks, TV, books, board games

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair value, but nothing notably away from the norm.
description: A quirky café bar out in the neighbourhoods, everything from the shape of the building, an unusual exterior growth extended from a smaller building, to the inside with its sweeping lounge area and cosy seemingly subterranean backroom with lampshade, rugs, antique furniture and eclectic decor. Nothing you won't have seen before, but nicely curated and very unusual by Croatia's modest standards. Drinks are adequate while the range of amenities is more of a standout here, a versatile place you could sink into the sofa and read a book, or enjoy some sport on TV, lounge out in the garden, catch up with friends or go for a buzzy evening out. Very much worth a look while in Zagreb. (Added April 2023)

name: The Beertija
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A competent range of drinks with a fairly mainstream selection, broad and accommodating without offering much that's modern or high end. 
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Sprawling venue occupying a front yard of a historic building with the typical bunting, coloured lights and deckchairs, in a reasonably alternative fashion, with a scuzzier late night basement drinking hole attached. All a little ad hoc.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
The central location and less usual format ensures a crowd in the front yard on warm evenings, the space and ability to wander and explore adds an element without quite  touching Ruin Bar type experience/
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Plenty to go at, outdoor seating, exterior food and drinks van, TV, live events, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
A mid-brow price range for the city centre, unremarkable either way.
description: Zagreb is full of slightly abortive versions of other concepts, which fall in the cracks between its stock and trade - the generic caffe bar, the craft beer venue and the generic cocktail lounge. The Beertija is a central offering with expansive, appealing outdoor courtyard space. Colourful and atmospheric, with a scuzzier basement bar/club attached, the place seems to inhabit the alternative and the mainstream, slightly uneasily but still to its credit. Drinks are competent and there's a lot to do. For its utility and change of environment, it is worth recommending. (Added April 2023)

name: Orient Express
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Caffe Bar type selection with a few craft beers from local breweries in bottles and cans.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
By Croatian standards a very distinctive bar fitted out in homage to the Orient Express, fitted leather seats and booths, ephemera covering the walls, wood fittings. Small and narrow, a good job to execute the closest they could make the place feel like a train carriage. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A central crowd with a mixed audience, this is a downtown kind of atmosphere and stays open til midnight on weekdays and 2am at weekends. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Snacks, smoking permitted. limited outdoor seating
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices, maybe 5% higher than some, but nothing too outrageous.
description: A bar we found simply by walking past it, who knows how many hours of research we saved in the process. Eye-catching Orient Express theme, a small narrow bar you enter straight off a shopping street. Wood fittings, leather upholstered seats and booths, golden age ephemera on the walls, this is noteworthy, particularly in a country with a famously 'who cares' approach to decorating its caffe bars. Drinks are fairly stock but complimented with some local craft options. Service is very friendly and used to touristic custom, and the place does a familiar kind of city centre trade, perhaps not a place with regulars as such. Well worth a look while in Zagreb. (Added April 2023)

name: Restaurace Na Mělníku
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pilsner Urquell pub with the usual Czech liqueurs in the back bar, very traditional choice but also very well poured.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An unspoilt Czech pub, large but cosy feeling, enter to find the taproom in small Knajpe style where you can drink a beer on the stand, but walk through to a series of large rooms decorated in blacks and creams, simple but effective. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
An Ur-typical Prague pub with its format copied and pasted around everywhere, but here they have kept the original interior intact. Cosy and social, it can be pleasant in quiet and busy times, and acts as one of the cornerstones of the local neighbourhood.

Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Food, snacks

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Fair for both food and drink
description: The area around Letna and Strossmayerovo Namesti is swiftly becoming clear as the number one place for unspoilt Prague pubs. Only a short tram ride from downtown, there is much reason to give it a try. This really is a classic with a template passed down through time and preserved so long it has started to look interesting again. Black wood, cream ceiling, net curtain, huge tables and Pilsner Urquell. (Added April 2023)

name: Na Sekyrce
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.5
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A typical traditional Czech offering, good standard Pilsner Urquell, some budget options and a back bar of bitter liqueurs.

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A small drop in hospoda, plain walls and simple furniture but personalised to some extent around the bar area and the place has a personality.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Local life and the rhythm of an authentic hospoda, here is somewhere tourist-free and free of tourist trappings. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, basic pub food, snacks, limited outdoor space.
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Fair, affordable
description: Prague is renowned for its large central beer halls but the true hospoda experience is less advertised, and reflects normal life for real people in the city, far away from the con tricks, bill scams and arsey service. It is a good idea to wrench yourself away from Prague 1 to experience what is really going on in the city. One of the best areas currently is Letna down to Strossmayerovo Namesti where a dozens such pubs exist, one of which is Na Sekyrce. At first glance a small, relatively plain pub, and not one you would go out of your way to find, but it's the combination of its rhythm and authenticity, the well tapped beer and the atmosphere of locals socialising in their own space that makes an overall distinctive enough pub to recommend. (Added April 2023)

name: Dragon Social Club
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.8
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
Although the bar seems full of taps don't expect too much out of the ordinary. The range of drinks as a whole is broad rather than peaking in much relevant or high quality.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A pleasant hangout spot with informal comfortable seating opposite the bar and a more alternative loungey area. There is also a performance area and piano. From its homemade decorations to the general ramshackle nature, this is likeably non-corporate.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A cult venue in Poznan, long-standing and reliable, the often heard answer to 'where next?' A broad range of people from rockers to the more towny prove the versatility of the place.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️❤️
Pub grub, outdoor seating, live music, piano, books, board games, community events
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
City centre prices, not extortionate but not overly cheap
description: This cult venue has been a fixture of Poznan's nightlife for what classes in Poland as a very long time. The key to its success is versatility and provision. Versatility is shown in its decor which attracts the alternative and the towny, and in its drinks offerings which are broad and accommodating, if not the highest end. You can gossip, play games, visit for live events, and everything is provided. Service is friendly too. No wonder it earns this reputation. (Added April 2023)

name: Aura
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Cocktails from a concise menu focusing on bourbon and Old Fashioned spinoffs, with a selection of classics. In theory you can ask the bartenders to make a cocktail from scratch, but the price will climb steeply.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Tiny corner bar with an unusual, disorienting set of dimensions from the low to the ground window seating to the walls lined with rugs around curved mirrors, gilt edged bar and ladder to access a wall of spirits. 
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
A surprisingly neighbourly vibe, possibly on account of the sheer tininess of the bar and lack of pretense of the duo servers whose character and rhythm itself adds personality. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Outdoor seating, nibbles
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
City centre, capital city prices, albeit 10% underneath what you would pay in London at such a place. 
description: This quirky cocktail bar intrigues on pictures and first impressions will be no less curious. Tiny venue with colourful bar fitting, rugs on the walls, curved mirrors, padded window seating and ladder to access a wall of bourbon. The crowd are international but it has a very informal, almost neighbourly rhythm accentuated by a charismatic bar team, a duo who are well versed in the art of cocktail making and equally important rapport. It's still difficult to quite know what to make of it, but the conclusions were positive overall. If you're seeking cocktails with a bit of a twist to the format and environment in an intimate, characterful space, this is certainly among Warsaw's better options for that. (Added April 2023)

name: BackRoom Bar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Signature cocktails created by the bar itself, with a concise selection of classics. Alternatives are available. 

Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
There is no sign, this place is simply the last door around the corner of the courtyard. Once inside a bunker/speakeasy dynamic with muted lighting, seats at the bar, and an appealing backroom in the backroom. Seating by the bar errs towards the generic.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Always appealing hanging around a clandestine venue as well as drinking at the bar, however the experience is slightly detracted by overly officious staff and a hipster bro atmosphere at quiet times, plenty of preening and pretense.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️
Nibbles, recipes to take away
Value For Money: ❤️❤️
Undeniably pricey, but this is in line with what you may expect from a capital city cocktail bar, and a fairly exclusive one at that. 
description: In two minds about BackRoom. The voyage to locate it for the first time adds to the intrigue, and inside its clandestine atmosphere is effective. The cocktails are excellent and some nice touches like nibbles and the recipe to take away are thoughtful too. However, the cast of hipster bro staff preening by the bar, and overly officious front of house leaves it feeling a little spoiled, not achieving its potential. Certainly there is plenty to recommend if you can deal with those elements. (Added April 2023)

name: Biblioteka
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.7
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️
A familiar, last-gen Polish range albeit not the worst by far, just not brought up to date with the last 15 years developments.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Attractive basement setting, fairylit entrance beckoning into a warren of rooms with a light literary decor.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Difficult to imagine much reading happening in this low-lit venue. Everything about it screams 'reliable bolthole' and you'll find this offers a consistent and effective social space. 
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Books, snacks, TV, games

Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
On par with the competition and against the quality of what's on sale.
description: Every city needs a pub of this sort, reliable basement hangout where you can just as easily plot in a corner, watch sport on TV or melt into the scenery, and it's easy to imagine all three happening here. Brick vaults and a light touch literary theme provide a nice environment which is complimented with the local social scene. The drinks offering typifies an approach which is based around a lack of pretension and instead simply provision, serving the people in an unshowy way. (Added April 2023)

name: Medina Škrinja Pub
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Provincial pubby selection enhanced with some European and craft beer options. Overall a notably superior
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Unexpectedly cavernous venue, brick vaults in what appears to be an old store room in a historic building. The bear with treasure strapped to its chest dangles from the ceiling looming over proceeding. Very dimly lit even during the day.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Naturally atmospheric venue with typical local provincial life that cranks up as the evening progresses.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
Snacks, outdoor seating, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
Reasonably fair value for the produce
description: Distinctive informal pub with entrance around the back of a garden. Based in a historic building, these brick vaults clearly had a historic use but now house this cavernous pub decorated with medieval sigils and a huge bear with treasured strapped to its chest. The venue is drinks focused, so expect socialising, not meals and dining. Extremely gloomily lit even during the day, it is somewhere to hideout in a corner with a nice beer, or when it gets busier enjoy the clubby, down to earth buzz. (added April 2023)

name: Kvazar
description:
EBG Rating:: 7.6
Choice/Quality of Drinks: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Beer specialists, you'll find an notably superior selection of Croatian craft on tap. They also have a good rakia selection if that's your thing.
Style/Décor: ❤️❤️❤️
A pubby bar with musical memorabilia on the walls, a small venue really with seating around a central bar.
Atmosphere/Character: ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Popular city centre haunt with a healthy ratio of locals to tourists. Natural buzz and energy to the place.
Amenities/Events: ❤️❤️❤️
TV, outdoor seating, free Popcorn with drinks, smoking permitted
Value For Money: ❤️❤️❤️
