name: The Old Moseley Arms
description:
City: Birmingham
description: An attractive bar area and Edwardian type saloon bar atmosphere, a popular courtyard beer garden. Well reviewed.

name: The Plough
description:
City: Nottingham
description: A Nottingham Brewery pub with fair prices, old school pub decor and community of locals.

name: The Chapel House
description:
City: Gornal
description: A traditional homely community pub with a local atmosphere and cosy simple appeal. Very well reviewed.

name: Hill House Happisburgh
description:
City: Happisburgh
description: An inn with rooms, but the pub area looks homely, cosy and characterful.

name: La Mayor Cervecería
description:
City: Madrid
description: A beautiful lived in beer bar with a pub  like appearance without becoming a tacky Irish pub. Popular and renowned for its selection.

name: Volunteer Arms
description:
City: York
description: A well reputed neighbourhood local, with typical community pub decor, uncomplicated and potentially atmospheric in the evenings. Have visited a couple of times but a little quiet on both occasions to get a true sense. Similar vibe to The Ackhorne nearby. Lacking a certain something in comparison to sister pubs The Swan and The Slip Inn. Last visit in 2024.

name: Imperial Arms Pub & Courtyard Bisro
description:
City: Chislehurst
description: A pub with an ornate Victorian lounge, plush leather seats, curtains, sadly fairly tacky fake book wallpaper ruining the effect.

name: The Stocks Inn
description:
City: Furzehill
description: Pleasant looking coaching inn pub with exposed beams, ungentrified decor, good reviews.

name: Wallace Arms
description:
City: Rowfoot
description: We are pleased to announce, a real pub, a proper pub, a hikers pub one with a local community and not turned into a middle class dining room yet.

name: Crown & Mitre
description:
City: King's Lynn

description: A pleasant riverside pub without corporate trappings, and a homely, distinctly English feel. We are excited to try it.

name: The Stork Hotel
description:
City: Birkenhead
description: Beautiful preserved Victorian pub with glass panels, ornate wood, tiled floor. Characterful and local.

name: Pivnice U Pražského Groše
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: Small pub with good regional beer and cosy atmosphere, well reputed in town.

name: Pivnice u Peruna
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: A proper pub focused on beer and a fair selection of regionals in trad style.

name: Divadelni Club
description:
City: Hradec Králové
description: 'Theatre Club', this is in fact a cosy, clandestine pub set up for drinking. Extremely well reviewed and seemingly Poutnik on tap. The most appealing looking venue we have found so far in Hradec Kralove.

name: "Pumpe" - Gasthaus Zum Großglockner
description:
City: Klagenfurt 
description: A traditional pub/gaststatte with plenty of room for a drink, not just food. Wood beams, traditional decor and impressive old bar area.

name: The Eagle Vaults
description:
City: Worcester
description: Attractive Victorian pub worth a look, however perhaps a little too lacking personality for its own good? We will see

name: House Without A Name
description:
City: Bolton
description: A pub with a very definite name.

name: The Packhorse Inn
description:
City: Little Longstone
description: Looks a lovely ungentrified country pub.

name: Le Jacques Coeur
description:
City: Bourges
description: Beautiful pub in half-timbered building, Belgian and local french ales on offer

name: La Cave a Vin'ce
description:
City: Bourges
description: Tiny wine bar with democratic prices, very well reviewed.

name: 't Goed Voorbeeld
description:
City: Lier
description: Brown cafe with parquet floor, mannequins and religious iconography. A proper bar as well. Looks very good.

name: Cafė De Mort
description:
City: Lier
description: Gloomy (in a good way) brown café specialising in higher end Belgian ales and well reputed. A few comments about being OK value, too.

name: De Tramstatie
description:
City: Ranst
description: A lovely well-done pub with wood panels, retro signage, pub games, classic furniture. Large enough to occasionally host live music.

name: Sint-Gummarus
description:
City: Lier
description: A traditional tavern/brown café with a beautiful riverside terrace and historic setting.

name: 't Kelderke
description:
City: Geel
description: Beer café with some distinctive touches and Belgian character but we are on the fence as to whether there's really enough going here.

name: K-Trolle VZW
description:
City: Roeselare
description: A bit more of an alternative city bar with some old time influences, more of an all-rounder, anyway. Looks like it has potential

name: The Salehurst Halt
description:
City: Robertsbridge
description: Timber framed pub with engagingly dark wooden beams and enough in the shape of the building to resist the attempts to gentrify.

name: The Rose & Crown
description:
City: Clayhill
description: A surprisingly distinctive venue with an eye for the old fashioned. Plenty of character and cosy interior. If only there were more of these around in the countryside.

name: Einstein. Die Bierkneipe
description:
City: Magdeburg
description: Cosy pub-like drinking hole, albeit smokers friendly. Social and well-reviewed.

name: Le Stanze
description:
City: Bologna
description: Le Stanze. A bar inside a chapel. We visited in 2014 but it didn't make a profound impression. However the interior does look outstanding, so worth closer inspection.

name: Harvest Pub
description:
City: Bologna
description: Neighbourhood beer bar with wood panels, a fairly distinctive independent effort, not too craft-cookie cutter.

name: eKoiné ri-pub
description:
City: Bari
description: Strangely named, this alternative hangout spot is a tad ramshackle - in a nice way - and offers extremely good beers.

name: L'Orabeffa
description:
City: Brindisi
description: On our first visit, we were not totally convinced. High prices as well as a cover charge, along with sneaky extras for snacks. Otherwise a decent all-rounder with good drinks options. May be worth returning.

name: Windigo Saloon
description:
City: Bari
description: Lots of wood, as you may imagine from the name. Another bar with good beer and pub credentials in the Bari backstreets.

name: Pinky Pub di Ricci Michele
description:
City: Martina Franca
description: Looks an excellent pub with strong beer credentials and cosy wodden bench seating.

name: Tausend Pub
description:
City: Martina Franca
description: Surprisingly interesting looking backstreet pub considering the location. Beer, down to earth decor, cosy seating arrangement.

name: Osteria All'antico Vinaio
description:
City: Florence
description: Stunningly historic, well kept osteria. Certainly food-focused but with a pub-like atmosphere and informality that welcomes drinking.

name: The Four Alls Inn
description:
City: Ovington
description: Attractive, cosy looking country inn without too much modernisation or attempt to appeal to only one class of person.

name: Langdon Beck Hotel
description:
City: Forest-in-Teesdale
description: Attractive, cosy looking country inn without too much modernisation or attempt to appeal to only one class of person.

name: Entlas-Keller Biergarten GmbH
description:
City: Erlangen
description: Gardens don't feature all too commonly on our guide but here is a great looking pub and a fun-looking garden - neither tacky nor stuffy.

name: House of Beer
description:
City: Kraków
description: A venue that hasn't quite done it for us yet, however you can't deny the beer range, and they have some nice exposed wooden beams in what does really feel like a house taken over. Maybe a few more visits will convince us to add this one.

name: Non Iron. Pub
description:
City: Kraków
description: One of the genuinely local places in the city, this one specialises in live sport and Czech beer, with several low-key regionals on tap. Missing something to make it truly lovable, but we are convinced it could be on the fringes of an inclusion.

name: Gaststätte HARR
description:
City: Siegen
description: Old fashioned Gaststätte set up for drinking over eating from what we can see. A decent ausschenk at least. Looks homely and characterful.

name: De Zeeduif
description:
City: De Haan
description: Fun-looking bar with some cafe features, funky stylings, interspersed with pub-like parts.

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: Bath
description: One of the true highlights of bath. Preserved pub interior with a cosy bustling feel. Wood panels and red cushions, a classic.

name: The Green Tree Tavern
description:
City: Broxburn
description: A homely drop-in pub with lived-in appearance and character as a result.

name: The Old Fox
description:
City: Gateshead
description: A local institution, information thin on the ground but live music, large beer selection and local character is to be expected.

name: Alibi Creative Club
description:
City: Lecce
description: – one of the more interesting décor wise. Cavern like but with verdant hanging plants. Some food focus but enough latitude for evening drinks

name: Quanto Basta
description:
City: Lecce
description: Reportedly the best cocktails in the city. Decor is down to earth, mostly it is about the product.

name: Gusto Vinile
description:
City: Brindisi
description: Interesting concept - a vinyl bar stuffed with records, some live music too. Extremely highly rated, even if the decor looks a bit dated now.

name: The Halfway House
description:
City: Brenchley
description: Characterful venue with exposed beams, dangling hops and barrels strewn with beer ephemera. Distinctive and seemingly heroically well reviewed.

name: Johnnie Fox's Pub
description:
City: Glencullen
description: Somewhat touristy due to being the highest pub in Ireland, but the venue itself has much to recommend it. Historic and has the character you'd expect. A little chintzy but non-corporate and all the better for it.

name: The Glenmalure Lodge
description:
City: Glenmalure
description: A country inn with plenty of preserved rustic charm by the looks of it.

name: The Cartoon Inn
description:
City: Rathdrum
description: A somewhat distinctive pub from the inside (the gaelic script signage is a bit drab), a fireplace and plenty of hanging artwork provide the cosy atmosphere you're seeking.

name: Tochar House
description:
City: Roundwood
description: Another rustic country inn with local life and character that's not yet been extinguished

name: The Blue Light
description:
City: Sandyford
description: Roadside pub with stone walls and a coastal type decoration. Visited by those seeking a good view of Dublin city and a bit of a day out.

name: The Cumberland Inn
description:
City: Alston
description: An inn with rooms, this one looks to have kept the concept of a cosy bar and lounge going.

name: Café De Vriendschap
description:
City: Terneuzen
description: Venerable brown café with a few seasidey elements. Nevertheless very brown, and well reviewed.

name: Luwak
description:
City: Terneuzen
description: Lucky to have a place like this - a cosy pub with exposed beams, high ceiling and antique decor, some mixing of old and new. Exceptional reviews.

name: Cafe "Bij Jean en Tinneke" ("Bij Voghel")
description:
City: Brussegem
description: Very characterful looking brown cafe with home kitchen stylings thrown in. A venerable establishment.

name: Karrewiel
description:
City: Merchtem
description: Characterful brown café enjoyed by young and old. Looks distinctive and individual.

name: Het Obstakel
description:
City: Opwijk
description: Not the average brown cafe, this bar has more individual styling with marble bar top, quirky plant based decor but plenty of dusky candle lit atmosphere in the evenings, mainly well reviewed except for music volume.

name: Prince of Wales
description:
City: Foxfield
description: Despite some dud old design choices you can't criticise this pub for its community feel. It looks to have local character and individuality which is worth a lot more in the long run.

name: The Kings Arms
description:
City: Barrow-in-Furness
description: A true neighbourhood pub owned by a local rugby player. Traditional pub amenities and cosy seating. Uniformly well reviewed.

name: The Wellington Inn
description:
City: Loppergath
description: A homely inn with a local, as well as countryside flavour. Down to earth appearance and very well reviewed.

name: The Junction
description:
City: Castleford
description: Famous local pub for music gigs, with a few cask ales. WARNING: Cash Only. On our first visit we didn't quite see it at its best but willing to try again. (Added February 20240

name: The Drovers Inn
description:
City: Inveraran
description: A locally-famous pub with interesting low-slung ceiling and stuffed animals. Quite corporate in its presentation but seems like it will be effective in its execution of a country pub.

name: The Hairy Lemon
description:
City: Dublin
description: Perhaps unbearably tacky and touristy,  but this is a very well known venue for its decor and atmosphere in the evening

name: The Crafty Baa
description:
City: Windermere
description: Tiresome name, but plenty of thought (and money) in the execution, straddling modernity and cosy traditional values. Good drinks are presumably available.

name: Black Bull
description:
City: Coniston
description: A pleasantly homely pub with a delicate touch, of the kind you often get with inns offering rooms. Looks reasonably good and offers a beautiful riverside view.

name: Tower Bank Arms
description:
City: Sawrey
description: Characterful, upright but traditional pub trying to attract diners, potentially losing some of its cosiness in the process. However given the location it merits a closer look.

name: The Eagle & Child Inn
description:
City: Staveley
description: Majestic pub with steep beamed ceiling, plush furniture and an array of carefully positioned bric-a-brac. Looks genuinely fab.

name: Warthe-Eck
description:
City: Berlin
description: Looks like a quality 'Eck', corner pub, with darts, retro (original) signage and no-nonsense service. A format that is increasingly alien, even in German cities.

name: Up´n Prüfstand
description:
City: Varel
description: One of the smallest bars in Europe, based in what seems to be a fishing hut or little chalet. Opening hours seem erratic, so this may be a labour of love. Some people enjoy it for the cosiness.

name: Schlappen
description:
City: Freiburg
description: Recommended by a friend...

name: Cztery Pokoje
description:
City: Legnica
description: Very well reviewed bar with a few different areas. Seemingly quite versatile, with a pub dog.

name: Bimbeer
description:
City: Legnica
description: A decent range of beers and somewhat clandestine looking interior. Reviews thin on the ground.

name: Gaststätte Madhouse
description:
City: Augsburg
description: Highly personalised and lived-in features, live music, and a bit of a local legend. Also looks very different from a lot of other Augbsurg bars (in a good way)

name: The Blue Mugge
description:
City: Leek
description: Studded red leather bench seating and other Victorian/Edwardian features in this traditional down to earth boozer that is outstandingly well reviewed.

Edit - On a 1st visit the layout was very distinctive but the floral wallpaper and slightly sterilised feel meant it didn't quite make the cut.

name: Britannia Inn
description:
City: Elterwater
description: A 500-year old building, it looks like a cosy country inn with exposed beams, stone fireplace and ungentrified feel. A genteel setting looks to make outside seating in summer enjoyable too.

name: Black Swan Hotel
description:
City: Kelso
description: A hotel pub with an attractive and welcoming ungentrified downstairs that plays host to local life.

name: The Three Tuns
description:
City: Alcester
description: A suitably old building with exposed beams and a stone floor, one or two nik naks which are in tune with the design, and it's a popular venue. We are ready to be convinced.

name: The Grey Horse
description:
City: Consett
description: Fabulous looking local gem, traditional neighbourhood corner local that's been kept as cosy as it should be. Looks a classic.

name: The Falcon Inn
description:
City: Arncliffe
description: A frankly beautiful cosy looking old in which just to look at recalls the pubs of times past, the best bits anyway. We look forward to visiting.

name: 't Schrijverke
description:
City: Temse
description: Cosy looking cafe with night atmosphere as well. Seems personalised and characterful in its own way.

name: Blue Cow Cafe
description:
City: Bornem
description: Characterful venue, well decorated with a lived-in feel. Seemingly well known in the area and well thought of. Brown cafe design but a little bigger than usual. Popular.

name: Cafe De Paling
description:
City: Ninove
description: Beautiful interior with tiled floor and plenty of aged local life

name: Sint-Annakamer
description:
City: Ninove
description: Beautiful tiled floor and rustic furnishings. Mirror panels, wooden fittings, the lot.

name: Gonzo
description:
City: Ninove
description: Highly rated pub that aims to be a live music rock pub and cosy cafe when live acts aren't on. Very well rated and looks good for either occasion.

name: Café Mombasa
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Belgian-style corner cafe with retro signage and wooden seats, some art nouveau touches. Looks cosy and authentic.

name: Bierkroeg Den Hulst
description:
City: Herselt
description: Roadside cafe with authetic/nostalgic decor, nik naks up the walls and very strong beer offerings, as could be predicted. Looks fantastic.

name: Kaffee Den Afgrond In De Swa(e)nekelder
description:
City: Heist-op-den-Berg
description: Details thin on the ground but this has previously been listed as one of the best brown cafes in the area. Some recent reviews (2019)

name: La Pisici Cafe
description:
City: Timisoara
description: Unclear on drinks options but this cafe bar looks after stray cats, the decor is very individualistic with a twee living room style.

name: Willoughby Arms
description:
City: Kingston upon Thames
description: A down to earth boozer with occasional live music and events room upstairs. Seemingly unconcerned by the concept of pretentiousness which can hardly be a bad thing given the location.

name: The Masons Arms
description:
City: Teddington
description: Beautiful octagonal bar area with bench seating around it. Looks to be very well reviewed and rated for its beer selection in addition to local atmosphere.

name: The Grill
description:
City: Aberdeen
description: Somewhat of an oddity, this is a local institution. No food. Art deco appearance with varnished wood fittings and sleek ceiling. Leather bench seats but quite open plan. Cast iron tables, lamplight and whiskies galore.

name: Swan with Two Necks
description:
City: Pendleton
description: A slightly twee country inn with comfortable seating and rustic decor. A working fire helps of course. Excellent reviews and award winning. (Added 2020)

name: The Bell Inn, Aldworth
description:
City: Aldworth
description: Beautiful unspoilt country pub that hasn't gone too beige to appeal to diners. Some nice retro signage and mid-brown wood fittings with a low ceiling make it look pretty cosy. We would like to visit!

name: The George & Dragon
description:
City: Hudswell
description: Perpetual CAMRA chart-topping pub, an early community-owned venture with an established reputation for the back-to-basics first principles of how to run unpretentious pubs.

name: U Krajčů
description:
City: Pozlovice
description: A true village pub with pajzl (dive) type elements as well as rustic community elements.

name: The Drovers Rest
description:
City: Monkhill
description: Given the location, this looks to have a great beer selection, roaring fire and lots of other homely country inn features. The bar area is small but with a characterful cluttered collection of items pinned to the ceiling. Whoever put THAT thing above the bar deserves sending back to school.

name: The Hope
description:
City: Carshalton
description: A frankly fantastic looking community owned pub. Red leather, cosy carpets, exposed beams. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: The Kings Head
description:
City: Bonsall
description: A slightly gentrified but still tasteful and rustic country in which looks comfy and warm, without too much emphasis on dining.

name: Barley Mow Ltd
description:
City: Bonsall
description: Cluttered and characterful pub with character. Some of the decor is downright awful (chicken patterns anyone?), but overall it seems to be terrific. A potential 9 or 10?

name: Fishermans Arms
description:
City: Hartlepool
description: A very atmospheric looking coastal boozer with live music performances, nautical theme and cosy surroundings. Highly rated online.

name: De Karper
description:
City: Ghent
description: Corner bar with some modernisation, but still looking characterful.

name: Victoria Inn
description:
City: Rugby
description: A beautiful preserved little corner pub with cosy decor in 'flat iron' type building on the corner.

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Portishead
description: A throwback 1970s era pub with a notoriously brusque landlord Vic. Cash only. But it does look charming in its own way.

name: Restaurace Chata Tesák
description:
City: Rajnochovice
description: Country pub with decor throwing back to the socialist era. A bit of a timewarp, but fondly thought of.

name: The White Hart
description:
City: Shifnal
description: Wooden beams and mock tudor appearance, it's a traditional pub with low ceiling, and looks a cosy choice.

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Brierley Hill
description: Enticing looking neighbourhood boozer with leather upholster seats, dartboard and friendly communal appearance. AKA The Bull & Bladder

name: Sandbrook Vaults
description:
City: Market Drayton
description: Old fashioned pub with nice wood panels and vaulted beams in a mock tudor building. Some live music events and a fairly neighbourly look despite the central location.

name: Salopian Star
description:
City: Market Drayton
description: Market town pub with old fashioned furniture and a cosy feel. Unsure quite what to make of it but seems like it would have potential.

name: Old market inn
description:
City: Douglas
description: Cosy coastal pub with an intimate atmosphere. Looks really good.

name: The Harp Inn
description:
City: Neston
description: Fringe of the countryside with a hint of the neighbourhood about it. Old fashioned homely looking inn with a local crowd. Especially the simple unreconstructed bar area.

name: Park Inn
description:
City: Mumbles
description: Cosy neighbourhood pub with light wood fittings, some bric a brac and live music

name: The Red Lion Inn, Penderyn
description:
City: Penderyn
description: While some of the furniture is bland, there are some characterful elements such as exposed brick, wood panels and beams. Looks a bit of a hybrid but surely worth a look.

name: The Goose & Cuckoo Inn
description:
City: Abergavenny
description: Looks like a lovely pub, ungentrified and homely, unspoilt, cosy and lots of those things a country pub ought to be.

name: The Eagles Inn
description:
City: Bala
description: Looks like a true throwback! Ungentrified and unpretentious country pub with a local crowd.

name: The Royal Oak Inn
description:
City: Rhandirmwyn
description: A lovely country inn with a dark wooden appearance, particularly at the bar area, in stark contrast to the rooms it offers upstairs.

name: Brynffynon Hotel
description:
City: Llanwonno
description: Details thin on the ground but this stone house with 70s arcade signage casts a striking figure, and the reviews tell of a rustic country experience inside.

name: Tafarn Jem
description:
City: Lampeter
description: A ...gem of a pub according to all and sundry. Old fashioned country inn with long standing owners.

name: Cwmdu Inn
description:
City: Cwmdu
description: A really down to earth looking pub with no airs and graces. Small club style bar hatch, simple seats and old fireplace.

name: Roast Ox Inn
description:
City: Builth Wells
description: Looks set up for food, but nevertheless characterful low ceilinged pub in a historic building, with a country appeal.

name: Literatka
description:
City: Wroclaw
description: Bookish cafe pub with atmospheric smoking section. Reportedly still the traditional casual meeting place for artists, politicians and so forth.

name: Salvador
description:
City: Wroclaw
description: A longer standing alternative bar with 'upside down' furniture and plenty of people remarking on the decor. Could be interesting.

name: Golden Lion
description:
City: Lancaster
description: Enticing looking trad pub with small old fashioned tables and cushioned stools. Some live music by the look of it.

name: Priory Arms
description:
City: London
description: Neighbourhood local with attractive exterior and belgian beer ephemera. Slightly plain when empty, which would be the only concern. Has potential.

name: The Railway Inn
description:
City: Upper Killay
description: A potential 9/10 or higher? Small cosy wooden interior stuff with decoration. Ungentrified with local character and folk nights. Looks fantastic.

name: The Old Friends Inn
description:
City: Ulverston
description: Highly popular pub with some home beers. Frequently described as a 'proper' pub with comments on great value drinks. Looks like a good all-rounder too.

name: Cutlers Arms
description:
City: Rotherham
description: Something of value in Rotherham? It looks like it. This beautifully wooden-fittings traditional town boozer has attractive decor, a cosy feel and some up to date beer options.

name: The Shinnon
description:
City: North Wingfield
description: An isolated neighbourhood local well reviewed for its interior, live music and community character.

name: Crown Inn
description:
City: Beeston
description: A well-known local pub that is a strong all-rounder. While it didn't knock our socks off, there is little to dislike. Good range of drinks, nice enough decor and cosy interior, along with some effort put into the beer garden. Worth another try.

name: The Surtees Arms
description:
City: Ferryhill
description: Microbrewery and friendly local in one, this looks every inch the community boozer. Extremely well rated.

name: The St Mabyn Inn
description:
City: St Mabyn
description: A slightly eclectic pub lurching from contemporary touches to very nostalgic ones in an old stone house. Looks curious enough to be worth a try.

name: The Dolly Peel
description:
City: South Shields
description: Local seaside boozer with plenty of the character you'd expect from that. Generally unvarnished looking. Could be good...

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Shaftesbury
description: A pleasingly ancient looking boozer in a stone house. Looks pretty good!

name: The Bricklayer’s Arms
description:
City: London
description: A pub from 1826 with some late Victoria features and not ruined by gentrification or pubco nonsense yet. Looks reasonably good with a distinctive ceiling.

name: The Virgin Queen
description:
City: London
description: An attractive wooden bar and shady wood panelled interior seem to create some good atmosphere in among the unwelcome clattering of fish and chips plates. Remains to be seen if it will qualify, but worth a look.

name: Hemingford Arms
description:
City: London
description: Famous for hanging baskets and a highly eclectic interior. Distinctive, nonetheless there's a hint of the middle class about it. We are prepared to give it a try.

name: Restaurace "Zelená"
description:
City: Rusava
description: A classic village Czech boozer with decor not updated for god knows how long

name: The Olde Sun
description:
City: Nether Hayford
description: Beautiful old house with low beams, a fire and distinctive selection of decorative plates. Looks cosy. Potentially overly foody, we will see...

name: Panda & Sons
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Cocktail bar with a pub style layout, cosy looking with lounge seats, strikes a halfway house. It didn't quite do enough to persuade us on our visit. Low ceilings and towny, but the drinks are good, service is very attentive (as it should be for the price) and the concept is relatively fun. (Added February 2024)

name: The French House
description:
City: London
description: Famous Soho pub focused on wine, with only half pint measures of beer, and a no-tech policy. Long literary (ie. boozy) history.

name: Chequers Inn
description:
City: Doddington
description: A country pub that hasn't yet decided to turn into a middle aged persons dining room. Quaint and genteel, perhaps, but with the beams and age of the building plenty of character remains. It looks like it wouldn't throw you out if you just ordered beer.

name: Montefiore Arms
description:
City: Ramsgate
description: Cosy community boozer with simple decor, and straight forward approach.

name: Blood Bay
description:
City: Ludlow
description: Cool name, and a conscious throwback to the old ale houses of the past. Everything's banned, you suspect, except talking and drinking. It looks like a one-off though.

name: Spotted Cow
description:
City: Holbrook
description: Perhaps a little too open-plan and food focused. Wooden beams and struts, exposed brick and rustic furniture provide the character. It looks like it has a little something, so may be worth a try.

name: Valentin - Curious Bierkneipe
description:
City: Volos
description: A smartly designed pub restaurant with dark wood, plenty of space to just drink, and high quality European beers.

name: The Dog Inn
description:
City: Whalley
description: A traditional drink-first boozer with cushioned bench seats. Refurbed rather than old, there is still a little something to the place that makes it look appealing. Well reviewed.

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Pamphill
description: A country pub with a lovely garden and distinctive interior decor, with a flamboyant touch. Looks different and yet also cosy and familiar, making it appealling.

name: Pils Doktor
description:
City: Munich
description: Popular local kneipe where schnapps is delivered with a toy train. Everything else is wooden and trad.

name: Ungewitter
description:
City: Munich
description: Owners in their 70s, this longstanding 'Boazn' is a slice of old Munich life. A Pilsbar with a distinctive 3 sided bar decorated with framed artwork and photos. Looks interesting. Service may be a little on the salty side.

name: Bierschuppen
description:
City: Munich
description: One of the famous 'boazn' Muncih is known for. Small wood panelled interior. Looks really nice. (Added February 2025)

name: Zur Gruam
description:
City: Munich
description: Quirky little pub by the tracks. Interesting design and down to earth. Slightly punky/bookish.

name: Bahnwärter Thiel
description:
City: Munich
description: Club-cultural venue with free entry before 9pm. Bohemian ruin-bar type hangout spot. Interesting decor and very well reviewed.

name: Cafe Schau ma moi
description:
City: Munich
description: One of Munich's famous and disappearring 'boazn'

name: Schrott
description:
City: Brno
description: Steampunk/micro-brewery with a different feel to sum. Not totally craft-generic or hospoda-generic. Distinctive, looks to be well reviewed.

name: Restaurace U Průmyslovky
description:
City: Brno
description: A pub from 'Old Brno', if you like. From the 1980s and on into the past. Austrian-era decor on the ceiling. A simple no-nonsense interior. No airs and graces. Cheap. One for rubbernecking. 'Fourth grade'. Featured on Czech TV program 'Tales of Old Pubs'. We have been twice but not yet convinced it deserves an inclusion.

name: Blues Bar Garch
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Basement cellar pub with a down-n-dirty blues rock theme. Reportedly good value with decent atmosphere.

name: Gaststätte Schnerpfl
description:
City: Pegnitz
description: The bar in Pegnitz, extraordinarily well reviewed for service and atmosphere. Seems to be reasonably cosy decor too. In Franconia it's a dead cert there will be good beer, pictures show a dark, candlelit interior with chunky wood fittings. (Added 2021)

name: LEIKA, baras, UAB ONI GRUPĖ
description:
City: Klaipeda
description: Down to earth bar with a lived-in appearance, memorabilia and eclectric decor, red paint. Well reviewed.

name: Royal Oak Inn
description:
City: Dacre Banks
description: This village has been the starting point for many walks and the car park faces this pub. It looks like a decent country pub with an attractive dark wood bar and simple rustic seating, doing the genre justice by the look of it. We look forward to visiting.

name: Trappentreustüberl
description:
City: Munich
description: Cosy looking lived-in pub with distinctive decor and plenty of amenities. Generally well reviewed and on the 'boazn' list.

name: Ubier Schänke
description:
City: Cologne
description: Beautiful trad boozer with stained glass and wooden interior. Some live music events. Generally well regarded. Stays open late (3am)

name: Jadrošova Krčma
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Backstreet pub with a very good list of beer on rotation from Jadrnicek pivovar, a de facto taproom for the village brewery west of Olomouc. Unpromising exterior but inside safe and friendly.  Cosy ruralist decor of pine wood and greens. On our visit in November 2023 we didn't see it at its busiest that may have firmed up the recommendation to a full inscription, but enjoyed it and will keep the recommendation live. (Added November 2023)

name: Hospoda U Beníšků
description:
City: Melnik
description: An old time classic Czech hospoda by the look of it, but with some personal touches on the walls and ceilings. Set up for drinking and good reviews concerning the standard of the Pilsner Urquell.

name: Zum Freischütz
description:
City: Schwerin
description: Nicely brown, old and candle-lit. This is a well reviewed venue with a mixed crowd. Looks good.

name: White Star
description:
City: Liverpool
description: Cosy Victorian pub with leather seats, many a framed photo and lamp lights. Very central and despite a couple of visits we haven't quite been convinced yet, there is a trashiness that let's it down.

name: The George Inn
description:
City: Norton St Philip
description: Impressive stone house, with magnifient bar area and cellar like surrounds in some side rooms. Looks like a decent country inn that still retains some space for drinking.

name: Union Vaults
description:
City: Chester
description: A reported classic corner community local. Bar billiards and darts, old school atmosphere.

name: Fendstüberl
description:
City: Munich
description: A reported classic boazn, their term for a trad boozer.

name: Graf Arco Stub'n
description:
City: Munich
description: Well reviewed 'boazn', an old time boozer with dark wood panelled bar. On our first visit we loved the gloam, the friendly service and the hazy vaporwave experience but it didn't do quite enough to reach the threshold. Maybe give it another try! They do free crisps too (added August 2023)

name: The Three Greyhounds Inn
description:
City: Great Asby
description: Country inn with a more toned-down and lived-in pub feel. Looks like a very decent spot. Terrifically well reviewed.

name: Scotch Piper Inn
description:
City: Lydiate
description: A pub that has an interior that suits the thatched building outside. Cosy with nooks and crannies. Very well reviewed and at a glance you can see why.

name: Luppitt Inn
description:
City: Honiton
description: Very little information, we hope the place is still open! A historic pub of national importance, unspoilt farmhouse. Go before it vanishes.

name: Tap and Spile
description:
City: Pity Me
description: Looks like a classic boozer with some Durham community to it as well.  Folk music, etc. Highly reviewed.

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: Salford
description: An elderly community pub with a cult following. Information is scattered but it seems to have plenty of character and looks to be lived-in.

name: Traditionsgaststätte "Bei d'r Tant
description:
City: Cologne
description: A simple looking gaststatte with a local following. Space for drink and food. The bar area looks reasonably pubby too.

name: The Alma Pub Islington
description:
City: London
description: An airy but down to earth and lived-in pub with maori artworks and a non 'city' feel.

name: Kavarnica Rokaj
description:
City: Maribor
description: A riverside bar with an extensive drinks menu. The decor seems down to earth, lived in and characterful enough. A local favourite, seemingly.

name: Bierbaron Bierspezialitäten
description:
City: Graz
description: One of Graz's bautsatzlokale, rustic pubs with cheaper fare aimed at a younger crowd.

name: Restaurace Nádraží Jedlová
description:
City: Jiretin pod Jedlovou
description: Your classic train station pub, by the looks of things. Lovely genteel pre-iron curtain appearance, lived in with personal touches. Well reviewed.

name: Black Lion
description:
City: Leighton Buzzard
description: From what can be seen, this is a local treasure. Expansive drinks menu and a mixture of old and new stylings. Some old fashioned panels and insets give the place a characterful look. Very well reviewed.

name: St Johns Hotel
description:
City: Hull
description: A 'hotel' pub, down to earth decor, with a good rep for real-ale. Seems to be home to a few 'characters' without being overly rough, though that rather depends on your point of view.

name: Donald's pub
description:
City: Angers
description: Small atmospheric looking beer bar in the historic centre. Medieval signage, perhaps a little more modern inside, but still following a rustic wooden theme. Looks like it has potential.

name: The Aliane, Café Boutiquo-Games
description:
City: Colmar
description: Board games and brews - hipsterism arrives in the Alsace. Still, it's well reviewed and worth a look

name: DEER AND BEER
description:
City: Colmar
description: Info thin on the ground, but a beer focus bar by the canal, exceptionally well reviewed. The Deer is a reference to Jagermeister, which is less of a draw, to be honest. Worth a look.

name: CHECKPOINT
description:
City: Colmar
description: Videogames bar, very well reviewed. Worth a look given it's so far outside the norm for a town like this.

name: Bar Saint Ulrich
description:
City: Ribeauville
description: Very nice looking old wooden bar with a hybrid of French tavern/Belgian cafe dynamics. Hops on the ceiling which is more redolent of Czech and German places. No doubt beer is the focus here.

name: T Kabouterke
description:
City: Eeklo
description: Seems to be the best brown cafe in town. Nostalgic reviews and a cast of regulars. Looks reasonably trad from the limited info we can find.

name: Café Meng
description:
City: Genk
description: One of the last brown cafes in Genk. Looks legit with some worn out wooden fittings and attracting a mixed crowd in the manner you'd expect.

name: Café Sonja
description:
City: Genk
description: One of the disappearring Belgian brown cafes still run by a lady of advanced years in a suburban location. Looks authentic and as such it should be visited as often as possible.

name: 't Kont van het Paard
description:
City: Brielle
description: A pub in an old stables, one of the eldest buildings in the town. A step back in time venue, which aims to be an brown eetcafe, ie they rely on food to prop up the pub. All the same, the beer selection looks excellent, they do different community events and it's very well reviewed.

name: Tapperij 't Sloepje
description:
City: Zierikzee
description: A small rustic brown cafe with a simple format.

name: Nu 't Moment
description:
City: Sommelsdijk
description: Amazing looking dark wood shady boozer with the usual nautical bric a brac on the walls. A must visit for the area.

name: La Pompe Benoit
description:
City: Mons
description: One of very few interesting looking venues in Mons. A narrow 'classical' look to this belgian bar which makes use of all the merchandise and ephemera in a stylish fashion.

name: Het Zevende Zegel
description:
City: Ottenburg
description: What a pub to be out in the middle of nowhere like this! Barn type event space which has been lavishly decorated and appears to be very cosy for bar drinking. The reviews are uniformly positive.

name: Velvet
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Possibly too twee and cafe-like but the effort put into the decor and availability of alcoholic drinks make this interesting, we shall see

name: Kulturni centar Mesnička (Mesnicka Cultural Center)
description:
City: Zagreb
description: A music venue/bar with an antiquey appearance and near uniformly well review. Looks like one of the top options in the city. Jam sessions on Mondays.

name: Tolkien's House
description:
City: Zagreb
description: EDIT - CURRENTLY CLOSED
Looks like it just treads the line between gimmickry and functionality. Certainly lived in, cosy looking and atmospheric. The public appear to approve.

name: Veliki Tolk
description:
City: Zagreb
description: An extension of Tolkein's House next door. More space, still well reviewed.

name: Carpe Diem
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Looks like a solid all-rounder option with a pretty extensive beer menu

name: Caffe bar "Legend Riders"
description:
City: Zagreb
description: We try to give the Caffe Bars a chance but so many are so bland. This one at least has a distinct theme. Rock music and biking. Fairly extensive drinks selection too.

name: Vintage Industrial Bar
description:
City: Zagreb
description: An attempt at a ruin bar, perhaps not spontaneous enough in design, but nevertheless spacious and atmospheric looking.

name: Hendrick's garden
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Already a cult venue, this twee wonderworld focuses on the outdoor attractions with a treehouse, hedges and plenty to explore. Looks very distinct.

name: Sunshine Inn
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Caffe Bar, for sure, but this one has an integral 1960s design, darts and pool, and overall v highly rated for a neighbourhood type pub of this kind.

name: Mátra Borozó
description:
City: Budapest
description: All information indicates this is an old-school wine bar, a throwback to the past. Simple, homely and affordable. Unchanged despite the chaos around it. Wonderfully well reviewed - who would have though it? Beer also available

name: Möve im Felsenkeller
description:
City: Berlin
description: Venerable and cool-looking little pub, the kind Germans like to call Laden (or shop), some nice original features.

name: Libo Café
description:
City: Malaga
description: A cafe in an extraordinary baroque venue.

name: The Magazine Hotel
description:
City: Wallasey
description: An atmospheric-looking coastal hotel-pub with some trad features, cosy surroundings and occasional live music performances. Down to earth, don't expect anything flash.

name: Trädgården
description:
City: Stockholm
description: Ruin-bar/clutterful designed club/party venue.

name: O'Connors Bar
description:
City: Thornton Cleveleys
description: A cult venue, down to earth and ungentrified. Office-type panels by the ceiling, cheap but lived-in cosiness. Not for the faint hearted by the sounds of it, but a bit of a one-off.

name: The Whitestone Inn
description:
City: Ballasalla
description: A typical market place pub with a low ceiling and village life.

name: The Grey Bull
description:
City: Stanhope
description: An unspoilt simple country boozer with plenty of room for drinking only. Looks very nice in its simple way.

name: The Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: St John's Chapel
description: Pleasant looking country pub in a stone cottage.

name: The Wainwright Pub
description:
City: Keswick
description: Cosy and lived in pub with wooden beams, pump clips and beer mats everywhere.

name: George & Dragon
description:
City: Lichfield
description: Traditional high street pub with cosy bench seating around the bar. Characterful brick exterior and beams in side rooms. Attractive looking beer garden.

name: Bitter-Suite Micropub
description:
City: Lichfield
description: High street micropub. Down to earth homely interior with some old fashioned pub games.

name: The Ashton
description:
City: Helensburgh
description: High street real ale venue with a local crowd.

name: Zoiglstubn beim Brucksaler
description:
City: Neustadt
description: Part of the fine tradition of zoiglstubn where a communal brewhouse is shared and a family restaurant opens on rotation. A more bland setup than some on our 2023 visit, though the beer itself is interesting, as is the community surrounding this tradition. Hospitality is friendly and welcoming. (updated August 2023)

name: Zoiglwirtschaft Zum Waldhauser
description:
City: Neustadt
description: Part of the fine tradition of zoiglstubn. Visit as soon as you can.

name: Zoiglstubn zum Mundl
description:
City: Stornstein
description: Part of the fine tradition of zoiglstubn. Visit as soon as you can. Check to see if it's open before travelling here.

name: Old Doctor Butler's Head
description:
City: London
description: Plenty of old wood and historical appeal at this boozer in the banking district run by Shepherd Neame.

name: Caniço
description:
City: Alvor
description: A one off. Its terrace has a unique view looking out onto the bay. Very popular and of course in fairly high demand.

name: Old Swan Inn
description:
City: Netherton
description: AKA 'Ma Pardoes'. A town pub that hasn't had its layout gutted to become open plan and characterless. Cosy siderooms with studded leather bench seats. The wallpaper and paintjob is a little tacky but overall the pub retains its necessary character.

name: Na staré kovárně
description:
City: Prague
description: A new venture by a local music group, it's a cafe bar with a bit of extra attitude and more contemporary beer options.

name: Vagabund Brauerei
description:
City: Berlin
description: A contemporary brewery tap but that's also a neighbourhood local. Modern but seemingly done well. Exceptionally well reviewed.

name: Na Kovárně
description:
City: Velhartice
description: Rustic country inn that looks part workshop as well as pub. Concessions to progress are kept to a minimum and there's clear a dash of local character too. The beer options look excellent and cheap.

name: The Prince Of Wales
description:
City: Stow Maries

description: A pub that's clearly also the heart of the community. Community takes precedence as can be seen from everything above it. Loved and lived in, without being spectacular.

name: Fat Cat Ipswich
description:
City: Ipswich
description: Down to earth welcoming boozer with a conservatory at the back and characterful (if poorly decorated) bar area. Very popular and with good reason, seemingly.

name: Dove Street Inn Ipswich
description:
City: Ipswich
description: Another corner boozer/micropub that may not have the historical appeal or furnishings to set a tone as a proper pub, but does have the drinks and community around it. Looks good.

name: The Odd One Out
description:
City: Colchester
description: A terrific looking free-house in beautiful brick building. A community hub and almost frozen in time feel. Looks very cosy and highly likely to score well with us.

name: New Inn
description:
City: Colchester
description: Another characterful looking community pub with a deliberately ramshackle but homely appearance, real ales and extensive whisky selection.

name: The Compasses
description:
City: Littley Green

description: Fantastic country pub with a real traditional tavern feel, through its tiled floor and wooden bar area. Looks excellent.

name: Brewery Tap Sudbury
description:
City: Sudbury
description: While there are some bland design choices, quirks such as historic pub games and of course the brewery tap make it look like a solid community-boozer.

name: The Station Arms
description:
City: Southminster
description: A well kept 'station pub' with a lively community feel. Local but friendly looking. Excellent reviews.

name: King William IV
description:
City: Braintree
description: Lively looking community pub with large beer garden.

name: The Carpenters Arms
description:
City: Maldon
description: German beer and cider abound in this genteel sizeable pub. Looks lovely.

name: Farmers Yard
description:
City: Maldon

description: Micro and bottle shop with attractive wooden bench seats and panels. Exactly what you are looking for from this type of thing.

name: The Boars Head
description:
City: Stockport
description: Sam Smiths pub decorated in traditional style. We gave it a go in 2022, perhaps needs a further visit to decide. (Added July 2021)

name: Zum Dürnbräu
description:
City: Munich
description: Expensive but characterful looking beer hall on the site of a historic - but defunct - brewery. On our first visit it was too quiet to reach a real impression, but looked to have some potential for winter.

name: Tap-House
description:
City: Munich
description: 40 taps, you will not go wrong in the task of finding a beer you'd like to drink. We have visited but aren't sure this place deserves inclusion. Decor is bland and the seating options (all stools) make it less relaxed than it ought to be. There are positives though, so it's on the fringes for now.

name: Gasthaus Neue Welt "Aris"
description:
City: Nordlingen
description: A distinctive pub with wooden beams, low ceilings and white tiles. Very down to earth with scarves of local football teams and a youngish crowd interested in a beer and a chat. Games are available too, along with Sky sports, so it really is a drinking kneipe primarily. We felt it just didn't quite have enough overall to stand out as worthy of inclusion, but keep it here as a tentative recommendation.

name: Dideldum Pilsbar
description:
City: Rothenburg ob der Tauber

description: Despite 2 visits I haven't quite seen fit to add this to the guide. There is a lot to like. The Italian owner has the place running to a tee. She is friendly and her daughter helps in the evenings. The interior is plush and very distinctly un-Germanic, though it is also very clearly a pub and bar too. The place is a little bit of a throwback, and due to the lack of other options in town it tends to be very popular with youngsters. We can tentatively recommend.

name: The Raven
description:
City: Bath
description: Reasonably characterful old pub, well reviewed, decor a bit on the bland Laura Ashley side but furniture looks quite traditional.

name: The Bell Inn
description:
City: Bath
description: Live music in a friendly down-to-earth setting, by Bath standards of course. Looks good and is well reviewed.

name: Pivnice U Čiháků
description:
City: Podebrady
description: Looks like an absolutely excellent pivnice with great beer selection and characterful enough interior. The reviews speak highly of it too.

name: Bei Tina
description:
City: Munich
description: One of Munich's 'boazn', small pubs normally run by women of the house, dying out around the city.

name: Saddle Inn
description:
City: Douglas
description: Excellent quayside boozer with darts + pool. Looks to be down to earth and authentic as an alehouse.

name: Bulls Head
description:
City: West Clandon

description: A down to earth boozer with an attractive beer garden. Looks local and characterful enough with a distinctive bar area.

name: The Jolly Farmer
description:
City: Bramley
description: A barn-like pub strewn with beer mat and jug decorations on the walls and ceilings. Looks to have gone the extra mile to be distinctive, and is well reviewed.

name: Cafè Bar Catalunya
description:
City: Sant Cugat del Valles

description: Certain problems with service and price aside, the venue is a piece of history both in the decor and format, so can't be missed if in the area.

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Wincle
description: A real fire, wooden beams and thick carpets at this country pub. Gentrified a little and food-focused but still with some inn character.

name: The Lord Eldon
description:
City: Knutsford
description: Superb looking interior with black beams, brass decorations and characterful bar area. a real pub by the look of it.

name: The Star Inn
description:
City: St Just

description: Thoroughly cornish pub which looks homely and down to earth, distinctive with it.

name: The Guide Dog
description:
City: Southampton
description: Well reviewed community pub with a down to earth neighbourly feel. One for simple virtues rather than anything flashy, by the look of it. Nothing wrong with that.

name: Hostinec U Libuše
description:
City: Zakolany
description: Looks to be an excellently kept hospoda. Mid-brown wood-fit walls in the classic fashion, some homely decor and games. Looks versatile without being bland.

UPDATE - Looks like very little information since 2023 - could now be closed down

name: The Dysart Arms
description:
City: Bunbury
description: 19th century pub with oak beams and homely furnishings, bookcases and rugs. Fairly neat and tidy, there is still a hint of the open-plan bland dining pub but it nevertheless looks like a good venue.

name: The Ye Olde Rose & Crown
description:
City: Stafford
description: Joules pub with a nice distinctive character, not in the normal mould, not wildly out but still of its own thing. Wooden beams, fire, folk music nights.

name: The Arden Arms
description:
City: Stockport
description: Fine interior with parquet floor and red upholstered bench seating in traditional fashion. Robinsons place, popular spot. However, on our visit it was far too foodie and didn't feel like as welcoming place to go for a drink as it ought to have. We remain on the fence. (Added July 2021)

name: The Barley Mow Inn
description:
City: Kirk Ireton
description: Very distinctive country pub that hasn't done a bland cookie cutter template. Plenty of character in the layout and arrangement. Strong identity, and well reviewed.

name: The Royal Oak Laxfield
description:
City: Laxfield
description: Large timberframe building in the style of a coaching inn. Very much a village pub these days with large beer garden, meals, function rooms etc. The reviews tell of a quirky venue with good atmosphere and genial hosts.

name: The Kings Head (The Low House)
description:
City: Laxfield
description: Information about the pub rooms are thin on the ground, but this thatched cottage pub is well reviewed and all reason to believe there is a characterful, homely interior inside.

name: John Harvey Tavern
description:
City: Lewes
description: Tentative inclusion. While aspects do look cosy and nicely wooden and characterful, there is a bit of 00s grey paint and standardised decor in places. The proximity to Harveys brewery and reliability of a good pint may prop this  one up.

name: Colvile Arms
description:
City: Lullington
description: While a little genteel, there are some authentic characterful pub features in this village inn, could be worth dropping by. Very well reviewed and on CAMRA's national inventory of interiors.

name: Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: Newbiggin
description: Beautiful Dales cottage inn based in a remote hamlet. While of course surviving on food, this inn appears to have plenty of traditional character with tarred exposed beams, horse brasses, a fireplace and homely decor. Very well reviewed.

name: Hyltn
description:
City: Oldris
description: A supposedly legendary operation with an original innkeeper. Looks like a typical functional out-in-the-sticks boozer, which is brought to life by its locals as opposed to its decor.

name: Roubenka Borová
description:
City: Borova
description: Attractive wooden cottage with typically rustic country decor in the courtyard and a cosy looks interior. Looks fine for both drinking and eating.

name: The Thorn Tree Inn
description:
City: Matlock
description: While under Greene King's control anything to do with this pub must have a pinch of salt taken with it. Nevertheless, with commanding views of the valley from the beer garden and an attractively cosy and compact interior, perhaps not even the awful GK can blandardise this one.

name: St Radegund Pub
description:
City: Cambridge
description: A tiny pub in traditional style (wooden, benches, etc) dedicated to Cambridge's rowers. Looks pretty good.

name: Barnabeer
description:
City: Namur
description: Popular beer mecca. Exposed brick, old beer signage, and stylish stucco ceiling designs, among other features. It looks like it will be a reliable all-rounder than love at first sight.

name: George Hotel, Youlgreave
description:
City: Youlgreave
description: A very much independent feel to this pub, fewer concessions to the corporate standardised norm. Everything is a little ad hoc, and probably for the better.

name: The Railwayman's Arms
description:
City: Bridgnorth
description: Wonderful station pub, decorated like the inside of a Pullman carriage, but even more amplified, it looks cosy and friendly. Very well reviewed.

name: The Victory Inn
description:
City: Staplefield
description: Attractive country inn with a genteel rustic decor inside, not cookie-cutter by any means (although the food looks rather generic). Even so, great reviews of the place.

name: Horní Újezd - Obecní Úřad
description:
City: Horni Ujezd

description: One of the fast vanishing municipal pubs, commonly owned and as simple and stripped back as that suggests. There to keep the community together.

name: The Pestle & Mortar
description:
City: Hinckley
description: Ad hoc decor, a mish-mash, a bit like a middle aged person trying to create a craft venue on the cheap, but with clearly a lot of community value and a great range of beer.

name: Crown & Kettle
description:
City: Manchester
description: Craft beers in a setting with impressive gothic interior decor and ceiling. The pub itself appears awkwardly fitted around it, but the appearance is distinctive enough to be very worth a look.

name: The Land Of Liberty, Peace & Plenty
description:
City: Heronsgate
description: Nice to see a drinks focused pub in a village, this one has an octagonal central bar with simple bench seats and horse brasses decor. Plenty of cask ales to choose from.

name: The Ypres Castle Inn
description:
City: Rye
description: A simple minimalist format works quite well here given the unusual setting and the tasteful choices of furniture and decor. Big beer garden and interesting beer choices from Germany.

name: The Turks Head Inn
description:
City: Gloucester
description: Typical micropub in appearance. Everything a tad off centre and ramshackle in a characterful way. Typically spartan when it comes to rules, so no phones allowed inside. UPDATE DECEMBER 2022 - May be moving location and closed for renovations.

name: Live & Let Live
description:
City: Cambridge
description: Lively free house, beautiful wooden decor. Local ales. It looks terrific.

name: Telford's Warehouse
description:
City: Chester
description: A large dockside venue recommended for its drinks and live music events. We didn't get the best of it last time but it remains on the recommended list from the back of the great reviews.

name: The Cavern of the Curious Gnome
description:
City: Chester
description: Reopened since covid, a fantasy-world take on a Belgian beer bar set in Chester's famous rows. Great reviews and we can't wait to go. (Added March 2023)

name: Die Wampe
description:
City: Spandau
description: Looks like the best bar in Spandau, certainly with a vampy, rock-bar aesthetic. A cool hang-out spot for playing card, pool etc and enjoying music.

name: The Red Lion
description:
City: Bromley
description: A very well reviewed 'old man pub' (is that what we're calling trad pubs now? Hope not). Proper pub, perhaps? Yes. A proper pub. Down to earth, lived in, not just a chain.

name: Foords
description:
City: Filey
description: Well known locally. Clearly not everyone's cup of tea, but if you like old, gnarled cosy pubs, this one looks like it should appeal.

name: The Nag's Head
description:
City: Malvern
description: A well-kept yet relatively unspoilt and ungentrified pub, give or take a few design choices. Simple wooden tables, carpeted, wooden beams and low ceiling. Great reviews.

name: Dun Cow
description:
City: Seaton
description: Other than glowing reviews, information is a little thin on the appearance of the interior. All reviews tell of a traditional and unspoilt north eastern boozer, no airs and graces.

name: Star & Garter Pub
description:
City: Bromley
description: An impressively ornate frontage gives way to an airier interior and large bar area with an array of cask and keg beer options. The decor is tasteful, in keeping with some of the original fitting without being dramatic. It looks like it might be viable for the guide, we'll see.

name: Foersters Feine Bier
description:
City: Berlin
description: A bar specialising in very high quality small batch traditional German brewing from Franconia and elsewhere. A bar stacked with steinkrugs on the shelves and pleasant retro signage and rustic wooden seating is also very clearly quite modern and clean, so while I doesn't have true gnarly rustic appeal it looks well worth a visit nonetheless.

name: Eckkneipe
description:
City: Berlin
description: A classic Schultheiss, red hoarding, corner neighbourhood Berlin pub, probably one of the most typical examples, and therefore well worth a visit to sample true Berlin pub culture. Very well reviewed.

name: Zum Goldenen Hahn
description:
City: Berlin
description: Notorious smokey kneipe for punks and crusties. Kind service and the sort of raw, almost unchanged atmosphere that's worth sample. If there was a nuclear strike you'd probably be able to come here to find everyone still alive, sucking on cancer sticks and downing the cheap, if awful Schultheiss. A sociological experience, if nothing else. Clearly not one that will appeal to many, but one that will definitely strongly appeal to some.

name: Settle Inn
description:
City: Stirling
description: Looks like a fab boozer with stone walls, curved ceiling and alehouse type options. If they can keep it homely and not tacky they're on to a winner.

name: Zum Schiffchen
description:
City: Koblenz
description: The evening kneipe in Koblenz. Still looks to have plenty of atmosphere and local life. Excellent reviews.

name: Im Rondellchen
description:
City: Cologne
description: Round, yes indeed, this is a circular pub and so quite an unusual, if still trad interior. You'll find this one is still an ungentrified popular evening pub serving Gaffel kolsch. Looks pretty good.

name: Früh Em Jan von Werth
description:
City: Cologne
description: We passed this several times without going in, but from our research it seems this is a local's pub, and a strong all-rounder rather than just a beer hall. A few amenities, corners for socialising and so on, and seems welcoming too, heads will not turn if you walk in here.

name: Im Tubak
description:
City: Konigswinter
description: While other pubs sadly appear boarded up in this one-horse tourist town, Im Tubak seems to be the last trad pub, or indeed pub of any real kind standing. Seems to be by locals, for locals, but not unwelcoming.

name: Kneipchen Nr.7
description:
City: Wernigerode
description: Although we didn't make it here, this pub looks like a similarly viable option to Tommis. An evening kneipe with local life, authenticity and a bit of something extra for cosiness and identity.

name: Gittis Bier-Bar
description:
City: Berlin
description: This quaint, personalised old kneipe is just the sort of thing we are looking for, a slice of local life that seems cosy and authentic. Evidently popular with a range of people.

name: Fussballkneipe Elfmeter
description:
City: Halle
description: Stuffed with sporting memorabilia and trinkets, this pub may not appeal to some but may strongly appeal to others. Looks authentic and a slice of local life. Decor looks reasonably good even without the football theme and all signs point to a popular pub with a strong identity.

name: Café Brohmers
description:
City: Halle
description: Brooding pub cafe with some nice Deco styling, known for live music performances on a small theatre-like stage.

name: The Wee Howff
description:
City: Paisley
description: A small cosy haunt with a nice layout and wooden fixtures. A few bland interior design choices but it does look overall like a superior venue, despite the wannabe Laura Ashley who bought the cushions and wallpaper.

name: Hodpoda U Jezzu
description:
City: Roztoky
description: A quite beautiful riverside setting lends this rustic pub a natural advantage already. However, with a nicely placed beer garden, and lodge style interior this is a very clearly superior effort for Czechia. Local beer and Bernard's offerings compliment an overall outstanding venue.

name: Guduls cafe Moorsel / De Zwette Zoal
description:
City: Moorsel
description: Moorsel's premier brown cafe/volkscafé.  A legit brown, preserved lived in interior that should be a national monument but we will probably find has been bulldozed, turned into a hair salon or just left empty any day now.

name: Café Stinne
description:
City: Asse-ter-heide
description: A wonderful country pub with a homely interior, some longstanding features, lived-in character and cast of rural locals.

name: Pivrnec
description:
City: Ostrava
description: If you want a real slice of old time industrial town life in Czechia, go here.

name: The Plough
description:
City: Little London / Tadley

description: Wooden beams, roaring fire, Ringwood beers. A rural country pub that zones in on what makes them so good.

name: The Eagle Inn
description:
City: Abbotts Ann

description: Even at first glance, a very impressive attempt to run a pub catering for all tastes, whether that's the wood panel boozer feel of the bar, the games rooms, beer garden, and food areas. It is all tied together well without feeling bland. Highly rated.

name: White House Hotel
description:
City: Peel
description: Sometimes 'proper pub' seems a little sneering, but not a bit of it here. This is a down to earth pub that's massively popular for its classic unpretentious and homely setup.

name: The Nag's Head
description:
City: Reading
description: One of those neo-rustic alehouses they have now with recovered antique furniture and bar mats/pump clips everywhere. It does look like an utter classic, itself situated in a mock tudor building. Beer choices abounding.

name: The Chequers
description:
City: Little Gransden

description: Slightly marred by tedious jingoism but plenty still to like about this 'proper pub' as the phrase goes. Ie - communal, social, homely, down to earth and beyond corporate bollocks. Occasional live music. Exceptionally well reviewed with a family line going back 65 years.

name: The Mallard Inn
description:
City: Worksop
description: Worksop deserves a break and what a pub this looks. An unreconstructed station pub with some real lived-in character, lots of cask ales and right next to the tracks.

name: Fez
description:
City: Margate
description: Exciting looking bar with carefully curated salvaged trinkets and ornaments. Looks like a standout for the county let alone Margate.

name: Brauerei Witzgall
description:
City: Hallerndorf
description: A family operation, here is a slice of authentic Franconia. Simplicity and honest endeavour. Go before it's gone.

name: The Crown & Sceptre
description:
City: Stroud
description: Real ale, live music and altogether unpretentious friendly looking venue with rave reviews

name: Prince Albert Inn
description:
City: Stroud
description: Made famous through the BBC's series Saving Britain's Pubs, the wonderful owners Lotte & Miles are tenants who run a thriving community venue with a diverse crowd and live music events.

name: The Island Queen
description:
City: London
description: A wonderfully well preserved bar area makes this place a point of interest, though we believe it is a tentative suggestion rather than a must-visit.

name: Quimet & Quimet
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Famously piddly little bodega with bottles stacked high. Hardly any tables but apparently the atmosphere in there when you get served is worth the effort.

name: The Rising Sun
description:
City: Gunnislake
description: Ungentrified, lived-in cosy pub with a nice garden, great views over the valley, real ciders and a community feel. Priceless.

name: The Miners Arms
description:
City: Mithian
description: Exceptionally well reviews, this one seems like an all-rounder. Plenty of food is sold but you'll find a real fire, cottage/inn type stylings with a low ceiling. Looks like one to explore.

name: The Old Bull
description:
City: Inkberrow
description: Timberframed village pub with exposed beams in the entire, fireplace and hearty food, so just what you're after with this sort of thing. Well reviewed overall.

name: The Crown Inn
description:
City: Chiddingfold
description: A venue to put on your Sunday best for, this is a splendid old timberframe building that does very upscale dining. However, a well preserved bar area, albeit with some dull upholstery manages to preserve an interesting slice of historic Inn culture. The ales look decent too. Worth a look.

name: The Golden Lion
description:
City: Rochford
description: Seemingly a strong example of a traditional simple English pub, wood fittings, worn in and cosy, looks like decent ale choices too - well reviewed.

name: Black Horse
description:
City: Clapton in Gordano

description: A village pub with a rural setting and beautiful garden. Tarred beams and low ceiling inside, along with some nice lived-in elements are strong signs .

name: U Neostichu
description:
City: Prague
description: Cult Smichov pub with a cast of locals and well off the normal tourist trail. Although it was very down to earth, on our October 2024 there was not much to it that stood out.

name: The Olde Boars Head
description:
City: Middleton
description: Tudor stylings in a simple wooden beamed setup that looks warm, cosy and a safe bet.

name: The Boat Inn
description:
City: Melton Mowbray

description: Excellent reviews about this sidestreet pub that in effect acts as the station pub. Local life, cosy warm inside, homely and unpretentious, ungentrified. Looks really nice.

name: Brauerei Drei Kronen
description:
City: Schesslitz
description: Great reviews of this Gasthof and brewery. Things done the old way, it seems. Or at least taking the best from the old ways.

name: Pebbles Tavern
description:
City: Watchet
description: A real-cider micropub with attractive bar area and distinctive personalised interior. Excellent reviews.

name: The Esplanade Club
description:
City: Watchet
description: The local residents are lucky to have not 1 but 2 distinctive venues. A really personalised bar area that's live in, another one of those that's like an extension of the owner, an exhibition of their personality. Live music events give this another string to its bow.

name: The Belleman Pub
description:
City: Bruges
description: Dated but authentic pub with cushioned seating - rare for Belgium. At certain times of the year you'll find regulars reoccupying the spaces the tourists normally take up.

name: Eagle Inn
description:
City: Salford
description: A potentially uneasy peace treaty between a traditional pub and modern influences seems to have been resolved successfully here. A first visit was spoilt by a bad group of people, but are prepared to give it another go or two.

name: The Crossways Inn
description:
City: Churt
description: A beautiful simple pub that has made an asset of its preserved features instead of ripping them out. Tiled floor, countryfied furnishings and the last thing you really expect in such a wealthy area.

name: The Surrey Oaks
description:
City: Newdigate
description: A large country inn with beer garden, petanque pitches, low-ceilinged interior with various barn-type rooms. Overall it looks a good all-rounder.

name: The Elms
description:
City: Burton upon Trent

description: Celebrated Bass pub with large signage outfront. Cosy, unglamorous but homely inside.

name: Manor Arms
description:
City: Broughton-in-Furness

description: This really looks like a classic English pub. Communal friendly, simple and run on an established format. No wonder the reviews are glowing. We look forward to visiting.

name: The Blue Anchor Inn
description:
City: Helston
description: Another Cornish pub that looks fantastic. Late medieval building, local ales, simple interior cosy with stone walls. Just what you'd be looking for from the area. Use it or lose it.

name: The Lower Angel
description:
City: Warrington
description: Real ales aplenty in this compact boozer. Looks decent.

name: The Mermaid Inn
description:
City: Hugh Town

description: Classic smuggler cove type pub with very attractive bar area alongside the predictable nautical nik naks

name: The Flying Childers Inn
description:
City: Stanton in Peak

description: Beams, tankers, rugs and rustic furniture. Seemingly largely unspoilt ungentrified country charm. Looks very nice.

name: Pivnice U Čiháků
description:
City: Podebrady
description: Excellent looking hospoda with a rotation of Czech and craft beer classics. The interior has a familiar feel but with some personal touches.

name: The Glimmer Man
description:
City: Dublin
description: Interesting blend of old and new here, with a Brixton style back yard but inside trad furnishings and some ornate fixtures and fittings. Looks pretty good, well reviewed and off the tourist trail.

name: Pheasant Inn & Caravan Park
description:
City: Harmby
description: A proper country inn by all accounts, old fashioned, homely and lived-in, excellently well reviewed. Looks good.

name: The Retreat
description:
City: Reading
description: Real ale haunt with a slight DIY/micro vibe. Very well reviewed.

name: The Bay Horse Inn
description:
City: Crakehall
description: An unchanged, unmodernised small town pub with home comforts and a local crowd. Looks pretty good, classic Yorkshire fare.

name: The Royal George
description:
City: Morton-on-Swale
description: Seemingly classic Yorkshire country pub with lived-in character. Cosy, carpeted joint with a real fire, snug rooms and home cooking.

name: Blacksmiths Arms, Broughton Mills
description:
City: Broughton Mills

description: High-end gastropub but in an arch-traditional pub setting that looks to have a bar area fitting our requirements.

name: Digby Tap
description:
City: Sherbourne
description: Wonderful looking pub with stripped back but homely charm. Lots of wood, retro signage, and a certain rustic throwback feel. Think Sheaf View, Sheffield.

name: Three Horseshoes Warham
description:
City: Warham
description: Seems to be still just enough cosy character left in this near-coastal pub which has been given one of those typical seafaring decoration. Well reviewed and placed here from a personal recommendation.

name: Waggon & Horses
description:
City: Ibstock
description: Another good Waggon & Horses, apparently. Looks like a preserved classic. Upholstered bench seats, bass, simplicity. An alehouse not a gastropub.

name: Modrá Hvězda
description:
City: Prague
description: A smoking throwback - the old school atmosphere of Prague's Smichov district. Staropramen on tap, dirt cheap prices, yellow walls, identity, passion and no pretension. In order to comply it is a 'club' and so be careful to ensure you have your airs and graces when entering.

name: Helwith Bridge Inn
description:
City: Helwith Bridge

description: A typical walkers pub, hard wearing carpet, dogs, fireplace, though some brighter areas taking advantage of the riverside view. Very well rated.

name: Im Goldenen Kessel
description:
City: Dusseldorf
description: Schumacher's most central bierhalle. Fairly good for this sort of thing.

name: - KLO -
description:
City: Berlin
description: A toilet themed pub. We'll leave that with you.

name: Estaminet De Brouwerij
description:
City: Izegem
description: Taproom for the nearby D'Oude Maalderij brewery. Tonnes of beer ephemera in a cosy wooden barn. Looks great.

name: The Blue Lion Inn, Pub and Restaurant with Accommodation
description:
City: East Witton

description: A fine old bar area with characterful brown wood. Certainly upmarket elsewhere in the pub but looks good and well reviewed.

name: The Robin Hood Inn
description:
City: Amblecote
description: A classic neighbourhood pub. A sense of familiarity, lived-in community value, typical upholstered bench seating and stools, several real ale pumps. Looks very nice.

name: The Wyche Inn
description:
City: Malvern
description: A classic pub layout with some half-timber structure to boot. Pool table and local life.

name: The Five Bells
description:
City: Bassingham
description: Fantastic-looking pub with chunky beams and hanging foliage, a free house with some character.

name: Středověká krčma
description:
City: Detenice
description: A barn dedicated to medievalism to great effect. Definitely a pub-restaurant rather than a boozer but a remarkable place considering it's in the middle of nowhere.

name: Pivnice Batalion
description:
City: Jicin
description: Long-standing classic boozer set up for local socialising. Down to earth and intended for fun. Cheap Staropramen is the main beer offering.

name: Tuckers Grave Inn & Campsite
description:
City: Faulkland
description: Looks absolutely exceptional. Excellent seemingly unchanged rustic country inn with large grounds and views and rickety preserved interior.

name: The Chequers Inn
description:
City: Laddingford

description: 15th century country pub, low beams, and suitably for drinking, not yet turned into a bland beige dining room.

name: Bodega Joserra
description:
City: Bilbao
description: Popular bodega with historic fittings and cosy huddled together atmosphere.

name: Siegl's PUB
description:
City: Wiener Neustadt

description: A rare sign of life in a quite dull city. A curved ceiling in a Czech pivnice style provides a homeliness and there's an impression this is somewhat of an instutition.

name: U STAREJCH HADRŮ
description:
City: Prague
description: A true basement dive bar from the camp horror signage outside to scuzzy furniture and decor inside. Table football, table tennis, arcade machines and so on. If it's your thing, you'll love it. Marmite factor: High

It was a little quiet on our first try in October 2023, but will give it another try.

(Added 2021)

name: Krčma na náměstí
description:
City: Tři Studně,
description: Wonderful country style Krcma, so lots of chunky wood, hearty food, roaring old fire with ceramic panels. The front room by the taps looks good if you just want a drink too.

name: U Opilého draka
description:
City: Žďár nad Sázavou
description: An absolutely superb looking pub with an interesting concept.

name: CRAFT BEER PUB - U Škvorů
description:
City: Čerčany
description: This is not your average swish modern cookie-cutter craft bar. The craft beer here and the pub itself is all about content not style. Excellent local beers and simple honest and homely, if amateur, surroundings.

name: Hostinec U Janečků
description:
City: Kadov
description: A lovely unspoilt village pub with some homely genteel decor that has a personal touch. Looks like the sort of operation that could have been going for centuries.

name: The Locks
description:
City: Geldeston
