description:
City: Huish Episcopi

description: Absolutely cracking looking country pub, untampered with, comfortable homely boozer in a stone building. Popular with bikers occasionally. A lovely warm pub of old that we look forward to visiting - potential 9/10. (Added August 2021)

name: The Cock Inn
description:
City: Brent Eleigh

description: Lovely looking homely country pub of relatively modest size. Personalised exterior and interior. A beautiful throwback with smoke from the chimney and classic pub interior with tiled floor, worn furniture, dartboard, fireplace. Not a dining room, and actual pub. We would love to visit to verify. (Added August 2021)

name: The Red Lion
description:
City: Sedburgh
description: Pleasantly stolid Northern town tavern with stone grimness offset by roaring hearth and homely surroundings. Looks reasonably nice and unspoilt, Jennings brewery associated. (Added August 2021)

name: The Gryphon
description:
City: Bristol
description: Warning: Metal pub. Just a very good looking well reviewed metal pub, in a stark wedge shaped building. Beer clips on walls and ceiling, and of course you will either love or hate the music, there's no getting away from it. (Added August 2021)

name: The Gypsy Rover
description:
City: Redcar
description: A reason to come to Redcar? But please, really. Well, yes, it seems pretty convincing on the evidence of this well put together micropub full of personal touches, homely decor and that uncanny valley effect you get with DIY efforts on a budget. Adds to the charm. Bags of local life on offer. Whether that's your - or our - thing remains to be scene. (Added August 2021)

name: The Strawberry Hall
description:
City: Dublin
description: Cracking riverside inn that still has its historic unspoilt dark brown interior. (Added August 2021)

name: Bodega Sa Xarxa
description:
City: Lloret de Mar

description: Looks like an enjoyably trad drinks-focused boozer with wooden barrels lining the walls and a stripped back old-school format. (Added August 2021)

name: Hospůdka Na Vyhlídce
description:
City: Hrčava
description: A classic unspoilt country Czech pub known for its good views, hearty cooking and hint of Polish influence. (added August 2021)

name: The Borough Arms
description:
City: Crewe
description: Traditional low-ceilinged ale house that has a wide range of cask + keg options with Belgian beers available, in relatively cosy wooden, carpeted surroundings. A free house. (Added August 2021)

name: The Colmore
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Opulent restored/refurbished modern classical pub by Thornbridge/Pivovar joint venture, in the similar standard of The Banker's Cat and The Market Cat in Leeds and York respectively. On our first visit it was pleasant but not conclusive in terms of deserving a place on our guide. (Added August 2021)

name: The Lamp Tavern
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Excellent looking traditional little pub with Irish leanings but focusing on the basics well rather than just sticking Guinness and Irish flags everywhere. Plenty of character and great reviews about Landlord Eddy. Folk music and singing, 'like being invited into someone's living room for a beer'. (Added August 2021)

name: Restaurant Na Brezance
description:
City: Prague
description: A local's place in the heart of the action in between Nove Mesto and Vinohrady. Affordable food but perhaps a little too plain to stand out on the guide. Anyway, it came close on a first try and we are willing to try it again.

name: Captains Bar
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Intimate little pub with folk leanings and performances. The space of the room doesn't really lend itself to a communal experience however, while the decor is a little bland and touristy (not awful though by any means). Still well worth a look if it's music you're after. (Added February 2024)

name: Outro Lado
description:
City: Lisbon
description: Intimate beer bar in the Alfama with large selection in the Fridge. While the decor doesn't leap out, the general environment and atmosphere looks good, worth a try. Well reviewed. (added August 2021)

name: Courtney's Bar
description:
City: Killarney
description: Absolutely superb looking pub with an intimate and dark interior stylishly but sympathetically designed. Take us there tomorrow please. Very well reviewed. (Added August 2021)

name: Swan Bar
description:
City: Dublin
description: On Dublin's Victorian pub crawl, here is an attractive boozer with mosaic floor, mirror panels and dark wood, but more importantly a degree of character, comfortable seating space and local life. (Added August 2021)

name: Uva e Menta Café
description:
City: Trento
description: A reasonably attractive informal bar focused on artisan beers. Looks decent. Worth a try. (Added August 2021)

name: Sandy Bell's
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: A renowned music pub that may be firmly on the circuit, in terms of notoriety and traffic but nevertheless deserves a look. Excellent Reviews. (added August 2021)

name: The Magdala
description:
City: London
description: Impressive exampler of a tasteful refurb. Wood strip bar with lamplights, stained/leaded hatched windows, wooden floors. While food is clearly evident there appears enough space for drinkers too. (Added August 2021)

name: Queens Head
description:
City: Boreham
description: Characterful village pub with Gray & Sons link, brick bar, low ceilings and beams, pewter jugs, dartboard, and drinks focused rather than meals-focused. Attractive outdoor area with view of an old stone church. (Added August 2021)

name: Ma Murphys bar
description:
City: Bantry
description: One of those pubs in small town Ireland that operates or at least used to operate as a newsagents, so interesting shopfront and bar area. Some outdoor seating. Rave reviews. (Added August 2021)

name: MacCarthy's Bar
description:
City: Castletownbere
description: Excellent looking old Irish pub and shop with preserved features and a lot of character to the place. Cluttered bar with counter and what appears to be an old deli shelf. (Added August 2021)

name: Hand In Hand
description:
City: Brighton
description: A diamond, seemingly. Cosy little bunker with distinctive features and personal touches. For the area, quite unpretentious too and reasonably priced. Highly rated. (Added August 2021)

name: The Spotted Dog
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Excellent-looking Digbeth boozer with some nicely preserved features and distinctive character. As yet, not overly gentrified. Well reviewed. (Added August 2021)

name: The Old Contemptibles
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Nicholson's, so expect chain grind and bad prices, however a bit of charm remains in this high-ceilinged city tavern with war-themed paintings behind the bar (not in a Gammon Help For Heroes way). Not necessarily conclusive but a possible fallback option. (added August 2021)

name: Lottas Krog & Pub
description:
City: Umea
description: A well designed English style pub (including several cask ales on handpump) with some nautical touches to the decor, and a nice cosy interior. (Added August 2021)

name: Gröna Älgen
description:
City: Umea
description: A nice blend of modern and traditional keeping some cosy touches while also being quite sleek. It looks warm and welcoming. Good reviews and a big fridge of ales on offer. (Added August 2021)

name: De 12 apostels
description:
City: Ypres
description: Very attractive classic Belgian bar. While not the true evocative 'brown café', there is much to enjoy from the religious iconography on the walls, parquet floor and great range of Belgian ales. Well reviewed. (Added August 2021)

name: Fishguard Arms
description:
City: Fishguard
description: Excellent looking quirky little alehouse set up primarily for drinking. Personalised and cabin like with woodstrip ceiling, old furniture and tasteful decor. Looks excellent and the reviews seem to agree. (Added August 2021)

name: The Three Horseshoes
description:
City: Duton Hill
description: Really excellent looking homely pub with a collection of memorabilia bordering on a museum and an ungentrified personalised feel a far cry from the template dining rooms many country pubs have become. Great reviews. (added September 2021)

name: The Bell Inn
description:
City: Wendens Ambo
description: Looks an unspoilt village pub with a handsome outdoor area but beams and wooden furniture inside. Decent reviews and a sense of community to it. (added September 2021)

name: Hark To Bounty Inn
description:
City: Slaidburn
description: Unspoilt Northern village boozer in a 16th century coaching inn. Fireplace, low beams. Not dramatic but cosy and friendly looking, homely. Very well reviewed. (added September 2021)

name: Cross Guns Avoncliff
description:
City: Avoncliff
description: Classic country pub with riverside beer garden and blackened beams with brasses inside. Some grumbles on the reviews appear to relate to an isolated incident some time ago. Looks really nice. (Added September 2021)

name: The Village Freehouse
description:
City: Salisbury
description: Freehouse with train station ephemera and real ales. Very well reviewed with some personal touches, even if not all successful, certainly distinctive enough. (Added September 2021)

name: The Snug Micropub
description:
City: Carnforth
description: A rare station pub, and this is a little one. A real mishmash with office style ceiling tiles, lime green paint, curtains and attracting little wooden bar. But it seems to work really nicely. Very popular and brilliant reviews. Range of real ales. (Added September 2021)

name: The Beer Engine
description:
City: Newton St Cyres
description: Fantastic looking pub which serves both gastro and social needs. Railwayside inn with outdoor seating, homely interior with a mixture of local art and train based decor. Own brews. Incredible reviews. (added September 2021)

name: Ratty Arms
description:
City: Ravenglass
description: A station pub, really. Views of the the railway, informal atmosphere (though some food), fairly nice looking carpeted interior with beams and historical train ephemera on the wall. (added September 2021)

name: Codsall Station Pub
description:
City: Codsall
description: An excellent-looking, almost dreamlike station bar that is the kind of thing you'd desire at almost any station in the country. Warm and homely interior rooms with the usual station/railway ephemera but interesting other aspects like a gabled conservatory style section. Local beers, books, and a sense of community. This looks great. (added September 2021)

name: Charters Bar
description:
City: Peterborough
description: A decent Peterborough option, you say? Apparently yes! Charismatic ship setting and attractive riverside surroundings. Pleasant beamed interior, decent selection of ales and bottles. Occasional live events. (added September 2021)

name: Crown Wharf
description:
City: Stone
description: A new pub, although with Joule's at the helm you can expect a very careful makeover. It looks big and traditional with a refurbished warehouse type building, but sympathetic decor, Joules beers, canalside setting. Looks worth a try. (added September 2021)

name: Swan Inn Stone
description:
City: Stone
description: Yuk to the blue paint on the bar but yes to the fireplace, brickwork, exposed beams, live music, communal atmosphere and social buzz. The reviews tell it all. (added September 2021)

name: Ye Olde Albion
description:
City: Rowhedge
description: Unspoilt riverside pub which retains its rustic feel through authenticity rather than conceit. Some beer and cider delivered direct from the box, belgian ales, blackened beams. It does rather look magnificent. (add September 2021)

name: Café Lugosi's
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Vampiric dive bar that seems down and dirty enough to avoid being that kitsch. Great reviews. (Added September 2021)

name: Jack C's Bar
description:
City: Killarney
description: Local life and authentic characters to be found here at a well-rated Irish pub. (Added September 2021)

name: Curran's
description:
City: Dingle
description: Exceptionally well rated Irish pub. We visited and while it is a very interesting venue - a shop cum bar with locals gathered around the shop counter, we didn't feel especially welcome and were treated to some really unfunny craic about mask wearing despite that being the actual law and adhered to everywhere else at the time of the visit. Prepared to give it another few goes though. (added September 2021)

name: The Swan
description:
City: Bushey
description: A traditional worn in pub without pretensions or bland refits. Low ceilings, beams, wooden fixtures, looks very nice. Well reviewed (Added September 2021)

name: bar Konirna
description:
City: Prague
description: Hiding in plain sight, a fair priced well-reviewed cellar bar that's been an institution in Prague for a while.

name: Tigh an tSaorsaigh
description:
City: Ballyferriter
description: A homely pub with attractive bar area, jugs on hooks, etc, and simple wooden seating. Excellent reviews.

name: SAXENBERG
description:
City: Český Těšín
description: Minibrewery with a lovely garden and some shelter. Looks by far the most interesting venue this side of the river. Be careful to check opening hours. Wasn't open on our visit in October 2021, but was clearly there (Added September 2021)

name: Stolarnia. Pub
description:
City: Bielsko-Biała
description: Beautiful garden and relatively hidden away spot for summer drinks, while also cosy and homely inside (though nothing dramatic). Worth a look. (added September 2021)

name: Chmielowe podcienia
description:
City: Bielsko-Biała
description: Craft beer, underground/cellar style surroundings and lots of pickle jars at the bar, providing a slight twist. Worth a look. (Added September 2021)

name: Środek
description:
City: Bielsko-Biała
description: Craft beer in a low-ceilinged bar with  modern decor, perhaps not the standout feature. Remains to be seen if the company and the beers can compensate for the more impersonal surroundings. (added September 2021)

name: Sádrový ježek
description:
City: Ostrava
description: Bookish café leanings. Decent crowd and well reviewed. We enjoyed our visits in October 2021 but it didn't quite stick out as distinctive enough to make the grade. The same applied on our 2024 visit. It is still worth bearing in mind as offers a decent selection of Svijany beers.  (Updated October 2024)

name: Koldovna
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Characterful looking little corner pub with lots of reviews attesting to the atmosphere being a little different from the norm. Eclectic artwork on the wall. That's enough to get us excited. (added September 2021)

name: Jazz Tibet Club
description:
City: Olomouc
description: Bar with a long row of seats leading to a nicely lit stage for live music performances. Fairly exotic looking decor and overall holds the eye well on pictures. Decent reviews. Probably worth a look. (added September 2021)

name: LOCAL LOCAL PUB Industy
description:
City: Olomouc
description: A potentially useful find this end of the city. A craft beer bar yes, with faux-industrial bits and pieces, yes, but there are some personal touches too. Clearly above the normal standard of this sort of thing in the region. (added September 2021)

name: Pivni bar Azyl
description:
City: Liberec
description: What's this, an independent beer bar in Liberec with a bit of personalised flavour and community support? Quite the one off in a city of largely drab chain restaurants and ugly herna bars. Has to be worth a visit when in town. (Added October 2021)

name: Bohem Tap Room
description:
City: London
description: Tiny but beloved taproom out in the suburbs. Independent flair, almost universally well reviewed. (Added October 2021)

name: The Crooked Billet Free House
description:
City: Colney Heath

description: Homely pub with exposed beams, tiled floor and a genteel rustic appearance with cushioned seats on wooden furniture. Very well reviewed for its drinks and clearly personalised rather than full of chain pub adornments. (added October 2021)

name: The Villiers Arms
description:
City: Oxhey
description: High up in the 'proper pub' stakes, this pub has a personalised community feel with a real fireplace, pump clips, round bar area, traditional homely decor. Beer potentially not as interesting as many places, however it nevertheless achieves great reviews. (added October 2021)

name: The Dove
description:
City: Bury St Edmunds

description: A true neighbourhood pub with local life and community events including occasional live music. Homely and warm looking interior with upholstered seats and communal layout. Ale options look very nice too, of a trad leaning. Exceptionally well reviewed. (Added October 2021)

name: The Firkin Shed
description:
City: Boscombe
description: Cracking looking, highly personalised micropub with musical leanings. Intimate interior with the typical range of independent ales. Exceptionally well reviewed. (added October 2021)

name: The Wykeham Arms, Winchester
description:
City: Winchester
description: Excellent characterful looking interior with pewter jugs lining the walls and wood-fit bar. Personalised and seems to be well worth a look, potentially relatively posh, but this is Winchester. (added October 2021)

name: The British Grenadier
description:
City: Colchester
description: A classic down to earth and friendly neighbourhood pub with a community atmosphere. Ale-focused with exposed kegs and pump clips lining the walls. Communal seating. Looks warm and cosy too. Well reviewed. (added October 2021)

name: Schizofrenia Café
description:
City: Kraków
description: Not an area known for nightlife, this place seems to capture a certain something from different genres. The beer garden looks attractive and on point with plenty of greenery and fairlights. Inside there is the array of antique furniture and nik naks, with cellar brickwork. Some live events and food. On a visit in February 2022 we were taken by some of it but not convincingly enough to add it there and then. Some decorations perhaps a little banal and bland. We will return though. (added October 2021)

name: SPOKO
description:
City: Kraków
description: Contemporary craft beer/street food venue in Podgorze, an area which could use a place like this. On a visit in October we liked the location but the bar itself didn't stand out as being a must-visit. (added October 2021)

name: U Mariánského obrazu
description:
City: Prague
description: Pleasant and fairly pubby looking PU place. Whenever we go past it seems to be people socialising. Formal for Zizkov we suppose, but better than the usual diner options. Didn't wow us on our 1st visit, but like U Veverky, the food is decent, and as a place to have up your sleeve, it's pretty reliable. (Added April 2023)

name: The Orange Tree
description:
City: Baldock
description: Excellent traditional backstreet pub with simple wooden seating and genteel surroundings. Looks very nice. (added November 2021)

name: The Cob & Pen
description:
City: Rhyl
description: Surprisingy nice looking ungentrified but not scary or dilapidated pub. Very good reviews. (added November 2021)

name: The Cock
description:
City: Broom
description: Excellent traditional freehouse country pub with pub skittles, exposed casks behind the bar, community events,  (added November 2021)

name: The Congress Inn
description:
City: Longton
description: Unspoilt corner boozer known for real ale, live music. Looks to have a true community feel. (added November 2021)

name: BCM Craft Ale Bar
description:
City: Evesham
description: A truly uninspiring name obfuscates a terrific looking micropub in a timber frame building. Furnishings are sympathetic to the structure and it is very much a little hub of all things ale. Amazing reviews. (added November 2021)

name: Ya Bard craft beer
description:
City: Stratford-upon-Avon
description: The bar area seems a relatively unsuccessful use of space in this nice Georgian looking brick building, however there appears to be some backroom space with nice leather chairs and recovered signage. Obviously the beer will be terrific due to the micro-pub and craft format. We shall see overall, but tentatively adding this. (added November 2021)

name: Jim O' the Mills
description:
City: Drombane
description: One of the highest rated pubs in Dublin, Family run, essentially a family house and only open one night a week, which is invariably a get together with music, drinks and food. Looks incredible. (added November 2021)

name: Morans Of Mornington
description:
City: Mornington
description: Another well reputed traditional pub with excellent reviews. The interior looks something truly special with its wood panelling and deliberately preserved layout and decor. (added November 2021)

name: Storehouse Tourist Accommodation
description:
City: Rathanna
description: Also known as Osbourne's, this building serves as a pub too, though be wary of opening hours. Great reviews and national press attention for its traditional appeal. (added November 2021)

name: J O'Connell
description:
City: Skreen
description: Famous for its use in a Guinness advert, but time has really stood still in this place, a monument to times past but one that still seems to be keeping the fire burning. Looks excellent. (added November 2021)

name: Coachmakers Arms
description:
City: Hanley
description: A nice looking neighbourhood pub with a homely feel, some nooks and crannies too, piano, array of books and real ales. Looks promising (added November 2021)

Edit - on a 1st visit in January 2023 we thought this was a decent pub but needs another try to make our minds up. It is definitely on the tatty side, deliberately so, and service was friendly.

name: The Good Measure
description:
City: Bristol
description: Neighbourhood modern ale house with nice frontage and warm but relatively humdrum interior. Compensated for by the selection and friendly crowd by the look of it. (added November 2021)

name: Cervecería Vincer
description:
City: Gijon
description: Excellent characterful looking beer house with very good reviews, looks like a local institution. (added November 2021)

name: Cervecería La Abadía
description:
City: Gijon
description: A rather unusual format somewhere between a Spanish bodega and German gaststatte, something reflected in their offerings. A 1970s vibe to the interior. Worth a look for beer fans (added November 2021)

name: The Taggy Man
description:
City: Kirkby Stephen
description: The decor has slightly sterilised the place with a wash of that off-grey paint, but the layout helps keep a real coherence and the strong reviews suggest it is at least worth looking into. Real fire, food available (added November 2021)

name: Pivovar Lobeč
description:
City: Lobec
description: A restored historic brewery with a pub/taproom that displays the architecture well with sympathetic decor. Excellent reviews both for the beer, tours and pub, food available. We shall see. (added November 2021)

name: Nádražní restaurace Braník
description:
City: Branik
description: A real throwback historic station boozer that still has Branik as its tap option and a truly unpretentious down to earth feel, that's old enough to have developed a bit of personality too. All the same, it felt more of a lunch diner than a pub on our visit in 2023. Worth a look if you're around there. (Added 2021)

name: Old Orechovka
description:
City: Prague
description: Nice looking old pub and surprising location in rather grand building. Inside you'll find aged characterful wood panels, some mounted stags heads, piano, Staropramen beer and altogether informal type appearance. On our first visit in 2023 you could see some of the appeal but it didn't quite tip the balance for a full inclusion. Worth a try if you're in the area (added November 2021)

name: Pivní ambasáda
description:
City: Pardubice
description: A nice looking, warm wood, simple layout hospoda with a focus on beer from smaller breweries. Perhaps a touch too clean but has that nice DIY feel some of these Czech pubs have. Worth a look (added November 2021)

name: Cable Cafe
description:
City: London
description: Pleasant looking café bar with a slight bohemian (if hipster) vibe, occasional live music. Warm colours, ramshackle decor and impressive artwork. Possibly best in the evenings? (added November 2021)

name: Bodega Marín
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Another 'go before it's gone' city bodega with history and character. Great reviews, looks very nice. Can't wait to go. (added November 2021)

name: Bodega NADAL
description:
City: Barcelona
description: On our first visit to this family run winery in April 2024 it didn't quite tip the balance, due to a slight lack of atmosphere on account of the space. However, the family operation and history makes it an interesting one we'll return to (added November 2021)

name: Old Crow
description:
City: Zurich
description: Understated little bar with characterful stone arch. Parquet floor, lamplight and focus on the back bar rather than beers. Still, looks good. No doubt expensive. (added November 2021)

name: Kommprobier
description:
City: Langenargen
description: Interesting venue which is a large bottle shop/warehouse but also bar. Tables inside and out, decorated with beer ephemera. Neighbourly vibe according to reviews and clearly most German beers under the sun, in bottles at least. Has to be worth a try (added November 2021)

name: PIVO & SYN
description:
City: Brno
description: Perhaps a little bit modern and on the nose, but the clear simplicity of the format appeals as well, and seems to have a nice intimate space. Very well reviewed too. We shall see. (added November 2021)

name: Gaststätte Kollektiv
description:
City: Leipzig
description: East Germany era decor in this bar-diner Gaststatte, possibly too food oriented but interesting looking and well reviewed.

name: Münzbar GmbH
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Info slightly thin on the ground but looks like a decent well reviewed sports bar with a football theme (added November 2021)

name: Zum Schäufele
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Looks like a must-visit old time lunch Gaststatte with amazing reviews. (November 2021)

name: Synde Bräu
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Brewery and taproom with tables for sampling wares. Well reviewed, looks decent. (November 2021)

name: Zum Wilden Heinz
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Excellent looking cabin type bar with ramshackle garden. Quite quirky and characterful looking. Excellent reviews. (added November 2021)

name: Joseph Pub
description:
City: Leipzig
description: While described as an Irish pub, this seems more like just a Pub. Classical Victorian style decor with green bench seating. Some tap choices are generic Irish pub but the surroundings actually look very pleasant, and this is well reviewed too (added November 2021)

name: Casa Pepe
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Arty multi-floor venue bordering on ruin-bar aesthetic. Bohemian yes, but perhaps not quite a ruin. All the same, looks very good and excellent reviews. (November 2021)

name: Betten Költzsch
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Attractive back garden and corridor with retro signage and recovered items. Inside looks pretty cosy too, simple and homely. Very good reviews. (November 2021)

name: Werk 2 - Kulturfabrik Leipzig
description:
City:
description:

name: Zur 102
description:
City: Leipzig
description: Old style with impressive 70s era exterior, smoking inside, not going to be everybody's thing. May be worth a try. (November 2021)

name: Grüner Brauhaus
description:
City: Furth
description: While the venue didn't do enough to bowl us over first time around, beer halls of this kind always require something special to tip them over the edge. The reviews are great and a lot depends if you can get a seat in the main hall. The beers are certainly more than competent, particular the new Rotbier. Worth a look. (added November 2021)

name: Ratsstube
description:
City: Rothenburg ob der Tauber
description: In a city not stacked with great pubs, the central beer hall is a very reliable fallback option. Warm, cosy and typically impressively cloistered. We would recommend out of the tourist season where it is typically plagued by touristy sorts of problems. (added November 2021)

name: Hospůdka na kopci
description:
City: Zivotice
description: Lovely old wood and lived-in homely surrounds. Rotating offer of both home brewed and standard offerings. (added November 2021)

name: Weinkellerei Dünker
description:
City: Frankfurt
description: Fantastic looking traditional wine bar in a characterful cellar. Exposed brickwork, candlelight and  barrels. Very well reviewed. (added November 2021)

name: George & Dragon
description:
City: Ilfracombe
description: Low beams and very characterful bar area, stone walls and fireplace, carpets and very typical familiar feel. (added November 2021)

name: Alt Berliner Wirtshaus Henne
description:
City: Berlin
description: Fabulously aged wood, stained glass and candelabras at this trad wirtshaus/pub with striking neon signage outside. It all screams 'proper pub'. Very well reviewed (added November 2021)

name: Hackethal's
description:
City: Berlin
description: A fab homely looking Gaststatte with retro signage, wooden seats and candles. Clearly room for drinking as well as eating. (added November 2021)

name: Lokobar, Nádražní restaurace
description:
City: Vsetaty
description: A classic Czech station pub, no b.s straightforward boozer here. Lived in and a bit raw with it. (added November 2021)

name: Zelenáčova Šopa
description:
City: Zlin
description: Multitap offerings in a homely wooden cabin with live music and a clear social vibe. 
UPDATE - on a first visit in 2023 there was live music and nice beers, but the overall space as a pub didn't quite cut it for a full inscription. However, it is well worth knowing about. (Added November 2021)

name: HogMod
description:
City: Kaunas
description: Modern but well executed pub with greenery, food and a stage for live music. Well reviewed and looks at least a little notch above the stale Scandi rip-offs that Lithuania is increasingly into. (added November 2021)

name: Ye Olde Red Lion Hotel
description:
City: Market Bosworth
description: A little dog-eared, perhaps, but the low-slung beams and unspoilt nature of this pub are an increasingly rare find. One for fans of traditional pubs. (Added December 2021)

name: Cherry Red's Cafe Bar
description:
City: Birmingham
description: A café diner early on that turns more into a Belgian type café bar as the day progresses. Reasonably offbeat and popular locally. We thought it was OK but needs a few more tries before we can reach a firm decision. (added December 2021)

name: The Eagle Ale House
description:
City: London
description: Homely and authentic looking pub/ale house which has been decorated and personalised in a non-pretentious way. Very popular for its drinks selection and well reviewed. (Added December 2021)

name: Metronome Jazz Bar
description:
City: Chester
description: Excellent reviews for this fairly lively and atmospheric looking Jazz Bar. While it has a modern look, there is some style and personality with it. Has to be worth a look. (added December 2021)

name: Waters Green Tavern
description:
City: Macclesfield
description: Town centre boozer with a real ale focus and decidedly pointed refusal to modernise, which is often a good decision for a pub. Mock tudor exterior with wood panelled bar, pump clips on the wall. (added December 2021)

name: The Unicorn Inn
description:
City: Canterbury
description: Tudor style inn with beamed exterior and cosy historic interior with fire, snug, pub billiards. A fairly unspoilt bunker, but need to see if there is an atmosphere. Well reviewed. (added December 2021)

name: Taberna Rikitri
description:
City: Vigo
description: A Celta Vigo supporters bar with live music and a cult following. Worth a look! (added December 2021)

name: Cobweb Inn
description:
City: Boscastle
description: Genuinely lovely looking pub with settles, pool table, bottles, tankards and fairy lights stuck to the ceiling. Rickety with off-centre frames and character. (added December 2021)

name: The Fountain Head
description:
City: Branscombe
description: Country inn with some of its original features intact with space for drinking, despite the encroachment of dinners. Flagstone flooring, fireplaces. Very well reviewed. (added December 2021)

name: The Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: Tattershall Thorpe

description: Country inn with some of its genteel quality intact, with artwork from the nearby RAF base. Exposed beams, real fire and fairly unshowy in terms of modernisation. (added December 2021)

name: Restaurace Zastávka Nižbor
description:
City: Nizbor
description: Cult railway pub with cheap Zubr, and cast of die-hards, with all that entails in Czechia. Rustic interior. We tried to visit here in March 2025 but it was packed out for a screening of a film. Some famous faces present. It looked excellent. (added 2021)

name: The Prince of Wales
description:
City: Green Tye

description: Country inn and free house with whitewashed exterior and some preserved features. Evidence of community involvement too. Recommended by BRAPA (added December 2021)

name: The Chequers Inn
description:
City: Wareside
description: Review scores dragged down by some issues several years ago, but from the evidence available this seems a classic country inn with handwritten menues on the blackboard, carpets, exposed beams and low ceiling. Worth a look, surely? (added December 2021)

name: Red Lion Inn
description:
City: Litton
description: A classic hikers pub, stone inn on the village green with fire, hearty pub grub and ales.  (added December 2021)

name: Luppolo Station Roma
description:
City: Rome
description: A good looking beer bar with wooden furniture and excellent selection. (Added December 2021)

name: St Bernard's Bar
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: Excellent mix of traditional and individual here at this quirky little pub. Very well reviewed and a bit of a cult audience. (added December 2021)

name: 3 Små Rum
description:
City: Gothenburg
description: 3 small rooms, a cosy, homely and unflashy beer bar specialising in...well...you guessed it! (added December 2021)

name: Café des Étangs de Saint-Denis
description:
City: Mons
description: A truly beautiful looking lakeside pub with all the homely appeal and rustic farmhouse charm you would look for. Very well reviewed. (added December 2021)

name: La Taverne Ardennaise
description:
City: Vresse-sur-Semois
description: A small town on the river hosts this central market town style bar/tabac with a Belgian beer focus and reasonably rustic surroundings, enough to stand out from the norm at least, but warrants closer inspection. (added December 2021)

name: Kings Arms
description:
City: Sutton-in-Craven
description: A small town Yorkshire pub serving a local community. Lived in interior with homely decor. Piano, fire, live events, cask ales. Very well reviewed, looks nice. (added December 2021)

name: Cryan's Teach Ceoil
description:
City: Carrick-On-Shannon
description: Regarded as one of the places in Ireland one can enjoy true traditional Irish folk performances, as the reviews and pictures attest. The pub itself looks friendly and traditional enough with a familiar layout. Very well reviewed (added January 2022)

name: Kavárna Na Šumavě
description:
City: Prague
description: A twee, rustic cabin like café with effusive owner and good beer selection. Overall while a little pubby the café nature of it was dominant, meaning it doesn't quite qualify. (added January 2022)

name: The King & Queen, Caterham on the Hill
description:
City: Caterham On The Hill

description: While it has enjoyed a degree of gentrification this has largely been sympathetic, with the beams and siderooms intact, and furnishings in keeping with rustic country surroundings. The signage also looks homespun and down to earth which makes a change in this area. (added January 2022)

name: The Plimsoll
description:
City: London
description: Formerly a sports pub, the Auld Triangle, the new decor as of end of 2021 has a stripped back retro look with a touch of class to the wood fittings and finish. Still seems light on good beer options however, but must be worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: The Royal Oak
description:
City: Eccleshall
description: A classy looking traditional market town tavern in the typical rustic revivalist style favoured by Joule's brewery. Well reviewed (added January 2022)

name: The Abdication
description:
City: Daybrook
description: Pleasingly homespun and personal micropub with a degree of taste and thought in the decor and usual array of local ales served by enthusiasts. Terrific reviews...which we expect will be deserved! (added January 2022)

name: Tap & Bottles
description:
City: Southport
description: A contemporary and familiar shabby-chic casual micropub/bottleshop set in an attractive arcade. (added January 2022)

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Rugeley
description: Well reputed Free House with rustic stripped back tiled floor and wooden furniture, brewery connection and community events. Looks great. (added January 2022)

name: Hospoda u Zemanů
description:
City: Popelin
description: Beautiful rural pub connected to a brewery. Simple communal hospoda decor that looks to have been fitted relatively recently, but in a sympathetic and homely fashion. Exceptional reviews. (added January 2022)

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Deal
description: Attractive unspoilt tavern with dark green paint, predictable nautical artwork and photography as decor and range of real ales. Excellent reviews. (added January 2022)

name: White Horse Inn Edwardstone
description:
City: Edwardstone
description: Rural pub that has kept its farmhouse appeal and not gone full into gentrified dining room territory. There is food available, however an old fashioned country pub with excellent range of ales both traditional and modern can be found. Great reviews too. (added January 2022)

name: Mellett's Emporium
description:
City: Swinford
description: Antiques and olde world signage + decor abound in this traditional Irish village pub trading on its history as a multipurpose venue. Excellent reviews. (added January 2022)

name: The Windmill
description:
City: Sevenoaks Weald
description: A truly fabulous looking pub with hanging hops, dark wooden settles and cosy rooms. The ensemble overall looks to create a warm welcoming and distinctive establishment. Locally brewed ales, log burning stove, etched windows. Can't wait to try it. (added January 2022)

name: The Albion
description:
City: Ampthill
description: Attractive alehouse with warm wooden strip fittings, pump clips and historic decor. Simple furniture. Looks effective, routinely award winning for ales. (added January 2022)

name: The Burnaby Arms
description:
City: Bedford
description: Neighbourhood corner local with piano, homely fittings, slightly spoilt by greywashing and sterile lighting at the bar, but could be compensated for on music nights. Several real ales on offer. (added January 2022)

name: The Stone Jug
description:
City: Clophill
description: Excellent reviews, this pub comprises 3 16th century cottages, with exposed beams and brinkwork inside, brick flooring and dart board, community events. Food available but a proper village pub, not a dining room. (added January 2022)

name: The March Hare
description:
City: Dunton
description: Traditional pub in the good beer guide. Relaxed village stylings and renowned for well kept ales. Community shop, folk music nights, but aside of the guide information is thin on the ground other than some traditional homely looking pictures of the interior. (added January 2022)

name: The Engineers Arms
description:
City: Henlow
description: Free house with at least 8 real ales on cask, occasionally straight from the barrel. Ciders also feature prominently. The venue itself looks excellent with breweriana lining the beer garden and historic photos in the interior. Some room for pub games and live sports, occasional community events. Excellent reviews, no wonder. (added January 2022)

name: Brewery Tap
description:
City: Shefford
description: Beautiful trad pub run by Banks & Taylor brewery. The historic ensemble appears intact with warm yellows and reds and a homely appearance. Darts, dominoes and cribbage teams supported, patio area to the rear. Excellent reviews, looks great. (added January 2022)

name: The Six Bells
description:
City: Beenham
description: The core of the pub is the central appeal here with two cosy bars decorated with eclectic items and furnished in a homely unpretentious style that's distinctive. Love to go. (added January 2022)

name: The Bounty
description:
City: Cockmarsh
description: A truly eccentric establishment accessible only on foot or by boat. Quirky and characterful with nik naks and memorabilia wherever you look. (added January 2022)

name: The Alehouse
description:
City: Reading
description: Distinctly revivalist feel here with pump clips covering all available wall and ceiling space, and the venue sticking to good microbrew beers, ciders and perry. Looks like a classic, though one that won't be to everyone's tastes. (added January 2022)

name: Hop Leaf
description:
City: Reading
description: Staunchly low key unfashionable revivalist venue with Hop Back beers and traditional pub games. Looks very nice. (added January 2022)

name: The Bell Inn
description:
City: Waltham St Lawrence
description: Very attractive bar area with true centuries old feeling ensemble. Blackened beams and sympathetic furnishings. Wide selection of ales and log fires in winter. Looks like a gem. (added January 2022)

name: The Alma
description:
City: Windsor
description: Street corner local with a personalised touch, antiques and some bohemian stylings. Large beer garden and overall informal feel. Relatively distinctive, worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: The Perseverance
description:
City: Wraysbury
description: Attractive village/country pub with some homely features and well designed space. Piano and inglenook fireplace are complimentary as are the bookshelves. Guest ales and regular beer festivals. Looks nice. (added January 2022)

name: The Crown Inn
description:
City: Little Missenden
description: A lovely throwback village pub. Idyllic rustic setting with beautiful garden. Continuous Good Beer Guide inclusion run by the same family for over a centre. Genteel and rustic interior that appears unchanged, probably through tasteful, sympathetic choices. Looks very nice. (added January 2022)

name: The General Havelock
description:
City: Loudwater
description: A Fuller's pub that seems to be a successful all-rounder. Cosy with bric-a-brac inside and a lovely beer garden. Several ales on show and longstanding Good Beer Guide inscription. Credit where it's due. (added January 2022)

name: The Two Brewers
description:
City: Thornborough
description: Drinks-focused thatched village pub in tranquil settings. Inglenook fireplace and woodburning stove create a cosy environment helped by exposed beams. Looks simple and effective, and distinctive from the usual modernised large coaching inn gastropubs of Buckinghamshire. (added January 2022)

name: The Stratton Arms
description:
City: Turweston
description: A rarity around this area. Unspoilt and ungentrified village pub with local flavour. Some original features such as a horseshoe bar, also with large beer garden. (added January 2022)

name: King and Queen
description:
City: Wendover
description: Sometimes it isn't just about the style but the layout and space that makes a pub effective. This appears to be the case here. Refurbished without losing its character, huddle around a fire and cosy bar area after a walk and enjoy some impressive map displays on the wall. Looks great. (added January 2022)

name: Prince Of Wales Feathers
description:
City: Castor
description: Free house in a stone inn. Looks a decent down to earth all-rounder with beer garden and occasional live music. The overall ensemble seems effective and should provide a nice stop for walkers or on a summer's day. (added January 2022)

name: Green Man
description:
City: Colne (Peterborough)
description: An attractive country inn with unspoilt familiar interior with exposed beams and carpet, fireplace and social lounge area. Now a free house. A local ale on tap guaranteed (supposedly) - (Added January 2022)

name: King of the Belgians
description:
City: Hartford
description: Excellent looking traditional in which has a degree of personalisation, distinctive and welcoming looking. Oak beams, copper-topped bar. Looks to be a genuine community-centre pub as well. Can't wait to try it. (added January 2022)

name: The Plough Inn
description:
City: Little Downham
description: A Grade II listed Victorian pub with attractive and historic wood-strip bar area and cosy space. Known for Thai food which is an odd juxtaposition but probably a welcome one for now. Let's hope it doesn't turn into a dining room. (added January 2022)

name: Blue Bell
description:
City: Maxey
description: Interior shots a little tricky to find. Longstanding Landlord runs this converted barn decorated in a sympathetic rural fashion. Paraphernalia of countryside life on the walls and shelves. Many ales on tap. Popular meeting place with community groups. (added January 2022)

name: The Queens Head
description:
City: Newton
description: Perennial inclusion on the Good Beer Guide, this pub has seen generations of long serving landlords and what refurbishments have taken places have been done gently and sympathetically to the surroundings. The cosy lounge area looks particularly social and homely with hops hanging from the bar. Cask ales straight from the barrel. Looks excellent. (added January 2022)

name: Coalheavers Arms
description:
City: Peterborough
description: A stripped back and distinctly ungentrified yet relatively contemporary alehouse worthy of a try. One room back street community boozer. (added January 2022)

name: Palmerston Arms
description:
City: Woodston
description: Bateman's pub with genteel East Midlands rustic feel inside. Looks nice with a clear cast of locals, guaranteed good beer and extensive range of whiskies. (added January 2022)

name: PIG n FALCON
description:
City: St Neots
description: Ale house with a lived in feel. 8 ales and 4 ciders, good range of bottles. Occasional live music. Distinctive and with a reasonably well designed layout that it seems worth a try to us. (added January 2022)

name: The Reindeer
description:
City: Saxon Street
description: Watch out for very limited open hours. Friday and Saturday evenings in winter, weekday evenings in summer and afternoons Saturday Sunday in summer. Why the fuss? A large selection of pub memorabilia and breweriana from cigarette cards to pub signs. Information is thin on the ground but ignore the handful of reviews if you're in the area, give it a try. In the Good Beer Guide. (added January 2022)

name: The Bank Micropub
description:
City: Willingham
description: Effective looking micropub with exposed brick, host of ales and some community events. Compact space yet high ceilings creates a degree of atmosphere. Almost universally well reviewed. (added January 2022)

name: The Mere Inn
description:
City: Alsager
description: A Joule's pub which means traditional rustic/but quite upright decor, and a drinks focus. Sounds good to us. Warm wooden fittings and red upholstery, some interesting corners and spaces. Worth a look. (Added January 2022)

name: Bhurtpore Inn
description:
City: Aston
description: A large pub with several rooms, some of which look excellent, unspoilt and traditional. Great reviews attest to its quality. An ever-present in the good beer guide too. (added January 2022)

name: The Poachers Inn
description:
City: Bollington
description: An unspoilt village pub near hiking trails and with the audience to match. Family run freehouse with guest ales, fireplace and comfortable unfussy surroundings. Looks good and very well reviewed. (Added January 2022)

name: Hops Belgian Style Cafe Bar
description:
City: Crewe
description: Choice of paint notwithstanding, there is a hint of the Belgian café about the arrangement, while the beers certainly compensate for those shortcomings. Worth a look at least. (added January 2022)

name: The White Lion
description:
City: Disley
description: Just enough personalisation to stand out as worth a look. Some community events and good range of cask ales tip the balance. Worth a look, at least. (added January 2022)

name: Helter Skelter
description:
City: Frodsham
description: Modern, friendly looking micropub with 8 handpumps, occasional live music upstairs. Great reviews. Could be worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: Swan with Two Nicks
description:
City: Little Bollington
description: Looks to have just enough of interest. Idllyic rural setting and large brick building, the bar area and surrounding space looks homely and communal with unspoilt table. Food available but the places aren't set, if that gives you some idea. (added January 2022)

name: The Wharf
description:
City: Macclesfield
description: A distinctive bar area with red paint and details, and thoroughbred simple communal and social Northern pub with cosy space aside it. On the Good Beer Guide, multi-award winning, looks great. (added January 2022)

name: The Black Lion
description:
City: Nantwich
description: Traditional pub with half-timberframing, wattle-and-daub walls among Nantwich's equally historic Welsh Row. Creaking floorboards and uneven surfaces. Heating stove adds to the character. Looks interesting and worth a try. Well Reviewed. (added January 2022)

name: The Ferry Tavern
description:
City: Penketh
description: Interesting river and canalside setting, find black beams and a market town type trade inside. Looks OK, with a huge whisky selection and large range of real ales to fallback on if not. (added January 2022)

name: The Beer Emporium
description:
City: Sandbach
description: The typical micropub/alehouse with pump clips and beer mats festooned everywhere, but pleasant paint and furniture choices offer warm hues. Product is of course vastly superior to most. Looks good, well reviewed. (added January 2022)

name: Willeymoor Lock Tavern
description:
City: Willeymoor Lock
description: Pleasingly unspoilt simple and familiar canalside pub popular with walkers and boaters. Good beer guide inclusion. (added January 2022)

name: The Foresters Arms
description:
City: Winterley
description: Not every pub should be listed just through having blackened beams, low ceilings and horse brasses. The shape of the rooms and general ambience plays arguably a bigger role. Information is incomplete about this place, but the Good Beer Guide inclusion and more rural setting tilts us towards thinking this is worth a look. (added January 2022)

name: The Fat Pig
description:
City: Exeter
description: A decent looking all-rounder with a personal and homely touch, seemingly good food along with an up to date range of ales covering most bases. (added February 2022)

name: Rising Sun Inn Launceston
description:
City: Altarnun
description: Rural Cornish pub that has nevertheless been modernised. Slate floors and exposed bricks, a shame about the dining areas which looks stark and unhomely. No reason to go then? Far from it, the low ceilings, wood strips and cosy bar area still give the impression of a pub well worth visiting with a space for a drink. Has featured in the Good Pub Guide. Excellent reviews too. (added February 2022)

name: The Old Ferry Inn
description:
City: Fowey
description: 400 year old inn with slate floor and unspoilt interior, whitewashed brick and nautical nik naks. Works as an inn and proper hostelry. Well reviewed with some local cider as well as ales. (added February 2022)

name: Bolingey Inn
description:
City: Perranporth
description: An unspoilt country in with a familiar homely feel, wooden furniture and carpets. Popular with locals for the food and social connection. Generally looks a good'un. (added February 2022)

name: The Queen's Arms
description:
City: Botallack
description: One-room traditional pub with blackened beams, stone walls and central bar, popular with walkers. A familiar feel. In the Good Beer Guide and well reviewed.(added February 2022)

name: Masons Arms
description:
City: Camelford
description: Poor reviews about food drag the place down but it does looks an interesting place with tin mining artfacts, tankards and collection of nik naks. Highly personalised and distinctive. Has to be worth trying for a beer. (added February 2022)

name: Star Inn
description:
City: Crowlas
description: Award winning roadside freehouse with a brewhouse, beers served directly from cask. A long bar with adjoining rooms. Relatively traditional and 'lived in'. Exceptionally well reviewed. (Added February 2022)

name: The Fountain Inn
description:
City: Mevagissey
description: Drinks-focused inn with slate floors, stone walls and low beamed ceiling. Historic photos on the wall, somewhat gentrified but tastefully. Smugglers history. Excellent reviews. Looks worth a try. (February 2022)

name: Lamp & Whistle
description:
City: Penzance
description: Must-visit pub/bar with one off decor, a labour of love. Be warned, landlord has an attitude problem. (added February 2022)

name: Countryman Inn
description:
City: Piece
description: Nice to see a rural pub still focused on its community and socialising, not just dragging in rich people from the towns for Sunday lunch. Traditional decor with stone fireplace. Cast iron cooking range. Live events. (added February 2022)

name: Blue Peter Inn
description:
City: Polperro
description: Up a steep flight of steps and overlooking the sea, this cosy low beamed pub is improved with its unusual souvenirs, local artwork and cast of regulars. Exceptionally well reviewed. Looks a must visit. (added February 2022)

name: The Castle Inn
description:
City: St Ives
description: Characterful wooden bar with character pouring from the walls, even with busy town trade it has retained a historic patina. Decent ale range and well reviewed. (added February 2022)

name: Mediensis
description:
City: Medias
description: City wall setting with plenty of wood on show, very interesting terrace besides the stone and wooden walls, and looks to have enough going on inside too. (added March 2022)

name: Queens Hotel
description:
City: Gosport
description: A local neighbourhood feel to a pub that retains a bit of character and a bit of an institution. (added March 2022)

name: Anglers Retreat
description:
City: Wintersett
description: A true tucked out of the way pub run in a distinctive and personal way, great reviews. (added March 2022)

name: Staff Of Life Inn
description:
City: Lydgate
description: Famous roadside pub with a history. Stone walled in with local ales, great reviews. (added March 2022)

name: B148 - The Place to Beer
description:
City: Lille
description: Beer mecca, modern but with some warm wood and ephemera on the walls, well reviewed and looks like a decent shout for beer lovers. (added March 2022)

name: Le Yéti
description:
City: Lille
description: Alt/rock/punk little hangout bar with table football and informal lived-in surroundings. Better value than some bars nearby too, apparently. (added March 2022)

name: Hostinec U Štamgastů
description:
City: Hukvaldy
description: One of those brewpubs where the pub looks really nice, cosy, personalised and welcoming? Seemingly so! (added March 2022)

name: The Plasterers Arms
description:
City: Norwich
description: Although the greywashing has stripped some of the character from the place, very good ales, local life and community feel leave this venue a tentative recommendation that nearly tipped the balance for us. (added March 2022)

name: La Pâte Brisée
description:
City: Lille
description: Exposed brick in this 2-floor estaminet with pub features and relatively informal layout. (added March 2022)

name: Le Chat qui Fume
description:
City: Lille
description: Cosy looking pub-restaurant, 'Estaminet' with wooden bar and informal setup. (added March 2022)

name: Estaminet de la Maison Commune 't Oude Wethuys
description:
City: Hondeghem
description: Excellent looking country pub restaurant with enough space to drink or eat. Exposed walls, warm lighting, historic features and an elegant bar area. Very well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: Estaminet Kasteelhof
description:
City: Cassel
description: Attractive Estaminet pub restaurant, informal enough for either food or drink, pleasingly rustic and homely in appearance. Well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: L'Absurde
description:
City: Lille
description: Information thin on the ground, formerly 'Au Tord-Boyard', but excellent reviews and tales of old Lille come into focus. (added March 2022)

name: Kunstkroeg De Doedelzak
description:
City: Kortrijk
description: Amazing looking art café with brooding lighting and antique furniture. Open 5-11 Friday + Saturday, 3.30-11PM Sunday. (added March 2022)

name: cafe wielsbeke
description:
City: Kortrijk
description: Very much a locals bar with interesting out-of-date Stella signage and fittings. Still, some cosy signs and in a town that's low on brown café options, this comes closer to the top than it would in other cities. (added March 2022)

name: Cassimir
description:
City: Kortrijk
description: Fun-looking café bar with some funky design, very well reviewed and excellent beer. (added March 2022)

name: Café Dudu
description:
City: Heule
description: A legitimate brown café albeit with a large bar area. Most of the elements are on show, good reviews too. (added March 2022)

name: La Ducasse
description:
City: Lille
description: Belgian café style corner bar with iconic blue neon sign. Some of the typical features on show in the bar, and space for a drink, not just food. Next time, we'll go! (added March 2022)

name: Planet Bar
description:
City: Tirana
description: Another tastefully decorated courtyard bar with some ambience, worth a look. (Added March 2022)

name: Libraria Bar
description:
City: Tirana
description: Reasonably eclectic looking all-rounder with high shelves for books, a large well-stocked bar and some personal touches too. Very well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: Whiskey Irish Alley
description:
City: Shkoder
description: Attractive looking whisky bar with wood and warm colours. Information thin on the ground but should be worth a go. (added March 2022)

name: Pub For Sale Podgorica
description:
City: Podgorica
description: A much more pubby appearance here with barrel ends, wooden furniture and rustic decor. Wasn't open on our visit though. Please try and report back. (added March 2022)

name: Gradska pivnica
description:
City: Podgorica
description: A proper pub with Czech beer, classic furniture. Looks small. Unfortunately closed on our visit. (April 2022)

name: Bulevar Džada
description:
City: Podgorica
description: Reasonably personalised Caffe Bar with good lagers available and bric a brac inside. Well rated. (added March 2022)

name: Klub Bocara
description:
City: Podgorica
description: By the forests around the back of the stadium, a leafy terrace which hosts occasional events and eclectic decor inside provides instant appeal, when twinned with the positive reviews. (added March 2022)

name: Beertija Pub
description:
City: Skopje
description: Play on words, 'Birtija' being an old coffee bar. Looks decent with shady lighting and music memorabilia. Neighbourhood pub with occasional bands. Seems to still be local. (added March 2022)

name: Van Gogh Bar
description:
City: Skopje
description: A shady late bar with nice patio out front and fairylights inside. Well reviewed. (added March 2022)

name: Brauerei + Gaststätte Alte Mühle
description:
City: Muhlendorf
description: Attractive old fashioned brewpub with tile steam heater in the centre of the room, simple pub-like surroundings. (added April 2022)

name: The Coronation
description:
City: Bedminster
description: Old fashioned ale house with a hint of boho personalisation. Extremely well reviewed and looks to be a must visit in the area. (Added April 2022)

name: Broomfield Tavern
description:
City: Coventry
description: Award-winning real ale pub with multiple handpumps, hops above the bar, dark wood and leather fittings. Looks very nice. (Added April 2022)

name: The Flask
description:
City: London
description: Beautified to fit the discerning needs of the wealthy residents of this neighbourhood, but nevertheless the core charm and appeal is retained in the layout and slightly dusky atmosphere of the interior. (Added April 2022)

name: The Glasshouse Stores
description:
City: London
description: Warning: SAM SMITH'S PUB
A classic boozer by appearance, with lacquered brown wood fittings and simple ale house layout. Historic with the usual throwback appeal. Love it or hate it. (Added April 2022)

name: IMPRFCTO
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Quirky and slightly artsy/experimental bar with some Belgian themes. Well rated and looks like a change from the norm. (added April 2022)

name: Le Kremlin
description:
City: Lille
description: Whether a Soviet/Russia themed bar can survive in a Western country after the Ukraine war is anyone's guess, but the fact is this does look really good. (Added April 2022)

name: Cock Hotel
description:
City: Wellington
description: A fully refurbed (in rustic alehouse style) pub run by Joule's that do a similar operation to Sam Smiths in terms of bringing back the old times, but without the draconian rules and whiff of desperation. This one looks like a tidily put together pub that over time will become even more lived in and characterful (added April 2022)

name: Hlucha Zmije
description:
City: Brno
description: 'Deaf Adder', this is a basement bar of some renown, very well reviewed, noted for good beer too. It was fine on our first visit but didn't quite have enough going on to justify an inclusion. (Added April 2022)

name: Hluchá zmije
description:
City: Brno
description: The other 'Deaf Adder' pub in Brno, again look out for a personalised dive bar with great beer options. (Added April 2022)

name: Ye Olde Bell and Steelyard
description:
City: Woodbridge
description: Oak beams, fireplaces, a generally historic tavern. Unfortunately received a lick of grey/blue paint but looks to still be intact enough. Decent selection of beers for a trad pub. (Added April 2022)

name: The Ill Repute
description:
City: Bristol
description: Adventurous boho-y cocktails and craft beer location with vintage furniture and retro stylings. Very well reviewed. (added April 2022)

name: The Hole in The Wall
description:
City: Brighton
description: Micropub with a striking exterior and compact, well-curated interior. Simple but warm and homely, familiar without falling into the generic/bland trap. Extremely well rate. (added April 2022)

name: Doctor Inks Curiosities
description:
City: Exeter
description: Cocktail bar with antiquey interior, verdant with hanging plants and lush hedonistic vibe. Well rated. (Added April 2022)

name: Old Timers Bar
description:
City: Exeter
description: A labour of love, beautiful little pub with recovered pub fittings and signage. Uncanny valley but in a quirky way. Looks good, and the reviews back that up. (Added April 2022)

name: Krčma - Nositeľ radu práce
description:
City: Kosice
description: Information thin on the ground but seems to be a Soviet themed pub? Got to be worth a look given the options in the city are limited. (Added April 2022)

name: Krcma pod Orechom
description:
City: Kosice
description: Log cabin cosiness and a degree of homely personalised pubgoing that Kosice is largely free of. (Added April 2022)

name: The Butchers Dog
description:
City: Driffield
description: Excellent looking micropub with jolly looking red and yellow signage outside. Inside more personalised and ad hoc, exposed brick and slanted ceiling. Very well rated. (added April 2022)

name: Galerie piva
description:
City: Prague
description: Bottleshop + bar with some tap options and wealth of options in the fridge. A few tables for sitting and drinking, and some street activity too.

While it was fairly enjoyable the threshold hasn't quite been met on our two visits.

We may give it another try.  (Added April 2022)

name: Church Inn
description:
City: Saddleworth
description: Very well put together country pub. While there is food the balance is struck well, remaining a pub not a dining room. Characterful bar area. Good reviews. (April 2022)

name: Hospůdka u Oráče
description:
City: Ostrava
description: A surprisingly rustic, countrified pub to be by a motorway close to an industrial city, but all the better for it, it would seem. Excellent reviews and it's not difficult to see why. (Added April 2022)

name: Hops Bar Tirana
description:
City: Tirana
description: Overall vibe was a little too lounge-bar for us, while the value for money here is poor, but nevertheless, it wasn't bad overall and could be worth a look if you want some superior beers. (added April 2022)

name: Irish Pub Five
description:
City: Ohrid
description: Your mileage with Irish pubs may vary, but the thematic elements are relatively ignorable here (particularly if you face your back to the Irish flag) which leaves a decent enough little pub with upholstered leather seats, an intimate interior with a bit of atmosphere and good range of beers in the fridge from German lagers to Balkan craft styles. Be warned the place has a markup for tourists in order that locals can afford it. You may find that the bill comes to more like Western prices. Overall, we didn't think this place warranted a position on our guide, but it is one to try when in the area. (added April 2022)

name: The Victoria
description:
City: Walsall
description: Characterful looking ale house with a lived in appearance, well-reviewed with a good reputation, clear local life on show too. (added April 2022)

name: Sawley Junction
description:
City: Long Eaton
description: Characterful venue with exceptionally good reviews, must be worth a look. (added April 2022)

name: Minibrowar Reden
description:
City: Chorzów
description: Characterful brewpub with visible brewkit, wood fittings and exposed brick. Looks really good. (added April 2022)

name: Ironbrush Pub Tirana
description:
City: Tirana
description: We passed by and this one looked an interesting option, differing from the usual conservatory lounge bar selection in the city. Well reviewed, worth a look! (Added April 2022)

name: Bar-Kafe " Albert " Vila "Shani" rr. e Durrësit
description:
City: Tirana
description: Down as temporarily closed on Google but was open as we passed by on April 2022. Looks interesting and different from the typical Tirana conservatory lounge bars. (added April 2022)

name: Craftbeer Lodge
description:
City: Freiburg
description: Modern craft bottle shop and bar with exceptionally good reviews. (added April 2022)

name: Spricc Romkocsma
description:
City: Szombathely
description: A provincial ruin bar, we tried to visit but it was unusually quiet and when we tried later on it closed, presumably due to lack of custom. The ruin bar aesthetic was minimal and it more resembled a lounge bar. Perhaps one day we'll try it again. With limited options in the town you may wish to take a closer look (added May 2022)

name: Kétmedve Söröző
description:
City: Szombathely
description: Looks like a decent beer focused pub with amenities and games, some wood fittings, decent reviews. (added May 2022)

name: Sörpatika Pub és Pizzéria
description:
City: Szombathely
description: A very pubby pub, with bench seating, typical wooden seating, great reviews, not too foodie despite the pizza in the title. Looks fairly cosy too. (added May 2022)

name: Jobb Mint Otthon Söröző/Borozó
description:
City: Szombathely
description: Excellent looking traditional pub/wine-bar intact with kind service and a range of bottles. (added May 2022)

name: Mona Lisa
description:
City: Komárom
description: A pub worth seeking out in this border town which appears to have secured piles of Pilsner Urquell merchandise to decorate (and stock) a small bar. Very well reviewed with few complaints, seems fairly 'pubby' inside. Worth a look? (added May 2022)

name: Vinyl & Cafebar K
description:
City: České Budějovice
description: Homely bar decorated with musical nik naks. Looks refurbished with typical Czech arches, but some personalisation. Very well reviewed. (added May 2022)

name: Hostinec Na Šumavě
description:
City: České Budějovice
description: Images in short supply but what there is looks interesting. Unspoilt true Czech pub with some decoration and character. Good reviews (Added May 2022)

name: Restaurace U Podkovy
description:
City: České Budějovice
description: A throwback pivnice with familiar wood strip fittings renowned for its steaks and old time atmosphere. On a first visit in May 2022 it certainly was authentic but didn't blow us away. Worth another try though. (added May 2022)

name: Barell bar
description:
City: Cesky Krumlov
description: It's a small town, so choose wisely, this may be one of the more active, atmospheric bars in town, it seems to be fairly informal and rocky which makes sense from previous experience. Good reviews too. (Added May 2022)

name: The Blue Bell Inn
description:
City: Kettlewell
description: A historic Yorkshire 'hikers pub' that has retained its social character and rural charm despite the decades of churn and is one of the better pubs in a village with otherwise more gentrified and bland options. (Added May 2022)

name: Peadar O'Donnell's
description:
City: Derry
description: Superb looking Irish pub with an appearance you could almost conjure without seeing a single actual picture of the pub. Very well reviewed, looks great. (added May 2022)

name: six d.o.g.s
description:
City: Athens
description: Atmospheric courtyard bar with high walls and festooned lighting. (Added May 2022)

name: Zum Franziskaner
description:
City: Stockholm
description: More towards a restaurant, however this place specialises in tapped Franconian beers with a selection that would make any pub even in Franconia blush. The bar area and surroundings look pleasantly pubby but we hope it isn't too formal. (added May 2022)

name: U Lasíků
description:
City: Unetice
description: Highly rated pub serving the village's local beers with a genteel, timeless look. Clean but pleasant warm shades and personalised elements. Known for its quiches - if you like that sort of thing (yuck) (Added May 2022)

name: The Gas Lamp
description:
City: Manchester
description: Basement bar with well-reputed beer selection and some atmosphere with tiled brickwork and lamp lights. On a first visit we weren't totally sold but prepared to give this another try (Added May 2022)

name: Frau Dietrich
description:
City: Linz
description: Reasonable looking cocktail bar with brick interior, shady with vaulted ceiling. Well reviewed. (Added May 2022)

name: Badcafe Linz
description:
City: Linz
description: Basement vaults with exposed brickwork and small stage for jazz and piano. Looks small, but well reviewed. (Added May 2022)

name: Freizeitstüberl Asten
description:
City: Linz
description: An incredible looking cabin type bar stacked with personalised nik naks and character. The reviews tell all. Have to go. (Added May 2022)

name: Kilele Music Cafe
description:
City: Kecskemét
description: An atmospheric looking venue with exposed brick and live music acts, pretty well reviewed and in a town like this, has to be worth a look in the evening. (added June 2022)

name: U Dragouna
description:
City: Prague
description: Visited in October 2024. Wood strip panelled old-time drinking den, even Branik fronted. Compact and a social focus - some musicians, groups of friends. Entirely locals and fairly priced. Overall it wasn't far off an inclusion, as it represents a dying breed of pubs, but didn't quite stand out enough.

name: Green Devil's Absinth Bar & Shop
description:
City: Prague
description: As advertised, expect green lights and the shady Alchemist lab type interior. Very well reviewed. Very likely to be touristy but that doesn't always mean it's a bad thing. (added June 2022)

name: Taberna Basaras
description:
City: Bilbao
description: Cracking looking Taberna Characterful, homely, plenty of room for socialising and drinking . Personalised with worn in wooden decor. (added June 2022)

name: Pod Šimlem
description:
City: Sviadnov
description: Kocsma type rustic roadside pub with a village atmosphere. Big beams, football scarves and an all-purpose feel. Almost made the cut on our visit but I think it would be best visited on a busy winter evening. Worth popping to if you're in the area. (Added October 2024)

name: Obester Winery
description:
City: Budapest
description: Locally known well reviewed Borozo, these weird hybrids of wine bars and pubs. Space for all here, it seems. Honest and simple but with a fair choice too. Very well reviewed. (added June 2022)

name: The Stanley Arms Hotel
description:
City: Wildboarclough
description: Isolated characterful looking rural Inn with rooms and classic country pub. Well reviewed. (added June 2022)

name: Naštartované retro
description:
City: Bratislava
description: Retro Kavarna in crumbling but stylish building. The old days are preserved here, and it looks pretty funky. Very well reviewed.

UPDATE - On our first visit we enjoyed some of the retro decor, decent beers too but wasn't enough going on, particularly in atmosphere to deserve an inclusion (Added June 2022)

name: Spinners Arms
description:
City: Adlington
description: Two pubs called Spinners in such a small town is a perverse way of trying to drive a pub researcher mad. This does appear to be the one worthy of interest, however why not pop up the road to Top Spinners too? (Added June 2022)

name: Blakes of the Hollow
description:
City: Enniskillen
description: An exciting looking pub. Deep brown wood panels, tiled floor, simple seating. Cosy corners. (Added June 2022)

name: The Wheatsheaf
description:
City: Falkirk
description: Wood panelled intimate boozer that looks to be a standout for the region, very well reviewed. (Added June 2022)

name: Stormbird
description:
City: London
description: Personalised, fairly unpretentious beer specialist pub adorned with Belgian brewery signage and a nice warm glow to the place. (added June 2022)

name: White Lion
description:
City: Westhoughton
description: A preserved interior with curved bar and tiled floor. Decent reviews too, local life to be found no doubt even if it may not be to everyone's tastes. (added June 2022)

name: The Pigs Nose Inn
description:
City: East Prawle
description: A big budget concept pub by normal standards, particularly rural standards. Very atmospheric looking with an open space stuffed with decorations supported by blackened beams and a characterful bar area with oak barrels. A must-see if in the area. (added June 2022)

name: Mansel Arms
description:
City: Porthrhyd
description: Roadside pub with a distinctly local crowd and homely appearance set up for some events and gigs. Extremely well reviewed. (added June 2022)

name: The Holy Inadequate
description:
City: Stoke-on-Trent
description: Excellent looking ale house by the railway and main-road, but outside the centre of town. Classic appearance and instantly welcoming look. Excellent reviews. Silly name. (added June 2022)

name: The Greyhound
description:
City: Newcastle-under-Lyme
description: Cosy cask ale pub with cushioned seats, some live events, social space, welcoming. (added June 2022)

name: The Albert
description:
City: Newcastle-under-Lyme
description: Really lovely looking homely neighbourhood pub with cushioned seating and intimate social space. The sort that should be so common yet more infrequent to find. (added June 2022)

name: The Baker's Arms
description:
City: Cheadle
description: Great looking pub with warm appearance, leather upholstered niches and chequered tile floor. (added June 2022)

name: Gitane
description:
City: Ghent
description: Belgian café with strong brown café vibes, exposed beams, browns and blacks, traditional interior and lots of Belgian ales. (added June 2022)

name: Held-Bräu Robert Polster
description:
City: Ahorntal
description: Classic Franconian gasthof with glazed tile floor, communal seating space and beer garden. Genteel and social. (added June 2022)

name: RÖSLA - Marktplatz Kneipe
description:
City: Burgkunstadt
description: A proper Kneipe. Market town pub that's unspoilt and hasn't been given over to the usual games, fruit machines and sport totally either. The reviews attest to that. Looking forward to visiting. (added June 2022)

name: Red Lion
description:
City: Cotherstone
description: Information thin on the ground but all we have indicates an unspoilt village pub with a passionate following. (added June 2022)

name: The Sekforde
description:
City: London
description: Understated but stylish traditional pub refit that looks well worth a look.  On our first visit we enjoyed it but needed a bit more of a personal appearance to compliment the great raw materials (added June 2022)

name: Špunka Old Barrel Pub
description:
City: Panevėžys 
description: Unpretentious drinking den for craft beer and socialising. Great reviews. Looks good. (added June 2022)

name: Herkus Kantas
description:
City: Klaipėda
description: Artsy bar with huge impressive lights and space, bikes on the wall. Courtyard and archway leading to the pub. Great reviews. (Added June 2022)

name: Seklyčia prie uosio
description:
City: Panevėžys
description: Intriguing cabin for Kvass and ales, key theme with keys nailed into tree trunks, cosy wooden space and attractive bar area. Nice reviews. (Added June 2022)

name: U Báby
description:
City: Prague
description: A decent looking lived-in fourth grade boozer. Unpretentious with a little cult following. Branik on tap which tells you what you need to know. A love or hate place, we suppose. (added June 2022)

name: Restaurace U Bohemky
description:
City: Prague
description: 4th grade pajzl/putyka Staropramen dive bar which acts as a Bohemians pub, big kangaroo print on the wall. A smoky, intimidating typical time-stood-still drinking hole with a cult following. A love or hate place but no denying it offers a slice of the 1980s/90s.
(Added June 2022)

name: Hospůdka Parukářka
description:
City: Prague
description: Nice looking lived-in, pubby Krcma type park pub with indoor and outdoor attractions. Looks good, decent reviews too. (added June 2022)

name: Café Gijs de Rooy
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Characterful corner pub that shows a bit more versatility and pubbyness than the usual brown cafe while still having some interesting characterful interior features. (Added July 2022)

name: De Drie Dorstige Herten
description:
City: Utrecht
description: Revivalist little beer café with a stripped back appearance, almost like a Dutch answer to a micropub. (added July 2022)

name: The Shipwright's Arms
description:
City: Hollowshore
