description: Truly characterful cosy, lived in shoreside Inn with blackened beams, cushioned seats and old time character. Very well reviewed, no surprise. (Added July 2022)

name: Yew Tree Inn (Cauldon)
description:
City: Cauldon
description: A truly special looking pub, something of a one-off with its antiques and layout. A must-visit one day. (Added July 2022)

name: The Crumplehorn Inn & Mill
description:
City: Polperro
description: Picturesque pub with a watermill and unspoiled, relatively ungentrified characterful interior that looks charming and cosy. Well reviewed. (Added July 2022)

name: Gaststätte Wochinger Brauhaus
description:
City: Traunstein
description: Picturesque brauhaus/pub-restaurant with warm interior and classic Wirtshaus type decor. (Added July 2022)

name: THE FROGGY BLUES - Café bar
description:
City: Boulogne-sur-Mer
description: A typically bizarre theme for this pub lends it a surreal frivolity while at the same time moving dangerously close to seaside tat. However, overall it looks like there's enough here to be excited about including the community events and drinks selection. (added July 2022)

name: Cafe the Minds
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: Interesting looking and well reviewed alternative bar which is popular with punks and metalheads - as far as that contingent exists in central Amsterdam. Looks fun either way. (Added July 2022)

name: Beer Temple
description:
City: Amsterdam
description: On the craft-beer end of the bar going spectrum, this is worth marking down when in Amsterdam if you've had enough of brown cafés and Belgian beers (although why on earth you ever would is anyone's guess). (Added July 2022)

name: CAFE WOLF
description:
City: Graz
description: Cult live music venue which sits curiously with a more elegant, refined classic café bar interior. The great reviews are intriguing and it should be place to check out. (Added July 2022)

name: 15.000 Hops
description:
City: Barakaldo
description: Narrow beer café with wide choice of craft and classics, personalised alternative/punky decor, clearly worth a look and well reviewed. (Added July 2022)

name: Mendi taberna
description:
City: Barakaldo
description: Long running pintxos bar with classic wooden bar top historic tiling and framed photographs. (added July 2022)

name: The White Swan
description:
City: Stokesley
description: Fab-looking unspoilt Yorkshire village pub with attracting beams, bar area and social spaces. Unpretentious and very well reviewed. Looks good. (added July 2022)

name: The Green Man
description:
City: Stokesley
description: Micropub with reddish brown interior somewhere between café, alehouse and pub taking in local ales and a good range of Belgian options with it. Well reviewed. (Added July 2022)

name: Café De Pieper
description:
City: Broek op Langedijk
description: Attractive exterior as this corner hut leads to a typical brown café interior with rustic seating and historic character. (added July 2022)

name: Café de Stad
description:
City: Utrecht
description: A simple brown café with familiar, if not totally outstanding decor, however the promise of live music could elevate it, and reviews suggest that is the case. Worth a look. (added July 2022)

name: The Goodmanham Arms
description:
City: Goodmanham
description: Fab 'East England' rural pub with original tiling and rustic furniture complimented with sympathetic farm decor. Really outstanding looking venue as reviews appear to confirm. (added July 2022)

name: Tandle Hill Tavern
description:
City: Tandle Hill
description: Attractive unspoilt country boozer with a social look to it, not all consigned to dining by any means. Well reviewed too. (Added July 2022)

name: St John Inn
description:
City: St John
description: Lovely homely inn with a traditional rustic feel, unspoilt and characterful. Attractive garden with a lovely setting. Great reviews. (added July 2022)

name: The Gladstone Arms
description:
City: Combs Ford
description: A truly cracking looking village pub with more beer choices than normal, attractive beer garden and cosy, personalised and unpretentious interior. Looks like a must-visit and reviews attest to that. (Added July 2022)

name: The Nook
description:
City: Holmfirth
description: An on-site brewery in a tall stone townhouse, with basic but charming looking interior with tiled flooring. Looks like a community pub with plenty of amenities. A must visit. (added July 2022)

name: The Hut
description:
City: Dublin
description: An unspoilt classic Victoriana pub with partions, fine wood carvings and cosy, social drinking den feel. Outside the centre so more local life to be found. (added July 2022)

name: The Hermit Inn
description:
City: Burley Woodhead
description: A traditional inn with some stripped back unchanged appeal, that seems to be worth a look. Located high up near Ilkley Moor. (Added July 2022)

name: The Salutation Inn
description:
City: Ham
description: All-round excellent looking country inn with lovely garden, basic genteel interior with exposed stone, and very good range of ales and ciders. A must visit. (Added July 2022)

name: The Railway Inn, Ketton
description:
City: Ketton
description: Almost exclusively adored village pub with rustic wooden interior and simple decoration. (added July 2022)

name: Jakes Ale House
description:
City: Romiley
description: Micro-pub with a warm social feel, newly built but seems to be adequately cosy. Ale choices clearly superior and great reviews are convincing. (Added July 2022)

name: Cerveseria Vaso de Oro
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Touristy but popular and not unlikable institution. A long bar for tapas dishes and own brewed beer. City prices and a patrician type setup that will appeal to some people. Worth a look but didn't quite tip the balance for us. (added July 2022)

name: The Criterion Bar
description:
City: Stornoway
description: Local life and folk nights are the key appeal to the place. If intimate socialising in a locals pub doesn't sound your thing, steer clear. (Added July 2022)

name: The Wonky Pear
description:
City: Congleton
description: Micropub/cafe with slightly affected shabby chic with faux-antique design, may split opinions. Good reviews and great drinks options on the other hand look to be in its favour. (added July 2022)

name: Prince Of Wales
description:
City: Congleton
description: Another beautiful Joule's pub with labour of love olde-world interior. Looks genuinely great. (Added July 2022)

name: The Cheshire Ring
description:
City: Hyde
description: Appearances may be deceptive. Run-down exterior but a cosy lived-in interior offering a wider range of ales on cask, keg and bottled. Well reviewed with a clear community value. Go with an open mind I suppose! (Added July 2022)

name: The Angel
description:
City: London
description: A compact Sam Smiths pub with some attractive interior features including original partition, Art Deco area styling and seafaring artwork. Views of the Thames. (Added July 2022)

name: Turner's Old Star
description:
City: London
description: Attractive corner boozer with original wooden bar, stained glass and attractive Edwardian styling. A little opened out and airy, but seems worth a look. (Added July 2022)

name: Café Pardaf - craft beer & traditionals
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Colourful Deco-influenced bar with curved bar area and a more upbeat look, complimented by a modern selection of beers to go with the usual. Well recommended, but let's see. (Added July 2022)

name: Pivo Västergatan - en tjeckisk ölbar
description:
City: Malmö,
description: A seriously impressive looking Czech style pivnice that has gone for authenticity over tourist tattyness. A great selection of beers from Czechia properly pulled. Dedication to the art. (Added July 2022)

name: The Fish Market Cafe
description:
City: Antwerp
description: While not totally convinced from what we've seen, continual recommendations have kept us interested to find out what this is like. (Added July 2022)

name: Biercafe De Jordaan
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Very well reviewed beer café and locals pub a little off the tourist centre. Along with contemporary beer options there's a nice homely looking space with attractive bar area facing the entrance. (Added July 2022)

name: Clock (The Cafe)
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Simple brown café with leather backed bench seats and parquet floor. Something straightforwardly appealling about it without being flashy. Obviously local rather than touristy, also. (Added July 2022)

name: Café Boekowski
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Moving away from the awful pun, this bookish café bar has a charming appearance - and no shortage of books - piano, sofa and lampshades provide a loungey feel, but this is supplemented by some typically nice beers. Not a brown café, but a bar of contemporary relevance that has a bit of character to it (Added July 2022)

name: den Tripel
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Brand new 'old style' brown café in a well-to-do district of Antwerp, well financed with tank Stella and quite clearly a few Tripels. Looks fairly classy as well as traditional and worth a look. Closed on weekends and opens mid-afternoon onwards. (Added July 2022)

name: Café Bezemsteeltje
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Witch-themed with dozens of little witch models strewn about the place. Characterful with exposed brick and little niches. Perhaps spoilt by games machines and loud music? We'll have to see. (Added July 2022)

name: Cfou
description:
City: Antwerp
description: A change of speed, this bohemian bar is more shabby chic than brown cafe, but with its greenery and some preserved tiling it does seem intriguing, further still with the excellent reviews. (Added July 2022)

name: Kropsburg
description:
City: Karlsruhe
description: A 'lokal', that is to say an unpretentious but fairly characterful venue with genteel decor and neighbourhood life. Very well reviewed. (added July 2022)

name: Old Chapel Pub
description:
City: Karlsruhe
description: Looks a fairly solid bet with dark wood fittings and a familiar saloon bar feel with stools and leaning posts. Well reviewed too. (added July 2022)

name: Le Coin du Diable
description:
City: Brussels
description: Classic corner Belgian café with some traditional stylings but an international flavour. Well reviewed (Added July 2022)

name: Le Wappers
description:
City: Brussels
description: A nice white/light brown traditional bar area and good reviews regarding atmosphere and beer options make this appealing. Let's see... (Added July 2022)

name: The Hacienda Bar
description:
City: Dublin
description: Worth a look, very well reviewed cosy hangout with pool and darts, seemingly more local life. (Added August 2022)

name: Cafe Den Benghel
description:
City: Hamme
description: All the classic features of the typical Belgian brown café are on show, with great reviews attesting to the beer options as well. Cosy and gezellig, with small town type environment. (added August 2022)

name: Plume of Feathers
description:
City: Castlemorton
description: Rural setting with large garden overlooking fields, cosy interior with exposed beams and rustic bar area, which appears to have been modernised to an extent. Overall though, worth a look. (Added August 2022)

name: Elephant Cafe
description:
City: Mechelen
description: Conveniently located brown café that has survived despite the tumultuous times. Tiled floor, greens and browns provide a familiar yet still individually distinctive setting for Belgian beer enjoyment. (Added August 2022)

name: Artillery Arms
description:
City: Ramsgate
description: A little neighbourhood boozer with two distinctive features, firstly its stained glass and secondly the military theme, which may be cloying to some, but is nevertheless a different pitch. Very well reviewed with several cask ale options. (added August 2022)

name: The Golden Lion
description:
City: Padstow
description: Superb reviews for this whitewashed stone inn with attractive wooden bar area and rustic feel inside, looks like a must visit if in the area. (Added August 2022)

name: Hagglers Corner
description:
City: Sheffield
description: Charming little art space and bar with attractive courtyard and niches to enjoy. Very well reviewed and a change from the usual offering in the city. (Added August 2022)

name: Le Perroquet
description:
City: Brussels
description: Corner café with tropical bird theme including interesting stained glass elements. Arcadey feel which didn't fully convince first time around, but is worth another look. Useful location if combining a bar crawl. (added August 2022)

name: Cafe St Hubert
description:
City: Ghent
description: A must visit brown café opening mid-afternoons which has great reviews. All images of the place make it look personalised, homely and distinctive, which could make an ideal winter months stop off. Breaks up a walk into Ghent from the station too. (Added August 2022)

name: Bar Belien
description:
City: Ghent
description: Candlelit late bar with a younger crowd, decent drinks options across the range, good reviews. Seems to be occasional music sessions, a brooding hangout without being overly pretentious. (Added August 2022)

name: Moca Vintage Cafè & Hairdresser
description:
City: Ghent
description: Hidden down an arcade, we got a look at it but didn't stay. Tables sit aside stalls of antique goods, a maze of routes, cluttered and certainly nothing if not distinctive. The hairdresser to the back adds another typically Belgian quirk. We will need to take a closer look at this. Very well reviewed. (Added August 2022)

name: Café Backdoor
description:
City: Ghent
description: Beautiful arty, music focused pub with warm hues and cosy looking niches. Very interested to go here, with local life and excellent reviews. (Added August 2022)

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Clitheroe
description: Unspoilt Lancashire pub with communal bench seating and traditional surroundings. Well reviewed and looks a good bet with real ales. (Added September 2022)

name: The Alma Inn
description:
City: Scarborough
description: Quirky throwback looking pub, unspoilt and rather lost in time. Seemingly in a good way. (Added September 2022)

name: SCHOLAR BRAUEREI Craft Beer
description:
City: Göttingen
description: Aka 'Nautibar', we won't dignify that rubbish name and will use Scholar Brauerei instead. Personalised interior with lampshades, tiles and a living room type appearance, very unusual for this sort of thing in Germany. Very well reviewed. (Added September 2022)

name: The Jolly Drayman Pub and Hotel
description:
City: Gravesend
description: Charming traditional pub downstairs at this hostelry with low-slung ceiling, wooden beams and unspoilt communal areas. Well reviewed which seems unsurprising. (Added September 2022)

name: The Little Pack Horse
description:
City: Bewdley
description: A traditional pub with impressively chunky bar, niches and exposed beams. Something of a classic seemingly. Ale selection seems good too. (Added September 2022)

name: Giełda Piw Pub
description:
City: Wroclaw
description: Modern but quite tasteful and sympathetic pub focusing on good craft beers in warm and fairly homely surroundings. Sounds good to us, and reviews appear to agree. (Added September 2022)

name: Na Blbým Místě
description:
City: Brno
description: Have walked past many times without going in, but it honestly seems like a nice hideyhole, particularly if busier. Proper pub with social space, telly, games and unpretentious surroundings. Position by a staircase is quite memorable too. (Added September 2022)

name: Nálevna U Leona
description:
City: Brno
description: File under down n dirty dive bar. Visit for informal and unpretentious late drinks and fun. Personalised decor, exposed brick, decent pace to things. Has to be worth a look if you like that. (Added September 2022)

name: Eisgrub-Bräu
description:
City: Mainz
description: Brewpub with exposed brick vaults and shiny brewkit that looks quite inviting. Reviews are mixed as these places tend to be, but it is worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: Tram 3
description:
City: Antwerp
description: Fun-looking bar exploiting an old townhouse to make a bohemian versatile bar with roof terrace and high-ceilinged bright bar space. Have had a peek and it seemed worth a try to us! (Added September 2022)

name: Szamos kocsma
description:
City: Szeged
description: Chunky cabin-like pub in true kocsma fashion with large beer garden. Seems a decent all-rounder and quite homely. (Added September 2022)

name: Pivaren Lemon - Craft Beer
description:
City: Bratislava
description: Nice looking homely craft beer bar which has a balance of small brewed lager and ales. Did we see a picture of a pub parrot too? (Added September 2022)

name: Chip N Ern Ale House
description:
City: Bingley
description: Cosy and well-reviewed micropub with traditional pub type charms on a smaller scale of course. On a first visit it was good but the clientele dragged it down substantially. Hopefully a one-off and we will try it another time. (Added September 2022)

name: Utopia
description:
City: Paris
description: Simple intimate space for live music and evening bar going. Surroundings warm, brown, low key and simple. Looks good and well reviewed. (Added September 2022)

name: Ton Air de Brest
description:
City: Paris
description: Less typical late-bar with a music focus and informal scuzzy dive quality that appeals. Breton focused with Brittany beers and wares. Some pirate decor in that spirit. (Added September 2022)

name: La Folie en Tête
description:
City: Paris
description: Music themed bar focused on drinks with a fair bit of memorabilia and clutter giving it a distinctive enough appearance. (Added September 2022)

name: Le Requin Chagrin
description:
City: Paris
description: A rather pubby looking Parisian bar with wood fitting and shuffleboards. Seems worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: Teddy's Bar
description:
City: Paris
description: Characterful bar with wood fittings, teddy bears (seems to work somehow) and warm lights. Well reviewed. (Added September 2022)

name: La Pomme D'eve
description:
City: Paris
description: Characterful little late night cocktail bar with live music cramped between a cloistered ceiling and vaults which are a very striking feature (Added September 202")

name: Le Piano Vache
description:
City: Paris
description: Characterful and clearly well loved, lived-in institution with live music, music posters and niches. (Added September 2022)

name: Le Piston Pélican
description:
City: Paris
description: Grand café styling with ornate fittings, pillars, lanterns and sweeping seating arrangement. At the same time, looks small enough to be intimate. Well reviewed, we would take a trip here. (Added September 2022)

name: La Ruée vers l'Orge
description:
City: Paris
description: Famed beer mecca with shelves of bottles and exposed brick vaults. Furniture disappointingly ho-hum but most other basis seem to be well covered. (added September 2022)

name: La Taverne de l'Olympia
description:
City: Paris
description: Local institution with exposed beams, classical setup, beer and social focus with some food available. International bank notes decorating the bar. Not everyone's cup of tea apparently but surely worth a try.  (added September 2022)

name: N U M B E R • F I F T E E N
description:
City: Lytham St Annes
description: Unusual venue with plush decor, raised area. Victorian gin palace vibes mixed with slight carnival style hysteria to the colour. Live music, cask ales. Looks well worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: The Commercial Inn
description:
City: Dunfirmline
description: An unusually friendly looking 'pubby pub' that could be more at home in an English market town, but nevertheless welcome here with more real ales than usual too. (Added September 2022)

name: Jolly Brewmaster
description:
City: Cheltenham
description: Dramatic curved bar decorate with hops in otherwise cosy and familiar lived-in neighbourhood pub, excellent reviews for ales and social quality. Looks pretty good. (Added September 2022)

name: National Trust - The Fleece Inn
description:
City: Bretforton
description: Extremely beautiful rustic heritage inn with genteel appeal, lovingly kept for decades on the Good Beer Guide. However, question mark over its succession when the owner retires? (Added September 2022)

name: The Wrong Bar
description:
City: Sofia
description: Popular looking down to earth pub with a nice garden. (Added September 2022)

name: Motor City Sofia
description:
City: Sofia
description: Well reviewed beer-focused drop in bar with some style, informal and a bit moody, looks worth a try anyway. (Added September 2022)

name: The Flying Dog Bar in Sofia
description:
City: Sofia
description: Beer-focused bar with excellent reviews, a little DIY in appearance. Not very well lit from how photos display the place, that may be an advantage. (Added September 2022)

name: Patches Blues Bar
description:
City: Sofia
description: Live music with personalised interior strewn with picture frames. Great reviews. Looks well worth a look. (Added September 2022)

name: Ретроспекция/Retrospection
description:
City: Sofia
description: Informal and slightly twee hangout spot with music, board games, computer games, books, niches and artwork. Very well reviewed and seems superior. (Added September 2022)

name: Vitamin B - Craft Beer Bar
description:
City: Sofia
description: Typical craft beer interior with plenty of drinks options, supplemented with what seems to be an atmospheric courtyard. (Added September 2022)

name: Bar Me
description:
City: Sofia
description: High ceilinged bar that looks refined and characterful without being plastic and pretentious. Most likely cocktail focused. (Added September 2022)

name: White Magic
description:
City: Borovets
description: Krcma type country cabin with wood-strip walls, personalised and very down to earth from appearances. Hockey memorabilia on the wall. Be warned this place will only open when it is tourist season. (Added September 2022)

name: L'âne sans queue
description:
City: Lyon
description: Quirky bar with artwork on an arched ceiling, modern and scuzzy touches too. Aperitivo, craft beer etc. Well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: The Star
description:
City: Oxford
description: Cracking looking neighbourhood pub with personalised decor and distinct identity. Decent looking beer choice, pool table, beer garden. (Added October 2022)

name: Kroegske ('t) Scheer
description:
City: Ostend
description: Difficult to know what to make of this place. Quirky and colourful, perhaps too foodie, too tacky, but at the same time looks very distinctive, and reviews are convincing enough. We'll see... (Added October 2022)

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Wilsden
description: A village pub that has maintained its pubby quality, a boozer rather than a dining room. Personalised with several hanging mirrors and signs. Well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: Království
description:
City: Prague
description: Attractively out of time 1970s hospoda diner that has a good reputation and whose name pops up too regularly to pass over. We're going here. (Added October 2022)

name: La Plata
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Classical tapas bar with tiled walls and barrels, great reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: The Cherub Inn
description:
City: Darmouth
description: Wattle-and-daub timber frame 3-storey pub restaurant with enough drinking and social space to be a candidate here, well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: Phil Carrolls Bar
description:
City: Clonmel
description: Seems to be an absolutely classic looking old Irish bar with superb reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: TWO SCHMUCKS
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Award winning cocktails in a casual bar with a host of framed artwork and photographs on the walls. (Added October 2022)

name: Locale Firenze
description:
City: Florence
description: Dramatic, lush and opulent award winning cocktail bar where the surroundings are as impressive as the cocktails themselves. Well reviewed. (Added October 2022)

name: The Cellars Alehouse
description:
City: Maidstone
description: Vaulted cellars host this very well reviewed alehouse that is surely worth a visit if in the area. (Added October 2022)

name: The Half Moon
description:
City: Oxford
description: Interesting mixed reviews but the place seems to be a well preserved stripped back ale house with a reassuringly old-school appearance. Has to be worth a look. (Added October 2022)

name: The Black Lion
description:
City: Hereford
description: Unsure how we missed this but a pleasant pub with preserved heritage features. May be slightly on the foody side but looks like there's plenty to enjoy. (Added October 2022)

name: The Flowing Tide
description:
City: Dublin
description: Very pleasant looking pub with some original niches, partitions and bench seating, personalised with nice decor, not too tacky either. Reviews are good rather than great which may be due to its central location - but surely worth a look. (Added October 2022)

name: The Lamb Inn
description:
City: Eastbourne
description: Historic low ceilinged pub with timber frame, large fireplace and heritage feel. Good reviews. Perhaps foody but still surely worth a try. Good reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: The Masons Arms
description:
City: Billinge
description: Truly lovely looking pub with plush upholstered seating, real ales, personalised interior and pleasant garden. Superb reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: Brasserie Thiriez
description:
City: Esquelbecq
description: Reportedly one of France's true beer and pub highlights. It looks the part with a superbly personalised and cosy looking interior. Amazing reviews. (Added October 2022)

name: The Magnet Freehouse
description:
City: Stockport
description: Ale house with some homely rooms and quite quirky arty personalisation which could work either way.  Good ales and ciders available. Overall, worth a try. (Added October 2022)

name: The Paper Mill Micropub
description:
City: Milton Regis
description: Very pleasant micropub with intimate space, red walls and rustic furniture. Good ales and cider, of course. Very good reviews. Has to be worth a try. (Added October 2022)

name: The Old Bookbinders Ale House
description:
City: Oxford
description: Stylised countryfied pub with musical and diner leanings while also rustic with tiles, a long bar and many real ales. Quite the curio. Very well reviewed. Looks a must visit. (Added October 2022)

name: Little 3
description:
City: Thirsk
description: Worn-in pub with attractive exposed beams, carpet and informal appearance. Live music, real ales and a bit of a golden glow to the place. May err a little bit to the tacky but worth a try at least. (Added October 2022)

name: The Bell & Jorrocks
description:
City: Frittenden
description: Superb looking village pub with an easy relaxed appearance, a pair of comfy worn in old shoes in pub form. Simple seating, hops above the bar, black beams and local artwork. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: The Black Boy
description:
City: Winchester
description: Amazing looking rustic pub with antiques shop. Terrific reviews, very characterful. Looks a probable 9/10 (Added November 2022)

name: The Kenton Pub
description:
City: London
description: Well reviewed off-beat redecoration of a classic corner pub, a little wacky but nothing too over the top. Still relevant and well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: The New Inn
description:
City: Pembridge
description: Looks an excellent traditional ale house with red paint, tankards, settles, looks potentially fairly small. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Craven Brew Co Tap Room
description:
City: Cross Hills
description: A taproom that takes a leave out of Kirkstall Brewery's book with recovered signage and tasteful worn in furniture. Check opening hours before visiting. (Added November 2022)

name: Pivovar a Hospoda Medlešice
description:
City: Medlešice
description: Excellent looking rustic village hospoda that is the taproom for the local brewery. Characterful and classically Czech. Worth a visit. (Added November 2022)

name: The Cellar Bar
description:
City: Batley
description: While on the towny side there seems to be some appeal to this classical market town tavern with some Victoriana/gin palace elements. Well reviewed and worth a look at least. (Added November 2022)

name: The Cornish Ancestor Micro Pub
description:
City: Callington
description: A very minimalist micropub with excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: The Star Inn, Vogue
description:
City: Vogue
description: A pub with some remaining character around the bar, a typical trad appearance with beams and pewter jugs, etc. Expanded elsewhere for functions, etc. (Added November 2022)

name: Cerveceria César
description:
City: Jaen
description: Popular local tapas bar with cheap plentiful portions of good classic food and typical beers. Looks casual and authentic. (Added November 2022)

name: The Garrison: Craft Beer House
description:
City: Jaen
description: Beer specialists in a little drinking den decked in beer ephemera. Perhaps a little on the ex-pat/theme pub side but also not so much that seems a problem. Worth a look. (Added November 2022)

name: The King William
description:
City: Milford
description: Riverside pub with a very traditional look. Exposed stone, low beams and several cask ales. Looks reasonably small and unspoilt too. Must return to try this out. (Added November 2022)

name: Krüger Eck
description:
City: Berlin
description: Magnificent looking corner kneipe with great reviews. Looks welcoming and diverse enough too. (Added November 2022)

name: P.EGAN Bar
description:
City: Moate
description: Highly rated and locally famous pub with a partly refurbished but still characterful look, most likely to be known for local life and social value. (Added November 2022)

name: Coach and Horses Inn
description:
City: Weatheroak Hill
description: A country inn which still seems to have retained some character, with attractive surroundings and a brick and beamed bar area, tiled flooring. Worth a try? (Added November 2022)

name: Jackson Stops Inn
description:
City: Stretton
description: A really super looking ale house of some character with tiled floor, rafters and homely decor, with some brighter concessions. Very well rated. (Added November 2022)

name: Zum Silbersack
description:
City: Hamburg
description: A cult kneipe from the late 1940s with wooden furniture, sporting memorabilia and preserved fixtures. Looks great and very well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: VINTAGE BAR - Rhumerie & Pub
description:
City: Bordeaux
description: A character retro-chic pub with cocktails and craft beers, looks relevant but characterful with it. Well rated. (Added November 2022)

name: Café Koops B.V.
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Attractive brown café that still seems relevant rather than a museum piece. Small and cosy, mid-brown with classic leaded windows and rustic seats. Well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: The White Swan
description:
City: Birmingham
description: Victorian heritage pub of great local renown. Looks great. Go before it closes, as there are rumours it may close for building works! (Added November 2022)

name: La Destilería
description:
City: Malaga
description: One of the city's foremost cocktail bars with a higher concept than most. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Speakeasy “The Pharmacy”
description:
City: Malaga
description: One of the city's premier cocktail spots with a higher concept than most. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Road House
description:
City: Malaga
description: Intriguing looking venue with a bit of a saloon type vibe from appearances. Only a visit will reveal all! (November 2022)

name: Bar los Mosquitos
description:
City: Cordoba
description: Authentic tapas bar with tiled walls, local life. Very well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: Taberna San Miguel Casa El Pisto
description:
City: Cordoba
description: Perhaps more pub-restaurant than bar, nevertheless, this authentic Taberna is stocked with bullfighting memorabilia and lived in character. (November 2022)

name: Café-Bar Casa Curioso
description:
City: Cordoba
description: A tapas bar with a difference, this one has gone the extra mile to add quirkyness and curiosity to the decor, otherwise looks like a pub-diner, fairly informal though. (Added November 2022)

name: Loop Bar & Records
description:
City: Granada
description: Late bar with vinyls and a vaguely alternative leaning. Well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: La Taberna de Kafka
description:
City: Granada
description: Tapas bar with the menu divided up by Kafka books. Quirky, but underneath the gimmick there appears to be a legitimate venue with good quality food and drink. (Added November 2022)

name: Bodeguilla "Casa Fuensanta”
description:
City: Granada
description: A wine focus to this Bodega style venue which looks reasonably informal too. (Added November 2022)

name: Bar Poë
description:
City: Granada
description: Ignore the yellow signage outside, come on in to this warm looking vibrant bar with a cosmopolitan flavour. Well reviewed. (Added November 2022)

name: Bar El Albergue
description:
City: Granada
description: Authentic very pubby tapas bar with wooden seating around a central bar area. Well known and well reviewed. (November 2022)

name: Taberna La Tana
description:
City: Granada
description: One of the city's authentic and well reputed tapas bars, this one with a bit more of a bodega/wine bar feel. (Added November 2022)

name: Bar Casa Julio 1947
description:
City: Granada
description: A must visit authentic tapas bar with tiled walls, exposed beams and typical service. Well reviewed given the location. (Added November 2022)

name: Bodegas La Mancha
description:
City: Granada
description: Wood-fronted heritage Bodega with classic interior and good reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Cafe Múnich
description:
City: Granada
description: Very well reviewed beer bar that branches out past the usual lager staples. Information thin on the ground but could be worth a look. (Added November 2022)

name: Pub Convent
description:
City: Almunecar
description: Very attractive taberna with a pubby bar area, leafy courtyard and plenty of money spent. Excellent reviews. (Added November 2022)

name: Ducks Inn
description:
City: Aberlady
description: Ignoring the drab hotel trappings (dining room/function suit etc), the bar seems a particular highlight with a cosy and personalised space that retains its social function. However, only a visit will confirm one way or another! (Added December 2022)

name: The Greyhound Inn
description:
City: Sutton Stop
description: Excellent looking well reviewed canalside pub. Personalised and lived in interior in an 1800s era stone building. Wood fittings, views of the canal, good cask ales. (Added December 2022)

name: Cleary's Pub
description:
City: Dublin
description: Unspoilt very well reviewed classic tavern with red paint, preserved signage and heritage artwork. Looks an absolute must-visit. (Added November 2022)

name: Šestajovický pivovar
description:
City: Sestajovice
description: Always nice to see a town brewery put as much attention into the venue as well. Quite pubby and clearly of community value. Worth a look. (Added December 2022)

name: Bira Ood
description:
City: Varna
description: A beer mecca with black bar area and walls of bottles, exceptional reviews for produce, and looks personalised enough. But is it good enough as a bar? We shall see. (Added December 2022)

name: Hospoda Kyčerka
description:
City: Velke Karlovice
description: Pub Restaurant with a wooden cabin feel (new rather than old) and lots of nik naks and mounted hunting ephemera up in the rafters. Seems worth a look. (Added December 2022)

name: The Old Bookshop
description:
City: Bedminster
description: Modern but quirky café bar with a piano fitted at the bar, broad range of beer. Will it break out of the generic? Looks like it has a fighting chance. Well reviewed. Worth a try? (Added December 2022)

name: Bank of Friendship
description:
City: London
description: A pleasingly well preserved boozer with sweeping angular wood-fit bar, personalised and lived-in interior. Seems well loved by locals. Worth a look? We'll try to get there. (Added December 2022)

name: Taberna Rincón del Cofrade
description:
City: Granada
description: Superb looking Taberna we unfortunately missed on our visit. Easter parade type decor, wonderful interior and great reviews. One to try! (Added December 2022)

name: The Waverley Bar
description:
City: Edinburgh
description: A local institution, small traditional bar with 60s posters, live music and communal seating. Great reviews, looks a classic. (Added December 2022)

name: El Jabali
description:
City: Martorell
description: A traditional bodega/taberna with a folky, rustic charm. Reviews are mixed but if you're in the area surely worth checking out for its distinctive features. (Added December 2022)

name: Taproom 27: A Hoppy Place
description:
City: Chisinau
description: Craft beer bar set in a large standalone building with a high roof, impressive beams and fairy lights. At ground level a hut-style aesthetic blends with the industrial chic ambience. 24+ taps covering craft and European classics. (Added December 2022)

name: Pub U Komárků
description:
City: Rohov
description: A super-looking village brewery, pub and social space in one. Very well reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: Minipivovar VLČEK Horažďovice
description:
City: Horazdovice
description: A minibrewery with some home spun charm and intimate cabin like interior. Chunky wood and stone. Worth a look? (Added December 2022)

name: The Vine Inn
description:
City: Manchester
description: Modernised but perhaps a worth a look. Not only for the attractive faienced signage that's been preserved, but for its own merit. (Added December 2022)

name: Peter Tavy Inn
description:
City: Tavistock
description: Traditional and relatively unspoilt country in with the usual low hanging beams, brasses and wooden settles. A hint of sprucing up here and there but not ruining the overall effect. A typical looking West Country rural pub with excellent reviews for atmosphere and meals. (Added December 2022)

name: Angel In The Fields
description:
City: London
description: Another super looking heritage pub with stained glass and preserved fixtures. It is a Sam Smiths pub however so bear in mind their usual draconian rules. (Added December 2022)

name: El Xampanyet
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Authentic and characterful tapas bar with the usual warm wood, cream walls and colourful tiles. Excellent reviews too. Worth a look! (December 2022)

name: Dr Stravinsky
description:
City: Barcelona
description: A pharmacy theme to this cocktail bar. It appears it stays just the right side of curiosity rather than cookie cutter. Well reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: Občerstvení KUFR
description:
City: Smrzovka
description: With virtually no online presence other than intrepid bar bloggers, this is a throwback station pub-restaurant with dartboard and social focus complimenting the food. Seems homely and unpretentious which is a major plus. Konrad beers available currently. (Added December 2022)

name: Petr Hauskrecht - Steam Brewery
description:
City: Brno
description: Their taproom, the Salanda only opens as part of the brewery tour but it looks beautiful, with a fond nostalgic design, and very well reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: Gallery Senk
description:
City: Bratislava
description: The reported new location for Hostinec Richtar Jakub. Lacks the atmosphere of the previous venue but the beers are there, and there is a gallery of artwork in a reasonably pubby setting (Added December 2022)

name: Station Inn
description:
City: Hull
description: A revamped traditional pub that is still suffering from poor legacy reviews but is now very well thought of for ales and atmosphere. We shall see... (Added December 2022)

name: Chase Inn
description:
City: Upper Wyche
description: An attractive homely looking country inn with low beams, warm wood, side rooms and cushioning. Decent range of ales, well reviewed. Worth a try! (Added December 2022)

name: Hospůdka U Černé kočky
description:
City: Teplice
description: An attractively unspoilt krcma type pub with chunky outdoor seating and wood strip interior. Seems unpretentious and splits opinion in that typical way. Worth a look? (Added December 2022)

name: Thirsty Scholar
description:
City: Manchester
description: Cult venue, ramshackle haven for ales and live events, check opening hours carefully before visiting and know what you're letting yourself in for to avoid disappointment. (Added December 2022)

name: Wheatsheaf Inn Llanhennock
description:
City: Llanhennock
description: Super reviews for this unspoilt rural Welsh pub. Personalised homely interior with a distinctive identity. Go before it's gone! (Added December 2022)

name: Princess of Prussia
description:
City: London
description: Classic old time boozer with wood fittings, large detailed mirrors and a simple boozer style bar with lounge to the rear. Well worth a look, and by London standards highly reviewed. (Added December 2022)

name: The Champion
description:
City: London
description: Sam Smiths boozer, however looks worth visiting for its beautiful interior. (Added December 2022)

name: The Anchor Inn, High Offley
description:
City: High Offley
description: Looks like a must visit simple rural, rustic country pub. Fishermen, bargegoers and caravaners use the pub frequently. Opening hours erratic but looks brilliant. (Added December 2022)

name: Tomney's Bar
description:
City: Moy
description: A cult favourite in the area, beautiful pub inside and out with a traditional heritage appearance, distinctive identity and very positive reviews. (Added December 2022)

name: Alexandra Vaults
description:
City: Saltburn
description: On a first visit we found this curious back alley pub with distinctive decor from the old tea sacks decorating a hatched ceiling, real fire roaring away to the left of the bar, pub dog, cinema/golden era ephemera in the bars side room and two pool tables (2 more than most pubs have these days). Zero cask ales which will not attract beer enthusiasts. If the drinks selection improves this will be worth adding to the guide. (Added January 2023)

name: The Roebuck
description:
City: London
description: Clutterful and personalised pub, unlike many in the area. Looks characterful with a fire by the bar area. Focus on real ales, excellent reviews. A must visit! (Added January 2023)

name: Peyton Arms
description:
City: Stoke Lyne
description: Ignore the limited mediocre reviews and focus on the positives, an extremely rare to find rural boozer focusing on drinks with a cobwebby display of antiques and ephemera to enjoy, served by the characterful landlord 'The Hat'. (Added January 2022)

name: The Man of Kent
description:
City: Little Mill
description: A hybrid between a casual ale house/café and traditional black beamed Inn, very well reviewed but a visit will confirm if it's really guide worthy. (Added January 2023)

name: Little Gem
description:
City: Aylesford
description: Small, rustic ale house with exposed rafters, timber beams hanging hops and genteel surroundings. Exceptional reviews, looks pretty good. (Added January 2023)

name: Hospůdka U TŘÍ SEKYREK
description:
City: Prague
description: It has been a while since a Mala Strana option came along that interested us, but this seems like a good operation. A green glazed tile bar counter with painting behind the bar, simple seating in an intimate space that resemble cellar vaults. Reviews near uniformly positive. Could be worth a look. (added January 2023)

name: Rodinný pivovar Cestář
description:
City: Ostruzna
description: Beautiful log cabin/chalet with mini-brewery and airy wood strip conservatory room for tastings and relaxing. Very well reviewed (Added January 2023)

name: Smugglers Ale House
description:
City: Robin Hood's Bay
description: Cosy looking intimate ale house, modernised but tastefully done with a warm hue. (Added January 2023)

name: Bar Bodega José
description:
City: Blanes
description: A long standing worn-in boozer with  large fireplace, red painted ceiling and chintzy nautical theme (of course) blended with saloon bar vibes. Very well reviewed and as a cult venue looks worth a try in the area. (added January 2023)

name: The Kirk Inn
description:
City: Romaldkirk
description: One of the last few wet-led pubs in hamlets run seemingly almost for the sheer hell of it, with all the homespun charm and eccentricity that involves - and unreliable opening hours. Good luck! (Added January 2023)

name: Spinners Arms
description:
City: Cummersdale
description: Pleasant looking village pub with distinctive exterior, homely interior and communal layout with several ales available. Excellent reviews. (Added January 2023)

name: Sun Inn
description:
City: Clun
description: One of those historic pubs that has become a famous destination. There can be some trappings associated with those, but all the same, the bar area looks reasonably authentic and unspoilt with a distinctively genteel rustic fitting. (Added January 2023)

name: Sir Sydney Smith
description:
City: London
description: While subject to some redecoration this small boozer looks promising inside and out, good reviews may hint at something more too.  (added January 2023)

name: The Bon Accord
description:
City: Glasgow
description: Whisky and ale specialists, terrific reviews. The pub itself is traditional, perhaps a little bland in places so we will take a closer look before deciding. (Added January 2023)

name: Bar L'Aviso
description:
City: St Malo
description: Cocktail bar with brooding red lights and wood fitting, not fully refurbished or pretentious, a deal of worn-in charm to enjoy, seemingly as the good reviews attest to. (Added January 2023)

name: The Golden Cup Inn
description:
City: Hanley
description: Refurbishment of a heritage pub with gleaming Victoriana tiles and wood fitting, seemingly with a focus on retaining the comfort and colours too. Excellent reviews. (Added January 2023)

name: The Blind Monkey
description:
City: Sheffield
description: An unusual recreation of a traditional pub within a more craft focused ale house. Compact with nooks and crannies - looks worth a try! (Added January 2023)

name: Pauwel Kwak Bierhuis
description:
City: Prague
description: Not Czech, but good reviews of this Belgian bar are nevertheless intriguing. (Added January 2023)

name: MANNALA PILS
description:
City: Colmar
description: Popular, well reviewed beer specialists with light hued wood, warm colours and social vibe. (added January 2023)

name: Bodega del Born
description:
City: Barcelona
description: Fun, funky and colourful. Well reviewed Bodega churning out classics but with a stylistic twist of its own. (Added January 2023)

name: Děčínská bouda
description:
City: Pec pod Snezkou
description: Cosy mountain hut/ Krcma style affair with chunky varnished wood, hearty meals, fireplace and countryside vibes. Very positive reviews. (Added January 2023)

name: Spinnrad - Berliner Kneipe
description:
City: Berlin
description: Truly excellent looking warm cosy, unspoilt Kneipe. Personalised and wood fit, great reviews. Authenticity is conveyed. (Added January 2023)

name: Hostinec
description:
City: Veselicko
description: Famous old Czech pub with a mechanical music player - featured on Tales of Old Pubs on Czech television. (Added January 2023)

name: Pension Hamerská krčma Jonáš
description:
City: Svobodne Hamri
description: Purposefully rustic, almost dreamlike rural Krcma as featured on Tales of Old Pubs on Czech television. (Added January 2023)

name: The Driftwood Spars
description:
City: Trevaunance Cove
description: Interesting little pub/brewing operation with a traditional yet personalised interior. Worth a look. Added January 2023)

name: Seven Stars Inn
description:
City: Stithians
description: Well reviewed traditional pub with a community feel to it, looks worth a try. (Added February 2023)

name: The Fat Cat & Canary
description:
City: Norwich
description: Another Fat Cat in the city, this one also an appealing homely pub with curved glazed windows, pub ephemera and a scheme of creams and reds. Real ales of course and live music. Very well reviewed. (Added February 2023)

name: Hemingway
description:
City: Cluj-Napoca
description: The best looking cocktail bar in town, which has some modern touches but a hint of the speakeasy sleaze which can improve the atmosphere a notch. Very well Reviewed (Added February 2023)

name: TABANCO EL PASAJE -VINOS y FLAMENCO-
description:
City: Jerez
description: Classic sherry bar with barrels, tiled floor and walls. Flamenco performances. Excellent reviews. (Added February 2023)

name: The Ship Inn
description:
City: Hull
description: Good write-ups in local press, run by a local councillor who also cooks the food. Some decent drinks options but otherwise a backstreet booze. May be worth trying one time. (Added February 2023)

name: The Hare On The Hill
description:
City: Bristol
description: Cosy personalised corner pub with a wide range of drinks, well reviewed and a community feel. Has to be worth a try. (Added February 2023)

name: pub Kavárka
description:
City: Brno
description: Classic unspoilt down-to-earth Czech pajzl. Great reviews. Looks like Poutnik on tap, occasional live music. No airs and graces and not a new wave pub at all. (Added February 2023)

name: Newfield Inn
description:
City: Seathwaite
description: Cosy traditional inn, stone cottage with wood-fit bar and fireplace, excellent reviews. (Added February 2023)

name: The Strands Hotel / Inn & Micro Brewery
description:
City: Nether Wasdale
description: Hotel, micro-brewery and inn with an attractive stripped back simple, homely appearance inside, very well reviewed, looks well worth visiting. (added February 2023)

name: The Orange Tree
description:
City: Kirkby Lonsdale
description: Freehouse and hotel with a tidy traditional pub. Perhaps slightly tarted up for day-trippers it has still retained its core appeal for now, so it seems. (Added February 2023)

name: The Wellington Inn & Caravan Park
description:
City: Great Orton
description: A simple traditional country inn with exposed beams, red carpet and chunky furniture. Set up to serve hikers and caravan holidayers. Looks no-nonsense and fairy ungentrified. (Added February 2023)

name: Punch Bowl Inn Pub
description:
City: Great Broughton
description: A community pub staffed by volunteers - check opening hours carefully and maybe call ahead. A homely living room type interior and excellent reviews. Must be worth a try the one time. (Added February 2023)

name: Fox & Pheasant Inn
description:
City: Armathwaite
description: Attractive rural pub in a stone cottage with dark wood fittings, exposed stone. Some dining element to it but with a dartboard and pubby looking bar it should have a balance still.  Well reviewed (Added February 2023)

name: Hostinec u Olinka
description:
City: Lhotka
description: As featured on series Tales of Old Pubs on Czech television. A dressy appearance is deceiving, you will find a down to earth social pub with a musical connection here. Looks good, reviews are exceptional. (added February 2023)

name: Old Black Bull Raskelf
description:
City: Raskelf
description: Very nice looking country pub with a Theakston tie, traditional homely interior with a classic appearance of blackened beams, cream walls, fireplace. Music nights. Very well reviewed. (Added February 2023)

name: The Old Star
description:
City: Kilham
description: Unspoilt country pub with reassuringly chunky wood fittings and cosy interior. Very well reviewed. (Added February 2023)

name: The Bridge Inn
description:
City: Ruswarp
description: Impressive wood fit interior with upholstered bench seating. Despite the exterior it appears to have retained its unspoilt appearance. CAMRA listed and good reviews. (Added February 2023)

name: Arconti 31 Pub
description:
City: Gallarate
description: English style pub with varnished brown wood panels, multiple beers on tap. May possibly have a cask line too! (Added February 2023)

name: Taberna Casa Manteca
description:
City: Cadiz
description: Unmissable traditional taberna with a homely feel. Exposed beams, tiling, dozens of framed photos and artwork, classic format. Excellent reviews. (Added February 2023)

name: La Fresquita
description:
City: Seville
description: Traditional tapas bar decorated with religious iconography. Seems to be worth a look when in the area. (Added March 2023)

name: Taberna del Dragón Verde
description:
City: Seville
description: Lavish, possibly silly bar with large wooden fittings and mythological theme. Very good reviews so perhaps worth a try. (Added March 2023)

name: Bodeguita La Chicotá
description:
City: Sevilla
description: Wild card - authentic working class Bodeguita, snack bar (a pub in essence), with personalised bar area, self-service and very affordable quality plates. (Added March 2023)

name: El tremendo
description:
City: Sevilla
description: Tiny but characterful little tapas bar with metal counter and a host of personalised nik naks inside with a classic 70s appearance. Well reviewed. (added March 2023)

name: Bar Motocyklowy 2KOŁA
description:
City: Warsaw
description: Cool, low-key and informal with a motorcycle theme, live music, off-beat. (Added March 2023)

name: Hydrozagadka
description:
City: Warsaw
description: Well reviewed club with some ruin bar aesthetics and different spaces to explore. Definitely on the club rather than bar end. (Added March 2023)

name: The Unicorn Bathams
description:
City: Wollaston
description: An unspoilt Batham's pub with familiar old school charm and its range of ales. (added March 2023)

name: The Plough & Harrow Batham's
description:
City: Kinver
description: Old-school traditional boozer with familiar Batham's stable appearance. Well reviewed. (added March 2023)

name: The New Inn Bathams
description:
City: Wordsley
description: Old-school traditional boozer in the Batham's brewery stable with good reviews and familiar charms. (Added March 2023)

name: The Lamp Tavern Bathams
description:
City: Dudley
description: Traditional Batham's brewery tied pub with old-school boozer appeal and familiar charms, could go either way. (added March 2023)

name: Fox & Grapes Bathams
description:
City: Pensnett
description: Batham's brewery tied pub, an old school boozer with traditional Black Country charms, good reviews. (Added March 2023)

name: The Live & Let Live
description:
City: Bringsty
description: Super, rustic country pub with plenty of wood and hanging hops. Exposed beams, flagstone floor, pewter jugs. Great reviews. Looks well worth a try. (added March 2023)

name: The Cross House Tavern
description:
City: Tewkesbury
description: Superb looking micro-pub that has a traditional rustic appeal with some retro branding. Excellent reviews. (added March 2023)

name: The Weavers at Park Lane
description:
City: Kidderminster
description: Don't be confused, there are two such places. This looks excellent. Brick floor, real ales, classic beer signage, dartboard, homely interior. Very good reviews. (Added March 2023)

name: Taverna Kupljen Jeruzalem Svetinje
description:
City: Svetinje
description: Wine specialists in an uber-rustic setting of chunky wood with scenic views. Excellent reviews. (Added March 2023)

name: In 't Spinnekopke
description:
City: Brussels
description: A classic brown café interior can be found here at this estaminet, a pub-restaurant with space enough for drinking when it isn't peak evening meal times. Reviews vary but this still should be looked into. (Added March 2023)

name: Booze'n Blues
description:
City: Brussels
description: Fun, bluesy, sleazy looking bar with Jazz ephemera, great reviews. Does look good. Has to be worth a try. (Added March 2023)

name: Kava Bar Orfej
description:
City: Ptuj
description: A decent looking small pub with curved pivnice type ceiling, varnished wood fittings, leaning posts. Good reviews too. (Added March 2023)

name: Cafe Filmriß
description:
City: Zittau
description: Excellent looking pub-cafe with film memorabilia and highly personalised bar area. Great reviews. (Added March 2023)

name: Staromeštianska Pivotéka
description:
City: Bratislava
description: Basement multi-tap pub with traditional appearance and bang up to date beer options. Well reviewed. (Added March 2023)

name: Café de Hut
description:
City: Haarlem
description: One of the city's brown cafes, traditional unspoilt venue. Unusual bar top with round protrusions at each end to maximise seating/leaning space. (Added March 2023)

name: Proeflokaal de blauwe druif
description:
City: Haarlem
description: A truly classic historic tavern with aged wood, oil paintings, chandeliers, terrific reviews. Looks like a classic, maybe the classic in Haarlem. (Added March 2023)

name: Huiskamer café El en Ben
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Informal, personalised, homely and unspoilt corner pub with great reviews. Looks very nice. (Added March 2023)

name: Café Van Egmond
description:
City: Haarlem
description: A tiny unspoilt brown café with a reportedly friendly owner. Great reviews. (Added March 2023)

name: Café Sligting
description:
City: Overveen
description: Looks worth traveling to from Haarlem. Old brown café fixtures, art Deco era bar fitting, pool table, refined yet aged character. Good reviews too. (Added March 2023)

name: Café de Gooth
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Despite a listing as a restaurant this is a very publike interior which appears to us far more casual than a dining spot. Personalised with signage, wood fittings with grand old covered ceiling lamps, worth a try. (Added March 2023)

name: Café Du Theatre
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Fun, personalised and characterful little bar dominated by the bar area itself. Looks well worth dropping in for one. Reviews appear to agree. (Added March 2023)

name: Het Wapen van Bloemendaal
description:
City: Haarlem
description: Historic cafe with some dramatic arched fittings at the bar, some murals and preserved wood fittings. Stylish lamps and hints of Deco and Nouvau. Excellent reviews. (Added March 2023)

name: Bierreclame Museum
description:
City: Breda
description: This looks well worth a trip out from the centre. In the district of Princenhage is a pub/museum to beer signage. Cluttered is an understatement, this is one of those obsessions/labours of love manifesting in something special. Despite the museum element all reviews talk about the pub itself which is great news. No excuse to avoid this if in the area. (added March 2023)

name: The Ducie Arms
description:
City: Manchester
description: Attractive wood-fit bar, excellent reviews and several ales to get stuck into. Seems to be worth a look. (Added March 2023)

name: Farmers Arms
description:
City: Penzance
description: Characterful, informal hangout with a personalised interior of movie posters and musical instruments on the wall. Decent reviews, worth a look. (Added March 2023)

name: The Dolphin Tavern
description:
City: Penzance
description: A fairly well pier-side pub which of course does the usual coastal pub meals but has retained a sense of character with its beams, nautical theme and seemingly a good balance found. Very good reviews. (Added March 2023)

name: Les Distilleries Idéales
description:
City: Nice
description: A beautiful opulent bar, grand cafe style with ornate wood fittings, murals, etc. Not overly stuff by any means though, there are some personalised elements that clearly indicate this is for fun, not pretense. (Added March 2023)

name: La Boulisterie Club
description:
City: Nice
description: Bar with a petanque court inside. Modern warehouse conversion, bright and airy but looks to have a bit of quirkiness about it. Well reviewed. (Added March 2023)

name: Le Shapko
description:
City: Nice
description: Nice's best Jazz bar by all accounts, with a predictably colourful hint of sleaze about it - as you'd hope! Well reviewed, high up on the to-visit list in the city. (Added March 2023)

name: GIST
description:
City: Brussels
description: Beer specialists, a distinct focus on the tap offerings here. The venue has an inheritance of attractive stylish wood fittings but the decor is understated and muted by the standards of a traditional Brussels bar. It looks worth a try at least to sense what the atmosphere is like. (added March 2023)

name: La Cheminée
description:
City: La Plagne-Tarentaise
description: Apres-ski kiosk that looks quite fun. (Added March 2023)

name: The Minerva
description:
City: Hull
description: Riverside real ale pub with outdoor seating and indoors claims to have the smallest snug room in England. A wedge shaped building, relatively unusual and the site of a former microbrewery. There is still a bit of character in the front room but a rather over-officious front of house spoils the chance for typical pub informality and the backrooms are tired + stink of frying. A bit of a mixture, we can recommend it but still undecided about an inclusion to our guide. (added March 2023)

name: The Flowerpot
description:
City: Mirfield
description: A decent looking country pub, all-rounder, Ossett beers which is generally a good sign for a Yorkshire pub. Tiled floor, fireplace etc, not too corporate looking. On a first visit in October 2023 it didn't set our world alight but as it was a quiet Monday it is clearly worth another try (Added March 2023)

name: Kings Arms
description:
City: Sunderland
description: Fabulous looking traditional backstreet boozer with attractive wood fittings including woodstrip ceiling, bunker like, looks very good. (Added March 2023)

name: Pivnica Budweiser
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Pleasant looking Karczma type pub-restaurant with chunky wood interior, Budvar on tap and pleasant beer garden. Well reviewed. (added March 2023)

name: Ero
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Dark wood bar very unlike the majority of Zagreb's cafe bars, almost interest for that aspect alone, let's see. (Added March 2023)

name: Mr. Fogg
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Slightly steampunky modern bar with a reasonably dark, fairylit appearance in the evening. (added March 2023)

name: Klubokawiarnia LALKA
description:
City: Poznan
description: Very nice low key bar with homely surroundings, some live music, craft beer. Young, slightly bohemian. (Added March 2023)

name: Towarzysz Klub PRL
description:
City: Torun
description: Retro bar with 80s socialist nostalgia decor. Very well reviewed. (Added March 2023)

name: Café Sperl
description:
City: Vienna
description: Ancient preserved Viennese coffee house which has a social scene. You can drink, you can play pool but it was a bit too staid for us.

name: Délirium Café Vienna
description:
City: Vienna
description: Vaguely disappointing, owned by the same company as Mel's, with a much smaller beer list. Bar is curved, it is decent, perhaps worth a try if you're running out of options. (added March 2023)

name: Maggie´s Leberkas Stadl
description:
City: Graz
description: Very peculiar place that almost made our guide on atmosphere alone. Tiny bar specialising in meatloaf, but in practise a local's hangout. Cheery, and a tad camp too, it's a pub alright. (Added April 2023)

name: Brot & Spiele
description:
City: Graz
description: Not quite worthy, this pub and games complex has perhaps too much of a bowling alley/snooker hall atmosphere in places, but the main bar is good and the beer selection is, for Austria, very good indeed. (Added April 2023)

name: Craft Beer Bar
description:
City: Varazdin
description: Popular local's hangout, all about the atmosphere and the beer selection, not so much about the room which is very plain, almost a hollowed out hotel foyer. It doesn't make our guide quite, but it's worth keeping in mind as an option.

name: Caffe bar Picabia Varaždin
description:
City: Varazdin
description: Decent locals bar that is an all-rounder, really and surprisingly pubby. (added April 2023)

name: Pub Mlinarica
description:
City: Zagreb
description: Terrific beers in a roadside pub-restaurant. Somehow lacking a centre piece, a bar room that really makes the atmosphere sing. The bar area itself is too small. However, there is a lot to like. We are torn. Didn't quite make the cut on 2 visits. (Added April 2023)

name: Unijazz
description:
City: Prague
description: Relocated cultural cafe, friendly safe space with large rugs and comfy seats, but alternative enough to be interesting, with regular events. Beer options also good. Didn't quite make the cut but worth a look and a 2nd visit. (Added April 2023)

name: Planeta Žižkov
description:
City: Prague
description: The pubbiest of pubby pubs, a stalwart option in the district but everything about it says a solid 7/10. Likeable but didn't find it hit the heights in any area. Nonetheless, worth keeping up your sleeve as it is generally open and quite a versatile venue. (Added April 2023)

name: ROESEL - beer & food
description:
City: Prague
description: Keep walking, yes, straight ahead to the end, to this little pub cafe that has inherited historic curved ceilings and treads a line between drinking hole and light-bite venue. A younger, hipper crowd here, but prices remain fair and it has caught the attention of locals too. You may need to be prompt on weekends in order to get a table. Beer is excellent and the food is worth the money, staff are generally young, helpful, polite and multilingual. We haven't included it on our guide overall however as it lacked any X-factor to speak of. A little too plain? Anyway, there is a lot to like, it's worth keeping in mind. (Added April 2022)

name: U Kocoura
description:
City: Prague
description: A vital stopgap if you can't get in U Hrocha, this would be a very nice pub if it didn't have the sense of being an overflow area, a Plan B. It's a little tired, but the beer is cheap and the operation is honest. A rarity in the district. It isn't quite on our guide but it deserves circulating for practical purposes. (Added April 2023)

name: Niewinność Wine Bar
description:
City: Warsaw
description: Wine bar with 4-5 tap options in a market stall with seats and hoardings widening the sense of pub. Produce is excellent, service kind and helpful, venue going on twee but distinctive enough to avoid being bland, and certainly not overly pretentious. Didn't quite make the cut on our first visit but worth bearing in mind. (Added April 2023)

name: The Duke Of York
description:
City: Salisbury
description: A traditional side-street boozer. Rated highly by BRAPA, information thin on the ground but what there is looks homely and promising. Worth a try at least. (Added April 2023)

name: The Three Horseshoes
description:
City: Bradford-on-Avon
description: Traditional freehouse with a homely, personalised and non-chain appearance. Characterful bar area, occasional live events, great reviews and close to the train station. Surely worth a try? (Added April 2023)

name: The Boot & Flogger
description:
City: London
description: Sprawling wine bar, wood-fittings and one of a kind, excellent reviews, looks like a distinctive venue with multiple rooms. (Added April 2023)

name: The Purleigh Bell
description:
City: Purleigh
description: Traditional genteel village pub with settles, beams and so forth. While a little staid in appearance there seems easily enough to justify a visit. (Added April 2023)

name: Tutu Whiskey & Jazz Club
description:
City: Torun
description: We visited but alas, only at closing time. This looks like one we genuinely missed out on and should have tried to get to, but you can't win them all. Give it a go. Great reviews. (Added April 2023)

name: Thonet
description:
City: Poznan
description: Interesting looking bar with some more comfortably and homely features than some of the towny options. (Added April 2023)

name: Kafe Zale
description:
City: Krnjaca
description: Beautiful looking beer bar with homely features such as a piano and far more pubby feel than the usual Balkans efforts. Great beer options and superb reviews. (Added April 2023)

name: Three Kings Inn
description:
City: Hanley Castle
description: Village freehouse with a truly beautiful traditional, genteel interior including a characterful bar area. Comes highly recommended by third parties and very well reviewed. (Added April 2023)

name: Park Tavern Pub
description:
City: Kingston-upon-Thames
description: Traditional pub with comfortable upholstered bench seating and loungey interior including fireplace. Highly personalised with ceiling festooned with pump clips, good ales, excellent reviews. (Added April 2023)

name: Taberna de Angel Sierra
description:
City: Madrid
description: Long standing taberna with key distinctive features, it's huge barrels, a ceiling mural and stained glass among other things which give it a sense of institution. Looks very good, of course being Spain, the format and formalities are open to question, so the only way to know for sure is to go! (added April 2023)

name: Café Zsivágó
description:
City: Budapest
description: Retro Kavarna which stays open late, by which time hopefully the atmosphere will have developed into something special. Very well reviewed. (Added May 2023)

name: The Black Horse
description:
City: Hellifield
description: Intriguing Inn with a characterful and highly personalised bar area, great reviews but full info thin on the ground. We shall try to correct this. (Added May 2023)

name: The White Bear
description:
City: Devizes
description: Traditional market town tavern with low beamed ceilings and Bacchanalian artwork above the bar. With some tasteful tweaks in terms of furnishing, hopefully they will continue exhibiting the true character of the place and not turn it into bland middle aged place with Laura Ashley prints. (Added May 2023)

name: Labský Zámek
description:
City: Liberec
description: Tough finding good pubs in central Liberec but here is one with a First Republic era nostalgia to the prints and wood strip panelling, but it's not all a museum piece. Looks to have a personalised, ad-hoc and quite homely feel. Excellent reviews. (Added May 2023)

name: The Black Swan pub
description:
City: Shepshed
description: Not much info around about this but it seems to be a nice cosy little backstreet pub with comfortable communal seating and a bit of character. Well reviewed. (Added May 2023)

name: Midgehole Working Men's Club (aka The Blue Pig)
description:
City: Midgehole
description: Famous unvarnished and old school club/pub (added May 2023)

name: Pivnice Na Zastávce
description:
City: Světlá nad Sázavou
description: A very pubby Pivnice with large communal tables and warm interior. (Added March 2023)

name: The Anchor Inn
description:
City: Wingham
description: Unspoilt traditional pub with basic furnishings and genteel decor, in line with the surroundings. Very well reviewed. (added May 2023)

name: Church Inn
description:
City: Prestwich
description: Multiroom boozer with a communal, social layout. Organ in one room, social events. Overall seems worth a try if in the area. (Added May 2023)

name: Rivoli Ballroom
description:
City: London
description: A fantastic preserved ballroom and night spot, cult venue with amazing reviews. Opulent, preserved and time stood still type decor, this is well worth a look. (Added May 2023)

name: Pivnica "Usporavanje"
description:
City: Niš
description: A low-key more homely pub, simple furniture but good reviews and apparently very well liked. (Added May 2023)

name: Pivnica Nemir, Niš
description:
City: Niš
description: Reasonably pubby looking bar with some superior beer options. (Added May 2023)

name: Hush Hush Lounge Bar
description:
City: Niš
description: One of the better garden bars, still looks reasonably ad hoc and not over-glammed up. On our visit we enjoyed the surroundings but it didn't quite make the grade. Worth keeping in mind as a fallback option though (Added May 2023)

name: Paris Art Ame
description:
City: Niš
description: Vintage antiquey café that looks like a standout. How bar like it is remains to be seen, but it deserves a try. Great reviews. (Added May 2023)

name: Gardoš Pub
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Terrace bar with pubby interior and views, very well reviewed. Worth a look. (Added May 2023)

name: Pivo i kobaja
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Pubby beer bar with breweriana signage and contemporary food - sausage in particular. Although pleasant it was reasonably generic and the beer options were disappointing. (Added May 2023)

name: Vox Blues Club
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Part in/part out little cabin club with a terrace, rustic decor and stage for live performances. Excellent reviews. (Added May 2023)

name: Polet
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Ruin-bar type interior with crackling plaster and degrading walls. Interesting terrace space too with climbing ivy and graffiti. Partly art space. (Added May 2023)

name: Pivnica Realist
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Very pubby pub with leather upholstered seats, dark wood, niches, framed mirrors and ex-pat type beers. Looks well realised without being too hokey. Well reviewed.

UPDATE: On our first visit it was clear it was a solid mainstream pub but didn't really stand out. A decent fallback option (Added May 2023)

name: Das LANGE Pub und Beisl
description:
City: Vienna
description: Intriguing pubby possibility somewhere between a true drinking venue and gaststatte. (Added May 2023)

name: The Black Horse
description:
City: Leicester
description: Unspoilt communal traditional village pub with upholstered bench seats, multi-room, cask ales, hatches, tiled floor, wood panels. Looks a near cert inclusion. Well reviewed. (Added May 2023)

name: The Hole In The Wall
description:
City: Torquay
description: The kind of intimate little beamed, higgledy seaside pub you hope to find. Very well reviewed - a little foody? We shall see. (Added May 2023)

name: Cigla & Krigla Pub
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Aside of the good selection of local beers this is an otherwise reasonably generic pub, though competent and fairly shady, nothing outstanding. Worth having up your sleeve as a fallback option. (Added May 2023)

name: Varia Craft&Beer Bar
description:
City: Novi Sad
description: Safe and friendly craft beer bar with loungey upstairs. Nothing hugely of interest aside the beer selection though. (Added May 2023)

name: Pivnica ''Moto klub''
description:
City: Novi Sad
description: Reasonably good evening hangout with motor decor and free popcorn but didn't fully click to deserve a guide inclusion. Maybe we'll give it another try one day. (Added May 2023)

name: Freeport Cultural Center
description:
City: Pecs
description: A worthy cultural centre straddling mainstream and alternative, decent enough but was slightly lacking across the departments to merit an inclusion

name: Gajba
description:
City: Osijek
description: Small craft beer pivoteka down a side street with very local life of Croatian hipster bros hanging out. That said, it's social, friendly and has a nice selection, somewhere you can go and find English spoken, no problem. We wouldn't add it to our guide but would keep it in mind if you're on a jolly around Osijek. (Added June 2023)

name: Doctor Bier
description:
City: Quedlinburg
description: A bar we must have missed on our journey. A proper kneipe - drinking den with football scarves on the ceiling, dark interior. Well reviewed. (Added June 2023)

name: Docker Brewery & Beer Garden
description:
City: Belgrade
description: Sprawling modern brewhouse and garden in ex-industrial space,with plenty of options. Didn't quite make the cut on our first visit but not by much. Perhaps a little on the corporate side of things. Worth a look. (Added June 2023)

name: Falkland Arms
description:
City: Great Tew
description: A country pub with attractive low-ceilinged interior with flagstone floor, fireplace, exposed beams, glazed mugs, fairylights and chunky furniture. Real ale - yes - a given, and it doesn't look like it's been 100% turned over for dining just yet. (Added June 2023)

name: Karavella Sörbár
description:
City: Pecs
description: Large range of beers (by Hungarian standards) in a modern setting. Highly uninteresting decor and no atmosphere but some people will enjoy it nevertheless for the product.

name: Restaurace Na Hrádku
description:
City: Prague
description: One of the remaining 'Fours', fourth grade pub that hasn't been driven to closure by chains or costs. Simple format, unchanged in years, cheap food, cheap booze, local life. Worth a look - try evenings for more atmosphere. (Added June 2023)

name: Vacuum Art Bar
description:
City: Prague
description: Interesting arty/punk bar with garden, vegan street food and foosball. Ring for entry. Worth a look? (Added June 2023)

name: Pivnice Na konečné
description:
City: Prague
description: A survivor at the tram terminus. Not as famous or cult as Prvni Pivni Tramway but looks pretty damn good still. Featured on Praha Ozrala TV series on the episode about estate pubs. Has had the chain pub Gambrinus thing added to it though, some of the old interior has been slightly sterilised, but on our visit we found honest service, clean well tapped beer, unbeatable prices and a case of true stamgasty and regulars who all know each other. It slightly missed an inclusion overall but if you're in the area or fancy a quirk or a pilgrimage for some of the cheapest beer in the city, you could do worse. (Added June 2023)

name: Hospůdka u Bartoše
description:
City: Prague
description: Bernard beer and pub dog in a tiny drop in knajpa/ausschenk. All locals. The rear room is decorated in a throwback genteel homely fashion. Closes early. Didn't quite make the cut on a first visit but there will be time to return (Added June 2023)

name: Hospůdka U Pošty - Doma
description:
City: Prague
description: One of those frozen in time pubs that appears to have kept much of the best of the Czech hospoda intact. On our first visit it was a true fourth-grade pajzl, slightly intimidating at first but harmless inside, 1990s atmosphere. Didn't quite tip the balance. (March 2024)

name: Hospoda U Procházků
description:
City: Prague
description: Local pajzl, worn-in with its own character, net curtains, ceiling fan, a certain lost in time quality. Very cheap Gambrinus. Purely for hanging out. Good reviews. Worth a try? (Added June 2023)

name: Aleš VANICKÝ - ALVA
description:
City: Prague
description: An unusual, homely looking pub/café with rugs, artwork on the walls and a curved ceiling giving off a real sense of intimacy. Folk music and other community events, this really looks like a must-visit venue.

WARNING - This is a private members club set up so that smoking could continue inside. In order to attend you will need to acquire membership. Do not just turn up, as you may be disappointed.

name: Bar Bakeliet
description:
City: Antwerp
